I called the front desk and I was told they would send an engineer right up.  After 45 minutes and no engineer, we told them to never mind.   Lastly, a morning hotel evacuation top off a…

title: Good place to stay
review: We appreciate the time you took to write about your experience.  Our goal is that each and every customer enjoy a fine stay with us and we're sorry if your expectations were not met.  As for the A/C units - the thermostats are "energy saving" and if there is no activity in the room for some time, they shut off until the unit detects movement in the room.   We're sorry for the incident with the evacuation and are bringing this for review to top management.    Ultimately, we hope you left with pleasant memories of Clearwater Beach.  Thank you for staying with us.  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Perfect Family Vacation!
review: I stayed here from april 18 to the 22 and everything was great until i got my car the day that i checked out, the windshield was cracked and the hotel said that they are not responsible for that cause they contracted the valet company to do business on their property. So who is responsible? How is that possible? They cracked my windshield an now nobody is responsible for it? Horrible. I will never stay in this hotel ever again.

title: fantastic location, facilities and food
review: will basically echo all the positive comments and add:  parking is valet and costs but this is very well advertised and the guys give you plenty of time to unpack / pack the location is fantastic the food is amazing - the best deal is the breakfast buffet at Jimmys- for $12 with tax - this is a great deal for the quality, decor and service - a great way to start the day - though not sure it is on everyday??? The kids eat free worked very well - we literally ate at Jimmys all the time as the atmosphere was so good too (it felt like a family friendly margharvitervillel!!!) all the staff are very friendly indeed - thankyou Miranda, Luke and Joan (well they laughed at my bad jokes) and Que and Susie at Jimmys The pool area is very good and sheltered which made a big difference when…

title: 2nd trip, not disappointed
review: This is second year in a row staying here for spring break.  First off, Charles at the front desk was very accommodating and placed us in the room we requested, even though we had a very late arrival, spoke to him during the morning of our trip while enroute from Michigan, he assured us he would do what he could and he did.  We couldnt have been happier.  Ate a late meal at the attached Jimmy Guanas restaurant, again staff were friendly and food good. Ordered room service breakfast, arrived quickly, exactly as ordered and hot!  Room was clean, common areas very well kept.  Hotel pool was convenient and clean.

title: Nice
review: Thank you!   We love seeing our guests come back for more beach memories, and we're so glad your stay was a pleasant one.  Please know your compliments to our staff are so appreciated and will be shared with the appropriate department heads.  Our entire team here wants every guest to have great memories.  We look forward to your next visit -- and stay tuned on our Facebook page for more reasons to come back.    Such as:  how about a fall vacation in October to include Clearwater Jazz Holiday?    Thanks again,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Great place for families!
review: Ok,  disappointed It was noisy,  and needs to be updated.  However, can not complain because the price was great.  Drinks were expensive,  not very close,  parking very difficult...  Other than that an ok place

title: Anniversary Getaway
review: Thanks for taking time to review your recent stay with us.  We want every guest to have a fabulous experience so we're sorry we did not meet your expectations.  You didn't specify where the noise issues were coming from so it is hard to address that, but anytime a guest advises us of a situation, we do our best to correct or improve it. If it was related to the construction next door, that hotel is now open so the situation has improved dramatically.  Ultimately, it sounds like you enjoyed good fun on Clearwater Beach and we do hope you'll return in the future.    Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Spring break
review: We planned a last minute spring break to Clearwater Beach. We were pleasantly surprised at how wonderful the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites was. We had a suite which gave us plenty of room with our teenage sons. We appreciated having two bathrooms, microwave, refrigerator and a balcony with an amazing view. There were many amenities we took advantage of such as the fitness room, laundry, game room, gift shop, valet parking, coffee shop, restaurant, poolside bar etc. We enjoyed a coffee and breakfast items from the onsite coffee shop looking at the ocean each morning. The pool was beautiful and on the water. The poolside bar served reasonably priced adult beverages. We enjoyed many amazing sunsets from the pool and sunning deck at the hotel. We also enjoyed a delicious dinner,…

title: Overall a good value
review: How nice of you to take time to write about your recent stay with us so other guests can learn first hand what to expect.      You are right - our family suites are spacious and the perfect size for families to spread out when they stay several days with us.  We're so glad you decided to come here at the last minute!     And yes, we're pretty centrally located -- and, we have the trolley that comes by frequently as an added convenience.  We do hope you'll be back with us soon -- we'll look forward to it!  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Spring Break
review: PROS:  Beautiful sunset views from the patio, pool not all that crowded, clean rooms, excellent ocean front restaurant/bar and friendly staff.  CONS:  The biggest drawback (which imho was unacceptable) was the location of our room.  My husband is a Platinum Elite member and the ONLY thing I requested was a room on a higher floor.  We booked the room almost 3 months in advance so this should not have been a problem.  We not only got a room on the 2nd floor, but it was probably one of the worst rooms in the resort.  It overlooked this ugly platform and was so noisy that we really couldn't sit out on the balcony.  I requested a different room and was told they were sold out.  Other drawbacks: no beach area on site like other resorts in the area, no hot tub, hotel overall needs…

title: Good stay!
review: Thank you for taking time to write about your stay here, and truly, we thank you for.being a H.I. Platinum Elite member.     We are so sorry we did not measure up to the expectations you had for your room's location and regret that we did not have another one to offer you.   We do not advertise ourselves as being on the beach; in fact, our website specifies how close we are to the Clearwater Beach.  If our guests choose not to walk, they can take the Jolley Trolley that comes in front of the resort.  We will share your comments regarding courtesy of the coffee shop staff since our top management is always grateful for feedback on what areas need improvement.  Hopefully you did leave with good memories of your vacation on Clearwater Beach, and we do hope you'll consider returning.  Feel free to contact me directly; I will be happy to assist.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Friendly staff, clean and well run
review: A friend and I flew to Tampa and when we arrived I was notified of a family death.  We went on to this hotel and explained immediately to "Joanie" the situation. She was very professional and comforting. We had booked for 5 nights but explained that we weren't sure of how long we would be staying and she told us not to worry. We checked out on Wednesday without any problems at all.  We have stayed here numerous times and appreciate the staff.  Thanks Holiday Inn and you will see us next year!

title: Great location, good hotel
review: I was a little nervous about booking this hotel based on the reviews listed. It turned out that none of the negative reviews I had read applied to our experience. This hotel is near all the action of Clearwater. You can walk everywhere! The beach is a short walk. The Pier is a short beautiful walk. Driving didn't make any sense here. Traffic and parking is the biggest pain in Clearwater and we found we could walk everywhere so we didn't drive unless leaving Clearwater. Our room was clean and good size. We had a good view of the pool and canal. For us, I would say the only thing we would have liked would have been for there to be a hot tub, self-parking, and a better restaurant on location.

title: This place is great!!
review: Thank you so much for taking time to share comments about your recent visit.  We're so pleased to know you enjoyed what we have here at the resort as well as the closeness to area shops, dining and beach.  We do share feedback with our top management so thank you for making a few suggestions.  As for parking, since space is at a premium, it is off-site, and for the comfort of our guests, valet parking is our only choice,  Sure hope to see you back here again.    There's always fabulous events going on -- such as Clearwater Jazz Holiday in October!  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: More pros than cons!
review: I have stayed here several times with my friends.  We always enjoy our selves here.  Everything you could want is here or near here.  The food at Jimmy's or Shepherds is good and reasonably priced.  Also nearby is a well-stocked small grocery store which seems to have just about everything. Pay the extra amount and stay facing the pool or the gulf. The views get better the higher you go.  We were on the 5th floor.  You do have to pay to park here. $12 a night for registered guests.  A bit more ($20)if you are staying with your friends and not registered. They play music here poolside until about 11 PM. However with the door closed and the air conditioner running you don't even hear it. There really is no beach at the hotel, but nearby there are several beaches all of which are…

title: Great for Our Family of 4
review: Thank you for taking time to write such a detailed review so that others looking to visit will know more about us.  We're so pleased you enjoyed your stay with us and we very much appreciate your compliments to the staff.  We'll be sure to share them because our team here really wants everyone to enjoy a pleasant stay.  We sure hope you'll be back with us soon whenever fun in the sun calls to you!  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Perfect!
review: The following  are things I liked most: Friendly staff, Clean rooms, Pool area Views from both the Balcony and Pool deck area, and restaurant. The cons: Construction noise next door (Woke Tuesday am with a jolt, took us a bit to figure out that is was a jackhammer), I was told when I called 3 weeks prior to my trip that construction would be completed. After complaining to the desk staff we were moved to an area closer to the inside of the hotel so the noise was limited. I do believe that the hotel staff were not aware when the construction workers would be there. Very accommodating staff. We had some issues with our breakfast tickets but those were also resolved and we received two free drink tickets. The hotel was somewhat crowded  but it's Spring Break! My bad.  The…

title: Great place/bartender
review: Had a great stay, pool side bartender (Stacy) was warm, personable, & made a mean drink! The hotel was clean and in a great location!! Defiantly recommend staying here if you are looking for a place with great gulf views and friendly staff!

title: Construction is mostly finished-enjoyed our stay
review: Thanks so much!  We're pleased you had a great time during your stay, and we'll tell the management of Jimmy's Fish House & Iguana Bar that Stacy took care of you well!  It's so nice to hear that we met your expectations for a beach resort with a great location and amenities to suit.  There is always something exciting happening in Clearwater and we do hope you'll be back with us as soon as you can!  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Good location but below average
review: I read several reviews about the noisy construction and was slightly nervous about booking this hotel. We had a room on the 6th floor facing the gulf, overlooking the pool and never heard any construction. We attended a conference in the Duvall center, walked to and from our room through Jimmy's (the bar/restaurant) several times a day. Our room was great-we were pleasantly surprised about the comfort of the bed. Our balcony was perfect for catching the sunset each night. We could hear the live entertainment on the weekend until it stopped at 11pm.  Great trumpet and violin players!  So if you are an early riser and need to get to sleep before 11pm I would suggest a room on the interior-they are a little bit cheaper too!  We enjoyed the entertainment and the music played each…

title: Perfect for family and just a 5 minute walk to the beach!
review: Thank you!  How nice of you to take time to share your experience here during your conference stay.  We're so glad we met your expectations since - truly - our goal is for all our guests to have a memorable and enjoyable stay.  We'll be sure that our housekeeping staff knows of your compliments.  We are fortunate to have them and they love making our guests happy!  We do hope the next time you come will be strictly for pleasure.  There's no shortage of fun on Clearwater Beach!  Thanks again,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Clearwater Beach to Indian Rocks beach
review: Best thing is the pool (despite the scrawny towels they provide): large enough for the current occupancy, beautiful view, bar, water at perfect temperature...  The rest of the features are way below average: terrible service (they do not even look at you or greet you in the hallways and they use the public elevator to access the service area, which looks directly like hell...); everything is dirty, the carpet is so filthy it is sticky; the valet service is very inconvenient if you have to use your car more than once per day; rooms are smaller than other of the same category. Worse of all, there is construction going on, which makes staying at the pool very uncomfortable, is noisy, impedes the access to the beach without walking in the middle of the road and, when finished, will…

title: Better places to stay for the money
review: A typical holiday inn but very old and dirty.  Rooms were musty & the A/C unit didn't cool the room well.  Construction happening all around the hotel (parking lot, buildings next door, etc.) so extremely noisy both inside the room and couldn't really sit on the balcony.  Elevators were very slow & extremely hot.  No water pressure in the shower.  Both electrical outlets were loose and very unsafe.  Fire alarm went off twice so had to evacuate both times for a false alarm.  Disappointing and glad we moved to a different hotel.

title: Great location - proximity to beach
review: Thank you for staying with us recently and we, of course, are disappointed that we did not meet your expectations.  Yes, we did have issues with the fire alarms and are so sorry it conveniences our guests.    The construction next door is nearly done so again we are sorry it was disruptive.  We've tried to work with the construction crew to minimize noise and dust so our guests won't be disappointed.  As far as the A/C and loose electrical outlets, we do hope you called our attention to it so we could have our maintenance crew check things out while you were here or offer to move you to a different room.  We truly want all our guests to enjoy a pleasant and relaxing experience and are sorry this was not the case with you.  If you decide to return to Clearwater Beach, please feel free to contact me personally if you have any issues.  Truly, we value you as a customer.  Thank you,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: 5 Day vacation on the water!
review: A great spot, spacious rooms, awesome pool, great tiki bar and a wonderful restaurant with lots of action at Jimmy's Iguana. Check to see about live entertainment of the deck overlooking the gap leading from the gulf to the intra coastal. There is not a beach at this hotel, but Clearwater Beach is a ten minute walk away. We would return.

title: not on the beach
review: Thank you so much!  We're so pleased you enjoyed your stay with us and all the fun Clearwater Beach has to offer.  We'll share your compliments with Jimmy's.  You're right, the deck (newly expanded) is a great place to watch the boats go by, dolphin jumping and gorgeous sunsets.  Sure hope you'll be back with us soon.  Thanks again!  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Needing some TLC
review: We had a wedding in the area on Saturday. We wanted a place right on the water with an ocean view. We couldn't have been more happier! Seeing the boats come and go all hours of the day between the harbor and the ocean is so relaxing! The sunset from our waterside balcony was to die for!! The pool area, ocean side deck area was clean and enjoyable. Jimmy's Iguana bar has a very good food and entertainment every day.

title: Best Bargain in Clearwater!!! SHHHHH don't tell anyone
review: This isn't a 5 star resort and you didn't pay a 5 star price......now lets review. We have stayed at other hotels in Florida and of all the places we stayed for the MONEY you can't beat this place. Yes parking is a pain but it's only $12 a day and the valet are fast and there 24 hours. We had a ocean view suite and it was just awesome, two bathrooms living room and bedroom 3rd floor room 358. What a great room for the price. Like I said this isn't a 5 star hotel so if you go in thinking it is you will find something that is wrong. Our room was cleaned everyday at different times but was cleaned everyday but we also tipped the cleaning lady daily. Front desk staff.....spot on. The pool and pool bar area what a great place, great for kids and if you like adult beverages by the…

title: Good value for money
review: Wow --- thank you, thank you!   First off, we're so pleased you enjoyed your stay - and secondly, we thank you for sharing with other readers what to expect when they visit us.  We very much appreciate your compliments to our staff because they work hard to ensure every guest has comfortable clean rooms and friendly service.  We're also pleased you enjoyed your time at Jimmy's.  Did you know we're widening the deck for even more space?  Sure hope we'll see you back here again - hopefully this year.  Thanks again!  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: The Best Hotel - We've Stayed at in Florida.
review: Location was decent but still a 10-15 minute walk to the beach (but is on the water). However because there are so many hotels on the beach we ended up walking 20-25 minutes  to find a quieter spot. Need to walk same distance in the evening for main restaurant area. Rooms fairly dated and cleanliness satisfactory but not outstanding. Overall would still recommend. You get what you pay for and it's good value for money. Best part is every evening there's a countdown to sunset at the hotel bar. You get a free shot and there are often dolphins jumping right by the water.

title: The good, the bad, and the ugly
review: Thank you for staying with us and for sharing your views about your visit.  Feedback is always welcomed and shared with our top management team.  Did you know there are alternatives to walking to the main beach?  The Clearwater Jolley and Florida Free Rides offer service to that quieter area you mentioned.  Hopefully next time you'll find that easier.  We appreciate your business and hope you'll return soon.  There is lots to do coming up including Pier 60 Sugar Sand Festival in April, power boat races, July 4th festivities and more.  Best regards,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Can't wait to go back
review: Great Staff, Location, larger than average rooms, Very useful, for Handicapped, Stones throw from Beach. Hotel is in convenient, reasonably quiet location, in a Gem of a Florida Beach - area. Love It so much.. Would go back any time.. All staff were very friendly and helpful .check in Staff wonderful.. Thank you ..

title: Great please to stay
review: Unfortunately we could only stay for 1 night. The suite was spectacular with a stunning gulf view. The room looked like it was recently updated. Everything looked new from the vessel sinks to the coffee pot!

title: There are better places to stay.
review: Let me preface by saying this is my first hotel review ever.  We only stayed for one night after a concert in Clearwater but there are definitely better places to stay. If you think you are getting something special because it's a Holiday Inn.....you're not. Yes we had a nice view but the rooms are overpriced and dated, they force you to valet park and charge $12 a day, the in room coffee is terrible, there is no free breakfast,  which is offered at other hotels nearby and the staff at check-in were not pleasant. The gentleman who checked us in talked to us like we were children explaining to us in detail how we will be fined if we smoke in the room???? When I said we don't smoke his response was "And we don't allow pets either "???   Anyways, I'll stop rambling.....bottom line,…

title: Not a 5 star hotel but enjoyed
review: We thank you for taking time to share your experience with us.  Please know that reviewer's comments are shared with our top management team because we want all our guests to enjoy an excellent stay.  Most properties on Clearwater Beach do have a parking fee simply because parking is at a premium.   We encourage those who read this review to do rate comparison for services such as free breakfast (we do offer the Holiday Inn Kids Eat Free program).    As you can see by many other guest reviews, we do satisfy many customers time and again.  Ultimately, we hope you left with good memories of Clearwater Beach.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Jimmys Fish house restaurant
review: We are spending a week here and find it perfect for us.  We are on 6th flood in a suite.  Has a microwave and refrigerate is large enough for lots of items.  Has silverware, sink, few dishes.  Our suite has two rooms, bedroom and other room couch, chair, table and chairs.  Both rooms overlook inlet and Gilf.  Tv in each room, wifi good.  Heated pool on deck with outside bar.  Also restruant and bar on another deck.  Happy hour everyday, food good.  The location is very good, a little out of the crowds.  We like it  and recommend it unless you want a luxury hotel.

title: Could be better
review: We're so glad you are enjoying your stay with us and thank you for taking time to write about your stay.  You've found that the spaciousness of a suite is a great asset when you have several nights to be here - and we're glad you've enjoyed the amenities.  Hope you've seen a few dolphins jumping just off the deck!  Thank you again for your compliment and w hope you'll be planning your next visit soon!  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Great Value
review: 5 night stay in Feb.  Clean, quiet, comfortable.  This is not the Ritz but is an excellent value.  Our room on the 9th (top) floor had a view of the water and sunset that I would put up against any other hotel on the beach.  Simply fabulous.  And yes,  there is no beach but the hotel tells you that in every description I've read.  So no surprises.   Rooms were clean, beds comfortable.  Only minor complaint is small (but clean) bathroom.  Again, not the Ritz and ultimately not that important when you consider the view.  Construction next door will continue for months but there was minimal noise because it appears most work has moved indoors.  Jimmy's is a treat.  The 2 person band was outstanding.  One guy played trumpet and the other a violin that was breathtaking, especially…

title: Great for a long weekend!
review: Thank you!   We're so glad you enjoyed your stay here and thanks for writing such a detailed review...we appreciate it.  A good update -- the construction next door is in its final stages and it will be over quite soon; we appreciate your patience during this time.  You're right - our location is great and an easy walk to the public beach -- and, there is the Clearwater Jolley Trolley and Florida Free Rides that offer transport as well.  We're so glad you enjoyed the music out on Jimmy's deck.  They do have some pretty awesome groups!  Sure hope you'll be back with us again when you need more fun in the sun.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Great Location
review: The Holiday Inn Clearwater is a very good choice, especially if you are a IHG member.  I was able to use points and rewards nights to make this vacation stay affordable.   The hotel has had some updates, nothing super fancy, but it wasn't gross or icky. Our room was plenty big! The bar was a lot of fun, and the calamari was tasty.  Holiday Inn's Clearwater location is also pretty decent if you don't mind not being right on the beach. It is a short walk away from sand, but that aside, the pool is very nice!   There was construction nearby, but that is all too common in resort towns these days. It doesn't bother me.

title: Inconvenient during construction - wait till done
review: Thank you for staying with us -- and for being a loyal IHG member!  We appreciate your compliments and are glad you enjoyed your stay with us.  Yes, Jimmy's calamari is pretty awesome!   Also, the construction next door will be through quite soon, so we're sorry if it inconvenienced you at all.  We're glad you enjoyed fun time on Clearwater Beach.  Did we let you know there is a trolley that goes past the hotel if you didn't want to walk?  Again, thanks for your review and we hope you'll be back soon.  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Long weekend trip
review: Family stayed at this hotel and we visited them while we stayed at a different hotel of the beach. Excellent pool bar and pool area. A nice clean and friendly hotel. We are staying there next trip to Clearwater at the end of February.

title: Recent two week stay at the Holiday Inn
review: I recently stayed two weeks in a two room ocean front suite. I have stayed at this hotel in the past. I will point out Pro's, Con's and Tips. Overall the location of the hotel is excellent and within walking distance of everything on the island.  Pro-The sunning deck at the waters edge is excellent with plenty of chairs and right on the water at the sea wall. Con- There is NO beach at this resort. Tip- If you walk down to the pool and then south through the parking garage there is a set of steps that allow you to enter the ocean. The water depth is only about 2 feet to 3 feet deep for at least 50 to 75 yards out into the ocean. Very gradual and safe for children. If you were to continue south for another 25 feet, there is a stair case down to the ocean at Shephards resort that…

title: good hotel for families
review: Thank you so much for providing a detailed review on your stay with us.  We're so glad you were able to spend two weeks on Clearwater Beach and enjoy all that it has to offer.  Your feedback is quite valuable to us and please know that we do share it with our top management team.  We wished you would have notified the front desk on the housekeeping issue because we would have addressed it for you.  We appreciate your understanding of issues caused by the hotel next door to us.  It will be done soon and will alleviate many of the issues you addressed.  There is always something fun to do on Clearwater Beach and we do hope we'll see you back with us again this year.  Thanks again.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Revisit !
review: this was a real good hotel for the price and location. the pool and rooms were clean. it is family friendly and the breakfast is good.  the breakfast is complimentary but it includes eggs and pancakes.  The hot tub is clean and the area is well spaced

title: Below average and definitely would avoid for the price point
review: Thank you so much!  We appreciate your kind words and the time it took to share your experience so others can learn what we're all about.  You are so right - families have been our mainstay since we opened and we're delighted you were able to make family memories right here on Clearwater Beach.  Sure hope you'll be back with us again!  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Exceeded my expectations!!!
review: This is our second visit to this location !  Service was very good !  Water front location   Very busy  Convenient to area attractions within walking distance to most   Room was clean and well stocked   Unfortunately there was major construction next door on a new addition to the hotel  made parking very difficult, very dusty,  due to be complete early 17

title: Enjoy this place but.....
review: Always love staying here when we are in Clearwater. Been staying for years. Never any issues except for this morning. Woke up to a near heart attack because sounded like someone trying to get in room at 1:45am. Looked out peep hole. Just maintenance working on our door. Seriously?! This couldn't be done during day hours? I dont even know why was working on it. Had trouble falling back to sleep so thanks for that. Guess I will try sleeping on the flight home.

title: OCEAN VIEW'S A MUST
review: Wow.  We have to ask if you called us at the front desk to report this.  The safety and comfort of our guests is of extreme importance to us and you should have been notified in advance.  Please accept our sincere apologies.  Thank you for your compliments that - other than that episode - you again enjoyed your stay with us.  We do hope we'll see you back here in 2017.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: OK, just ok.
review: Checked in on 23rd November for 10 night stay after having 4 days in Orlando.  Had a gulf-view room booked.  Beautiful view, and a definite must to go the extra and pay for the view.  We could see the dolphins playing in the bay, especially just before and after sunset.  Another point, the sunsets from here are renowned and daily the management do a countdown, so you should never miss one. The weather in the main, was clear and sunny and about 75-80F. The food in the restaurant was reasonably priced and worth trying as you can sit out on their decked area and watch the world go by.  Had a thanksgiving meal there which could have been lovely (as all trimmings were tasty) but was cold by the time it arrived with me which spoilt it. Breakfasts were good, although the Americans…

title: beach vacation
review: Thank you for taking time to write about your stay here.  Many of our guests, like you, come to us after touring the central Florida theme parks and are in search of a quieter pace and natural beauty.  We're glad you found our location and resort to be to your liking (and we love the comment on American bacon -- the same might be said for sausage!)     Thanks also for your compliments to our staff - they all make it their goal to make every guest leave with pleasant memories.  We hope if you come here for holiday again that you'll be back.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: GOOD BEACHFRONT HOTEL
review: This hotel is ok, a few cockroaches in the room, old bathroom, terrible beds, very noisy. The breakfast is too pricey, the restaurant they recommend, placed in the hotel building, its food is HORRIBLE. Not joking, lol! The hallway smells old house and cigarette smoke. Located quite close to the beach, pier 60 where all the shops are and to the supermarket but also too close the noisy and highly trafficked road (which is hard to cross by foot)... The gym and pool area was quite nice but old, I won't return to this hotel but I strongly recommend Clearwater beach as destination.

title: Very nice stay for our family
review: We wanted to stay in Clearwater this time with our 2 young boys (7 and 5).   Hotel was clean and comfortable.  We had a family suite which was amazing especially if you are traveling with kids.  The bedroom was divided into 2 separate sleeping areas.  One king bed for us and a side area with a bunk bed and tv for the kiddos.  Balcony off the bedroom also.  2 bathrooms as well.  Couldn't be happier with the room for a well travelled family.  The game room kept them busy for hours.  We booked through allegiant air from Peoria.  No complaints from us.  Come here for a great family vacation.

title: Birthday Weekend of Beach Fun & Spearfishing
review: Thank you!   We're so pleased you and your family enjoyed your stay here -- and that your boys had a great time in our bunk bed room in the family suite.  Having that extra space when you have a family makes a big difference and our guests love these suites.  We're glad you enjoyed your trip down with Allegiant; they are a good partner to us and offer excellent service to our area.  Sure hope we'll see you again in 2017!  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Fantastic Location
review: The location of this hotel is fantastic. You are walking distance to stores, restaurants, bars, & the beach. There is a Sunset Celebration each night at the restaurant downstairs. The pool & pool bar area is very relaxing, you can sit & watch all the boats go by. The rooms have slightly dated decor, however they are very clean & the bed is very comfortable. If you like to fish or spearfish, there are many charters close by that will take you out for the day. Nauti Nancy's is a locals restaurant that will cook your catch. Great hotel for the price.

title: Very scenic
review: Thank you!   We appreciate your comments about your recent stay with us and are so pleased we met your expectations for a beach holiday.   You're right, we are within walking distance of all the beach fun in addition to having beautiful Gulf and sunset views right from our deck.  We do hope you'll be back with us again.  So glad you took away great memories!  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Needs update but beautiful view and excellent staff
review: I stayed at this hotel for a week with my husband and we really liked it.  The location is fantastic - there is a CVS and a few restaurants, bars and other little shops in very close walking distance.  I really liked Indian Rocks Beach - it has a slower pace and very laid back.  I was a bit worried reading some of the reviews before we travelled, but when we arrived at the hotel it was all good!  We had the standard room which had an internal view but this was not a problem.  The room had 2 large double beds and was absolutely spotless clean with a large tv, coffee machine and a full size fridge.  Didn't hear any noise from the rooms next door and the blackout curtains worked a treat.  The only noise we heard was from housekeepers' trollies or suitcases being wheeled along the…

title: Scenic and beautiful
review: Amazing view from our balcony with gulf view.  All day long dolphins where swimming in the inlet and very visible from our room.  The room was very clean and well kept and the housekeeping was very responsive and respectful.   Great place for a getaway!   The iguana bar down stairs also accommodated our children and they are free there since we were hotel guest!  Perfect vacation spot!

title: View of the pool and sunset, what more could you want?
review: Thank you!  We're so pleased you enjoyed you and your family enjoyed your stay with us -- and that the dolphins put on their best show!    Your compliments on our resort facilities and housekeeping are very much appreciated. We really want for each guest to leave with great memories and we're glad you did.    Hope you'll be back next year for more beach fun.  Season's best greetings,  Christine Bottger

title: Get away
review: Stayed here with my granddaughter for two days.  She loved watching the pool change colors at night and family friendly.  I loved the sunsets from my balcony.  Very comfy spacious and clean room.  The reception area is very helpful for hints and info... will be back soon I hope. Central location, walk to the beach....

title: Bears and Bucs!
review: Thank you so much for commenting on the stay that you and your granddaughter had here recently.   We're so glad you enjoyed what we have to offer - including those fabulous sunsets!  We hope - too - that you'll be back with us soon.  There's always something new to do in Clearwater Beach!  Season's Greetings,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Wonderful for long stays
review: The Holiday Inn Hotel and suites on the south end of Clearwater beach is an average, no frills place to stay. The building is older and pretty compact. It was fairly clean and the staff was friendly. The gulf side pool has a nice view of the gulf sunset and the out door bar/dining patio is right next door. The price is reasonable for what you get in accommodations. The beach is a short walk away.

title: Nice hotel but no beach!
review: I would first like to start off by saying that the photos of this hotel are a little misleading. The photos make it seem like it is right on the beach. While it is right on the water, there isn't a beach. With that being said, the public beach is only a couple blocks away and is very easy to walk to. So it's not really a big deal, but if you are expecting a beach right outside of the hotel, you will be disappointed. The hotel pool is nice, although there wasn't a hot tub. There were lounge chairs to sit in overlooking the water, which was beautiful, especially at sunset. The rooms were clean and up-to-date with free Wi-Fi. I never said anything to the manager (which I should have but didn't have time when I was checking out), but no one ever cleaned my room. I had a…

title: Good location for the cheap price
review: Thank you so much for taking time to write about your experience with us.  We're ultimately glad that you enjoyed beach time on Clearwater Beach and pool time here at the resort.  Regarding the photos - we do say in the front pages of our website that "we are less than 500 feet from the powder-soft sands of Clearwater Beach" because we of course want our guests to fully understand that we front on the Gulf but not on the beach itself.  Some people think our address of "Clearwater Beach" means we are directly beach front.  As you said, it is an easy walk (or trolley ride.)  As to your housekeeping issues, we so wish you had called this to our attention.  After the fact doesn't allow us to correct the mistake, so we recommend that wherever you stay, let management know of anything that needs attention.  It is our intent that each guest leaves with positive memories and 100% customer satisfaction.  Please know that your comments will be shared directly with our top management team so it can be addressed with their staff.  Thank you for reporting that we are affordable.  Our goal is to provide a fine customer service experience to each of our guests at a competitive rate.  Best wishes for the upcoming holiday season,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Great View, Great Service
review: We visited family in Safety Harbor, but wanted to stay on the beach. We chose the   Holiday Inn in Clearwater beach. Positives: directly on the water, beautiful bay views, pool looks out at the ocean, and fun dining on the bay by the water. The restaurant has a bar and a fun atmosphere, including a live band. There is construction directly next to the hotel but it didn't bother us. We couldn't hear any construction noise. We the walked to the beach, which took only 4 minutes. There a multiple restaurants and bars within walking location. The room was clean and the bathrooms were updated. Vending machine on each floor with an ice machine. We had a great time.

title: Great stay again!
review: We're so pleased you and your family took a side trip to the beach and stayed with us.  Thanks so much for taking time to write about your experience so that other potential guests will hear directly from a guest what we have to offer here at our resort.  You're right - guests love that we are in a central location close to the public beach, restaurants, and other attractions.    We hope you'll be back with us again!  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Company Business Conference held here
review: The view from Tower 2 is exceptional.  We had a suite that included the living room, separate bedroom and 2 full  bathrooms.  Very reasonably priced.  Our suite overlooked the Gulf and the beach and was very comfortable.  There is construction going on next door, but there was not a lot of noise.  We could sit on our balcony and listen to the band playing at Jimmy's Fish house on the main floor of the hotel.   By the way, the food at Jimmy's was excellent. and the service even better.  Breakfast included a buffet option and dinner was reasonably priced.  The trolly stops near the hotel (next door and directly across the street).  Great place.  I would stay again.

title: Very good hotel!!!
review: We stayed here for 2 nights as part of our holiday. Nice and basic hotel with very comfy beds and spacious rooms. We had breakfast at Jimmys restaurant which was part of the hotel and it was very good! I had pancakes and my family had eggs, bacon, sausages, toast etc... A special mention goes out to the staff at the reception who were exceptionally helpful telling us everything we needed to know and to make us experience at Clearwater easier and better (even step by step instructions on how to get to Busch gardens!) would definitely recommend this hotel!!!!

title: Mini-Vacay
review: Thank you!  We appreciate your kind words and are so glad you were able to enjoy a trip to Clearwater as part of your holiday.    Your compliments to our staff will be shared with our top management as our team here wants every guest to leave with great memories.  We're glad you'll be recommending us - but we sure hope you're planning your return visit soon.  We love to see our guests return!  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Road Trip Stop
review: Absolutely love this place. Staff is super friendly. Tiki bar at the pool is always hopping, and you can't beat the views! Things to do for the whole family. Our 9 year old played in the arcade while we also enjoyed lounging at the pool. Plenty of room on deck. Games at the pool available. Jimmy's Fish House is right next door. Perfect layout. Deck was kept spotless and we always felt safe and all areas of the hotel were clean and neat. Front desk staff was more than friendly and helpful. The place has personality and charm but also has the accommodations and the service you expect from the IHG chain. Many things to do within walking distance and our unit had a nice kitchen area that we could stock with the local market goods. Would definitely make this a destination when we are…

title: Good price and close to beach
review: Thank you for your compliments!  We're glad you and your family had a great time here - and we're glad you were able to enjoy the spaciousness of our family suites.  You are right - we are centrally located to the beach, shops, dining and the marina - all within walking distance of trolley ride.  You also share the opinion of many guests -- our views are quite spectacular  We sure hope you'll be back with us as soon as possible - and we'd love to see you stay in touch on our Facebook page.  Thanks again,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Last minute local trip
review: This hotel was very clean and the staff were so nice.  The hot breakfast in the morning was delicious.  They have a pancake machine! The beds were comfortable.  The pillow choice option was perfect. Free parking on site.

title: Still good
review: We stayed here 3 years ago and couldn't wait to come back, although we knew about the construction. That said, and before I go any further, any gripes we had were mentioned to the duty manager before we left - I don't believe in saying nothing and then writing a bad review, its unfair.  The valet upon arrival loaded our cases (several due to the 4 of us being on a 3 week road trip) onto a trolley and then disappeared. After check in, we struggled to manoeuvre the trolley to our room but we sort of managed. The room, a gulf view suite as requested, was lovely, as we remembered. Clean, spacious and comfortable. However, a plug socket was hanging off the wall and the hairdryer was unusable due to the buttons missing therefore exposing the wiring. We made a call, the socket was…

title: Couldn't have had a better stay
review: Thank you so much for writing a detailed report of your experience with us.  Of course it is our goal that each of our guests have a completely 100% positive experience, so please know that you comments you shared will be reviewed by top management.  We're so sorry you had disruptive music and offensive people marring what should have been a great vacation, and your comment on the music is duly noted.  And we apologize that your car was soiled due to construction issues.    We're very glad you brought these issues to our attention while you were with us to enable us the opportunity to address them.    Thank you, overall, for being such a valued customer and we do look forward to having you return.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger  General Manager

title: This hotel has so much to offer
review: Hotel was nice and clean, even with the nearby construction, which I was forewarned about.  The staff were very, very helpful with anything I asked for whether it directions or anything else. The room was clean and the a/c cold.  Jimmy's bar was very convenient and the food we had, lobster mac n cheese, coconut shrimp and clam chowder with a1/2 sandwich were delicious.  The outside pool area and bar were also very convenient for those that prefer to stay "local."  All in all, I was very pleased with this hotel and its staff and will probably seek it out in the future.

title: Good, but too expensive for the type of hotel!
review: Thank you for your kind comments about your recent stay!  We're so pleased you enjoyed all we have to offer and we appreciate your patience as construction continues next door.    You're correct, with Jimmy's offering inside/outside dining, it is easy to never leave your "beach home away from home" and we do hope you'll be back soon!  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Mixed Review
review: With this being a big trip and not wanting to disappoint, I was a little nervous with some of the bad reviews.  I found each of those went unfounded.  Yes, this is a beach hotel, things can be slightly more worn than at a pristine resort but we thought everything was really nice.  Our check-in experience with Taylor was fantastic.  She was very welcoming and had us set up in a great room.  The room was spacious, clean, and comfortable.  There was a balcony for us to dry our towels and unwind after a short walk over to the beach.  The pool was great, lots of chairs and a fun bartender from the City of Champions (Pittsburgh).  We even stopped by their well equipped fitness center and great on-site restaurant.  This is a hotel that I would love to visit again!  I only had two…

title: Right by the shore, comfortable rooms with great view
review: We spent two nights Labour day weekend at Holiday Inn and really enjoyed our stay. It was not the biggest or smartest hotel by the shore but our stay in the two-bedroom suite was very comfortable. Barring two minor repair issue, the rooms were spotless, well-planned with comfortable beds and plenty of space to spread out.   The location is pretty great. The back of the hotel backs is right by the water with views out to the water.  Apparently you could spot dolphins but it was Hurricane Hermine when we were there and the dolphins were in deeper waters.  There is no beach access from the hotel but you only need to walk about 5-8 minutes away.  Pier 60 was not to far and there's plenty to eat round the area including a very handy gas station and supermarket across the road for…

title: Large suites, good location but is very dated.
review: Thank you!   We appreciate that you took the time to tell us (and others) about your recent stay.   Please accept apologies for Tropical Storm Hermine's bad manner at leaving us with less than perfect beach weather for a few days!  We're so pleased at your compliments on our staff and will be certain to share them.  Each of our team members want every guest to enjoy great memories -- and to come back again!  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Good hotel for the price
review: Stayed 2 nights in July 2016.  The location of this hotel is very good. It's on the waterfront with spectacular views of the sunset and walking distance to the beach and restaurants. On arrival our daughter was given a soft toy which was a nice touch.   The suite we choose was large. It was in fact two adjoining rooms with one converted into a studio kitchen, living, dining room. We had two bathrooms, one with a shower and the other shower over bath.  A big complaint would have to be the lack of a hotel safe in the room. It is just not acceptable these days to not provide a safe in the room.  We chose this hotel based on price as we were staying over 4th July weekend and the prices in town were very expensive. It was perfectly adequate for our stay but I would have preferred to…

title: Didn't stay!!
review: Thank you for taking time to write about your visit to our resort.  Please know that we value guest feedback as it helps our team in our efforts to provide excellent customer service.     We're pleased your daughter loved her little amenity gift - we love spoiling our little friends!  And, we're glad that you took advantage of a suite to give you extra room.  You're correct that the 4th of July holiday weekend is very busy in the area.  As far as rates are concerned, we do our best to provide good value because we want all our guests to leave with good memories.  Again, thanks for your input.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger

title: Fine hotel, close to the beach
review: Me, My Wife, and 5 year old Son stayed at this hotel in a 2 queen bed room. The hotel and our room smelled good. We didn't have any bed bugs and the room was clean. The location of the hotel was pretty good. U can walk to Pier 60 and Clearwater Beach from the hotel pretty easy. The pool lights up different colors at night and it has a good view of the Sea. The staff were friendly including the valet parkers. The only things I didn't like was the fact that late at night sometimes there is no one at the front desk and there is no bell to it. The elevator is pretty slow as well and there are a lot of buildings under construction nearby. Overall those are small problems to me and it was a good deal for the price.

title: Loved the Suite
review: This was my first stay in Clear water beach.  The hotel is easy to find it's smaller than some of the others in the area, but it's in a good location.  Once we arrived and gave our car to the Valet we did not use it until we left 3 days later. The hotel is clean, the staff very friendly and was a good value ( now keep in mind that we were there in Aug ) so it is not their peak season which is during the winter months.  The rooms were clean one room had two queen beds and a full bath, it had a TV. The other room had a sofa, easy chair a table with four chairs.  It also had a TV, mini frig, micro wave and a bar sink.   The beds were comfortable as well as the pillows. The cleaning staff was also friendly an one morning after we came back from the beach we found a dog made of…

title: Good value, awesome bar
review: Thank you!   We appreciate the time you put in to provide readers information on what we have here as seen from a guest perspective.  We're so glad you enjoyed the resort, proximity to Clearwater Beach, and the general beauty that surrounds us.  Are you on Facebook with us?  We'd love to stay in touch and give you reasons to come back!  Thanks again,  Christine Bottger

title: Very nice place
review: Catching up on my review writing... We stay here for 2 trips(April 2013,May2014) We were looking for a warm weather getaway which wouldn't break the bank. We felt the Holiday inn was a great value. The location was great. While it was not on the beach you are very close to the beach path. This was not a big deal for us because we were happy to lounge ocean side with a tropical drink from the bar in the hotel lounge chairs. Rooms were dated but clean. We had a nice lunch at the restaurant but typically we went out for breakfast and dinners. There are several dining options that are walkable or there was always taxis available if needed. After dinner we would go to the bar. What fun! Bartenders were friendly. There was usually live music playing and it was very laid back. I got…

title: Family stay
review: Thank you!   You have a great memory and we're glad you stayed with us!  You're right - you are due for another trip back, and we hope you'll come back for more fun.   You'll notice some changes but we're still focused on customer service and keeping our guests happy!  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: We Love It Here!!
review: Our room was very nice and clean. The pool was very nice. The game on the back hooking a ring was fun, I would definitely go back. I did not pay the bill so I cant say anything about the value for the money.

title: Least favorite part of favorite trip
review: My boyfriend arrived in Clearwater before me and was going to check into the hotel so that when I arrived at 10 PM, we could just go up to our room. The gentleman (strong word) at the front desk wouldn't let him check in because the reservation was under my name, even though the hotel was paid for with his card. I can look past that, but it still wasn't pleasant. In addition, there was a magical $12/day parking fee added on at check-in. The pool area is nice, but smells pretty awful (probably from the Gulf right beyond) When we booked the hotel, we thought that it was beachside, and the images suggested it, but it is not. There is some riffraff along the building to stop erosion, and then just water - so there is still a bit of a hike to Clearwater beach. We stayed on the second…

title: Perfect location
review: Dear Whitney W,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our hotel. It is regrettable that some aspects of our amenities and services did not live up to your expectations. I sincerely apologize for any inconvenience you may have experienced. Please allow us to follow up on your concerns and have the opportunity to make it up to you. I have sent you a private message in an effort to obtain additional information. I look forward to your response.  Sincerely,  Faith R Case Manager IHGService

title: Nice location in the Clearwater Beach area
review: We recently stayed 5 nights on the 8th floor, overlooking the city.  Our stay was very nice.  We loved the pool area and sun deck overlooking the water.  This hotel is not beachfront but it is waterfront.    I felt like the staff were all just OK.  When we checked in, they never acknowledged that I was a HI club member, I had to ask if they had my numbers and at that point they thanked me for being a member.    The girl who handled the pool area was very nice and friendly.  There are towels available until late afternoon.  The bar service is also very nice.  I don't like the fact that you can't have any food/drink that is not purchased in their bar/restaurants around the pool.  They don't really police that issue too much but there are signs.    We had no issues with the valet. …

title: Valet Parking Issue
review: Thank you so much for telling about your stay with us.  We're so pleased you enjoyed your stay and we really appreciate your feedback and comments.  These are reviewed by top management so we can continue to improve our customer service.  So glad to hear you hope to be back.  We'd love to see you again!  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: A few problems!
review: Nice spot at Clearwater Beach but you got no direct access to the beach, you need to walk 400 m in order to access the public beach. Hotel is really OK, nice rooms but a lot of noice from the air conditioning system on the balcony. We got a really nice view from the room and could follow the sunset in the ocean

title: Dirty and basic amenities
review: The hotel is basic. At night we had difficulties with our toilet (noises and hot air was coming up through the toilet making it also hot when we needed to use it). They said no one was there and we would have to wait until the morning. The toilet was also dirty, I'm sure you can figure out what I mean without too many details. They do the bare minimum in the room. Don't look behind or under anything because you will be disgusted. We enjoyed the beach but we won't be staying here again and will spend the extra cash to stay somewhere a bit cleaner with better amnesties and support staff.

title: Great location
review: Dear dva1234:  Thank you for sharing your most recent experience with our resort.  We are reviewing your comments and currently have our Engineering Team investigating the issue you stated with the commode.  We do have to say this is the first we have heard such a thing.    We have also shared your feedback with our housekeeping team.   All feedback whether positive or negative is valuable to our overall success and for that we appreciate you taking time to share yours with us, and apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused your during your stay.    Best Regards,   Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Between everything!!
review: Stayed 3 days.    Pros: Ocean view room balconies were nice.  Good 2 man band that plays in the evening.  Within walking distance to a lot of restaurants, as well as a trolley stop.  Be sure to check out the trolley as it is invaluable.  No direct beach access but easy walk to beach.  Cons: Currently lots of construction so valet only parking, which I HATE.  Also to get to beach you will need to walk on the street as the construction has a sidewalk.  #HumanFrogger  Overall 5 stars and I would return.

title: Good location, old and tired hotel
review: Thank you so very much for taking time to write a review.  We value you as a customer and are so glad you enjoyed your stay and our resort.  We also thank you for your patience during the construction and parking issues.  We do try and work with the construction team to minimize disruption, and valet parking is our only option at this time due to space limitations.  We delighted to hear you're hoping to come back - and hopefully these issues will be resolved by then.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Great Trip
review: Beautiful view of the bridge & sunset. Room was clean & comfortable. Breakfast was good. Pool & the band at the bar were a great way to wind down in the evening for adults & kids alike. Though not beachfront, was close enough walk for even little kiddos.

title: Has some good things!
review: The manager and front desk staff were helpful and very hard working. The property has many things going for it and a few the staff can't fix right now. The hotel is not beach front. It is waterfront right on Clearwater Pass. It's very cool to watch the boats go by. We even saw several manatee from our balcony. The main restaurant has fun atmosphere and makes sunset fun with free shots.  Now for the drawbacks. The construction is a big issue. The parking guys are great but no self park. It is loud and ugly blocking views of the sunset from most rooms. Cleanliness is an issue for carpets and my bead spread had a brown stain. Yuk! The area is crowded and busy. Walkable but nerve racking traffic. No free breakfast. The coffee shop opens at 7. So so. They never had everything needed…

title: The location was gorgeous!  The staff was very polite and helpful and the room was clean and comfortable.
review: Thank you for taking time to share with us your experience during your stay.  Please know feedback such as you provided is extremely important because customer satisfaction truly is our ultimate goal.    We would have alerted housekeeping regarding your carpets and bed spread had we known because cleanliness is extremely important.  The construction can be disruptive although we do work with the crew chiefs to keep it to encourage as little disruption as possible.  Yes, there is no self-park since the location is a bit away from the resort, so we're sorry if that was an issue with you.  Ultimately we hope you took away good memories of your stay with us and hope you enjoyed some great sunset.   Thanks again.  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Don't bother if you're looking for nice accommodations
review: The only complaint was that people staying in the room across from us woke us up in the middle of the night because they were drunk and yelling. We called the front desk and someone came right away asking them to quiet down.  They eventually did.  It would have been nice to have a complimentary breakfast.

title: Great View location
review: Thank you for taking time to write about your stay.  We're so pleased you enjoyed your beach vacation - and sorry your room neighbors disrupted your evening.  Re: the complimentary breakfast -- we do offer the Kids Eat Free through Holiday Inn but not for adults.  Sorry.  Again, we are so glad you chose to visit us and hope you'll return again.  Please stay in touch on our Facebook page if you like.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: False advertising
review: It wasn't completely terrible but I wouldn't go back. Touted as a beach resort, it's actually located a mile from the beautiful Clearwater beaches. Not awful, but not exactly on the beach.  The rooms and hotel are run down, and with construction on the property, no view from the side we stayed. As a matter of fact, the front desk had a "surprise" for us and that's the location we were given. Not sure what the surprise was...?  The staff was excellent and Jimmy's was the only redeeming quality of the location. No parking and forced to use the $12/day valet...not worth it. Find a different hotel if you're visiting the Clearwater Beach area.

title: Great Hotel, Great Location!
review: Spent 6 days there last week and had an amazing time. Clean spacious rooms, fantastic restaurant and bar. Staff were helpful and nice! Construction a minor inconvenience but not worth over looking this great hotel. Can't wait to return when the new addition opens!

title: Nice Place!
review: Thanks!  We're so glad you had long enough to unwind and appreciate all we have in the resort as well as the surrounding area.  We appreciate your compliments on the rooms, Jimmy's Fish House and location.  And - we're glad you look forward to returning.  If you're on Facebook, please follow us for updates, photos and news. Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Great place for a family vacay!
review: Holiday inn was a great place. The pool was big and clean and the bar and restaurant was nice too! It is not right on the beach so if you're looking for a place directly on the beach, this isn't for you. Although it's a 5 minute walk and it was easy! The room was your typical Holiday Inn hotel room. For the 2 of us, it was the perfect size and we had a city view! Good hotel for a good price if you're on a budget

title: Lovely stay!
review: Thanks!  We're happy you had a nice holiday at our resort and enjoyed our amenities, pool, closeness to beach and affordable price.  Please stay in touch with us on Facebook for updates and news -- we'd love to entice you back for another stay on award-winning Clearwater Beach! Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Week stay
review: My mom and I brought my daughter and niece and nephew. We stayed in the suite with the bunkbeds. It was wonderful! The room was very nice with granite top vanities and a full sink in the kitchenette. We loved the pool looking over the ocean. We saw dolphins jumping in the water on the first day. We also loved Jimmy Iguana's and that the kids ate free, since we had 3 of them. We ate there everyday and for the most part enjoyed the food. We didnt mind having to valet the car and the valet guys were great and very helpful. The walk to the beach was very short and easy. We never heard any work being done from our room. No complaints! Great place to take a family!

title: Fantastic Location
review: Stayed a night here and was so handy, 10min walk to pier60, downstairs bar great at night. Check in and out was so easy. Rooms could do with an upgrade but apart from that all good. Would recommend this for location

title: Recommended hotel
review: Thank you!  We're glad you enjoyed your stay here with us and appreciate your compliments.    We do hope you'll be with us again for more beach fun.  Please stay in touch with us on our Facebook page for updates and reasons to come back.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Family stay in Clearwater
review: Although there is no beach access from the hotel it's really not a problem. It's only a 2 minute walk away. Most of the hotels along the beach are across the road, this hotel is on the waters edge and has great views out to sea. Rooms are a little tired but clean and comfortable. All staff have been pleasant and helpful. We've had a nice time at this hotel.

title: There's way better hotels on the beach!!
review: We're so pleased you enjoyed your stay here, and thank you for writing to let others know about us!  We're glad you found the rooms comfortable and the beach to be accessible within minutes.  Most importantly to us, we appreciate your compliments on our staff and that you had a wonderful stay.  Hope you'll be back! Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Family Vaca with Baby
review: Nice location conveniently located, very close to the beach (no direct access) and several tourist attractions, the pool area is nice and the restaurant offer good service and good food quality.  Maybe the constructions around were not funny but the funny family interaction made us to avoid that part.   Convenient prices!

title: Beautiful Property, nice room- but no direct beach access
review: My family stayed here for one night in mid-July 2016 and found it to be wonderful!  We were upgraded to a poolside room, which we are normally apprehensive about since it is normally noisy.  However, the insulation must be thicker in the windows/doors and walls, because you could barely hear the noise, even on the first floor!  We had access directly outside our slider to a beautiful pool and ocean view.  To access the beach, you had to exit the hotel and walk around the block.  We did not do this since we were staying only one night and didn't have enough time, but I figured I'd mention it to those looking for "beach front" properties, since this is "sort of" a beach front property, without direct access.  Room was clean, a/c worked nice and beds were comfy.  Front desk…

title: Clean and comfortable, but....!
review: Thank you so much!   We're so appreciative of the time you took to write about your experience here - and we're ultimately very pleased that you enjoyed all aspects of your stay!  We also appreciate your comments on the resort amenities, staff, and Jimmy's Fish House & Iguana Bar and we will share them with top management.  We, like most Clearwater properties, do charge for parking simply because space is at a premium here on the beach.  We do try and keep it affordable though, so thank you for noting that.  Sorry we were sold out and you couldn't stay longer!  Clearwater Beach is currently listed as the top U.S. beach on Trip Advisor, and it is a short walk or trolley ride from us.    Please stay in touch with us on Facebook for reasons to come back, news, and deals.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Great place
review: We stayed one night in two rooms. It's a good clean hotel with well equipped rooms, the downside was incredibly noisy air con units. It was like trying to sleep at an airport.   Breakfast was included but disappointing. Buffet style with very limited choice, Luke warm and bacon like elastic bands!

title: Great value for the family
review: Thank you for sharing words about your experience with us.    We appreciate your comments, and please know we take guest feedback seriously.  We will share your comments on Jimmy's Fish House with their top management.  Thank you for commenting on our cleanliness.  Our housekeeping staff wants every guest to appreciate the comfort of their room.  We hope you left with good memories of Clearwater Beach.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Priceless sunset and hotel!
review: We had a great trip. The hotel was clean and friendly.  Our room was right next to construction and we were not bothered by it. Most noise was covered up by our air conditioning unit. Beach is a short walk. All in all a great trip.

title: Close to water
review: Room and stay was nice overall.  Didn't like the valet parking experience.  When we arrived, there was a mess of cars in front and we quickly got what we thought we needed from the car.  I asked the valet if we would have access to the car, since there were some cars parked in front, and he said yes.  Later when we realized we needed something from the car, we went to get it but the car was inaccessible.  The valet said he could get the car for us, or the bag we needed if we could describe it and where in the car it was. When we checked out, it was also nuts trying to get out of the lot, with guests pulling into the small area.  One other problem was, the sidewalk next door was under construction, so to get to the beach, you have to go down the street, cross the street, go back…

title: Nice restaurant and bar
review: Thank you so much for your review and insights about your stay here with us.  We're sorry the issues of construction next door, a busy season, and the mandatory valet parking due to limited space were inconveniences for you and we appreciate your indulgence.  You did indicate you enjoyed the resort overall and we're so pleased you had a good one night's stay.   Hopefully you'll be back again for a longer stay -- perhaps during spring training if your Red Sox play the Jays or Phillies?  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Disappointing gulf-view rooms, mandatory paid valet parking.
review: I'm rating the restaurant and bar, not the hotel rooms. We are locals and find this a nice place to eat. It is located on the water. You might even see the  dolphins jumping and you will view a beautiful sunset if you are there at that time. They have nice music, reasonable prices, great food, drinks and atmosphere. Good service as well. We definitely recommend it.

title: Usually a favorite hotel of mine but this stay is disappointing
review: Thank you!   You're right - many locals come to enjoy the food, music, and views at Jimmy's Fish House & Iguana Bar, and we're always glad to have you here!    We appreciate your kind words on the service, entertainment and music and look forward to seeing you around again.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Good for the price
review: I'm writing this review in comparison to my experience with the Holiday Inn in Daytona Beach last year.  To begin, I booked a "Gulf View" room, which was $30 / day more than generic rooms with a King-sized bed. Last year, I'd booked an "Ocean View" room in Daytona which provided direct beach access from the pool area, so this was my expectation for the Clearwater hotel as well. In reality, there is no direct beach access and you'll need to walk 5 - 10 minutes to get to the beach.  The distinction between "Bay Front" and "City Front" at Clearwater is that with Bay Front you get a roughly 90-degree angle view of the Gulf of Mexico which is marred by an awful hotel construction project (currently all concrete) to the right of the hotel. And you get to drown out the wailing of…

title: Fantastic hotel
review: Love this hotel! Have been a few times and never disappointed. Lovely rooms, pleasant staff and good food. Love sitting looking over the bay at sunset. Unfortunately a newly built hotel adjacent has taken away the gulf view from a large number of rooms. Now we are unlikely to return as the view from the rooms was a major selling point. Building so close should just not be allowed.

title: Nice Beach
review: Thank you for writing to us about your recent visit.  We love our repeat visitors and are so pleased you returned for more enjoyment on Clearwater Beach.  As for the construction, the permits allowed are reviewed and authorized according to City statutes.  Since you've been here before, of course it seems very close compared to what it was before.  Yes, it does block the view from some rooms but if you ask for a room with a view, we'll do our best to accommodate you.    Ultimately, we thank you for being a valued guest and hope you took away good memories of Clearwater Beach.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Rude front desk
review: What a view this is a great hotel if you want to be close to the beach. Was here for one week and it was great the have it all in one place didn't even have to go don stair to get any thing. Front desk brought it right to your room with in minutes of me calling👍

title: A week of sun & relaxation
review: Thank you!  We're so pleased you enjoyed your visit with us!  Thanks for the compliments on the resort amenities, views and staff.    Our ultimate goal is for our guests to enjoy their time here on Clearwater Beach and we're glad you left with good memories.  Please come back and see us again!  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Decent for the price
review: WOW. Really rude front desk lady. Asked a question. She gave an answer that had nothing to do with question. Asked her question again. She got nasty and hung up on me. Over 300$ a night for this kind of treatment?

title: Vacation
review: We stayed from 6-12/6-17 and had one of the most relaxing vacations yet! Construction didn't bother us at all, it's also states on their website when you book that there is construction. We never heard anything from them while in our room. The hotel staff at check-in was excellent. We checked in 3.5 hours early and our room was ready when we got there! Valet parking was nice. Service was always quick while waiting to get our truck back. The staff that does house keeping was okay. They couldn't understand what we were saying, due to them not speaking any English. Not sure if this goes for every one of them, or just the few we had. We asked them for a few things and they just nodded and smiled. Still friendly. Always smiling. Bought a few things from the gift shop. Used the…

title: Pastor B. Whitted
review: Great time at the hotel, the sunset is priceless! Everything is just a few min walk beach, parasailing, jet ski all in walking distance! Great staff safe, clean! Mornings and evening are great pool deck, looking over the gulf! Food close beach just a few mim walk, ask for the water view or pool view!!

title: Great view/Needs updated for price
review: Thank you!  We're so glad you enjoyed your stay and we certainly appreciate your kind words about the resort and our staff.  Sure hope you'll be back with us again!  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Just a disgrace
review: This year is our 3rd time staying here.  The location and views are really amazing.  The pool area sits right on the main boat thoroughfare.  The views of the boats heading in and out all day is truly unbeatable!  However, the hotel hasn't seen much love over the last couple of years.  We stayed in a 2 room oceanfront suite.  While the room was clean, the walls were dirty, sides of the bathroom vanity were gross, etc.  I tried to clean it myself but realized it was mainly dirty looking because of age and wear and tear.  Just visually unappealing.  I think it wouldn't have been so noticeable if the rooms were more reasonably priced.  We paid about 280 per night.  We also had to get a cot for our son's friend and it was the worst.  It was so bad that I suggested he sleep on the…

title: Travelled for Buisness
review: Thank you for taking time to write about your stay with us.   Of course we want every guest to have their expectations met and leave with wonderful memories and we're sorry to learn you did not feel 100% positive.  Please know we do share review comments with the highest management level so we can continue to improve our customer's satisfaction level and these issues will be addressed. As far as the cot is concerned, we're sorry you didn't know about our Family Suites that have bunk beds and is very spacious.  We do hope you'll consider returning next year, and feel free to contact me personally if I can guide you to the best room for your needs.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: False Advertising, Horrific Customer Service, and Misplaced Personal Items
review: We take an annual Memorial Day weekend trip to the Holiday Inn in Vero Beach (which is AMAZING) and decided to try something different for a quick weekend getaway from Orlando this summer. We mistakenly assumed that the Holiday Inn in Clearwater would provide the same stellar customer service but were quickly disappointed.  For starters, their website states that the beach is 400 steps away and we were told on the phone when making reservations that the hotel was ON the BEACH. The hotel is NOT on a BEACH. It faces the Gulf of Mexico but there is nothing but a pool and a dock out back. The beach is a significant distance from the hotel and you have to cross the street with no crosswalk because there are no sidewalks due to the construction next door. You then have to cross back…

title: Special Birthday-- but such a let down
review: Dear Mallory H:  Thank you for taking the time to share your most recent experience with our resort.   Feedback whether positive or negative is important to our overall success.     We strive to be the leader in customer service on the beach, and it appears we failed you in this instance.   While we are on Clearwater Beach, we do not in-fact have any beach out back.  We are terribly sorry for any confusion regarding this.   Crosswalks are available and are strongly encouraged to use just south of the hotel due to the sidewalk currently being closed, as well as there are local transportation companies that will take guests to and from for a nominal charge.  We apologize we didn’t have the opportunity to share that with you personally.    Our pool policy as are most resort hotels in our area, is that no outside food & beverage are allowed in or around our pool area.  We have a full service restaurant and bar on hand to provide our guests with the necessary and food and beverage items they may need.   Regarding the tent, it was in fact left out in the hallway, and after several attempts of finding it's rightful owner, the housekeeping supervisor brought it down for safe keeping in our luggage storage closet.  He did fail to communicate that to our Manager on Duty so that it could have been quickly returned to you.
