During the course of our Management Team talking to the Police Officer, our evening Engineer stated that the tent was in the luggage closest. We know it may seem that it mysteriously disappeared until the Officer arrived, but that was not the case at all.    Regarding the Pet Fee, it is fact true that our Hotel only accepts Service Animals.  Service Animals according to the ADA are animals that provide a service or function for a person that is limited by a disability.  Emotional Support dogs help individuals by providing comfort or support.    Emotional Support, Therapy, Comfort or Companion Animals are not considered service animals under the American Disability Act as they are not trained to perform a specific job or task at this time.  Had the hotel been made aware at the time of check-in about the dog, we would have communicated that to you at the time of check-in as well.    Our Manager on Duty was actually on the phone with Holiday Inn Guest Relations at the time it was noted the tent was in the luggage closet, and was still on the phone at the time the tent was presented to you by the officer.  I am convinced if he were not on the phone, he would have been there to ensure that you received your tent personally.    Again, we are truly sorry that you feel you were not given accurate information or treated unfairly.  Should you wish to discuss this further or have any further questions, you may reach me directly at cbottger@ClearwaterBeachHI.com.  Thank you again for your feedback.

title: Just o.k.
review: Horrendous! Despite booking this 5 months ago, they failed to tell you there is MAJOR building work going on next door. So the 50th Birthday treat of a view of the Gulf was marred by a concrete wall to the right. It's lovely hearing the crashing of the waves and the drilling of walls...  What else? Not one of the coke machines is working on any floor. The gift shop was unstaffed despite waiting 5 minutes....  Fortunately only 2 nights here.

title: 2 day stay
review: We appreciate the comments you left regarding your stay and we're sorry we did not live up to your expectations.   We do publicize the construction next door through our travel partners and are sorry you did not know this.  We do hope you contacted the front desk regarding the coke machine, the unstaffed gift shop (we usually only have one attendant so she may have had to step out) and if we knew your room was not satisfactory, we would have tried to move you.  If you would like to email me to discuss this further, please do so at CBottger@clearwaterbeachholidayinn.com.  Thank you, and we hope you did leave with special moments of your special day.  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Great location--Nice pool--well appointed rooms
review: Hotel was ok. Nice pool facilities. About a 10 minute walk to beach. There are two restaurants on site. We tried to eat at the seafood restaurant and could not get service so we left and ate somewhere else. Our first night there, the valet service damaged our car. Beds were comfortable, and our room (double queen) was a nice size. Getting ice was a bit of a pain; machine was out of order on our floor and the floor above ours.

title: Not bad.
review: We stayed there for six nights in May this year. The Hotel is located on S Gulfview Bvd. about ten minutes walk from the Pier 60 area. Rooms are clean, and tidy. Staff are professional but the ones we dealt with were somewhat 'flat' in their attitude. Parking is valet only at a cost of $12 per day. Our room had a Gulf view.......if you craned your neck round the balcony edge..what we looked out on was the window of the corridor opposite or the air conditioning units...talking of which, our aircon unit was so loud we had a choice of not sleeping due to the noise, or not sleeping due to the heat! The pool is nice, if somewhat small and has a pool bar. Drinks are apparently not allowed in or around the pool, but this was being universally ignored. It was a bit unpleasant having to…

title: Great value hotel in a good location
review: Thank you so much for staying with us and taking time to comment on your experience.  We do appreciate guest feedback and are sorry that the smokers at the bar were bothersome.   As well, we hope you called our attention to the a/c unit so we could have had maintenance come out and repair it for you -- we wouldn't want any guest to sleep in the heat!  Again, we are glad you enjoyed the beach and entire area and do hope you'll be back with us again.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Family Vacation
review: Have not long returned from a short visit to the Holiday Inn and can say I was very impressed indeed.  I had a room on the 7th floor with a partial view of the swimming pool and bay area. The room is spacious with a standard two double beds. A nice touch was the alarm clock which has an ipod dock making listening to music possible, without speakers!  Wifi from my room (703) was excellent making a facetime conversation easy and simple without delays.   Made use of the pool, with plenty of sunbeds which was just big enough to swim and cool down in the afternoon sun, pool towels were on hand so no need to pack!   Although the hotel does not have a beachfront location, it is located on the waterfront and makes a great spot to sit in the early morning with a coffee and watch the sun…

title: Long weekend
review: Thank you so much for your kind words - and we're so glad you enjoyed your stay here on Clearwater Beach.  We appreciate the comments on the accommodations, location and other resort amenities.   Your tips on getting to the beach are good and we would add one - the trolley or Florida Free Rides that come up to our door.   It's a convenient way to get around!  Thanks for indicating that you'll be back with us again.  Nothing pleases us more than repeat guests!  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Bugs and wet floors...
review: This was our first trip to Clearwater so choosing a hotel was quite frightening. I must say we were pleasantly pleased with Holiday Inn Hotel and Suites. We had a suite on the 5th floor facing the gulf and I think it was worth every penny. During our stay we saw dolphins, stingrays and manatees! The front desk staff was very friendly and accommodating to our needs. Between my husband and the kids, I think we utilized every amenity. I think the beach was more like 5 minutes and we never used our van to go into town. We will definately return soon!

title: 4 night stay
review: Good location approx 10 mins walk to sandy beach Valet parking works well & is $12 per day Yes currently building work but did not affect us during our stay Food pleasant & staff helpful Would stay at hotel again if in area

title: Great place to stay
review: Thank you!   We're so glad you stayed with us and enjoyed your vacation time.  We appreciate your words so others can learn from your experience.  Please stay in touch with us on Facebook for reasons to come back.  We'd love to have you!  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Beautiful view
review: My friend and I have stayed before and had another great time here. Check in was easy and friendly and allowed an early check in. In one of our rooms the air conditioner wasn't working when we arrived and a very hard working maintenance man had it replaced quickly which we appreciated so much along with his kindness. Each and every person on the housekeeping staff showed courtesy to us by holding elevator doors for us and always asking what they could do for us. Zeni and the front desk people accommodated us whenever we needed help.  They allowed us to check out a day early due to Tropical Storm Colin which we appreciated. Jimmy's was a delight again with delicious food and nightly music but we missed seeing George 😓. We did not have a car but we used Florida Free Rides, the…

title: Beach side rooms had a beautiful view
review: Thank you so much for your kind words!  We very much appreciate your comments on our staff, because they all work so hard to make our guests' experience a memorable one.  So sorry that Tropical Storm Colin interrupted your holiday plans.  Fortunately, he is long gone now and we can return to our normal beach beauty.  We always share feedback with our top management team, so we'll let Jimmy's staff know you enjoyed their food and entertainment.   Sorry that George disappeared - he must have been hiding out because of the storm.  Yes, you gave fine examples of the ground transportation options -- so glad it worked out for you.  Thanks again and hope to see you back here!  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Mini getaway
review: This was out first visit here. Very good location. 10 minutes away from the beach. It is not very modern but very clean and comfortable. Hotel's restaurant has pretty good food however they should think about changing the crew because some waitresses are not very polite. the restaurant itself is located on the golf's shore which is amazing. Highly recommended.

title: Great location and a friendly staff
review: Somewhat older hotel that has been renovated.  Great restaurant on the water that celebrates sunset every evening with live music and a free rum punch shot.  Rooms were clean and very quiet.    No direct beach access as its on the inlet but a public beach is a 4 minute walk.

title: The best!!!!!!!
review: Thank you!  We do appreciate your compliments and are glad you stayed with us for your Clearwater Beach holiday.   We're glad you found our location to shops, dining and beach easy and that you enjoyed dining in Jimmy's.  Sure hope you'll be with us again!  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Good location
review: Let's have a look at the negatives first.....................NONE!!!!!! (apart from some morons who feel the love to moan!) So lets get into the positives (and this comes from a qualified Hotel Manager) Staff: the most welcoming people you could ever wish to meet.   Reception offered the most wonderful welcome.  Exceptionally smart and truly professional. Housekeeping absolutely excellent observing the best standards. FOOD!!!!!!!!! My passion The restaurant was excellent, presentation and food  offered a great choice with prompt service in a great atmosphere.  Comprehensive choice. Best breakfast buffet I have ever known served with a smile.  John on Breakfast is so very warm and also very amusing. No-one could possibly critisize sitting on the decking  eating wonderful food by…

title: Gorgeous view
review: Good location. Nice view of the gulf with dolphin sightings. Nice atmosphere for a family trip at the pool overlooking the gulf and nice onsite restaurant/bar with evening music, and beautiful sunset view with complimentary sunset shots. Was disappointed when making reservation that the hotel did not tell us that if you have your own car there is an additional $12 per day charge to park and that the parking is ONLY valet...and if you are concerned about the etiquette related to that, the valets expect a tip of around $5 each time they get your car. I do not know if they expect a tip when you drop it off too, but they didn't get one from me when parking it. Also, when at the pool, watch out for the brown and black bird who will swoop down and occasionally dive at you while…

title: Well located but in need of face lift
review: Thank you for staying with us and providing comments and feedback.  We share such comments with our management team so we can continue to improve our customer experience.  Our goal is that everyone leave with beautiful memories.  Regarding the valet, it is necessary to have this because of the construction next door which leaves minimal space for parking anywhere on the beach, and you will find the majority of resorts do charge.    The tip you provide is optional and at your discretion.  This is an independent company, but we will make note of your comments.    We do hope you left with good memories of Clearwater Beach.  Please come back when your vacation plans include sun and sand.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Great location near the beach!
review: Hotel is located about 500 feet from actual beach on causeway leading out to the ocean. No big deal as there awesome pool area is great place to sit &'watch the boats going in & out to the Gulf. Rooms are of good size & we had a great King room facing the water with nice patio. Two on-site places to eat with Jimmy's Fishouse great. Love the Buffalo Flatbread pizza & live music. Staff friendly & cold enjoyed flavored water in lobby. This was our second visit.

title: Great location, beautiful view
review: Thank you so much for taking time to review your stay with us.  You gave a good description of what readers on Trip Advisor can come to expect at our resort.  We're glad you left with good memories, very pleased you were here for your second visit, and we'll look forward to your third!  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Was my go too Hotel but not anymore
review: Centrally located in Clearwater Beach, this hotel provides beautiful views of the gulf and a great pool and restaurant downstairs. The food was great at the restaurant, and they have a little "party" with music every evening at sunset. We had an Oceanside room with a balcony so that was a huge plus. The reason I'm giving 4 stars is because my boyfriend had to leave very early one morning so we decided to order breakfast through room service. There was a form on the desk for breakfast orders and the instructions said to place it on the doorknob by midnight the night before. We ended up placing it around 10:45 and awoke the next morning to no food and the form still on the doorknob, no one had ever come around to pick up the order. We went downstairs to get some waffles from the…

title: Worst customer service and dirty rooms
review: Thank you for your kind words about your recent stay.  We're glad you enjoyed your beach getaway and appreciate having you as a guest.  Please know that all feedback is thoroughly detailed to our management team, so your comments on the room service and waffles is being addressed.  We want 100% customer satisfaction for each and every guest.  Again, thanks for staying with us!  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Disappointed
review: This used to be a great value in Clearwater.  It does not have beach acess which made it afforable but still gave you a great location.  The rooms are showing their age.  The hotel pool area is running down as well and you have to valet your car now. There is a construction boom here and I can see this place slipping even more with more newer properties near by.

title: Vacation
review: I've stayed at this hotel 4 times and always enjoyed the location and the pool area. The rooms haven't been an issue until my last visit. Let me start by saying that the hotel manager rectified the situation immediately. When we arrived to the hotel, it was about midnight. We check in and head directly to the room. We walked in and it was a room that hadn't been clean. There were towels on the nightstand and on the bathroom floor. There was trash sitting near the tv. Then we noticed blood all over the comforter. We walked out and went to the front desk and they put us in a different room. I would only say to check the cleanliness of the rooms before "settling" in for the night.

title: On the water, but no beach access?
review: We appreciate your words and review on your recent stay.  What you did is exactly what we hope each guest will do -- contact the hotel manager or staff if any situation comes up that is a problem of any kind.  In your case, we are very sorry that housekeeping failed to clean the room you were assigned to.  Please know that your feedback goes to the highest level of our management team so these type incidents will not be repeated.  Our goal is for every guest to have a 100% pleasant experience.  Thank you again for writing us and staying with us.  We hope you left with good beach memories.  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Nice hotel, great value
review: I stayed here for one night on a business trip.  I only had one hour outside in the sun and was disappointed to see that it was right on the water, but didn't really have beach access.  I was happy with the pool and outdoor space, though.  The hotel was surrounded by a construction zone while I was there, somewhat ruining any kind of view that you might have, but it wasn't noisy and the rest of the hotel was pretty nice.  The room had everything that I needed and was clean and comfortable.  Overall it was good for the price.

title: Nice hotel
review: Thank you for staying with us and writing about your experience.  You are correct, we are five minutes from the public beach but do not have beach in front of us.  Our own website does detail that but some people confuse our address of "Clearwater Beach" to think that we are beach side.  The trolley comes right across the street and will take guests to the public beach if they choose not to walk.  In any event, we appreciate your comments and hope that during your break from business that you at least enjoyed a beautiful sunset.  Ultimately we hope you'll be back for a personal holiday.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Roaches anyone?!?!?
review: Once the construction next door is done  I'd bump this rating to 4.5 the only thing holding it back is the date decore. Other than that this place is great. Large 2 room suites, clean. Best value in Clearwater and just a 10 minute walk to beach. Book it now and pay a little extra for a view. Worth it. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

title: Great location!! On the gulf!!!!
review: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Gulfview last night and had a great time at the pool overlooking the Gulf of Mexico.. We saw several dolphins playing within 20 ft from us!! Our room had a spectacular view as well. The room was very clean and the staff was great... Jimmys fish house is located on the property and dinning and the bar is right on the water... Beautiful sunset!!! They give out free shots of a rum punch at sunset which is great!! Thought we had a great rate as well!!

title: Not a bad stay
review: So glad you caught those beautiful sunsets and dolphins -- aren't they spectacular?  Thanks for staying with us and for your kind words.   We're so pleased you had a wonderful time and hope your travels will find you back here for more beach fun. Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Beautiful View
review: The hotel was clean and we had a nice view of the gulf. Be warned there is construction right next door that the web site warns you of. If this kind of thing bothers you, find someplace else until this new building is completed as it is noisy and literally right next door. Otherwise, there is a good tiki out by the pool and the view of the sunset from Jimmy's Iguana next door is spectacular. There is also a place to rent jet ski's right on the property if you are looking for some fun. Plenty of restaurants and bars in walking distance. If you are looking for a reasonably priced stay, this is a good choice.

title: Great View
review: Thank you!  We're pleased you enjoyed your stay with us and found us to be close to all the action yet packed with activities right here.  Sure hope you'll be back with us for more beach memories.  Please stay in touch on our Facebook page!  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Perfect!
review: Very clean.  Stayed in a suite with a living area, kitchenette area, bedroom and 2 baths.  Very nice room with a great view of the Gulf of Mexico and overlooking the pool.  Enjoyed listening to the live band right from the balcony!  The bed was very comfortable; the housekeeping staff even made an elephant out of a towel and put it on the bed.

title: Easy
review: Staying at the hotel was easy... No problems.. The driver for hotel (Bruce) was so so nice. He made our traveling pleasant. He is a gem to have working for you. He is a hard worker and a genuine person.

title: $50 early check in fee!
review: Thank you for your compliments, and for staying with us.  All our staff work hard to ensure our guests have memorable stays.  We sure hope you'll be back with us again for more beach fun.  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: A Reasonably Priced Hotel in what is becoming a very expensive location.
review: Our room was ready and waiting early.  I asked for an early check in and was told it would be $50 extra.  How ridiculous, you would think the $225 a night for an outdated room that needed a lot of updates.  The ottoman in the room looked like it came out of the trash, it was disgusting and the balcony needed painting, peeling paint and stains on the cement.

title: Great location
review: Thank you for taking time to comment on your recent stay with us.  Please know that all guest feedback is shared with our top management so that we can continually improve our customer satisfaction.  Regarding the early room check-in, our normal time is 4 p.m., so it may have been that you the time you wanted to check in did require an early fee.  We're sorry if that was an disappointment to you.     Ultimately, we hope you left with good memories of Clearwater Beach and we thank you for staying with us.  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Great location
review: This is a reasonably priced hotel in what is now becoming a very expensive location.  Five Upscale Hotels have been built or now under construction in Clearwater Beach -  Wyndham Grand Resort, Opal Sands, Sandpearl Resort, Hyatt Regency and now Clearwater Beach Guesthouse.    The Clearwater Beach Guesthouse is a 10-story, 155-room hotel tower that is presently under construction in what was formerly the parking lot for the Holiday Inn. Eventually the parking garage beneath the new hotel will handle parking for both hotels.  For now there is only Valet parking at the Holiday Inn.  I found the Holiday Inn to be okay but not great.  Good price (for an expensive location and by the Ocean).  There is no beach at the hotel but it is a short walk to Clearwater Beach.  I found the staff…

title: Vacation
review: Every thing was great the waiter josh was very helpful it was very clean yes there was construction but it didn't bother us great the food was fabulous but wish they had more of a selection otherwise we had a great time

title: Not frendly and parking cars in a building under construction
review: Thank you!   We're so glad you enjoyed your stay with us!   We'll let Josh know he took good care of you.  We're fortunate to have staff who want every visitor to have a great experience.  Hope you'll be back with us again - soon!  Please stay in touch on our Facebook page for updates, events and reasons to return!  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Great Stay!
review: All the area around is under construction and very noisy. The front desk was very rude and the car parking company is parking cars in unfinished building with warning signs of do not enter and other warning signs and not telling people where their vehicles are being parked. Here in the pictures you will see where your cars will be parked and looking at and listening to while you are there. We cancelled our visit after 1 night there. Do not visit there is no beach you have to walk to another hotel and use their beach.

title: Construction Wows.
review: Dear Sola1957:  Thank you for taking the time to share your most recent experience at our resort.  We are terribly sorry to hear that you were unable to enjoy yourself on this visit.   I will be share to share your comments with our team as a coaching tool for improvement of our services.    In regards to the parking, it is true that the valet company is parking cars on the first two levels in the garage and we have Certificate of Occupancy from our City to do so.  Please note all Valets have been trough the the Safety and Security training required by both the Fire Inspector, and the General Contractor to be able to enter and exit the building.  Safety and Security of our guests and employees are our top priority, which is why extra steps and measures were taken by the local authorities, the General Contractor and our team.    Again, please accept our sincerest apologies that you were unable to enjoy your visit.  We hope that after the project is complete that perhaps you would consider staying with us again.  Thank you again for sharing your valuable feedback.    Sincerely,   Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Wonderful Experience
review: First time in Clearwater Beach and we had an excellent time. Rooms were very clean, the staff were friendly and helpful. There was construction going on next door but it wasn't bothersome at all. Everywhere along the beach there was building construction going on. Jimmys Iguana Bar and Grille is there and we had great food and service. Live entertainment was nice and you cant beat the sunsets!

title: Tired and noisy
review: Booked In advance having eaten in jimmys restaurant within hotel and enjoyed the experience.  What a mistake. The restaurant failed to meet previous levels by a long way. The allocated room over looked the car park and next-door building site noise 7 til 5. We arrived after 18 hr journey to be greeted just but it was 2 days before we saw staff smile and that was the towel boy at the pool. fortunately only stayed 3 nights, no relaxation achieved. Not good at present.

title: Nice Getaway
review: We're so sorry you felt your stay with us did not meet your expectations.  If you would like to communicate directly with me, my email is:  CBottger@clearwaterbeachholidayinn.com.  We want every guest to leave with good memories and we're sorry the construction next door and other issues caused a less-than-perfect stay.  Thank you,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Vacation
review: Excellent from the time I checked in. Zany had me checked in early and I was out by the pool lounging within about 15 minutes after arriving at the Property. The weather was an 81 degrees, not a cloud in the sky. Perfect. The Wait staff at the pool were fantastic. The Tiki Bar was a great place to go and get some shade. There are tables at the pool with umbrellas. My room was perfect. It was clean, my view of the Gulf and Intracoastal Waterway were perfect. The room had an outside balcony which was perfect for watching the Sunset.   The food at Jimmy's was excellent. I had the Buffet Breakfast, which was well worth the money. You can order your omelet and watch it cooked. Dinner was the same, I had pub food, it was great.   Although the property is pretty much self contained,…

title: Great Location
review: If we could give a 5-star rating for a great review, it would surely go to you.  Thank you so much!  We're so pleased you enjoyed your stay here, found the staff friendly and helpful and our location perfect for gulf viewing yet near to the beach.  Glad you had fun at Jimmy's for dining and cool beverages....and you're right - the sunsets are spectacular just about every night!  If you're on Facebook, we'd love to have you follow us for reasons to come back!  Thanks again,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: One of the cleanest...
review: I paid for a Gulf Front and only got golf view. Management would not do anything about it. Bathrooms were very dirty .The hotel was under construction but still charging top dollar. I will never return.

title: Enjoyable stay while on business
review: I stayed here while on business in the surrounding area.  Overall the hotel is great. The staff is very friendly and helpful.  The rooms could use some upgrading as they seem a bit worn, but for the price they were adequate.  The construction next door is a bit of a headache with parking, but the valet service was fine.  While on my stay, I pretty much just walked everywhere.  There is a restaurant in the hotel that is AWESOME! I also caught a couple of gorgeous sunsets during my stay.

title: Would Stay Again
review: Thank you!   We always appreciate guest feedback, and your comments will be shared with our management team.  Our goal, truly, is that each guest leaves with a good memory of their stay here.  We're glad you had an enjoyable experience overall and we appreciate your indulgence with the construction next door.  We are working with them to minimize disruption for our guests.  So glad you caught a few sunsets -- and hopefully also saw some dolphins jumping!  All the best,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Jessica Morris:  Please FWD to Jackie.  Excellent customer service and professional help.
review: Nice, clean hotel and a great price when compared to the area. Not on the beach, but it's a quick walk. Yes, with the construction next door, parking is a hassle and there can be some noise. My time here was not ruined by that. The front desk staff were great. The pool area is beautiful. The views are spectacular! The two evenings we were there we enjoyed sitting outside on the deck off the Gulf enjoying a drink and the great live music. We upgraded to Gulf view...which I'd do again, but we're a little bummed we were on the second floor so included in our Gulf view was a lot of the roof from over the bar. We upgraded late so I was happy with what we got. But, if ya want Gulf view, shoot for higher up.

title: Great place to stay!!
review: Thank you!  We appreciate your review and comments about your stay.  We're very pleased to hear you did have an enjoyable time and you are right - sitting outside, relaxing with a cold beverage and listening to the entertainment is great fun.  Your advice is correct on the room views - the higher you go, it does get better.  We hope you'll be back with us whenever you need more beach time!  All the best...  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Very Good Stay
review: The person who booked the room for me, Jessica Morris, went above and beyond what most people do to help me.  She was very knowledgeable, professional, polite and funny.  I wish more people who worked in this business were like her.  She deserves the best treatment possible, and possibly a raise as well.  After contacting 6 hotels to no avail, Jessica, a representative of Holiday Inn, helped me out in every way she could, in a professional and polite manner.  I greatly appreciate people like this.

title: Awesome
review: This was such an awesome trip. I have stayed here many times in the past but this trip was exceptional. I was somewhat concerned with the reviews regarding construction next door but that did not impact my stay at all. Look ahead at your gorgeous gulf sunsets and you are good to go.  Awesome thanks to Mike in the Tiki bar who remembered my name and was on top of his game; attentive and friendly. Tim K, Taylor, and Robert at the check-in were amazing and more than accommodating.   I was recognized for my IHG status by means of an upgrade and free drink.   I actually was so happy here and enjoyed my time so well that I extended my stay. Everyone here made me feel at home. Thank you everyone! I have already booked my return trip!

title: Nice stay in Clearwater Beach
review: Thank you!   We're so glad you enjoyed yet another great stay with us and we really do appreciate the lovely compliments paid to our staff.  We'll be sure to pass them on because everyone really does love to see our guests have a great and memorable stay.  Thanks also for being a valued IHG member -- and we love the part that you had so much fun that you extended your stay....and have booked your next trip!  We hope you're following us on our Facebook page - we'd love to have you stay in touch until next time!  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Good location
review: Our family of 4 stayed here while visiting during the kids' spring break from school. The hotel was clean and the housekeeping staff were wonderful. Beds were very comfortable. The hotel is right on the water and had a great view of the sunset. The pool was wonderful and not too crowded. We ate breakfast at Jimmy's Fish House every morning. Kids who stay at the hotel ate free, and the kids loved the kids' menus that turned into iguana hats. We also enjoyed some late night drinks and snacks at Jimmy's and at the tiki bar. The Mai Tais were delicious! The kids also really enjoyed the small arcade at the hotel. The beach was a short walk away, and so were shops and restaurants. We took the Jolly Trolley (small fee) to the Clearwater Marine Aquarium, and took a bus to John's Pass.…

title: Spring break 2016
review: Thank you for taking time to give a detailed description of your stay here with us.  We're glad you ultimately enjoyed your vacation and we appreciate your comments on our cleanliness and housekeeping.  Our staff works hard to ensure every guest has an enjoyable vacation.  Your feedback is most important and is being shared by with our top management team so we can increase the quality of our customer service.  We're sorry that the noise by other guests disturbed you.  Regarding the construction, it appears the crew started work a bit earlier than normal because we also are working with them to be aware of our guests' experience.  We hope you'll return - and please use my direct email to contact me so we can look to keeping you as a valued Holiday Inn Clearwater Beach guest.  Sincerely, Christine Bottger General Manager cbottger@clearwaterbeachhi.com

title: Dissapointed AGAIN
review: Jimmy's Fish House is by far the best part of this hotel. Staff, food, location, live music, shot at sunset was awesome! The hotel has lots of activity. Pool was great! Poolside bar was just what the doctor ordered!  Coffee shop lady was a little rude  so we chose not to eat there but was told it has great waffles. The room was decent and balcony was great to have! There is noise from construction next door but not terrible. After a drink or two you don't even notice LOL. It's located on the water but a 2 minute walk from the actual beach. Not sure I would stay again but wasn't disappointed.

title: Decent Place
review: We enjoyed our stay.  Rooms were clean and spacious.  View was nice too.   There were a bunch of little things that bothered us.  We had an impression that the the staff did not try hard enough.  For example, the coffee shop was closed all they on a rainy day.  When it opened the next they, the espresso machine did not work.  Restaurant had a nice view and atmosphere, but the service was sloooow. They have a heated pool, but swimming in it under a working construction crane...  not the best feeling in the world.  Overall: not bad.

title: What a great place
review: Thank you so much for taking time to write about your recent stay with us.  Please know that feedback from our guests allows our management team to be aware of every situation that needs addressing and the issues you mentioned, such as friendliness of staff and non-working espresso machine, have been addressed.  We thank you for your patience with the construction going on next door to us.  We appreciate that it can be an inconvenience and annoyance and we continually work with their management team to minimize noise as much as possible.  Ultimately, that you for the compliments on our housekeeping and spaciousness of rooms.  We really hope that you left with wonderful memories of Clearwater Beach.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Good value in nice location
review: First thing I noticed was that every employee we saw had a smile on their faces. Room very clean and nicely updated. Had to call for someone to fix the shower for handicap. That person showed up in less than 5 min. Fixed the shower then someone else showed up to clean the shower.  Ate dinner and breakfast in jimmy's. Food was great, reasonably priced. Again employees singing and pleasant. Constantly cleaning even when already clean. Loved this place.

title: Spring Break stay in Clearwater Beach
review: Thank you!   We're thrilled that you enjoyed your stay with us and are so appreciative of your comments on our staff's friendliness and helpfulness.  Truly every one of our team wants each guest to leave with positive memories of their Clearwater Beach vacation.  We're glad you enjoyed Jimmy's as well and hope you were able to catch the beautiful sunsets from their deck.  We appreciate that you chose to stay with us and certainly hope you'll be back for more good memories of Clearwater Beach.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Great querky hotel in cool location.
review: We just returned from spending spring break and had a really great time.  The hotel was nice -- not luxurious but you get what you pay for.  The location was great and the pool and on-site restaurant were both great.  We spent more time at the pool than on the beach, and ate at Jimmy's more often than we ate out.  That is saying a lot for us.  The front desk was entirely helpful.  This is a great hotel for families.  I recommend.

title: Disappointed
review: I have stayed at this hotel many times in the past and have always been completely satisfied. This time we left disappointed unfortunately. We were nervous about the construction and the mandatory valet parking, but these were no big deal at all. We forgot about the construction immediately after we were there and the valet guys were AWESOME! We never waited more than three minutes for our vehicle. Room was clean and wonderful. We did see a little bit of black mold in one of the showers but that was probably just an oversight on someone's part as the rest of the room was spotless.  Food and beverage was so-so. The breakfast buffet (which used to be excellent) was terrible - not much variety and was cold both times we went which were at different times of the morning). We went…

title: Fun and sun
review: Thank you very much for taking time to leave a lengthy review about your recent stay with us.  First off, our goal is to ensure that each guest enjoys a wonderful experience and leaves with great memories - and we're glad to hear that you've been a repeat visitor.   We do value feedback - both positive and negative - to help us continually improve our customer experience, so we're sorry you had several incidences that did not measure up to your expectations.  Regarding the pool security, we're sorry if our pool managers seemed a bit overzealous.  They are there to ensure only our guests can use the pool, as well as do pool maintenance and oversee the pool for our guests safety.    Regarding the internet, we had no other complaints by guests so we wonder if perhaps a firewall interfered with your connection issues.  We're sorry the connection issue inconvenienced you.  As for the buffet, we will be in touch with Jimmy's management and let them know your comment.  And, as for the palmetto bug situation, thank you for alerting us because we do have a regular maintenance company for pest control and they will be advised of this.  Cleanliness and a bug-free environment are too big issues with us.  We do thank you for your comments on our landscaping and other staff who made you feel welcome.  It is our goal to create a beautiful memory for you so that you can return again for more memories.  If you would like to contact me further - or be in touch before your next visit, please do so at CBottger@clearwaterbeachhi.com.    Thank you again.  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Always happy and feel at home!
review: Great get way as usual. Love the town and hotel is great and affordable. Easy walking to everything with beach right there and so beautiful. Took the kids and it's family friendly with pool for the little ones. March is a great time for sun that's not too hot .

title: Affordable and good location
review: Thank you!   We're so pleased you took time to tell us about your family's stay here - and the good time that you all had.  You're right - we are close to everything which makes it nice for exploring the area's beaches, attractions and other dining outlets.    Glad our kiddie pool was a big hit with the youngsters -- we enjoy watching them have fun!  We hope to see you back here again whenever your vacation plans point to a beach holiday.    Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Another great stay at the Holiday Inn Clearwater Beach! Cant wait to return !
review: My family visited and stayed for a 4 night stay at the end of January and our trip was fabulous as usual.   We had a two room family suite which was very nice and something I'd recommend for those with families with young kids.  It allowed us to put the kids to bed at night and still stay up later without waking them.  The two bathrooms/showers was an added bonus.     Holiday Inn is our go to place in Clearwater Beach and we have stayed at this hotel for four previous trips to the area.  It is within walking distance to many of our favorite restaurants in the area as well as the fabulous beach.  I would also recommend a visit to Jimmy's Fish House and Iguana Bar downstairs as the food is good and reasonably priced and the bonus is kids eat free with paid adults.    We took…

title: Very good hotel
review: We stayed a week and was worried about the building work but was fine when doors closed. Had a really lovely clean big room. Valet parking was great staff always very pleasant. Good location lots going on to eat and drink each way of the hotel. Very good value for money highly recommend.

title: staff is accomodating and pleasant
review: Thank you!  We appreciate that you took time to write a review about your stay - and we so appreciate knowing that the construction next door did not mar your good times.  We're glad you enjoyed the facilities we have and we do hope you'll be back with us again.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Noise from construction and next door bar hindered sleep
review: Hotel is very clean and staff was great.Very short walk to beach and they provide the beach towels. Yes there is construction but it really didn't affect our stay. Be aware of the valet parking daily fee. Although it actually was very convenient and efficient. Jimmy's restaurant had good food at a good price. Overall a safe, clean nice place. And again staff was very accommodating.

title: Clean, comfortable room and friendly staff
review: Thank you!   We're so pleased you stayed with us and enjoyed a wonderful Clearwater Beach vacation.  Thank you also for the compliments on our staff - they all try hard to make every guest's experience a great one.  We do hope you'll be back again with us soon.  Kind regards,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Not Oceanfront
review: We booked this hotel for a 3 night stay for a quick trip.  We arrived late at night and were informed parking deck was under construction so only valet parking was available.  After only a few hours sleep we awakened to the sound of parking deck construction a little after 6AM.  When we brought it up they moved us to the other tower.  That night we were kept up by noise from the parking area next door.  We called down and were told the noise was from the bar at Shephard's next door and that it would stop after they closed at 3AM.  I expressed how unhappy we were as we had moved from the other room due to the construction noise.  They informed us we could talk to the manager the next day.  When we visited the front desk the next morning they offered to move us again to the 7th…

title: A Good Decicion
review: We have been coming to the Holiday Inn & Suites for many years for family vacations and extended weekend getaways. I will admit that after reading the reviews lately, this is the first year I considered staying somewhere else. However, the minute I walked into the lobby I knew I made the right decision. It felt like we were back to our second home. As usual, we were upgraded to an great Junior Suite with huge windows and beautiful views! (and allowed to check in early) The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the pool area every day as well as great food and drinks from Jimmy's too! I could see how the construction could bother some people, but the weather and view were just too perfect for it to be an issue for us. (There is pounding, but the worst part, the…

title: Great Stay
review: Thank you!  What a lovely review you submitted, and it pleases us so much to know you had a wonderful holiday here.  Thank you for overlooking the construction issues.  As you say, things are getting better as they progress and we look forward to the work being done this year.  We do hope you'll join us again for more beach memories.  We love seeing our repeat visitors!  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Husband wife get away
review: From check in to check out everything was perfect. Front desk staff helpful and friendly, our room was clean and stocked and our view was breath taking. Housekeeping and maintenance were great as well. Thank you for a great stay! Highly recommend this hotel. The restaurant in the hotel has great food and a great staff as well.

title: The hotel that tells guests NO Way Too Much
review: Thank you!   We're always pleased to know that our guests enjoyed their stay and left with wonderful beach memories.  We also appreciate the compliments paid to our staff -- they really do want every guest to have a great vacation!  Hope you'll be with us again soon, and please stay in touch with us on Facebook for reasons to come back.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Great Experience!
review: Amazing stay. A little pricey bu t worth it. Great room, resturant and game room. Amazing pool and bar by the pool. Will be back for sure. Check in was fast. Need to update the beds a bit a little to hard.  I just can't say enough about the amazing gift shop in site and jimmys fish house.

title: Unfortunate expensive getaway.
review: We much appreciated our stay at this Holiday inn at the same period last year. For my husband's birthday we booked an ocean front king size room at top price of over 300$ Canadian dollars. We arrived to a major construction site  10 feet from the hotel. Though the gulf view from the pool and lounging area and the proximity to the beach is fantastic, the major construction going on keeps people from really enjoying what they pay for. It's too bad that we are not warned or still charge top dollar when it's impossible to find the thru enjoyment people disserve when they spend hard earned money for a vacation.Go somewhere else this year.

title: South side room
review: Thank you for taking time to write about your experience with us.  First off, thank you for staying with us - we do appreciate all our Canadian visitors especially since the dollar exchange is not favorable now.  You did not mention how you booked your reservation and it would help us to know because we've notified our travel partners and reservations staff to inform guests who book.  If you'd like to share this with me, please email to:  CBottger@clearwaterbeachhi.com  We really want everyone to enjoy their stay - that is our goal, despite the inconvenience of the construction next door.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: CONSTRUCTION ZONE....LOUD AT 7AM
review: Rm overlooks water AND evening musical entertainment. Rm and bath were clean and provided what we needed. Housekeeping was above average on a daily basis. Warned about construction although we never heard it. Stayed Fri thru Tues. Beautiful sunsets from nice size balcony. HOWEVER, if you go to bed early, beware! Musical outdoor entertainment goes until 11pm. LOUD! We are night owls and therefore it didn't cause a problem. Restaurant/bar has indoor/outdoor seating. A little slow. No on beach access. Outdoor pool/and sm gift shop. Also coffee shop.

title: Okay
review: Thank you so much for writing about your stay with us.  We're so pleased you enjoyed yourselves and all that we have here at the resort.  We do hope you'll return again soon and that you'll stay in touch with us on Facebook.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Wonderful people - will be back!
review: After getting checked in by a lady that did not smile once during our transaction and charged us for a parking fee we were not aware of, we made it to our room on the 9th floor. Beautiful view and a wonderful pool area for all ages. Also a tike bar and restaurant and coffee shop on premises.Very Bad Noise however due to the construction of a building and parking deck right next door.If you plan on catching up on your sleep, Dont Stay Here..

title: Avoid for now
review: We were disappointed and actually checked out five days early...major construction in the area and a major building going up next door..the noise is deafening and makes enjoying the pool impossible..ember there is no beach...the only access to a beach is a two block walk down a street under heavy construction..the rooms are dated and while the food is so so the deck bar overlooking the gulf does offer spectacular sunsets...

title: Lot's of Construction BEWARE of Valet Service and key card rarely works
review: Thank you for writing and sharing your thoughts about your stay.  We're so sorry that the inconvenience of the construction next door diminished what you had expected to be a perfect stay.  We've been working with the construction management company to minimize the noise as much as possible but of course only so much can be done.  As for the beach, we do have the trolley that goes back and forth so you have an option if you choose not to walk.  Ultimately, we hope you left with some good memories of Clearwater Beach and we thank you for staying with us for a few days.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Great time
review: So we have a friend who lives in Clearwater Beach who recommended this hotel, said was ok price and convenient- alright sure.  We check in after a day of traveling from Maine.  You cannot park- you must use valet, which of course means you have no option but to tip every time- but ok fine-we do so.  We check in- check in was easy.  We are tired-we make it to our room- only to have the key card not work.  I am the one who said only one key card so less to keep track of- I regretted it as I sent my boyfriend back down to replace.  Ok, newly activated key card and we are in.  Hotel is clean- beds comfortable.  We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and we proceeded to have to walk back down to deal with key card 3 more times!  We did eat at the restaurant for breakfast-lunch and…

title: The construction is bad
review: Thank you so much for taking time to document the experiences you had here that were less than positive.    May I ask you to send me an email directly on this:  CBottger@clearwaterbeachhi.com. I would like to respond after knowing a few more details because, although the valet service is indeed an independent company, this needs to be addressed so that future guests will not have any incidents.  Thank you again.  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Great Location - Nice Bar & Restaurant
review: Wife wanted to watch a sunset over the gulf from a balcony. This was a great place to do that. Complete kitchen. Great room. Nice pool, and area to set in the sun. games for kids, and bar for adults. Good food also.

title: renovated rooms with ocean views
review: while still under renovation and building next door this property has beautiful views and newly renovated rooms with great pricing. while its at the end of the island, its a short walk to beaches and there are wonderful restaurants close by. sunset at Jimmy's is a fun experience with complimentary sunset drinks. in room mini kitchen was well stocked with supplies and would be great for families who do not want to eat all meals out

title: Ms.sulvan
review: Thank you so much for writing about your recent stay with us.  We are very pleased that you enjoyed your stay, all the resort amenities, and our central location to beach and other activities.  You are right - the mini-kitchens are a great bonus for families.  We do hope you will be back with us again for more beach fun and thank you again for staying with us.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Okay for a business meeting but not for a holiday
review: lots of building going around this hotel.  But, they moved us to a better room after the 1st night there.  The 1st night we woke up Sun. morning to pounding & hammering @ 6am.  Was crazy scary. We faced construction & an old air conditioning unit. Sad site, Glad they move us to a much better room.  Nice & quiet, with a view of the water.  The pool is very nice & warm.  And it's very nice to to watch the boats go by when laying right in front of the water.  So that made up for the 1st day & night of yuk.  The rest of the days were beautiful there.  I'd not pay 300. a night though, I think that a bit high.  I think more like 175.-200. range is better considering all the construction & the need for updating the rooms.

title: Declining
review: Thank you so much for taking time to write about your stay with us.  We are terribly sorry that your holiday was less than expected because of the construction next door.  We are working with the construction management to minimize inconvenience to our guests as much as possible but of course the noise can be bothersome.  We're glad the room we moved you to was better for you and that you overall enjoyed the experience of your beach vacation.  Thank you again for your comments and we do hope you will consider us for a future stay.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Ok
review: The staff are helpful, it is well located and the amenities are good (although the gym could do with an exercise bike) there is a good bar attached and plenty of local restaurants   Now for the not so good - it is currently like sitting in the middle of a building site and until this is completed I would avoid, so okay for meetings, which I was, but not for sitting by the pool as the banging starts at 7 through to 5.  Otherwise I'd come back again.  Oh, and you regularly see dolphins swimming by the back of the hotel!

title: Vacation Stop Over
review: We stopped here for the weekend on our way to Tampa for a cruise. Had a great time. Beautiful ocean view from our balcony. We enjoyed the most amazing sunsets and fun crowds at the hotel bar and restaurant. Rooms were clean and beds were very comfy.

title: Late January 2016 visit
review: Thank you!   How nice of you to take time to comment on your stay!  We're so glad you enjoyed all the resort has to offer - including those wonderful views.  (Hope you saw some dolphins and beautiful sunsets!)  We appreciate your comments and hope you'll be back with us again.  Hope your cruise was fun!  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Disappointed
review: There is a lot of construction going on around this hotel, but overall the room was very nice.  Visited with our two boys and they had bunk beds and their own tv, a sitting area with refrigerator/sink.  We didn't have the waterfront view so I would recommend asking for that.  During our visit - it was a little chilly for Florida - low 60's.  Their pool was heated and allowed the boys to swim which was a huge plus.  Doesn't have beach front access, but it is very close.  Kids 12 and under ate free with a paid adult meal. Would stay again.

title: Wouldn't recommend this one.
review: Thank you!    We're so pleased you and your family enjoyed your recent stay with us -- and we're glad you were comfortable in our family suites.  You're right - the bunk beds are favorites with kids and the parents love the sitting and common areas.  Sorry the weather took a cool dip, but we're glad everyone had fun in the heated pool. Appreciate your nice comments and hope to see you again!  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Great Location, very nice pool, great bar and club
review: For the money there are better options. Building site next door and builders stare at you while you swim . Car parking is a nightmare at $12 a day The restaurant is a rip off . Even though we had the buffet breakfast with little attention from staff they add a compulsory 18% service charge to everything . Check other options before staying here  Paul

title: Rooms are very noisy!!!!
review: Although the service by all staff members from front desk to valet to convention/catering staff was A++++, the rooms are SO NOISY.  The construction going on next door, 16 hours a day, was non-stop noise that sounded like something was going to crash through our balcony door!  Add to that the traffic noise all night long, and the fact that we could hear people talking in adjacent rooms, and hear every time someone flushed a toilet on our floor, and it was not real pleasant in the room!  The most disconcerting however was the fact that every time someone opened a room door near me, it sounded like they were opening my door.  I barely slept for five nights!  When the door is closed, there is a good half-inch of light showing on three sides -- this noise problem could be helped…

title: Average stay
review: Thank you for taking time to comment on your recent stay here.   First off, we appreciate your comments on our staff.  Everyone here wants each and every guest to enjoy a pleasant experience and leave with wonderful memories.  Regarding your other comments, if you would like to contact me personally, please email to CBottger@clearwaterbeachhi.com and I will respond.  Thank you again.  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Construction
review: I stayed here for 9 day is November of 2015. Being from Wisconsin, I expected an indoor pool. I was fine with the fact that it wasn't, but the pool was continuously dirty and there was no hot tub. There was construction going on next door that made it difficult to get in and out of the parking lot. It was not an easy location to get in and out of the parking lot since it's right on the corner and you can't make a left-hand turn. The bed was comfortable, but housekeeping left a stain on the edge of the counter for days.

title: Enjoyed our stay
review: Thank you for taking time to write about your stay with us in November.  We appreciate your comments and do discuss them with our senior management team to allow us opportunity to continually improve customer service.  Most area hotels have outdoor pools simply because guests prefer being out in the year-round pleasant weather.  No, we don't have a hot tub - but this is the type of comment that will be addressed with management.  We're sorry the construction next door inconvenienced you with noise and our parking situation.   We are working with them to minimize disruption as much as possible to our guests.  Again, we thank you for staying with us.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Bed bugs in 2nd Floor room!
review: I usually love this Holiday Inn.  I stayed here in August 2015, October 2015, and then June 2015.  June 2015 was THE WORST.  Parking is a disaster, they are building, valet is expensive, and the customer service was just as bad as the parking.  I was really upset when I was dismissed by the front desk, when they didn't mention when I was booking the cost to park, which was previously free if you were staying or eating at the Jimmy Iguanas.  We loved to eat at the bar, and did so for most meals.  It just wasn't the same experience as the previous stays.  I'm hoping when construction is complete, it will again be a great place to stay.

title: Exceeded Expectations
review: Despite the reason for my visit (an illness in the family), my 4 night stay here was perfect. We were in Room 718 and what an amazing view! The room was big and very well appointed! The only thing that showed wear was the ottoman. The beds were comfortable and the bedding was nice with lots of pillows.. The room was very clean....  But more important was the staff. Everyone was extremely nice and so helpful. The valet service was fast and they guys were so nice. A special thank you to  Valet Sean and everyone at the front desk.    Although this was not a visit for pleasure, this was a wonderful place to be.

title: Overnight stay
review: Thank you so much for taking time to share words of your experience with us. We're sorry you had to be here under unpleasant circumstances, but we're glad you found our lodging comfortable and staff friendly.     Also, we're pleased you did get to enjoy some of the beautiful views of the Gulf.  We do hope your family member's health has improved and that the next time you  visit will be during happier times.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Older property but in excellent condition
review: What a disappointment. When we arrived we were met with a construction site as next door they are constructing a new hotel, however they do not tell you that when you make your booking. This was a treat for my husbands birthday so not worth it. They started work early the next day so room extremely noisy. Mentioned it on check out and was told we have 2 years of this!

title: Great location, nice rooms
review: Dear Jeanette A:  Thank you for your candid feedback regarding your most recent visit with us.  We are terribly sorry you were unable to enjoy your husband's birthday celebration.   All of us are terribly sorry to hear that you were not made aware of the new parking garage/hotel project in our North West Parking Lot at the time of booking.    Our hotel does have an alert to advise the consumer at the time of booking when made over the phone, it does not currently appear if a guest is booking online.  We are working with Holiday Inn Worldwide to rectify this.   We are sorry for any inconvenience this may have caused for your visit to celebrate your husband's birthday.    Should you wish to discuss your stay in further, please reach out to me directly at cbottger@ClearwaterBeachHI.com.  Again, thank you for your candid feedback.    Best Regards,  Christine Bottger  General Manager

title: Good location and easy access to Jimmy's Fish House
review: Recently stayed there for the 2016 Outback Bowl.  Fresh paint everywhere and clean.  Currently working their way through growing pains of building new wing with parking.  Parking a BIG problem. Had to park at a remote parking area a mile away. Sometimes they had a shuttle, sometimes we took a cab, and sometimes we walked to the car. Traffic was horrendous (maybe due to New Years and Outback bowl.) We would definitely go back.....hopefully after construction is complete. They had problems with getting room key cards to consistently work. Had to have ours redone numerous times. The Hotel was totally booked which added to congestion. Pool was adequate and not overly crowded. Enjoyed Jimmy's Fish House in the hotel which overlooked the inlet and Gulf.  Food and service was excellent.

title: very nice and great location
review: Nice hotel! Clean and comfortable. Beautiful Ocean view! Pool and poolside bar were great! Towels went really quick at the pool though.  Good location. We chose to walk almost everywhere we went. Restaurant on site was pretty good. There were several more within walking distance.

title: Good Location and great bar
review: Thank you!   We're pleased you enjoyed your stay with us!  Thank you for the compliments on our location, views and services.    You're absolutely correct - we're right in the heart of things, with so many places to walk or take a short trolley ride to.  Please stay in touch with us on Facebook for deals and reasons to come back.  We'd love to have you return for more memories.  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Good Location
review: We arrived on 1/8 only to find that the construction was very loud, since we booked last year before the construction had started the manager gave us a two bathroom suit away from the noise at NO extra charge. Everyone working the front desk was very nice and very helpful, can't ask for more than that ! Only bad thing was the pull out coach was not at all comfortable, but the beds were great.

title: Excellent Hotel for Its Class
review: Thank you for taking time to comment on your recent stay with us.  We appreciate your feedback and share all of it with our management team.    We're pleased the construction did not inconvenience you and were glad we were able to upgrade you to a suite.  Our staff will appreciate your compliments - they really want every guest to have a wonderful experience.  Thanks again, and we hope you'll return for more great memories on Clearwater Beach.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Don't be fooled by the pictures!
review: Friendly and helpful staff, restaurant and bar with live music. Watching the sunset is amazing, close to everything you want.  Would stay there again.  Downside you have to pay for parking.apart from that great location

title: Could be great, but is just average
review: I wanted to like this hotel a lot, I really did. It has a lot going for it…the location is great, even if it isn’t directly on the beach. There are fantastic views of the gulf from west-facing rooms. Our room was large, comfortable and clean.  And yet, there are several factors that drag what could be a 5-star experience to a 3-star stay:  Construction Next Door – The noise did not bother us directly. Our room was on the opposite end of the hotel. But if you have a room close to the construction site, you will experience it a lot more, to the point where noise will be an issue. While the hotel’s advisement states that work begins at 7 a.m., on at least one day of our stay, a deep, pounding noise began at 6 a.m., with workers using bright floodlights. And while using the pool,…

title: Great stay
review: Thank you for taking time to write a lengthy review of your recent stay here.  Please let us  thank you for your business and recognize you as a valued IHG Spire Elite Member.  We appreciate that you enjoyed the spectacular views of the Gulf and sunset from the rooms and public areas and that our location provided easy access to the other fun on Clearwater Beach.  Please also know that the comments you provided are very important to helping us improve customer satisfaction.  As you mentioned, the construction next door is nothing we have complete control over although our regulations are what was specified and we're sorry they were not abided by.   As for the parking situation, we normally do offer a rate of $12 a night - most resorts in the area do that because of space considerations, but we're so sorry your evening was tarnished by having to take a shuttle.  This will be brought to the attention of those in control of the parking situation - as will all your comments that will be reviewed by top management so we can ensure that there will be improvement.  Understandably, the loose tile and no garbage bag do not live up to our standards.  While we hope you spoke to someone in management while you were here, I do want to give you my personal email should you care to discuss this further.    We hope you took away good memories of your beach vacation and thank you again for staying with us.  Christine Bottger General Manager cbottger@clearwaterbeachhi.com

title: average hotel, not bad/not great
review: We stayed here one night with a younger family and had a great stay. The room was ready early the valet parking was very affordable. Our room had a balcony over looking the Main Street of Clearwater beach. The beds were nice and the room was clean.  The kids enjoyed the outdoor pool and we loved the outdoor bar. I would highly recommend.  The price was right and we could not hear the construction going on next door. The beach is a short walk from the hotel.

title: Accommodating management
review: Thank you so much for taking time to write about the stay that you and your family had with us recently.  We're so pleased that you enjoyed your trip, including our hotel and amenities.   So glad that your children loved our pools....and hope they got to see dolphins jumping off shore.  You are correct .. we do try to offer affordable rates since we are definitely a family property, so thank you for recognizing that.  The construction can be a distraction but we're glad it did not disrupt your fun and thank you for your understanding.  We hope you all took away great memories of sunsets, beaches, fun and family time.  Sincere wishes for a fine 2016.  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Clean hotel, great views, and close to everything!
review: Gulf view from the room is nice, except for the construction next door. Owner gave up 100-car parking lot next door to build another high-rise hotel, so parking was a nightmare while here during a peak week. Valet parking often sent us to an overflow lot with shuttle service--not what you want to hear when returning from a great dinner someplace... Staff were super nice, tho. Rooms were very clean with newish carpeting, flat screen TVs, microwaves, mini fridge, etc. Good for families on a budget.

title: Great location, but tired and shopworn
review: Stayed here for three nights with family over Christmas. Great view of water, most staff were pleasant and friendly. Room rate changed by the day -- I had two rooms on one floor, one went up and one went down --but the beds were comfortable and if you ignored the water stains on the carpet and the dingy grout, and paid attention to the view, you would be fine.

title: good location, could do with refurbishment
review: Thank you for taking time to comment on your recent stay with us.  We appreciate your candor and share all reviews with top management since our goal is to provide top customer service for our guests.  We are pleased that you enjoyed your views, spaciousness of the rooms, and friendly staff.  We're glad you left with good memories of your Clearwater Beach vacation.  Sincere good wishes for a fine 2016,  Christine Bottger  General Manager

title: Great Hotel with a View
review: me and my wife stayed here for a couple of nights as we both love clearwater, the hotel is in a good location and is clean , we got upgraded to a sea view suite as i am a spire elite member. there is some building work going on next door which took the shine of the stay and the whole hotel could do with a make over but on the whole it was very good.

title: Horrible
review: Thank you for taking time to comment on your stay with us.  We're pleased that you and your wife enjoyed a beach getaway in our beautiful part of Clearwater Beach.  We appreciate very much your insights into your stay; please know that guest comments are shared with top management so that we are able to continually improve our guest experience.   We also want to thank you for being a member of the IHG Club.  We're glad we were able to provide you an upgrade during your stay.  Thanks again for staying with us and we do hope you'll return again when you're looking for another beach getaway.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: very nice family friendly place
review: We checked into this hotel after a four day stay at the Holiday Inn Express in Largo, FL. We were equally impressed by this hotel. We were in the new tower that has a better view of the water. We were fortunate in getting a corner room on the top (7th) floor. Without question, it was one of the best hotel rooms we've stayed in and it had a "spectacular" view including a balcony. If you're inclined to "stay put", there's a very good restaurant on the main level where you can eat inside, sit at the bar and gaze at the water or sit outside. The Happy Hour Menu should be checked as well. The only minor thing I would mention is the Internet speed is adequate but not screaming fast. If you're a Road Warrior that has lots to do on a computer at night, this may not be the beat choice…

title: A Dozen Surprises
review: WARNING!  Aside from the pounding construction next door; aside from the film of dirt that the construction renders the pool useless, and aside from the odd odors throughout the hotel and room, the worst part is going to the bathroom in the middle of the night, turning on the lights and seeing at least a dozen cockroaches all over the sink where we keep the toothbrushes, hair brush, soap etc.    When I informed the manager of the cockroaches, she never even uttered an apology. She didn't seem the least bit surprised, which means this isn't the first.   If you read this and still stay here, enjoy the extra company in your room.  If you have to use the bathroom in the middle of the night, turn all the lights on before getting out of bed. Give the roaches about 30-45 seconds to…

title: Girls weekend!
review: Dear Downtown 289:  Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience with our hotel.  We are terribly disppointed to hear that you were unable to enjoy your visit to our area.  I am sorry to hear a member of our Managment team wasn't empathetic to your complaint.    Should you wish to discuss this in further detail, you may reach me at cbottger@ClearwaterBeachHI.com.  All feedback whether positive or negative is truly valuable to our overall success.  Again, we thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us.    Best Regards,    Christine Bottger  General Manager

title: Except for not having a beach and a few other minor items, you will enjoy your stay here
review: Rooms were clean, great fitness center. No free breakfast but they have a cafe and restaurant there. Worked out great. Great location and great view. (Didn't like the mandatory $12 valet fee that you had to pay) We will go back if we stay in Clearwater again.

title: Hotel with good location, great view, spoiled by loud music
review: Thank you!  We're so pleased that your girl's getaway proved to be enjoyable and that you had fun in Clearwater Beach.  We appreciate that you took time to leave comments so that others will be able to experience what you have - a pleasant beach vacation.  Thanks again and season's best greetings,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Business conference retreat
review: First off -- this hotel is on the water; but there's only a narrow strip of beach at low tide. That being said -- the pool area is quite nice, except it gets loud in the evening. There is access to a restaurant, and two bars -- one by the restaurant one on the other side of the pool. Pool towels are provided -- and even at a busy time were in good supply.  We were upgraded to a suite over looking the water -- and it provided amazing views of the sunset and good photo ops. The room itself had everything you could want and more. Loved having two bathrooms. This would be perfect for a family to share! The only minor downsides to the room was that there was no in-room safe. And in the evening, the music from the (off-key) band was so loud it was obnoxious.  Other than that, people…

title: Very nice room, close to the beach!
review: We stayed in a suite with a living room, a bedroom and another small room with a bunk bed: perfect for a family stay! Unfortunatelly it was raining so we could not enjoy the pool or beach but it looked great! Good location: it is possible to walk to most things in clearwater beach and even to the marine aquarium

title: Worst costumer service I ever received
review: Thank you so much for taking time to comment on your stay here recently.  We're so glad you and your friends enjoyed your stay - despite that the weather didn't cooperate!  You are right - we are centrally located to most everything in Clearwater and it is easy to get around.  We do hope you'll be back again for some sunshiny days!  Season's greetings,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Wonderful Gulf Views Great Hotel and Restaurant Staff, but...
review: We checked in on 11/18/15 at around 04:00pm for just one night, and the girl at the front desk was very rude. First of all she did not even welcome us to the hotel, or explained any amenities of the hotel. They made us give them $100 deposit when our room was less then that. Me and my husband always travel everywhere for leisure with our small son and take mini vacations and this is by far the worst costumer service experience we had. Plus we work for IHG, so go figure they don't even treat their fellow coworkers right. and since the front desk gilr was so rude we ask to speak to a supervisor who instead of giving us attention was talking on the walkie. Very unproffesional. The room they gave us had horrible decor and the walls were all dirty. The bathroom had a standup shower,…

title: Great Location
review: Dear Jerlina:  Thank you for your candid review.  We apologize that your recent stay did not meet expectations.  We value our guests opinions, including employees of IHG.  As an employee you understand that each hotel has their own policy and procedures pertaining to cash paying guests, and it is true we do require a $100.00 from all of our cashing paying guests.    We apologize for any inconvenience you experienced regarding the necessary cleaning of the pool on Wednesday evening.  Arrangements were made to use the pool at our Good Neighbor hotel next door.  Notices were placed in the guest room and at the desk advising of this, and we apologize if that was missed.    It is true our Security Team did knock on your door around 11:00pm as we received a noise complaint from a neighboring room about loud voices.  For the safety and security of all of guests including the occupants of your room, we must investigate all noise complaints.  Again we apologize if you were inconvenienced.    We truly appreciate your business and your comments.  Thank you again for sharing your experience with us.    Best Regards,   Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Decent place
review: We have stayed at this Holiday Inn several times over the last few years. We love the level of service and the rooms are spacious, modern and clean! THe restaurant also provides great service and food. Suggest dinning on the patio for the sunset count down and the live music. I am not sure exactly what it is, but there is something special about this spot in clearwater. Beautiful sunsets, large clean and clear pool, tiki bar is fun to hang out at too. Now for the "but..." Construction construction construction. A parking deck being built another huge hotel going up, the parking is horrible, but they do valet for free. There is construction noise, but not early morning. This is one of my favorite places on Clearwater Beach and we will continue to return.

title: Pretty good
review: It has a really cool waterfront bar and a  convenient location. Friendly staff.There was good music at night. Rooms are a little jaded. But overall good quality at a good price. I would recommend for most uses. Construction next door starts at 7 am right now though.

title: Short visit
review: Thank you for taking time to write.  We're pleased you and your friends chose to stay with us for your beach getaway.  We have great fondness for our Canadian guests!  We appreciate your comments and feedback -- we share these with management in all appropriate departments so we can continue to improve the customer service experience.  We hope you'll join us again - and stay in touch with us on Facebook for reasons to return  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Beautiful
review: We spent 2 nights at this hotel. The staff was very nice and always helpful. The property was going though additions so we had to listen to hammering and sawing early in the morning.
