The rooms were comfortable but needed updating.  The hotel was full the weekend was there so it was very busy. Did eat at Jimmy's, food was good. Great drinks at the bar and the outside music was entertaining. Loved the deck and outside view.

title: Good
review: Thank you for taking time to write about your family's recent visit to Clearwater Beach and your stay with us.  We're pleased that you enjoyed the amenities we offer and are sorry you were inconvenienced by the construction noise next door.  We're working with the contractors to minimize distraction for our guests.  We want everyone's experience to be pleasant.  We appreciate your comments on Jimmy's and the deck entertainment.  So glad overall you left with good memories and hope we'll see you again.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Decent price, nice rooms, little garish
review: Stayed here to finish off our Florida holiday. After a busy 2 weeks visiting the parks, it was a welcome end to the holiday. Very relaxing, great food and beautiful views.. Watched the amazing sunset from the hotel..Would definitely return next time we go back to Florida :)

title: Very Poor Customer Service
review: My friends had called to book a room for three nights we contacted them off google where there price for a the room per night was $137.00 . They booked the room and then went to check in and were told there was not a reservation and that they could not book a room at that price! My friends called me to make sure they had went to the right holiday inn and so I checked Google and I checked my phones call log and it was the same number it was the right hotel. I called to speak to them and the guy who answered the phone was very rude when I brought up he situation he interupt me and I just got done dealing with those people and that unless we had a confirmation number he couldn't help us ??  Really you can't check her card though the system or try to locate the person we spoke with…

title: Nice hotel with problems!
review: Dear dillon3612:  Thank you for sharing your comments regarding your friends recent interactions with our staff.  Please accept our apologizes for any inconvenience your friends may have experienced.  All confirmed reservations with our hotel and any IHG Hotel are provided a confirmation number that is universal to Holiday Inn Worldwide and the property direct.     Our guests private information (i.e their credit card information) is extremely important to us and due to increased security measures, we are unable to search for reservations via an individuals credit card number.     Should you have any further questions or concerns, please feel free to contact me directly at cbottger@ClearwaterBeachHI.com  Best Regards,  Christine Bottger General Manager   We take our guests privacy

title: Heaven!
review: This is a nice hotel. It could have been a great experience but: 1. Six out if seven days the second elevator was broken and out of service. The hotel uses their elevators to transport housekeeping, repair men, food service, etc. you get the picture. One small elevator to trans port everything was in acceptable. My husband is handicapped and having to wait that long took the shine off of our vacation, 2. When I booked I saw that ther was onsite parking for a fee. No problem. What they don't tell you is how horrible the parking situation is! Everytime that you need your car you have to wait at least ten minutes and then you tip the valet. The 12 dollars a day quickly became 20. One night I arrived at the hotel and was told that I had to go next door to Shepard's Hotel and park…

title: Beautiful Gulf View
review: Thank you for taking time to write about your recent stay here.    We appreciate all guest feedback - whether good or bad - to help us in our efforts to provide a good experience for all our visitors.  We're very sorry that you came at a time when we had difficulties on site with the construction next door and our malfunctioning elevator, and we can understand that was not pleasant to deal with.   As to the housekeeping comments, we do address these comments with appropriate department heads; again, we regret that this affected your stay.  All in all, it looks as though you did enjoy your stay on Clearwater Beach and took away good memories.  We thank you again for staying with us.  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Excellent BUT beware of location
review: We have stayed at Holiday Inn several times over the last 3 years. I absolutley love the people who work there and the rooms were great!  The food is amazing and the live music is always entertaining. We stayed at Holiday inn on indian rock beach as well both are great.  In fact we will be there in a couple weeks again! I am so looking forward to it. While booking our vacation we looked at several other hotels but agreed that there is just something special about this spot in clearwater!!! Love it!

title: Several Problems
review: The front desk employees are friendly as are the valet car attendants.  The lobby has a big countdown to sunset clock which is nice because the sunsets are beautiful.  The biggest problem is there is NO BEACH ACCESS.  you have to walk several blocks down the street and cross busy Gulfview Boulevard twice.  If there is anyone with health problems, it is impossible to walk that far to get to the beach. The main problems with the room were the air conditioning in one room did not work, there were stains on the carpet and housekeeping was not timely on servicing the room when you were staying more than one night.  another problem is the ice machine on our floor was out of order and one of the elevators was out of order.  The phone in the sitting room of our suite did not work. …

title: pros and cons
review: Thank you for taking time to write about your recent stay with us.  Please know that all guest comments - both positive and negative - are appreciated as we strive for complete customer satisfaction.  We do hope you notified us of the issues you were having with the a/c and the ice maker, etc. so we could take care of that promptly.  The appropriate department heads including housekeeping will be advised of the issues you had and we're sorry they diminished the quality of your stay.  Although we are located on Clearwater Beach, we are not beach front, as you say, nor do we advertise ourselves to be.  The Gulf of Mexico fronts right from our deck, but the beautiful public beach is only a five-minute walk - or, if you have gear to carry, a trolley ride.     Hopefully you left with good memories of Clearwater Beach and we thank you again for contacting us.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Great location, great hotel
review: This hotel has equal pros and cons.  The Pros: The front desk staff is very friendly and knowledgeable about the area. The hotel is very clean and the room was adequately furnished. I especially like that there was a  fridge and microwave. The pool is beautiful and large and has a great view of the gulf and the bay. The restaurant has a great selection of food and nightly entertainment. The best part for me was that it is family friendly and kids are welcome! The Cons: The air conditioner is loud and when it clicks on it sounds just like the room door opening. So if you are a light sleeper beware. The walls are also fairly easy to hear through, bathroom noise, coughing, etc. This property has NO DIRECT BEACH ACCESS!!!!! You will have to walk across the street, down a few blocks,…

title: It was a nice night away.
review: Thank you so much for taking time to write a review about your recent stay here.  We're pleased that - overall - you enjoyed your stay and are interested in returning once construction next door is over.  In regards to the Tower Crane, I can empathize with you regarding the safety risk it appears it could pose.   Please know that the crane was erected and inspected for the safety and security of all our guests.  Careful planing and discussion were had about the location and any risks it could or would impose.  The safety and security of our guests are first and foremost in our hearts and minds.  You are right - we are in the community of Clearwater Beach but not directly ON the beach, although the Gulf of Mexico comes right to the edge of our docks.  Normally it is an easy five-minute walk for our guests - or they hop the trolley if they have a lot of gear.  Since other areas of Clearwater Beach also have construction, we know that means our guests have to cross the street, so we do recommend the convenience of the trolley.  As to the air conditioning, we take guest comments seriously and address them with appropriate department heads.  We're sorry the noise posed a problem for you.  Thanks again and we hope you'll be back with us again for more good memories of Clearwater Beach.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Great Resort!
review: Had a wonderful experience at this hotel- it was very clean and well-kept, staff was friendly and the views/distance to the beach was awesome. Definitely would stay here again and recommend to a friend. Because of our IHG Rewards club, we were upgraded to a poolside room so it was nice to be able to step out the door to the fabulous pool and great views of the Gulf. There was construction going on right next to the hotel, but the noise disruption was minimal.

title: Avoid this hotel for at least 18 months
review: My wife and I stayed here for 14 nights in September to October 2015. Room was clean and tidy, reception and public areas were nice. Hotel is just a short walk from Clearwater beach. That is the good points. We were in a room on 5th floor looking into a construction site where work started at 07:15 and did not end till18:15 every day except Sunday , we were awakened by the noise every morning ! We couldn't use the balcony due the noise from site and also air condition units on roof below. There was no in room safe and safety box at reception only holds passports and wallet , so don't bring your laptop as you will have to carry it everywhere.The construction dividing barriers were within a few feet of the pool terrace and a 100 foot tower crane was often swinging above pool area…

title: Great place
review: Thank you for taking time to comment on your recent stay here.  It is our sincere wish that all of our guests leave with pleasant memories, and we're sorry if you felt that we did not live up to your expectations.  We do wish that a member of our management team would have had an opportunity to talk with you prior to leaving our resort.  Actually, our website does not say construction is over in October 2015 - perhaps you saw it on another website but all of our tour operator partners have been notified and kept informed.  We will share the rest of your concerns with our Service Committee Team to review and take necessary steps to address the concerns your brought up in order to not inconvenience future guests.  Feedback whether positive or negative is vital to our overall success and we certainly use these comments to improve product and service to our guests.  Again, we thank you for sharing your experience and we hope you did leave with good memories of Clearwater Beach.  Best regards,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Holiday inn hell
review: We spent 2 nights here and even though there is construction going on next door, it did not bother us at all.  The valets were very fast and friendly.  The front desk staff were very helpful and friendly.  Our room was very nice, clean, comfortable beds, and had a balcony with a beautiful view. I would definitely stay here again.  We used the free ride taxi service and had a wonderful time exploring this beach town.

title: HI on the Beach
review: Thank you!    We're so pleased you and your family enjoyed your stay with us!    We appreciate the comments on our staff and resort amenities and thank you for your patience as construction goes on next door.  You are right - the free beach trolley is something our guests love and we're glad you were able to explore Clearwater.  Hope you'll be back with us again!  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Great hotel, loved the pool and view
review: Just left the holiday inn in Clearwater beach, cutting our visit there short by a week. We arrived on Saturday for a ten day relaxing stay after four hectic days visiting the parks in Orlando. Our first day and night were pleasant enough, but there was no construction noise as it was the weekend. Come Monday morning, early, the banging and drilling started and carried on relentless until 5:00 pm ish. While sunbathing round the pool a tower crane was swinging around with the counterbalance set right above your head. (Worrying).  Our room 405 was tired but clean. The air con was similar to other reviews, just like a jumbo jet landing, so that had to be turned off at night. The balcony outside overlooked the trash cans to the left, old broken appliances to the right and the smoking…

title: Not so bad
review: We  had  a good time .    Customer service could be improved upon but overall not bad.   Rooms nice.  After the winter we had just wanted a nice warm place to visit and this fit the bill.   Think better stay over service would be nice but once again not bad just not great.

title: Very nice hotel with gorgeous pool view - no direct beach access
review: Thank you for taking time to write about your stay with us.  We're glad you and your family chose Clearwater Beach as your destination and honored you stayed with us.    We share all guest comments with appropriate department heads so we can continue to improve our customer service - thank you for your candor.  There's always something going on in Clearwater and we hope you'll be back with us again.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Great Beach Hotel!
review: Room was nice...modern/renovated.  No stinky beach hotel stinky smell that you often find.  The hotel in general was nicely done and decorated.  The pool outside was beautiful although not heated, but the views were stunning.  What a sunset!  There was an arcade for kids, but I didn't look in there.   The attached restaurant had a nice, diverse menu and there was a tiki bar.  If you aren't looking for direct beach access, this is a great choice.

title: Third visit to Holiday Inn & Suites, Clearwater
review: Thank you so much for taking time to write a review on our resort.  We're so pleased that you and your family enjoyed your stay with us!  We appreciate your kind comments on the resort amenities and - of course - the spectacular views for sunset watching and dolphin watching.  There's always something new going on in Clearwater and we do hope you'll be back with us for more fun.  Please stay in touch with us on Facebook for reasons to return.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Decent hotel
review: OK, I like Holiday Inns and this one is very nice. Great clean rooms with confortable beds, Friendly staff, nice pool and nicely located for all the local beach attractions. Yes there is construction going on and you will see complaints about that from some reviewers. But as soon as you get to Clearwater Beach, you will realize that there is construction going on almost everywhere. I counted at least 8 new high-rise hotels under construction. So if hearing a bit of construction noise after 8 Am is going to ruin your trip, then wait until these hotels are completed. But that did not affect my trip in any way. This hotel has a great restaurant  with a beautiful outside deck, great sunset views. You can walk anywhere in the Clearwater Beach area. If you want to tour the outlying…

title: Had a nice time
review: For what I paid I had a nice view,I had no issues with check in the staff were very nice and friendly and the room was very clean. By far the best hotel I've stayed in and its right across from the beach. I am definitely going back!

title: very nice
review: Thank you for taking time to write about the stay you had here recently.  We are so pleased you both enjoyed great beach time and all we have to offer here at the resort, and we do hope that you will be coming back to see us for more memories.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Clean comfortable rooms
review: the hotel was very clean from reception and rooms. the breakfast on the week my wife and i were there were outstanding ,in fact they were that good and tasty we only ate an ice cream at lunch time. price appox.$10. overall a great stay.

title: Not Bad
review: Thank you very much for taking time to share comments about you and your wife's recent stay with us.   You traveled a long way for your Florida holiday and we're honored you chose to stay with us - and even more pleased that you left with beautiful memories.  We do hope you'll return again.  If you care to join us on Facebook, we'll keep you up to date with happenings, events and special deals.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Good value for money
review: Stayed here for two weeks from 5th September. We were not happy with the view from our balcony on level two, so we asked to be moved. Although there was no free rooms they moved us to the top floor no problem the next day where the view was magnificent.  The food was great at Jimmys, the pool, games room, bar and general service was very good. One or two servers could smile a bit more often, especially as it seems a rule-of-thumb to tip them.  The construction next door did not impact on us at all, infact the seagulls fighting over scraps of food was more annoying.  A good tip for saving on the $12 charge per day for parking is to look along the road almost opposite the hotel beside the petrol garage. We found spaces for parking everyday, the furthest we had to walk was about…

title: Our all-time favorite!
review: We've been vacationing here for years, sometimes twice a year and have always had the best time.  The staff is great; we always look forward to seeing Mary in the gift shop.  The location, view, rooms (higher floor, gulf view rooms), pool and tiki bars are perfect.  We never rent a car...  walk everywhere or take the Jolly Trolley.  Plenty to do on Clearwater Beach without ever leaving.  We'll be there again in 2 weeks to celebrate our 25th anniversary & my husband's 60th birthday and can't wait:)!

title: Great stay
review: First off - congratulations (early) on your anniversary and to your husband for his upcoming birthday!   We're so pleased you'll be sharing these special days here at our resort!  We thank you for your kind comments about our central location, resort offerings, and friendly staff (we'll tell Mary you sent regards!), and we look forward to another great visit from you soon.  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Holiday Inn Clearwater FL
review: Pros: onsite restaurant, fruit infused water in lobby, the view of the gulf from the pool area was great.   We stayed in a junior suite with a king bed and a nook with bunk beds. We had the living room with a kitchenette. A total of three tvs, 4 sinks, 2 full bathrooms and an extra room with a sink next to the nook. The other family that went with us stayed in a regular hotel room with view of the gulf but had the noise from the pool area daily until 11 pm. We paid the same price but our suite location was way quieter, which is what matters when you have young children.   Cons: Our room view was the hvac equipment. It didn't matter too much though. Great price for the space.

title: Can't wait to come back again!
review: Thank you for taking time to write about your family's stay with us.  We're glad you and your friends could get away for a little fun in the Florida sunshine.  You are right - we have different rooms types with different views - so we're glad you found the spaciousness of our family suite good for your needs.  The terrace view rooms are also beautiful, so we're glad your friends enjoyed them as well.  There's always something new and fun going on in Clearwater, so we hope you'll stay in touch with us on our Facebook page for reasons to come back.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Great motel, excellent view of the gulf
review: I had a nice stay at the Holiday Inn in Clearwater FL. The hotel is nice, the room has a microwave is dishes/utensils ready for extended stay. The pool is awesome, right next to the ocean, see photo. It's about two blocks from the beach so you have to walk to beach which is the downside but not too bad. I can see myself stay here again if I'm in Clearwater.

title: This wasn't our first time here, but it will more than likely be our LAST Time!
review: We have stayed at this location the last 3 times we stayed in Clearwater. We did read the reviews prior to even staying this go around and read people complaining about the construction and parking, but we thought we never had a negative experience here so we will book it again. I will say this was not a pleasant experience. It all started when we checked in. Granted we did arrive early, but we always checked in early here and never had an issue. We got up to the desk and my husband gives the woman our information. She tells that our room is ready and available but if we want to check in right now we would be charged $50. My husband and I were like are you serious, she rudely said yes so out we went. I couldn’t see her name clearly but I know it began with a “Z”.  We drove…

title: Excellent hotel for vacation!
review: Thank you for taking time to write a review following your stay here with your husband.  As you can imagine, we're sorry to read that we failed to meet your expectations on several areas, and - although it is after the fact - please know that guest comments are brought to the attention of our top management staff so we can see ways in which to improve the customer experience.  The construction issue has been a challenge, both for noise as well as parking, and we are working with the construction company to minimize disruption to our guests.    If you would like to contact me directly about your stay, my email is CBottger@clearwaterbeachhi.com and I would be glad to discuss this further, especially given that you've been with us before and not had problems in the past.  Again, thank you, and kind regards,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: great location
review: Stayed over at this hotel for 3 days last weekend and the overall experience was phenomenal.  Christine and her staff were very friendly and accommodating; the valet parking was very convenient.  The hotel is located within 3 mins walking distance to the main Clearwater Beach.  The swimming pool within the hotel was very clean with excellent view to the sunset.  Definitely will recommend this hotel to others looking for family vacation.

title: Nice view, but not happy with parking policy
review: Thank you for taking time to comment about your stay with us.  We're so pleased your family enjoyed all we have to offer and left with some great Florida memories.  We do appreciate your positive comments and certainly hope you'll be with us again for more fun.  Stay tuned with us on Facebook for updates, deals, and reasons to return!  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Fantastic Weekend Getaway
review: Good Hotel in a great location. Very short walk to beach,restaurants and shopping. Pool is on the water with sunsets and view of boats going in and out of Clearwater Bay. $12 per day parking but you can literally walk to anywhere on the Island. There is a ton of construction going on. Lots of Hotels being built. Did not bother us but just a FYI.

title: Great stay
review: Stayed at the hotel for the weekend in April. Room was clean and beds are comfy. Love the pillows and service was fast. Restaurant on site was good and had live entertainment. There is no beach access from the hotel and had to pay for parking. 12 per day parking. Short walk to clear water beach, which is incredible. Room had microwave and mini frig, which was nice to hold water and left overs. Pool is nothing fancy and plenty of towels, but have to grab them from front desk. There is a gas station almost across the street and restaurants withing walking distance. Would stay here again. Good value for the money.

title: A Very Nice Little Hotel - Absolute Waterfront
review: Thanks so much for sharing comments about your stay here in April.  We're glad you enjoyed the resort amenities, central location and live entertainment.   Our staff will appreciate your compliments since we want all of our guests to leave with good memories.  We do hope you'll be back for more fun on Clearwater Beach.  Please stay in touch with us on Facebook for news, updates and special deals.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Very good, great location
review: we hadn't intended on staying here, we stayed at Tampa Intercontinental, but moved after the first night, notwithstanding having the presidential suite there, and another suite, the property just didn't appeal, and being by the water in Clearwater was much more appealing.

title: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED
review: We are so glad you had the opportunity to stay with us and see for yourself all we have to offer.  Thanks for your kind words - and we do hope you'll return again for more fun on Clearwater Beach!  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Family booking - expectations met
review: Clearwater, what a gorgeous place, and the hotel is exactly what you expect from a holiday inn. Good quality, friendly staff, big rooms. Great bar looking out on the gulf coast, excellent bar team, great value!! Kids eat free and they really mean free!! And the food was good. The sunset from the bar we will never forget. We could have upgraded to a sea view room for extra charge but didnt as we really only slept there. Lots of heavy duty building work going on right next door, massive hotel being built, very very loud. If I had known this I probably would not have booked, but it's not spoilt our stay, pool is great and open til 11pm. All in all, great location, great value, lots of places to eat nearby, beach is a few minutes walk, harbour is 15 min walk, boat trips were…

title: Wonderful views
review: A couple of minor thoughts but please read the full review.  Parking is valet only at $12 a night but I'm sure is could be avoided if you are happy to park on a side street away from the hotel.  Overall the hotel has dated both in the rooms and the public areas.  However all of this is forgotten about when you see the amazing views and sunsets each day and night, the views of the Gulf of Mexico are out of this world.  Each evening the sunsets are so spectacular they can't be missed.  Well worth paying a little extra for an ocean view. We stayed in the 6th floor in a corner suite with balcony and the views are breath taking,  Will definitely be back.

title: Beach vacation
review: Thank you for taking time to write a review about your stay with us -- and share such beautiful photos!  We're glad you and your family had a great stay and that you enjoyed the spectacular views from our terrace-view rooms and Jimmy's deck.  Every night those sunsets just amaze our guests -- and us!  As for parking, the space on the beach is limited and we, along with most resorts, do have to charge but we do keep it is low as possible.  We would comment that your suggestion to park on the street might not work since there are very few spaces available (but a good thought!)  We're so glad to hear you'll be back and hope you'll stay in touch with us on Facebook --  Enjoy the rest of your summer,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Mrs compton
review: The holiday inn has no beach access and there is construction taking place next door. You can see the water but it's not the best view of the beach. You have no choice but valet parking which is free but you have to valet all the time. The pool is a nice size. View of the water from the restaurant.

title: I still like this hotel! Even with construction RIGHT NEXT DOOR!
review: Thanks so much for writing about your family's recent visit to us.  We're glad you enjoyed the beautiful gulf views and our pool, and are sorry for any inconvenience caused by the construction next door.    You're right - we do not have a beach - but we do have those beautiful close views of the Gulf and are a short walk (or trolley ride) to the public beach.  We hope you'll be back with us again for more Florida fun.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Under Construction
review: I came here with my husband and son. We had booked through southwest vacations. Which I will never do again. They placed us in the wrong hotel. So we were able to switch to this hotel. We were supposed to be booked in a two  Queen Bed suite. When we arrived at the hotel we only had a standard room. In order to have what we paid for we had to "upgrade" for $75 a night. Then when I received the bill I not only had a $75 charge but also an additional $10 in taxes per night that no one mentioned.  Upon arriving to my room I found a dirty pair of women's underwear. Eeww!!!   I also found out later as we came in for the night , after being gone all day that my room had no air.  For a woman who sleeps with a fan even in winter , it was unbearable. They couldn't switch my room until the…

title: High school get together - great time
review: Very clean hotel great service and good food.  We all had a great time especially at the Tiki bar!  Right on the water!  Lovely beach too!  Location was good because you could walk to several places to eat and or have cocktails.  We stayed here several times over the years.

title: Spacious rooms, hot hallways.  Great views (if you are lucky).
review: Thank you for taking time to write about your stay here recently.  We're sorry you had a view less than was expected and hope you did inquire at the desk if there was a possibility to move you.  Some of our rooms have configurations different from others, and that may have been part of the issue.  We do take guest comments seriously and appreciate your comments.  We're sorry you were inconvenienced by the parking and the construction going on next door.  We look forward to its completion.  All in all, we're glad you enjoyed your stay.  Thanks again,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Non Chalant Attitudes - Constuction
review: Our room, sadly, had a view of an air conditioner.  However, some suites overlook the gulf, and that must be amazing.  Our room was spacious, and if in a different area, I could easily be able spending a long stay here.  It was nice to have a table, chairs, sink, dishes and microwave.  However being next to the elevator, was loud.  Two nights guests someplace were making a lot of noise and our room shook with whatever It was. Security was on it but it was not fun.  There were a lot of loud guests that were not apparently aware of sleeping guests on their trip down the halls.  The hallway wasn't air conditioned, it was uncomfortable.  The pool overlooks the gulf, but we had to get towels from the front desk, we didn't know that.  The parking stinks, we had to have them park our…

title: Great Hotel.  Minus the construction.
review: Thank you for taking time to write and review your recent stay with us.  We are so sorry you were inconvenienced by the noise of construction next door.   This was why the parking situation was changed as well.  We can understand that noisy guests can be disruptive and we're glad you did phone our security; you expect a quiet holiday understandably.   We do share our guest comments with management team so we can try and improve our customer satisfaction.   We appreciate that you found our staff courteous and friendly and we'll pass that along; they do want everyone's stay to be memorable and pleasant.  We do hope you took away good memories of Clearwater Beach.  Thank you again.  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: great hotel but beware construction
review: We spent about $3000 at this hotel. We stayed 9 days in July from July 15th to July 23 2015.  It was not one of Holiday Inns Billion dollar renovated hotels. Rooms are smaller than normal Holiday Inn Suites  it is falling apart .The tvs are small old flat screens do not bother bringing a PS4 (which we had brought to watch our shows on Netflix ) because the tvs are so old they have no HDMI output and no you cannot buy a converter as we did try. You pay for parking that is additional to your nightly rate. However, if you get in too late there is no parking so you have to park at a parking structure next door that the valet told us was complimentary. This is an oxymoron as you can not have complimentary parking and pay $12.00 plus tax for parking in the same sentence.  Food from…

title: Great service
review: The staff are great and friendly they make u feel welcome at all times and so far one of my favorite place to stay in every time i come down here to florida. The shuttle drivers are the best and they always make sure ur enjoy the ride and having fun.

title: Nice Stay
review: Thank you!   We're so glad you came back for more fun on Clearwater Beach and enjoyed your stay.  We appreciate the compliments given to our staff - they do sincerely want every guest's stay to be a pleasant one!  You're right, the shuttle drivers are customer-friendly as well.  Hopefully some day you'll be able to return not for business but for pleasure!  Thanks again,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Didn't even bother to check in .....
review: I stayed here with my family.  We had 2 side by side pool front rooms. Granted,  there was a lot of construction going on next door.  But once in your room the noise was minimal. The rooms were very clean.  The pool and lounging area was nice.  And the staff was super nice. Once the kids were exhausted from swimming, they were tucked into bed. Then,  for the adults, it was nice to sit ocean front on the deck and enjoy the evening watching the sunset and ocean waves.

title: Great place minus construction
review: Thank you so much for letting us know that you and your family had a great experience here recently.  We're certainly pleased you stayed with us and hope you'll be back time and again.  The comments on cleanliness and resort amenities are appreciated, and we're sorry that the construction issues were an annoyance, but it appears that didn't stop you from having fun!  You're right - the end of a perfect day is sitting on the terrace and enjoying the cool breezes and sunset views.  Come see us again!  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Not Worth the Money
review: Arrived at 9:00 pm for our reservation.  I was stopped at entrance to the parking lot by a parking valet who informed me that I would be able to check in, but would have to move my car to a motel down the street, as their parking lot was full.  I asked if he could park the car for me at the other motel and he said no.   I went inside to check in and found a sign on the check in desk telling me that construction and drilling would begin at 7:00 am and that they were sorry for the noise.   I had made my reservation through corporate 800# and no one had informed me about the parking situation or the construction noise.   I told the desk person that I was on vacation and really didn't want to be jarred awake at 7:00 a.m. by drilling, especially for the high price of the room.   I…

title: Nice oceanfront location, friendly staff
review: We stayed in an oceanfront suite which was actually 2 adjoining hotel rooms, one with 2 beds and one converted into a living area with a mini fridge, kitchenette area, living room/dining area with sleeper sofa and 2 bathrooms. This suite worked out perfect for us with 2 teenagers as they slept on the pull out sofa and we could shut the door between the rooms. There was a balcony on the "bedroom" side and just a window on the "living room" side The views were absoluely gorgeous from our balcony and we even saw dolphins! The room decor was very dated and the furniture and carpets were older and stained but because of the view we were able to overlook that. Had I been in a room without a view I may have felt differently. The desk staff was wonderful. Joan checked us in and was very…

title: Not recommended
review: Thank you!   We very much appreciate knowing that you and your family enjoyed your stay with us - and that our family suites were perfect to allow you enough space.  You're right - the balcony offers views that are spectacular, and those dolphins put on quite a show! We'll let staff know of your compliments.  Joan is a valued member of our team and goes out of her way to ensure guests enjoy their stay.  We apologize for any inconvenience the next-door construction brought to your experience.  We are working with the construction company to minimize noise and dirt, but nevertheless it is distracting and we are sorry it was bothersome to you.   We hope you'll look to the future when this is over and you'll be able to return again for more fun on Clearwater Beach.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Okay experience
review: The first night upon arrival there were no towels at all in the hotel. I only needed 2 extra. Not even pool towels. Room service came while we were still in the room and said they would return later. They never came back. When I asked about room service I was told it is not provided the first 24 -48 hours. What?  Sheets were NEVER changed after 6 day 5 night stay. I saw the same makeup stains. I do NOT recommend this location.

title: Great place
review: Dear Mercedesrollingon  Thank you for taking the time to write your opinion regarding your most recent stay with us.    We strive for customer satisfaction, therefore we are terribly disappointed we failed in this instance.  We are working with our entire housekeeping team to ensure all guests are receiving the appropriate amoutnt of clean towels and linens.    We apologize for any negative impact this situation had on your stay.  I would love to have an opportunity to discuss this incident with you further.  You can reach me at cbottger@ClearwaterBeachHI.com.  We thank you for your opinion and best regards,   Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Beautiful View
review: I was a little disappointed in this hotel.  I was expecting more.  Wish that I had stayed at another hotel!  The carpet in this hotel was dated, the beds weren't that great, and the bathroom was very small.  The receptionist was not that friendly.  Housekeeping was pretty good.  Parking is extremely limited, and you have to pay $12 for valet parking.  However, the breakfast on the docks that we had was awesome.  Our server was pretty good.  The view was wonderful from the docks!  Wish that there had been beach access. Will choose another hotel next time if I visit Clearwater.

title: Birthday and Memorial Weekend
review: The place is awesome. The room was a 2 bedroom 2 bath suite. Room service , great food and right on time.  The Tiki bar awesome bartenders..   The only problem I see is they need to put some stairs to get down to the water..   This is the 2nd. time i stayed there.  Definitely would recommend this Hotel...  One of the best places I stayed at....  Thank Y'all for the greatest service !!!!!

title: Anniversary star
review: How kind of you to take time to write such a lovely review about your family's stay with us.  We appreciate your kind words, and most of all, we are glad you all had a great time!  We share guest comments with appropriate departments, so we'll be letting our bartenders know they offered great customer skills and left you with a good impression.  All of our staff want you to leave with great memories.  Hopefully you'll have time for another getaway soon, and until that time - please stay in touch with us on Facebook for reasons to come back!  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Lovely hotel
review: Overall good - View over water was very good with dolphin sightings but construction made it difficult to walk to beach.  Outdoor pool and restaurant were better than most but service at restaurant could have been a little faster since we were there with relative few guests.  Indoor coffee shop was very nice and service was excellent.  Location made valet parking necessary which can be a problem.  Noise was a problem due to construction nearby.

title: Nice family hotel at great location, but..
review: Thank you for writing about your recent stay with us, and may we offer up congratulations on your anniversary!  We're sorry the construction next door proved bothersome.  We are working with them to minimize noise and dust and we are doing our best to relieve the parking situation as we go through this period.    We do hope you'll look to returning to see us since you're not that far away.  You can always request a room on the other side of the resort to minimize disruption. Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Parking/Construction Nightmare
review: Only stayed here 1 night but hotel suite for our family of 5 was lovely and spacious right near the water 2 minute walk to the fabulous beach and lots of shops and pier 60  near by. staff were very welcoming hotel was very clean and modern  would recommend to all.  close to everything you would want to see at fabulous Clearwater just wish we could have stayed longer but we had only booked hotel for our visit to Busch gardens as we were staying in Orlando and wanted to enjoy our day in Busch gardens and have a beach day at Clearwater had a fabulous time!

title: Great hotel if you dont want a resort
review: We had a king room with gulf view. You can see dolphins  out in front and you can see the sand key park and beach. Hotel staff has been good. Room was clean and no complaints. Only bad thing is you have to walk about 3 blocks to get to the beach. Not a bad walk to the shop. Jimmys is downstairs on the first floor. They have a pool with small bar. There is a nail massage place here but we didnt try it. There is a game room for kids. Only thing i didnt like was finding out about the 12 dollar a night valet parking when i go here. Its close to waht appears to be a nice putt putt also.

title: Average, clean, pleasant stay
review: Thank you!  We're glad to hear that you two enjoyed your stay with us recently, and thanks for taking time to write about your experience.  We appreciate your comments on our cleanliness and the other resort features you enjoyed including Jimmy's and the pool.  As far as parking fees are concerned, most resorts on the beach do charge simply because parking space is at such a premium.  We do, however, try to keep the costs down as much as possible.  We hope you'll return again to see us and enjoy more of those gulf views and sunsets.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Nice experience
review: The positives: The hotel was super clean, everyone was very nice. The gift shop had everything I forgot at reasonable prices. The pool area is beautiful and well-kept. The restaurant Jimmy's Fish House was wonderful. The room was immaculate, beds comfy, toiletries were one of my favorite scents from Bath & Body Works. We were able to get early check-in and late check-out which was convenient since we were traveling with a baby.  The negatives: Construction right next door that has been going on for quite a while from what I understand. It was noisy and smelly and made the walk to the beach a little difficult. Speaking of the beach, while choosing a hotel I saw that the Holiday Inn advertised "beach front" which is deceiving because there is no actual beach access. The view is…

title: Not bad
review: Thanks for writing about your stay with us.  We're so pleased you and your friends had time for a bit of fun on Clearwater Beach.    We appreciate your comments on our cleanliness, the pool, and Jimmy's.  We're not certain where you saw that we advertised "beach front" because we are careful to position ourselves correctly; some third-party travel providers may word it differently and we're sorry you felt misinformed.   Sometimes people get confused because we are in the community of Clearwater Beach.  Hopefully the front desk did advise you of the trolley that stops right out front and takes guests and their beach gear to the public beach, shopping and dining venues.  It's very convenient.  We do hope you will return to see us again.  Construction next door won't last forever and there is always something fun to do in Clearwater.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Hotel OK but major valet parking issues
review: I stayed one night to have some me time before meeting up with friends for the weekend. The hotel is at a nice location, has friendly staff and is clean and well-appointed.  The people make the experience and they are the primary reason I am motivated to write a review. I interacted with several different front desk staff and they were always smiling and helpful. This was even true after a cranky lady was in line before me.  I ate dinner at the bar and enjoyed conversation with two happy and friendly people, and ate lunch and breakfast outside listening to the waves. Every server was friendly and conversational.   The rooms are nice. Mine had a balcony overlooking the pool and the water. I was even able to listen to the music at the bar from there (music stopped at 10).  The…

title: Adequate & Clean
review: I stayed here with my mom, aunt & toddler daughter for three nights last week. Hotel is very clean, staff is friendly & helpful. We got a two-queen bed room & I asked for a crib which was provided & very useful. Pool area was clean & we were happy to find a small, shallow pool that was just perfect for my daughter. The view was beautiful but there is no "beach" behind the hotel, just gulf water. A short walk to the beach and free valet parking were both convenient. For the money thought, I thought the hotel was a bit out of repair. The bathroom sink drained slowly, the microwave in our room was broken & there was no access to plug in the coffee maker. Extra bath towels were provided within minutes of request. All in all, an above average accommodation.

title: Loved our stay
review: Thanks so much for taking time to write about your stay with us.  We're so pleased your family enjoyed a nice getaway - and we loved knowing your little daughter enjoyed our kiddie pool!  Please know that all guest comments are appreciated and passed along to appropriate department heads, so we appreciate knowing of the issues you had with the sink and microwave.  We want every guest to leave with a positive experience and great memories.  We'd love to see you among those who come back for more beach fun and invite you to stay in touch on our Facebook page for events, happenings, and special offers.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: A pleasant stay at the Holiday Inn Hotel and Suites
review: We returned last night after spending 7 days. We had a suite facing the ocean. I was so nervous booking since the hotel does not have direct access to the beach but after spending a week there, I will never stay anywhere else! We watched the Dolphins every morning from our balcony. The beach was a very short walk. This was one of the few hotels truly on the water and the view was the best. We found a little beach where they rent jet skis and my kids loved swimming and playing in the sand more there than walking to the big beach. We ate at Jimmy's a bunch of times and the food was amazing every time! We can't wait to come back again next year. We did have one incident with "engineering" our first night and the man was less than pleasant. We saw him a few more times during our…

title: 3rd time here!
review: Thank you!   We're delighted that you and your family had such a fun experience while staying with us -- and we hope you'll be among those who come back on a regular basis!  You're so right - the dolphins are just magical to watch -- as are the sunsets, so we're pleased you enjoyed both.  We'll pass on your compliments to the staff at Jimmy's, and we're sorry you had the one incident with a staff member.  We do pass along guest comments so that we all can continue to improve our customer experience.  If you haven't joined us on Facebook, please do, and feel free to post pictures like you posted with your review - we love to share them!  Kind regards,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: nice hotel.
review: I just got back home yesterday from a trip to Clearwater Beach where I stayed at this hotel.  It is very nice and clean and the staff was always nice and accommodating.  The hotel is ocean front; however, it does not have an actual beach to go out on.  You have to walk maybe two short blocks to the beach.  Check in and check out was fast and easy.  They provide towels for pool and for the beach which is great if you are flying here and don't have room to pack towels.  My room was clean and the pool is nice.  The restaurant in the hotel, Jimmy's Fish House and Iguana Bar has pretty good food, especially the tilapia fish tacos. The hotel is a short walk to several restaurants and souvenir shops.  There is construction beside the hotel which I understand is going to be another…

title: Nice Holiday Inn
review: Spent two nights there, hotel does overlook the gulf but there is no beach to access from the hotel.  This was a typical standard Holiday Inn room with a fridge and microwave.  The room was clean, had a balcony and the free wi-fi was average at best.  Arrived hours prior to check in and were allowed to check in with no problem, that is a big plus to us.  All staff you came in contact with was helpful and friendly and always greeted you first.  Pool bar was great, pool area and deck was large and very nice and overlooked the gulf.  There is construction going on in the parking lot of the hotel as they are adding more rooms, but it was not an issue for us.  Had a couple of lunches and a breakfast at the hotel restaurant Jimmy's Fish House and all were very good.  The only negative…

title: Amazing location!
review: Thanks so much for writing about your visit to Clearwater Beach with your family.  We're pleased you stayed with us and enjoyed our resort and amenities.  You are right - we do have construction going on and are doing our best to keep the noise to a minimum for our guests.  As far as parking costs, most resorts on the beach do charge, simply because parking is at such a premium.  We do try and keep our rates as low as possible, however.  We're glad you enjoyed the dining and deck at Jimmy's and hope that since you're not that far away from us, we'll see you again.  Please stay in touch on Facebook for reasons to return.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Will not go back
review: Beautiful hotel in amazing surroundings. The restaurant attached to the hotel is average but having dolphins playing in the bay whilst you eat breakfast made up for it! Wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel or stay here again!

title: clearwater weekend .
review: Thank you!    We're so pleased that you both enjoyed your stay with us, and we're so glad the dolphins were there for daily greetings!   No one ever gets tired of seeing the dolphins right out in the Gulf.  We appreciate that we met your expectations and that you'd recommend us -- and we certainly do hope you will come back.  Please stay in touch with us on our Facebook page for ideas, events, and deals.  Thanks again,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Great long weekend stay
review: Stayed one night and had to pay $200 for a dirty room that looked at a parking lot. Not impressed. Also, you have to pay for parking in addition to the room. Would not recommend to anyone. Staff was rude and the bar/restaurant in the hotel is a joke.   Hotel is NOT on beach and thanks to construction, access to the beach was quiet a walk do the road.   Also, even though they say free wi-fi, we were unable to connect at all during our stay.

title: Not bad, but could be better
review: Stayed two nights for a solo getaway. Hotel itself is not bad at all; pool is wonderful and restaurant is well-above average (scallops were fantastic). The elevator for the West tower is very slow, and there is only one, so that is a minor annoyance. Room itself was average, but view from the oceanside room is very nice. No direct beach access, but beach itself is 5 minute walk (or you can swim in the channel, which is fine).  The reason it doesn't score higher is that it felt a little "chintzy" in the way they approached the pricing. I traveled (partly) on points, and I spent a significant number (plus an extra $40 per night). There is a $12 per day parking fee (which, since 99% of guests arrive by car, is effectively an additional room fee, unlike hotels in places like NYC or…

title: Honeymoon
review: Thank you for taking time to write about your stay with us.   We appreciate your feedback and we do share comments with our management team so we can continue to improve our customer experience.  Regarding the parking issue, most properties on Clearwater Beach do charge for parking because space is very limited on the beach; we do keep our rates as low as possible.  You are correct; most guests do drive, whereas many in large cities such as  New York and Chicago  may  not have as much drive traffic.  Our rooms vary in price due to view and size, and that added to your cost.    We do hope you took away some pleasant memories of your stay on Clearwater Beach.  Thank you for staying with us and being a valued customer of Holiday Inn.  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Great Hotel!!!  Not on the beach though...
review: The view was amazing from our very clean room. Staff was friendly and had lots of suggestions of local attractions to see. We ordered Jimmy's room service one night and were very pleased the crab dip is absolutely delicious.  Coffee shop has weird hours and not really the best coffee. There is no direct access to the beach and with the construction its a bit of a hassle to get there. There is a fee for parking for guest which was a little added experience that we were unaware of only because it wasn't listed on the booking site we used.  It was $12 a day which is nothing compared to the $20 plus a day to use public parking. All and all was a great stay and will be back to Clearwater again

title: Excellent! Worth every penny!
review: How wonderful that you stayed with us on your honeymoon -- thank you for staying with us during this special time of your life.  We're glad you enjoyed your stay and the fabulous meals at Jimmy's.   We do try and keep our parking rates low for our guests, and we're sorry your booking site did not indicate there was a fee.  Please stay in touch with us on Facebook - there are so many things to do in and around Clearwater and we'd love to have you return again for more fun.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Great location, right on the water, stunning views of Gulf
review: Rooms are clean, beds are comfy, staff is friendly, and the bar is stocked!  Honestly I was truly impressed by this hotel.  The rooms are large and spacious.  The private balconies have a great view.  The pool is very well maintained and cleaned on a daily basis.  The Tiki bar has great service and awesome drinks.  Jimmy's Fishouse and coffee shop are also on site and great places for food.  Great hotel for family or couples.  My only complaint is that it is not located on the beach.  There is no sand.  Yes, there is water right out front and a great view of the gulf, but no sandy beach.  The beach is about half a mile down the road.  So if you are one that likes to walk right out onto the beach, this hotel is not for you.

title: Great place to stay!
review: We truly enjoyed our stay here. Staff was friendly/helpful. It is right on the water and the public beaches are within walking distance. There are jet ski rentals nearby. Tiki bar outside for drinks and the pool was great! Only wish they had more umbrellas to beat the heat outside. Love Clearwater and will be back again soon!

title: Great stay!
review: Traveled with a friend for a long weekend vacation. Room was clean. Staff was friendly! We didn't use the pool area because the beach was so close we just ended up walking down there every day. The jolly trolley stops right in front of the hotel. Coffee shop in the hotel was great. Couldn't have asked for anything else!

title: Consistently a great trip for us!
review: My wife and I have been going to this exact hotel for roughly 8 years and we are consistently happy with them.  We normally get a gulf front room and we've never had a problem with our reservation being honored (we go there roughly 1-2 times a year).  You may find that other folks might put you inn a different type of room, even if you have a reservation, but they don't mess around with you like that.  The pool is nice, big enough for the amount of folks that are there and although there is a good amount of lack of shade at most spots, it's got a general good vibe and positive feel to it.  Pool guys are nice and help ya out - they're also good folks to jaw with if you need a local tip on anything.  The Tiki bar at the bar is cool - it's nice to be able to get a drink a few steps…

title: Mother-daughter trip
review: I had read mixed reviews for this property, so was mildly nervous prior to traveling.  I myself have nothing bad to say about the property or the staff now that our trip is over.  We had such a great time and everyone was so friendly!  The staff went out of their way to say hello, or to help us out since we are new to the area.  The restaurant and tiki bar were so nice to have on site and the food and drinks were well priced.  The hotel interior could use some sprucing up, but we weren't concerned about that aspect. The fitness center is nice and I did use it daily.  Very quiet, clean and well kept.  This property does not set on a beach but is about a 5 minute walk to the beach.  We didn't mind, however the construction next door was a bit bothersome since the sidewalk was…

title: Great for families
review: We have stayed at this hotel the last few times we have gone to Clearwater. The last visit we opted for the family suite to give us a little extra room and to let the kids have their own beds. WOW what a surprise we got when we checked in. The room was huge and had 3 separate areas AND 2 full bathrooms. It is definitely worth a bit extra if you want more space and privacy. The pools are great - even a kiddie pool for those with little kiddos. Game room, Jimmy's restaurant usually has free kids meals if you are staying on property. View is fantastic. We spotted dolphins and stingrays everyday. Short stroll to the beach.

title: Fantastic
review: We only stayed for 1 night but wish it was longer upgraded room overlooking the sea lovely room and great pool. Would highly recommend Jimmy's restaurant on site as well..hopefully we will return soon.

title: Good Hotel
review: This is a good hotel in a nice area.  Yes it is not directly on the beach, but the beach is only a very short walk away (2 minutes).  We arrived at the hotel early and although our room was not ready they gave us a parking pass and allowed us access to the pool area.  We decided to go for a walk up the beach as it was a lovely day.  When we came back our room was ready and we were checked in by a less than friendly woman, the reason this stood out is all the other staff were very friendly.  Our room was a two queen bed suite with a gulf front view.  The room was nice and having the second bathroom was very helpful.  We ate breakfast in the hotel as our room rate included this.  The breakfast was very nice with a good selection.  We ate one evening meal in the restaurant and it…

title: Would have been excellent, but breakfast service let it down and aircon was a little noisy ... but othersiwise all good.
review: Stopped here for 2nights and we selected the option that included breakfast - normally it would be breakfast but it had a limit of $25 per room - we had 2 in our room so it covered it but just be aware if booking and you like a bog breakfast the voucher may not cover it. The carparking is extra, but only $12 per day for hotel guests which seems good value as others ranged from $20+ per day. The hotel has a lovely restaurant overlooking the sea, but the hotel itself if not beachfront .. the public beach is a very short 3-4 minute walk away. Room was faultless (we had a late deal so couldnt specify king or 2 doubles .. but we had a king on 4th floor .. a standard room) The aircon units must be outside each room and they can be noisy .. dont get me wrong you get used to it, but if…

title: Might stay again of parking charge changes
review: Thank you for staying with us and taking time to comment on your vacation.  We're so pleased that, after coming such a long way, you enjoyed your holiday, our property and resort amenities.  All guest comments are provided to team members for review, so we'll be sharing your concerns on the a/c.  Thank you.  We do hope that you will come back and see us - there is always something fun to do in Clearwater Beach at any time of year.  Kind regards,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: They could've kept me with a little Customer Service...
review: Stayed four nights. The room was clean and the pool was nice with a great view. The sunset was also pretty to see.  Jimmy's had good food but slow service. House keeping was kinda slow too. Got a decent price on the room but to charge everyday for parking is a bit overrated!!!!

title: Great holiday inn waterfront hotel
review: We enjoyed a much needed weekend break at this wonderful waterfront hotel. We are elite platinum members, and at the time of check in were upgraded to a gulf suite at no additional charge. We were also provided with a courtesy lake check out in appreciation of our elite status. We really appreciated the gesture, and it is unfortunate that such appreciation does not take place at other holiday inn hotels. The hotel and rooms were very clean, all the staff we met were very friendly,

title: Weird pool rules
review: Thank you so much for taking time to write about your stay here.   We appreciate your kind words and the knowledge that your stay was pleasant and comfortable.  You are correct, our gulf suites are beautiful - those views of the sunset are pretty spectacular!  Hopefully if you return again, you'll stay with us.  There are so many reasons to visit Clearwater Beach!  Kind regards,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Hotel Drivers
review: Hotel rooms are dated and need upgrade.  Pool and Bar have great views, however....... No personal beverages are allowed, which I will forgive but the have a rule of no beverages in the pool.   I have never been in a resort area that has this rule.  In fact most places have pool bars.    When it is 94 degrees out I would like to be in the pool and sipping a beverage.  They have a little gestapo dude (name is Cody) in a Gilligans hat who chases grown men out of the pool that have drinks. That at least is valid entertainment.   Will not come back for this reason.

title: Great Location, Rare Appreciation for Elite Platinum, Hidden Gem
review: Thank you for sharing feedback on your recent stay with us.    We're sorry you felt that our pool rules were not what you expected but we have to follow the guidelines provided to us for guest safety, and no beverages in the pool is one of them.    Hopefully you enjoyed your stay overall at Clearwater Beach and we thank you for your visit.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Great Location - highly recommend!
review: Ive been coming to my dental courses for over a year and always great service Dave  one of many great drivers is always ready to help with your bags or take you to your destination he runs on time!  Enthusiastic and happy to work! On our way to airport always he cares and helps in any way he can thank you for having such a great employee :)

title: Great hotel in great resort
review: Stayed here end of April for 5 nights. This is a great hotel. Room was a gulf view king. It was spotlessly clean. Good pool and plenty of sunbeds. The onsite bar and restaurant (jimmys fish house and iguana bar) is brilliant. Highly recommend.

title: Fabulous as usual!!!!!
review: Thank you!  What a lovely review you wrote following your stay with us.  We're so glad you two chose us for your beach holiday and enjoyed the pool, restaurant, views and location.  We'd love to see you return and hope you'll stay in touch with us on our Facebook page.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Gulfview Two Rooms for One
review: My wife and I recently returned from a stay at Holiday Inn and Suites, Clearwater Beach.  Our stay which was our fourth stay at the hotel was fabulous as usual.  From check in to check out the staff has it down.  This visit included a gulf front room which was the highlight of our trip.  We spent many hours on our balcony overlooking the intercoastal waterway and gulf relaxing and taking in the views as well as listening to the entertainment from Jimmy's below.  Our room was #414 and we were not disappointed.  From our balcony my wife was able to see dolphin pods swim by on two separate days which was pretty neat.  The accommodations are perfect with close access to he beach and many wonderful bars and or restaurants nearby.  Previous reviews have stated that it is not right on…

title: Don't visit here if you love the beach!
review: Thank you!  We love our repeat visitors and we're honored you've stayed with us four times now!  You're right - the balcony views are just superb - and very relaxing.  Some guests say they don't want to leave!  We're glad the dolphins cooperated, and of course you caught some of our brilliant sunsets.  Yes, it is easy to get around from our central location, especially when the trolley comes right by our door!  We're delighted you plan to return again.  Please feel free to stay in touch on our Facebook page for news, events and reasons to come back!  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Second visit, second good trip
review: We received the best Customer Service with the staff, loved our two rooms facing the Bay and Gulf, and enjoyed food at Jimmy's with great sunset viewing. To our surprise there were dolphins and manatees that visited. Beautiful pool and family orientated. Everything is in walking distance and the weather was perfect. We returned home on May 1st. Flying in to PIE airport was wonderful. Will never fly in to Tampa again. This is the way it should be done. We waked to the Pier 60 and enjoyed the public beach on the Gulf. My suggestion is if you want to do the sites around, there is a lot to do! We found it so very nice to relax.

title: Not a place to stay if you are over 20
review: This is not the place to stay if you want a comfortable room. The mattress needs to be replace and the painting in the room is Horrible. No hot water . Pay for parking and for a guest to meet you at the hotel. Also the elevator is in deplorable condition .. Dirty and all the tile is broken and warning sticker on the floor.. No beach view only a Wall. Save your money and time and stay at a decent place.. Noise  is unbearable with kids running the halls and lobby all night.

title: Great views
review: Thank you for taking time to write your opinion following your stay with us.  We strive for customer satisfaction, so we were disappointed you felt you didn't have the experience you expected.  As for your comments about "over 20", we have many, many families who stay with us, and you can see by other reviews, they find us a great choice for beach fun.  Guest comments are reviewed with appropriate management and department heads since we do want every guest's stay to be memorable.  Thank you for your opinion and best regards,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Excellent value.
review: Stayed 3 nights from  26th April 2015.  Had a Gulf front room in the main reception block.  In this part of the hotel, there are just 4 Gulf front rooms.  We were disappointed at the small size of our room(414) especially as many reviews speak of the rooms as being large.  On inspecting the hotel plan on the door, it was clear that this room was considerably smaller than the other 3 Gulf front rooms.  This was confirmed by taking a peek in the other rooms while they were being serviced.  Also it was much smaller than the rooms along the sides of this block, although several of these were suites.  Having said this, the room had everything we needed and the view from the balcony was great.  The restaurant was serving a buffet breakfast during our stay.  This was satisfactory…

title: First Vacation to Florida!
review: We love our U.K. guests!  Thanks for taking time to write about your stay with us.  We're pleased that you two overall had a great stay here on Clearwater Beach and are enjoyed your Florida holiday.  We value guest comments and feedback and do share it with appropriate management here at the resort, so thank you for mentioning the toast issue, which we will share with Jimmy's team.  As for the room size, many factors come into play including availability at the time you booked and whether you may have booked through a 3rd party that has contracted for a certain room type.    If you do return to Florida, you can always contact us directly ahead of time to see what size room and view you have.    Enjoy your summer and we hope you'll return again.  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Great stay in a great location
review: We booked off Hotwire so we didn't know what we would get. We got a room with a view of the cove. We saw dolphins from our patio.  We could also see all the boats go out from the marina.   Room had fridge, microwave, and dishes. Employees were all friendly. There was always iced citrus infused water in the lobby. We arrived late afternoon. We asked if we could check in early and within 2 minutes we were checked in.   Our room was also right above the restaurant so we got to hear the live music right in our room. Typically this would bother me but the music was good and if we didn't want to listen then we shut the patio door and turned on the tv.    The hotel is slightly off of the beach which we loved since we are mid 30s now. It is a few blocks walk to the beach. Or hop on the…

title: Not a four star let alone a five star.
review: The staff is great especially Robert and Tim at the front desk.  The hotel is worn and tired the air vents on the first floor are gross checkout the one right behind the front desk.  The good news is, I checked the room A/C's and they have been changed.  The furniture is out of date and needs to be updated and the overall general maintenance is weak at best.  However, the rooms are clean and they do a good job of maintaining the pool.

title: False promises and lies
review: Thanks so much for taking time to give us feedback on your stay.  Please know that all guest comments are shared with management and appropriate department heads so we can continue to improve the customer experience.  We'll pass along your compliments to Tim and Robert.  We're fortunate that all our staff want each and every guest to enjoy their stays.  We'd love to have you return when you need another beach getaway!  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Well worth it.
review: Expensive for the quality. We had two rooms, and we're assured all rooms had balconies. We booked with the promise of balcony with ocean view,, and that parking was plentiful. Well, we got no view, no balcony, and had to pay $20 per day to park. The restaurant was terrible ,compared to others we tried. Go somewhere else.

title: Awesome views!
review: Dear DanielP:  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with our resort during your visit last month.  We are disappointed to hear that you felt misled regarding your accommodations, and for that we apologize.   We will be sure to review your comments with our team to enhance our services we provide to our guest.  Feedback whether positive or negative is important to our overall success.    Again thank you for sharing your experience with us.    Best Regards,   Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Visit to meet Winter at the Clearwater Marine Aquarium
review: We Will definitely return to this place amazing balcony view comfortable rooms great staff an awesome pool deck area overlooking the inlet. Location is within walking distance of everything you need in fact the entire island can be walked if you were a walker

title: Beautiful Hotel, Beautiful Gulf View
review: I was there for a girls weekend.  This is really the perfect hotel for any kind of stay.  There are things for adults and kids.  The pool is beautiful and it overlooks the Gulf.  There is a snack/drink bar where you can get pizza and other lunch items.  Great pizza by the way! Also there is a bar restaurant with indoor and outdoor seating.  A lot of times there is entertainment as well.  I really cant say one bad thing about this place except that I didn't get to stay long enough.  There is a coffee/ice cream shop in the lobby and if you venture out, lots of things within walking distance.  Stick around for the sunset and get a picture.  So beautiful off of the pool deck.  The staff there was excellent from check in to check out.  Tim was excellent and very informative at the…

title: AMAZING view!
review: Thanks so much for taking time to tell us about your girls weekend -- how fun!  We're so glad you all had a great time exploring the area, hanging out at Jimmy's pool deck, sunset viewing and enjoying great times together.  Clearwater Beach always has something new and exciting going on, so we hope you all will come back again for more memories.  Stay in touch with us on Facebook for deals and events to entice you!  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Excellent service, great location
review: We stayed at this hotel in May 2014. The second we saw the room I knew I made the right choice!  The view was absolutely amazing!  We had a gulf front room. We were only on the 3rd floor, but I think it was the best of both worlds because we could see dolphins swim right by, and sf night, could watch the live music right from the balcony.  We slept with the door to the balcony open and listened to the ocean. The entertainment was great, a floribean spin on most songs. The pool was great (a little colder than we would have liked - the ocean was warmer). The small tiki bar was a great spot to be, and the bartender was very friendly & creative. The sunning area was perfect...right on the gulf. You can watch all the tourist boats (pirate ship, little toot, etc) pass back & forth. …

title: No Frills.
review: How nice of you to write such a nice review of our resort - thank you!   We're so pleased we met and exceeded your expectations and you had a nice couple getaway here on Clearwater Beach.  We agree - the views of the gulf are spectacular and enjoying the beautiful sea air, plus watching the dolphins, make things so special.     Jimmy's will be glad to know you had fun atmosphere and especially our friend George!  We're delighted you plan to come back this year!  Please do stay in touch on our Facebook page for deals, events and enticements!  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Clearwater vacation
review: we spent two nights at this hotel. Staff is friendly and accommodating. Rooms are comfortable. The location of the hotel is excellent (very close to the beach). They have a nice swimming pool area that kids love (it changes colors at night). Will definitely come back!

title: First stay at Clearwater!!
review: This was our first stay in Clearwater beach and it most likely won't be the last. The hotel room, staff and appearance were great. We had the gulf view over the restruant which had great sunsets everynite.  Overall we had a great visit. Although there were some downfalls to the location, beach entrance wasn't as close as expected, parking fee for hotel guest that are already paying good money to stay and not being able to bring your own drinks poolside (money racket) I woukd recommend this hotel to anyone and woukd stay here again.

title: Exactly what we needed
review: Thank you for letting us know how much you enjoyed your first stay in Clearwater.  We're honored you chose our resort and are so glad we met - and exceeded your expectations.  Yes, we are not on the beach, but we are only 500 feet away from it and we do offer the trolley service.  Our views of the Gulf, as you saw, are spectacular though - and oh, those sunsets!  Parking is at a premium on Clearwater Beach so most resorts do have a parking fee.  We keep it as nominal as possible.  And yes, we do restrict what you can bring into the pool area for drinks; sorry that disappointed you.  Again, most resorts do.  We do hope you'll be coming back to stay with us again.  There is always something fun going on in Clearwater!  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: very comfortable  but water front is not the ocean beach
review: Came here for Spring Break.  My two girls loved the pool and views of dolphins and rays in the inlet area.  Reasonably priced compared to some of the other hotels since it was nota true beachfront hotel, but it fit our needs.  The rooms were updated and clean.  The staff very friendly.  Kids eating free at Jimmy's in the hotel made breakfast very convenient.  There is a small beach portion adjacent to the hotel which was enough for our kids most of the time, but if you want full beach access you can walk there in a mater of minutes without issue.  The service was prompt and courteous.  If you set your expectations right that this is a mid-grade hotel I think you'll be pleasantly surprised.  I still haven't figured out why I have to pay for parking as a hotel guest, but that…

title: Decent option too far from the center of town.
review: Thank you!  We're so glad you and your family chose to stay with us during your spring break holiday, and we're so pleased your little girls enjoyed the resort, the pool, and our friendly offshore dolphins.  Hopefully you caught a sunset or two as well!  You're right.  Our families find that the Holiday Inn Kids Eat Free program is a great dollar-stretcher, and our kid-guests love Jimmy's menu!    Re: Parking - most resorts are forced to charge for parking because space is at a premium here on the beach.  We try to keep it as affordable as possible however.  Glad you got to visit Clearwater Marine Aquarium.  We hope your girls loved Winter and Hope as much as we do!  Please come visit us again - we'd love to have you make more memories with us.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Excellent Hotel
review: we liked everything especially Tim who was great  we were disappointed about the ocean front not having a beach area and we did not like to pay for parking when we are staying at this hotel  we enjoyed our stay with comfort in the rooms and we thought being on the 8th floor would be hard but the elevator worked great...We ate at their resturant and it was wonderful and the food was great...They had live music and the pool was wonderful...The water was so nice...What was nice to is a IHop down the street and the ocean too Nice pick up with the tralley by the Hotel.
