Speaking of Clearwater Beach...did you know that USA Today reader poll just awarded us #1 Place to Watch a Sunset?  Hope you can come back soon.  And...we invite you to stay in touch with us on our Facebook page.  Kind regards,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: 5 star friendliness and service
review: We took 7 people with us on our vacation to Clearwater Beach and this hotel is absolutely amazing! The customer service is very accommodating, always smiling and ready to help at any time! The views are just stunning from whatever room you are in. We had 3 different view of the water from our hotel room. The pool is clean to a whole new level of clean and also a superior view! Would recommend this hotel to anyone going there. We ourselves will be back extremely soon...this time with no kids! Thank you for a great place to stay and enjoy!

title: Ariel...pool attendant
review: How nice of you to write such a nice review following your stay with us....thank you!  We're so pleased you enjoyed your visit - we want everyone to have a great experience and it sounds like you had fun with your group of people.  With our central location and resort amenities, there's always something to keep you busy.  Did you know that Clearwater Beach was just awarded #1 Best Place to Watch a Sunset?  We're pretty pleased about that!  Hopefully you can return - with the group or just yourselves - and we invite you to stay in touch with us on Facebook for lots of ideas and photos.  Kind regards,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Had a date night
review: We stayed here for a getaway weekend. You don't need to go anywhere else. Restaurant, Tiki bar, coffee shop, swimming in the pool or beach area, waverunners to rent, everything is here!  Great sunset view from Jimmy's waterside dining area, and the balcony of our room. From our check-in with Tim, a helpful and friendly desk clerk, to our lunch at Jimmy's before we left, with Mark, our fantastic server. We felt pampered and carefree, just what we needed. The room was roomy and clean. Loved it, we will be back!

title: Business and Pleasure stay August 2013
review: This hotel is right on the gulf but with no beach area. We were aware of this prior to our trip though. We had a one bedroom suite which had 2 rooms...one with 2 double beds and the other with a small kitchen area, pull out couch and table and chairs. Perfect for a small family although the pull out couch was anything but comfortable and looked like it was in need of replacement. There were days where we had no linen service all day and they would come at 5pm while we were getting ready for dinner. Told them to come back and they never did. Staff as a whole was not very friendly at all. You could walk by them 100 times in the lobby or the halls and you never got a hello out of anybody that worked there. Wake up call didnt work and didnt find out that it doesnt until the next…

title: Great Vacation Spot
review: Thank you for taking time to review your recent stay with us.  We appreciate your candor and please know that your comments on the bedding, service and friendliness of staff will be addressed in an upcoming management meeting.  We were pleased to see that you did enjoy the location, pool, Jimmy's and area surroundings - including those amazing sunsets!  Best regards  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Bad experience, Return trip a big disappointment.
review: Picked this hotel based on reviews seen here, was not disappointed.  Only had 1 day scheduled but we decided to stay another day.  Hotel is very modern and clean, first night had a gulf view which was beautiful, second night the city view which was good. Had friendly service from the staff we encountered.  Ate 4 different meals at Jimmy's - service was inconsistent. Breakfast the second day took half an hour to get our coffee and longer for food! Food was good but if you decide to get mixed drinks at the bar try going somewhere else, so watered down it was nasty. Kids loved the pool.  Will stay here again if we visit in the future.  (Best things we did was go on the Little Toot for dolphin watching and Columbia restaurant for dinner - the best!)

title: Nice hotel close to the beach
review: After our stay last year we knew we needed to stay here again.  Unfortunate for us the stay was not like the one the year before.  During check in the front desk manager was rude and unhelpful.  I took this as someone just having a bad day and brushed it off. So we went to our room and checked it out.  I will have to say the housekeeping staff needs a big thumbs up.  Our room was VERY clean. The pool was very cloudy and the wait staff would rather work on their tan then ask if you need anything. The guy collecting the towels seemed very upset and was cussing about something. All in all the staff seemed very unhappy and that seemed to show, and that I blame on management. I don't think we will stay there next year. Very disappointing

title: The best in Clearwater......
review: Dear Jason F,  Thank you for taking the time to express your thoughts and concerns. I am very happy that you noticed the cleanliness of your room and you were satisfied with the housekeeping services' performance. On the other hand, I certainly apologize for the inconveniences you experienced over the rest of the staff's unacceptable attitude. Kindly be assured that your comments are being shared with the hotel management and appropriate action will be taken. Despite your disappointment I do hope you will return to stay with us again at some future date when you can be assured of our very best attention.  Sincerely,  Karen G.  Case Manager IHGCare

title: Great Staff - Beautiful Beach - Awesome Location
review: I don't often write reviews but feel this hotel and their staff deserve it.  We live local so we hit restaurants up and down the beaches from Sarasota to Palm Harbor.  In particular, Julie from the wait staff always treats us like family, the beaches in and around the hotel are beautiful, and the sunsets from this place are incredible  We highly recommend it for breakfast, lunch or dinner.  And of course overnight is great.  We'll be back for sure!

title: Happily Surprised by This Choice as Our Busch Gardens Package
review: Thank you so much for your great review following your recent stay with us.  We're so pleased you enjoyed your stay, including our comfortable rooms and pool.  And, we will let our staff know that you were pleased with their friendliness.  That is so important to us!  Enjoy the rest of your summer and come back to visit soon!  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Great Location - Everything you need
review: We stayed here one night to get the Length of Stay Busch Gardens & Adventure Island Package (which is actually good for 14 days of visits).  I have to say, this H.I. FAR exceeded our expectations in every way for our family trip---EXCEPT, that the front desk staff members were rude according to my husband.  I was surprised and even WOWED by our rooms and the setting!  Usually pictures look better than the actual hotel, but not in this case.  I was stunned by this hotel's quality (room amenities and décor spotless, comfy, VERY roomy and the kitchenette came in very handy).  LOVED the pool (cool lights at night) and bay views and the nightly entertainment; I only wished they could've played longer into the night (we had to walk down the beach on the bay side to see more…

title: GREAT LOCATION - GREAT HOTEL
review: How nice of you to take time to write a review of your recent stay with us.  So glad you were able to take advantage of the Busch Gardens package and enjoy that fabulous theme park in addition to a short beach getaway.  Glad you were "wowed" by the quality of our resort and it's amenities (including the free sunsets!)  Please know that your comments on our staff's friendliness will be addressed at an upcoming management meeting.  Customer satisfaction is very important to us!  We'd love to have you stay in touch on our Facebook page - and look forward to the next time when you can hopefully stay longer!  Best regards,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Not worth the Money
review: Stayed here for a couple days and really enjoyed it.  May have been a little overpriced but I would go back.  Pool was great - If you have little ones, the big pool started at 4ft!  Tiki Bar was nice.  I didn't eat at the on site Restaurant but the view at sunset was great and I made sure I was there for Sunset every night for the "Sunset Shot".  Not the place to go if you want beach access but if you like sitting at the pool looking at the bay/ocean water you will be in your happy place

title: stay away from this place
review: I have never posted on these sites before but I just had to after the horrible experience my family had on vacation.The hotel staff so unfriendly at the front desk. Maybe they should take lessons from the maids. They were the only nice people we met during our stay. The pool was ok...nothing to brag about and the restaurant jimmys fish house was the worst of all.The staff really could care less if they wait on you. The food was almost not worth eating. Managers standing around doing nothing. No wonder why the servers do not do anything.  I never thought breakfast could be the worst point of our day till we ate at jimmys fish house.I would not recommend this place to anyone !

title: Business
review: Dear sandy g,   Thank you for sharing your experience with us. We appreciate you taking the time to help us improve our guest services.  Please accept our sincerest apologies for the dissatisfaction and inconvenience our level of service has caused you. This is definitely not up to our standards and we deeply regret the negative experience you had and the negative impressions you may have had.   Your comments are very important as we rely on you, our guest, to tell us how we are doing and how we can better meet your needs. rest assured that your comments will be looked into. We hope you give us a chance to change your perception of our hotel.   Sincerely,   Dhan M Case Manager  IHGCare

title: Nice stay at good beach
review: The room was excellent large and clean. The hotel honored upgrade due to Platinum status. Housekeeping did a great job. Location great and restaurant had the best food. The staff friendly and helpful. Would defiantly stay here again.

title: Perfect!
review: Planned a last minute trip to Clearwater beach with family.  Hotel is literally one block away from main beach.  Walking distance to beach, marina, restaurants, stores, convience store. Hotel is nice and the check in staff were very friendly and knew I was a priority member.  The room was a standard double with a small kitchenette.  Fridge, sink, microwave and some dishes and utensils which all came in handy.  The room was slightly cramped but fine for us on this trip since we spent little time in it.  Some downside items, view was of the hotel next door, no balcony and the walls where dirty. Also, kind of weird thing is some rooms have a letter with them. (i.e. 200 and 200a) so when we called front desk for something to be delivered to room they went to the one next door which…

title: Nice hotel walking distance to beach with nice on site restaurant!
review: My boyfriend and I spent a long weekend here for our 4 year anniversary and we loved it! Very clean and nice. The location was perfect- close to restaurants, bars, and shops... The bar downstairs was convenient... but most of all, we loved the friendliness, cleanliness, and efficiency of the hotel and room. If I had to complain about anything, it would be the amount of noise I heard through the door in the hallway during the day and how fast the elevator was (nausea). Overall, we are happy with this pick and will definitely come back.

title: Beautiful hotel and amazing view!
review: We spent 2 nights in this fantastic hotel. The view was absolutely spectacular! Clean, neat hotel! Even the pool area was carefully maintained by a hard working man who seemed dedicated to keeping it well-organized and clean. Extra comfortable beds and pillows were labeled as soft or firm. They granted us a late check out, which was appreciated. The hotel was close to the beach, and it had a friendly staff- Especially the lady in the coffee shop. We'd like to return to the 5th floor suite again next summer! Our only complaint was the $12 plus tax parking fee PER DAY. That would add up quickly for a family who stays a whole week. Overall, this hotel is a very desirable place to vacation.

title: watch out for palmettos
review: How nice of you to take time to review your recent stay with us!  So glad you had two nights for a quick getaway and could enjoy the great view, our pool, friendly staff and location.  We're sorry if you were disappointed in the parking charges.  Space is very limited on the beach and many places do charge.  We try to keep it as low as possible.  Please know your comments will be evaluated and were most welcomed.  Sure hope you can find time to visit us again - love to have you!  Enjoy your summer.  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Great place, But......
review: We genrally enjoyed this hotel and especially liked the pool and sunsets. The staff are genrally very pleasant. But beware--our room was over-run by giant palmettos! I would definitely try the Hyatt next time.

title: One of my favorite Hotels in Clearwater
review: Thank you for taking  time to review your recent stay with us!  So glad you enjoyed some of our beautiful sunsets, the pool, and our friendly staff.  We're sorry about the situation with the palmetto bugs.  Being a beach resort, it is so easy for them to attach to towels and things brought from outdoors.  Staff tries hard to keep them under control.  Do hope you called this to our attention immediately so we could spray the room.  Thank you again and know we appreciate your feedback.   Enjoy your summer.  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Best beach in central Florida.
review: Our recent stay was July 11, 2013 to July 14, 2013. The hotel was located just in the right spot... Loved the views and how clean the rooms and grounds were. Jimmy's was a wonderful place to eat great food and great value. The wait staff was helpful and friendly. One problem with a bartender that was addressed with a manager was one of the two problems we had. The second being was the deposit that we had to leave. While I have no issues leaving a deposit it was the way it was handles that bothered me. I was never told upon booking that a deposit was needed. No where on my confirmation email was there a mention of a deposit. Also when I spoke to the front desk about it they said one thing am then another. I think for the future it should be mentioned when booking. With that said…

title: Great weekend escape!
review: We had a blast here during the 4th of July weekend! Booked through Priceline and got a decent price for Friday and Saturday night (for a holiday weekend). We got there and they had put us in a room with just a King size bed which was not going to work for two couples! The first lady I talked to wasn't very helpful (She was trying to upgrade me to a room on the water with two queen beds for an extra $60/night when we had already called to make sure the room had two beds in it) but the next guy that we talked to upgraded us to a suite for $25 a night which was perfect! It was basically two adjoining rooms. One was a standard room with two beds (which the first lady told me they didn't have) and the other room had a full kitchen, living room and dining area.  The hotel is right…

title: Great stay in suite with the family
review: How nice of you to take time to write a review of your recent getaway from Orlando.  Isn't it easy to have a short beach vacation?   So glad you loved the facility and were able to watch dolphins play, had great times at Jimmy's (we'll be sure and let John know!) and loved the upgraded suite you were able to get.  Sure hope you'll be able to return!   Please stay up with us on our Facebook page, and do enjoy a nice summer.  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Over rated and over priced
review: This was a great hotel on the strip of clearwater.  We come to clearwater every year.  This was our first in a hotel rather than a beach house as we were heading out to a cruise out of tampa.  The nightlife was great with bands at night.  During the day the pool was amazing and the sun deck was perfect for overlooking the beautiful waters of the gulf.  There is no "beach" at this hotel as you need to walk a little to get to it but it did not bother us.  We still got in off the tanning deck and snorkled then rented the jet skiis.  Overall, very relaxing and great experience with the family.

title: Very Surprized!!!!
review: How nice of you to take time to write a review of your recent stay.  So glad you were able to visit from Virginia and enjoy our beautiful beach, pool, deck and activities such as snorkeling and jet skiis prior to your cruise.  (Hope you had fun on that as well!)  Sure hope you can return again - there's always something fun happening in Clearwater! Please stay up with us on our Facebook page, and do enjoy a nice summer.  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Great Beach Experience
review: The service was terrible from the guy at the front desk to the pool towel attendant neither of whom could be bothered to offer any service. Working in the industry myself it is not difficult to make eye contact and smile! The corridor to the room was always dirty and the room itself clean but well over priced for what it is. The photos of the hotel and pool area are all totally different to what they look like, although I imagine the sunsets are great, just had a lot of cloud when we we there. I have also never been to a hotel that charges $150 a night (again well over priced for the location no access to the beach!!!) and then in addition has the audacity to also charge for the parking at $12 per night, unless you were only parking for a few hours as a friend did in which case…

title: Location, location, location
review: We stayed here for one night on a visit from Orlando. It was a little frustrating that we requested an early check in (1pm instead of 4pm) but they couldn't make our room available even half an hour early. It would have been really appreciated. Anyway, it's not the most luxurious hotel but it has everything you need. Large bed, tv, fridge, balcony. The views are gorgeous, as is the pool area and bar. The restaurant is fab as is the location - it is a few steps to the beach and a short walk to the pier to watch the sun set.

title: Great Family Vacation
review: Thank you so much for your kind review following your recent stay here.   We love our UK visitors and were glad you could make a two-center holiday with us and Orlando.  Apologies that we were unable to get you into your room earlier than posted check-in.  We do make every effort to accommodate our guests but if a guest doesn't check out early, that puts us at a disadvantage to get rooms cleaned early.  Glad you enjoyed the room, the pool, Jimmy's and pool bar, and our central location. Thank you so much for reviewing your recent stay with us.  Follow us on Facebook - we'd love to stay in touch!  Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Clearwater Beach.  Kind regards,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: 3rd hotel vacation 2013
review: Just returned from a week vacation. We were very pleased with the hotel and my daughter whom is 2 looked for to the towel animals everyday by housekeeping.  Front desk help, ladies in the gift shop and all the housekeeping staff very friendly.  The only downside of this facility is the restaurant and tiki bar. Do not waste your time.  This restaurant is a "Sysco" restaurant.  Everything is frozen or already prepared.  The drinks are nothing exciting and the tiki bar staff is not very friendly.  Jimmy's needs some help. The left hand does not know what the right hand is doing and what makes the restaurant enjoyable is the music and sunset.  I gave this property a 4 based on the hotel, location, and we had a great time and made good memories.  But I highly recommend eating and…

title: $200 for Nothing Special
review: Thank you so much for reviewing your recent stay with us.  You had a long ways to come from Iowa!  We're so glad you made good memories here and enjoyed the resort itself.   Please know we do take heed to customer comments and will be sharing them with Jimmy's management.  We're sorry the restaurant and service did not meet your expectations.  Thanks so much for comments on our staff - they really try hard to make your stay memorable - and we're glad your 2-yr-old love the animal towels!  We hope you'll have a great summer  and can come visit us again soon.  Follow us on Facebook - we'd love to stay in touch!  Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Clearwater Beach.  Kind regards,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Blown Away
review: hi its me robert curtis im 9 years old and i really loved this hotel on both sides of my family and my room amazing ocean veiws plus jimmys fish house and iguana bar was amiazing and had a butiful ocean veiw and you can see ships and animals and sometimes a bird named gorege flys in and eats food our room had three beds and one bathroom had a jacuzzi tub we wereon the 5th floor i love that hotel i would go back if i had enogh money goodbye robert curtis

title: Great value
review: For the money this place is great.  You can stay at other places for way more money that are not as nice.  It's not on the beach but it is a super short walk from the beach and the boardwalk.  The suites are great.  I will definitely bring my family here again.  This place is way better than the Hilton located on the same beach.

title: Another great family vacation
review: We were here over Mother's Day weekend and, as always, enjoyed the property.  The hotel staff overall are super helpful.  That said, the weekend was VERY busy, and appeared to be more so than management had anticipated.  Bar staff by the pool were surly at best.  The hotel restaurant was overcrowded, understaffed, and they did not turn the air conditioning on so it was HOT.  If you are there when the hotel is busy, I strongly recommend you go elsewhere to eat.  Free meals for the kids simply isn't worth it when the kids are hot and tired and you can't get waited on.

title: Great hotel
review: Thank you for taking time to review your recent stay with us.     We see a lot of Orlando families come over for short getaways.  We appreciate your comments.  All are reviewed at staff meetings because we constantly try to provide every guest a wonderful vacation.  Yes, Memorial Day is a busy time and we're sorry if  found the service not as prompt as it might have been.  Again, that will be passed along to Jimmy's management.  Overall, we're happy you enjoyed your stay, our resort amenities, great location and the beautiful Clearwater Beach.    We'd love to see you come back again when you can!  Best regards,  Christine Bottger Holiday Inn Resort and Suites, Clearwater Beach

title: Good value.
review: We checked in to this hotel after having a bad experience the previous night at another hotel.  Switching saved our vacation.  The staff were nice, especially the lady at the gift shop who told us some places we should visit.  The pool area was nice, and our room was wonderful.  We had an amazing view of the gulf from the 7th floor.

title: Great place to stay 1 block from the sand ( directly on the ocean, but it's the end of the bay) very close.
review: Thanks so much for visiting us all the way from Iowa!   So nice of you to take time to review us.   We're happy you were able to enjoy your beach holiday and were able to catch the views from your 7th floor room.   Glad you liked the pool and other resort amenities as well.   We'd love to have you return whenever you can.  In the meantime, please stay in touch with us on our Facebook page, Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Clearwater Beach.  Have a great summer!  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Held conference at this hotel
review: The hotel staff was very willing to work with our small conference held at this hotel.  They met our requirements and we had excellent service.   The hotel is located at great location!  Although not on the beach, it was a very short walk.   Also it was walking distance to several great restaurants!  Rooms were neat and clean.   The restaurant at the hotel was decent.   The pool bar was also great.    The catering staff was also excellent and the service was wonderful!

title: Ocean View, but combersome to get to it.
review: Thanks so much for visiting us.   So nice of you to take time to review us.  We're pleased you attended a conference here - many of our leisure guests start because they attended meetings here.  Glad you enjoyed a bit of time at  the pool, pool bar and other resort amenities as well.   We'd love to have you return whenever you can.  In the meantime, please stay in touch with us on our Facebook page, Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Clearwater Beach.  Have a great summer!  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Anniversary celebration
review: The ocean view is great, but you really have to walk quite a ways to get to the beach itself.  And then there is not much beach there.  Very rocky, so take water shoes.  Lots of seashells and sanddollars to be found though.  Pool area is nice.  Agree with the comments about the restaurant being humid because it is outdoors.   Also with it being open, there are lots of birds.  But, the live entertainment at the restaurant was nice.

title: Good
review: Thanks so much for visiting us all the way from Kansas.   So nice of you to take time to review us.    Glad you liked the  resort amenities  including pool, live entertainment...and great views as well.   We'd love to have you return whenever you can.  In the meantime, please stay in touch with us on our Facebook page, Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Clearwater Beach.  Have a great summer!  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Nice rooms
review: We decided to take a few days away to celebrate our anniversay. We stayed in a gulf view room which had a beautiful view of the water and over the pool area. The room was very nice, clean, end unit so it was very quiet, a good working air conditioner, comfortable king sized bed and pillows. We walked a few blocks to the beach where the sand is beautiful and the water is warm. Clearwater beach is such a nice, clean beach. We also used the pool at the hotel which is a well kept, clean area, warm, large pool. There is a tiki bar if you want cocktails. Later we went out closer to the gulf, just outside the pool area where they have additional lounge chairs and watched the sunset, it was quite nice. The next morrning we sat at the same area and had coffee while listening to the…

title: Best in Clearwater
review: 2nd time in Clearwater, but 1st at Holiday Inn. Much preferred this over the Hilton by the Pier. Certainly worth being a bit further away from the Pier (although a pleasant walk along the front) for the quality of the Gulf View rooms. we were blown away when we saw the views from the 5th floor, but if you want to see the sunset from your balcony you will probably need to be in Tower 1. Staff very helpful and pool decking right down the front was a lovely place to sit to admire the sunset and take in a drink. Would definitely return here when we go back to Clearwater. Our 1st 2 nights were in a city view room, due to no Gulf rooms being available as it was Memorial holiday weekend, but we upgraded for our last 2 nights, and were so glad we did. Did not eat at the hotel or use the…

title: Nice hotel, unprepared staff
review: This was the second time we stayed at the Holiday Inn in Clearwater. The hotel is nice and it is the only hotel (that we could find) on the beach that had suites.  It's clean, the restaurant is good (though a touch pricey) and the view is perfect right on the water and it's an easy 5 minute walk to the beach.    My only issue is that the fire department was there when we were checking in due to a minor incident that we were told was found and resolved, but then there was a fire alarm in the middle of the night. I had to take my toddler and 4 month old out in the cold (thankfully we had grabbed car keys so we could sit in the car). Despite them not actually resolving the issue earlier, these things happen. But when it was time to go back in we couldn't find stairwells to get back…

title: Great Views!
review: Thank you for taking time to review your May stay with us.     We're pleased you chose us to stay with, coming down for your vacation from Jacksonville, and glad to know that you did enjoy our resort and friendly staff.  Please know we do seriously review guest comments and those about your service and meal at Jimmy's have been sent to management.    Having lived in Clearwater, it's nice you were able to enjoy some of our famous sunsets again.  There are lots of reasons to come back, and we hope you'll try us again.  Best regards,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Lovely hotel but noisy
review: Great view - gulf view room allows viewing of the watercraft going to and from the harbor/private boat slips.  There is no sand beach in front of the hotel, only the channel entering the gulf.  Great location to view sunsets.  Staff is helpful and friendly. Restaurants are within walking distance.  We stay at this particular hotel everytime we visit Clearwater Beach.  Also, please note that we try to plan our stays for only weekdays.  The crowds on Clearwater Beach (and at the hotel) are heavy on the weekends and holidays.

title: this is the place to stay stay
review: Thank you for your recent review of your May stay.  We're so pleased you enjoyed your stay and loved the wonderful views and our spectacular sunsets!   You are right, weekdays are a little less busy, so that was great you could come during that time.  Hopefully we'll see you back here in the future.  There's lots of reasons to return!  Enjoy your summer,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: very nice great location
review: Hotel is conveniently located at the south end of Clearwater Beach.  Attractions available at the marina, the public beach and most restaurants are within convenient walking distance (15-20 minutes).  Hotel's pool is very nice and has a great view.  Hotel's restaurant and bar are good, and hotel has other amenities (coffee shop, salon, game room, gift shop.  Doesn't offer complimentary breakfast. Suite was made by combining attaching rooms (one with double beds, one with sofabed, mini-kitchen, bathroom in each).  Only issue was in trying to get a late checkout.

title: Nice but expected more
review: Thank you for your recent review of your May stay.  We're so pleased you enjoyed your stay.   We're so pleased that overall you found our resort to your liking, especially our suite accommodations.  We try hard to make every customer's stay a memorable one.  Sorry you had issues with the check-out.  We will be addressing this situation to avoid further guest displeasure.  Hopefully we'll see you back here in the future.  There's lots of reasons to return!   Stay in touch with us on our Facebook page:  Holiday Inn Resort & Suites Clearwater Beach.  Enjoy your summer,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: three really is a charm!!
review: We stayed here in February.  Hotel is very plain and simple.  You have to pay to park!  We used our reward nights so that made up for simplicity.  Did not stay oceanfront because they wanted $75 more per night on top of our rewards.  What a reward!  Staff was very friendly and room was clean.  Pool area was nice and overlooked the ocean.  Very relaxing to watch boats go by.  Restaurant in hotel was good.  Live music was OK.  There was a fridge in the room so we bought some breakfast stuff and ate in the room every morning.

title: great hotel bad jimmy restaurant lounge
review: Dear Kristin B,   Thank you for taking the time to post a review of our property.  Your satisfaction is important to us and we try hard to make sure all of our guests have a rewarding experience at our hotel. I was delighted to read your review and your very kind comments regarding the service offered by our staff as well as the facilities. It was unfortunate to see your stay was not as comfortable as it could have been. We value your comments, as they enable us to further improve our services and to surpass the very high standards our guests expect.   Thank you for staying with us and we all hope to have an opportunity to serve you again.  Sincerely,   Karen C Case Manager IHGCare

title: Lots of positives
review: We stayed at the Holiday Inn for the 3rd time from May 01-May 8 and it was our best trip of the previous 2. As we were aware of the cost of renting and parking we used that part of our budget for a pick up, by limo, to get from the airport to HI. We used Executive Car Services and I highly recommend their services. Check in was a breeze and we went to our 2 room gulf front suite on the 7th floor and, as usual, it's appearance, which was great, matched its cleanliness. The weather, that day was cloudy with rain, but we were too tired, from traveling, to do much more than unpack and have dinner. We ate at Jimmy's Fish House, which is in the hotel, and had a great dinner. We found the service at Jimmy's, where we ate most of our meals, to be either excellent or poor, with no middle…

title: Great stay!
review: We had a great stay! Nice clean hotel, nice staff and great views. The beach was a little bit of a walk but very nice. The restaurant was great. We ate there twice. One time was for sunset and there was a band playing and a great atmosphere. Would definitely return.

title: Lovely stay!
review: Thank you for your recent review of your May stay.  We're so pleased you enjoyed your stay.   Thank you for your comments on our resort, restaurant, staff and cleanliness.  We work hard to make every guest's stay a memory.  Hopefully we'll see you back here in the future.  There's lots of reasons to return!   Stay in touch with us on our Facebook page:  Holiday Inn Resort & Suites Clearwater Beach.  Enjoy your summer up there in Illinois!  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Perfect for 3 generations
review: My boyfriend and I booked this hotel without ever having stayed there before and we were pleasantly surprised!  Clean and comfortable and very close to the beach - short walk.  Close to all amenities as well.  Everyone was friendly and I would highly recommend this hotel and stay there again if ever back in the Clearwater Beach area.

title: Great view & accommodating staff
review: *Be aware - if booking online at the Holiday Inn website, the room descriptions are not accurate. They claim there is a King gulf suite - which the local staff told me there is not! Not a problem for us, though. They do have a regular 1 room queen suite with a full kitchen. They call that the Queen bed Junior suite.  It was a girl's trip. Grandma, daughter and granddaughter. We had a 2 Queen bed Gulf Front Suite (for $222/night) which consisted of TWO rooms. 1 "standard" hotel type room - 2 queen beds, TV, balcony overlooking the gulf/causeway and bathroom. And then a connecting room (a door in between) with a couch, loveseat, small table & 4 chairs, mini fridge, microwave, sink, plates, glasses and bathroom with shower.   It worked perfect for us as Grandma got up early, went…

title: For the 20-30 crowd!
review: We chose this hotel on a whim when we decided to spend the night at the beach. The front desk was very helpful in getting the room we wanted & got early check in. Lunch at the restaurant was good & service great. For dinner there was a band so it was very crowded. It took a while to be waited on, but the waitress was good once we were helped. Breakfast was not crowded & service was awful, I would have ordered it as room service if I 'd known. It was the same menu & prices!  The view was wonderful. We enjoyed watching the activity in the pass, saw manatee, dolphins & sting rays as well as all kinds of boats, even a pirate ship! The room & bathroom were clean, beds very comfortable. The pool is gorgeous. We will go back again.

title: A Great Place To Relax
review: My wife and I stayed at the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Clearwater Beach, Fl. for a few days just getting back yesterday. You know you are enjoying yourself when you don't want to leave.  The service at the hotel was excellent. If we had a question the people at the front desk would stop what they were doing and try their best to meet our needs.  The training and fitness room had all the equipment needed too.  They had live entertainment at night where you could sit outside of the Restaurant/Bar, "Jimmy's Fish House & Iguana Bar," listen to some live music, have food and beverages and watch the sun set.  The food also was excellent. This was one of our best trips ever.Plus their's a trolley you can catch just outside the hotel, "The Jolley Trolley or the PSTA Trolley" and let…

title: Off the beaten path
review: We stayed for 3 nights. The hotel staff was polite and the place seemed clean. The walk to the beach wasn't to bad. The only disappointment was having to pay for parking. Great hotel and beautiful "off the beaten path" location.

title: Just right
review: We stayed here 3 nights. The hotel was clean and the staff was pleasant. The walk to the beach wasn't bad but it is a small distance. We were charged a daily parking fee which we were unaware of when we made our reservation. The food at Jimmys fish house was excellent but the service was terrible.

title: Good trip
review: I was there for a couple of nights with sisters. The sink in the bathroom was not draining so we called  for service to fix it. Even after it was " fixed" it drained slow. The room was fine. The very best thing about the hotel are the mojitos at the pool. She really knows howto make them!

title: Excellent Choice!
review: Nicole, Zeny and Guest Services manager Chris provided outstanding support and accommodated our wishes. The hot water was off from our tower, but Chris offered reconciliation gifts. We would certainly go back!

title: Not What it Once Was
review: We just stayed at the hotel for our third time. It is in need of a makeover. Furniture in suites need to be replaced. My daughter had marks from the coils in the pullout sofa on her back. The air wall air conditioners are noisy and either freeze you or toast you. Both AC's in the suite blow out to the balcony, which made sitting out on the balcony enjoying the nice gulf view impossible as you had hot noisy air being blown on to you. The service has slipped as well. Our room was not cleaned until 5:00 each night. When I complained at the front desk, I was told their policy was to have rooms cleaned by 5:30, which seems very late to me. We found the pool bar to be dirty with sub par bartenders, who could not make some basic drinks. When we return to Clearwater Beach again, it will…

title: Nice surprise
review: Dear Rtfde,  Thank you for taking the time to post a review of our property. I am truly sorry to hear that the food served during your travel did not live up to your expectations specifically with the room conditions and housekeeping services. Rest assured that your comments will be reviewed by our team and take actions accordingly. We hope that you take the time to stop in for a visit soon to see how we have taken every comment very seriously in order to make your future stays with us as pleasant as possible.  Sincerely,  Karen G. Case Manager IHGCare

title: Right on the waterfront
review: When I was in college I used to work on Clearwater Beach in several restaurants.  Man, how things change in 25 years.....Holiday Inn has also changed.  This is a nice, updated, laid-back vibe hotel that will be a hit with families with kids, and older travelers...I'm not sure it's the 20 - 30 hot spot, but then again Clearwater Beach isn't known for any visits by the Kardashian clan.  In any event, the rooms are ample size, they have a little sink, fridge and cabinet area which is nice for storing beer and leftovers.  The site has a nice pool area looking on to the Sandkey Pass.  The downside is that you are about 300 yards south of the beach, but its a very easy walk.  The upside is the pool and bar area have some of the best views on the West Coast of FL.  My favorite thing…

title: Beautiful & Relaxing
review: Pool and tiki bar right on the waterfront. Although there is no beach right at the hotel, you only Have to walk a few minutes to the amazing white, sugar sand beach that just seems to go for miles. The hotel were really good with us - check-in isn't until 4pm but we arrived at one and they gave us our room. The room itself is fine - had better and had a lot worse! You always know what you're getting with a holiday inn. Comfortable, clean and everything you need.

title: Very Relaxing vacation
review: Just returned from a 5 night stay at the Holiday Inn. It was just my boyfriend & I and due to extreme flight delays we didn't get to the hotel until 5am. The employee at the front desk (shout out to Doug!) was very understanding and accommodating.  We were put in a room designed for a handicapped patron, but that wasn't a problem. Our view was of the parking lot/condos across the way but I didn't mind that because it was fun to watch what was going on on the street below.  The pool was great and we really enjoyed the tiki bar. (Get the Ultimate Pina Colada! Delicious! - dipped in honey & coconut shavings around the rim!)  There is a sign that says hotel guests need wristbands for the pool area, which we got on purpose, but they didn't seem to make a fuss if some of the pool…

title: Spring Break Trip
review: We dont normally travel during Spring Break, and probably never will again.  The hotel was very nice, but very pricey during this time, over $200 a night.  Had a fab view on the 8th floor.  Looking over pool and the gulf beyond.  Lovely balcony.  The bed was HARD!  Pillows small.  Air conditioning very loud.  Spacious room and I really liked they had a fridge and microwave.  I am sure during normal times, room prices are ok.  I would stay there again, but not close to pier.  Although, with the bar, restaurant, and everything there, not necessary to leave much.  Buffet breakfast not worth it, although other food good.

title: Not Unbelievable but it works nicely...
review: Dear Sista94,   Thank you for taking the time to express your thoughts and concerns. I certainly apologize for the inconveniences you experienced because of the room conditions. Rest assured that your comments about the bed and the Air Conditioner have been documented and appropriate actions will be taken. We take the confidence our guests place in us very seriously and  work diligently to rectify any unsatisfactory experiences. While we understand that your stay was not 100% satisfactory, we would hope that you would give us another chance to make your stay as best as it can be.   Sincerely,   Janice A Case Manager  IHGCare

title: Holiday Inn a Notch Above
review: We stayed at this hotel recently for our second straight spring break.  I used some of my Priority Club points and booked a room for 8 days.  When we arrived, we were unexpectedly upgraded to a suite.  This was a huge plus, traveling with two teenage boys.  The extra room gave them all sorts of space to spread out, not to mention the extra closet and dressers to put all of our clothes in and two showers!  The location is good, about a two minute walk to the beach and far enough that you don't have crowds walking by the hotel at all hours of the night.  We have yet to eat or drink anything from the hotel's establishments as there are too many other good restaurants in the area to frequent.  We only have a couple of complaints regarding our stay; the pool area constantly ran out…

title: Great location! Perfect view!
review: We were here for Spring Break. There were 8 families with teenager and the kids had a ball. The rooms are quite large as this is an older property. It has been refurbished so don't be too worried.   Pros: Nice open air beach bar with nice patio and live music. Food is average in my opinion.  Large rooms and plenty of room Price is affordable  Outdoor pool bar is sufficient Next door to a good restaurant and tiki bar ,,,ie : Sheppards Jay the bartender is a really good guy and busy IHOP is a short walk away beach is a five minute walk away Downtown is a short walk away  cons:  No beach,  Cleaning staff uses the same elevators as guest,,, wait forever Cleaning staff is in the hall ways at 730 am with their radios blaring You can learn Spanish and other languages by just listening…

title: decent vacation spot
review: Dear PackMan50,  Thank you for posting a review of our property. I am pleased to know you like our room accommodations, facilities and location. However, I am sorry to learn that you were disappointed with your stay as we always strive to provide a unique experience to all our guests. I sincerely apologize for any inconvenience you experienced from our hotel staff and elevator service. I have taken note and wish to thank you for all your valuable comments. These are of great importance to us and allow us to monitor and improve our service continually.  We hope that you will afford us another opportunity to showcase our usual levels of service.  Sincerely,  Zelyn N Case Manager IHGCare

title: cockroach in my bed
review: Myself, my husband and my 10 year old son stayed here, 3 nights March 27-29, 2013. We paid a lot to be on the beach and ended up with a room facing the parking lot. This Hotel is run down, a lot of wear and tear, basic room you would expect in a cheaper place .On our last night we returned to our room  to find a decent sized cockroach in one of the beds. I wrapped up that sucker and went to the front desk. When someone finally acknowleged me I asked for a manager, spoke with a big guy named Christopher (if I remembered his last name I would print it), I explained the cockroach, handed over the tissue with cockroach. His way of fixing the problem was to change the linens, said he would have the room sprayed and offered me free parking and a voucher for breakfast, he said he was…

title: Not impressed
review: Dear ColletteSouthJersey:  Thank you so much for taking time to review your recent stay with us.    We rely on you, our guests to let us know how we are doing and how we can better meet the needs of our customers. Customer satisfaction is our main focus and I am deeply saddened to hear we were unable to address your concerns while you were staying with us, and for the lack of follow-up.    I would love the opportunity to speak to you more in depth on this issue.  You can reach me at either (727) 447-6461 x 7042 or cbottger@clearwaterbeachholidayinn.com   Thank you again for taking the time to share your experience with us.    Best Regards,   Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Great hotel, would go back again
review: I'll start with the good points:  good location only a short walk from pier 60 Good size rooms for families (gulf view suite) Pool towels provided. Unfortunately that's where the good points end and the bad points begin: When we booked we had requested a high floor and we followed this up with an email a couple of days before arrival. So we were disappointed when we arrived and were given the 1st floor up and even more disappointed when our reasons for not wanting a low floor were realised - the noise. People in the pool and at bar late kept the kids from getting to sleep. would probably recommend this hotel to party goers rather than families.   The room was a good size although a little tired.  The air conditioning unit was so loud we had to turn it off at night and there was…

title: friendly service
review: Dear DisneymumEngland  Thank you so much for taking time to review your recent stay with us.   Customer satisfaction is high on our list, and we are saddened to hear we did not achieve this during your stay.  You have provided us valuable feedback in regards to having something as simple as a corkscrew available at all times for our guests.  Suggestion and comments like yours let us know how we are doing and how we can better meet the needs of our guests.    I would love the opportunity to discuss your stay with us in more detail.  You may reach me directly at cbottger@clearwaterbeachholidayinn.com.    Best Regards,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Just as good as last time
review: I stayed there for 3 days march 27, everyone was friendly ,hotel was clean, my room was clean. Had a great time at jimmy's food was good ,drinks were good, bar tenders were great, jazzy jenny makes a killer bloody mary!!!

title: Right on the water!
review: Nice room,  clean, wonderful view, and great location.  We liked the restaurant very much. Staff were friendly. and helpful.  The coffee shop, ice cream shop, can be easily missed, the smoothies were great. We loved the towel animals left on our bed each day.  The live music, although entertaining was loud. We were on the 9th floor, and couldn't sleep until they pulled the plug.  WiFi was a joke. The bathroom was small.  If you needed to open a wine, you had to go the bar.  They don't have a beach, but the beach is a 2 block easy walk.  The balcony was where we spent most of our down time, two chairs and a very small table. And the best view I'm the world.  Be aware parking  can be problem, they rent out space during the day, many people got caught without a space.  Would we…

title: Very poorly run hotel
review: Arrived in Fl a few hours earlier than expected. Ask for an early check in and were told the earliest the room could be ready was 4pm which is normal check in time. We asked if our bags could be held and brought up to the room for us and they said no. The front desk person was rude and short with me.  The pool area is nice but too small for the size of the hotel. Their restaurant Jimmy Iguana's has a limited menu but the food is okay when u finally get it. Service is very slow if u can get it at all. The staff over all is rude and when asked for anything no matter how small acts like you inconvenience to them. You often hear staff complain about being short handed and over worked. Actual quote from waitress "Idon't want to wait on tables with more than one kid." They put a $200…

title: Great hotel
review: Dear Njtraveler7092,  Thank you for staying with us and leaving such a detailed review.  I am glad you like our convenient location.  However, I am deeply sorry you found our hotel less than satisfactory.  The feedback we receive from our valued guests, like you, enables us to target problem areas.  We welcome any opportunity to improve.  If there is anything we can do to make your next stay more comfortable, please do not hesitate to ask the Manager on Duty.  Sincerely,  Jaime W Case Manager IHGCare

title: Everything was awesome, except the internet and toddler pool
review: We stayed for 3 nights from 24 march. Lovely suite with kids bunk beds and separate sleeping area. Fridge etc very handy. The pool area was nice and we loved the bar with nice cocktails. Would definitely stay again if in Clearwater .

title: PERFECT family hotel in Clearwater Beach!
review: The view and the location: That is amazing and up to our expectations. I mean, eating breakfast while seeing dolphins jumping in and out of the water and the same dolphins showing up for sunset … that is hard to beat. The hotel is very close to the beach, which is also very convenient.  The suite: The balcony access is from the room where the Beds are, not the common room. Traveling with a 2 years old, this is annoying when the main purpose of having a balcony was to enjoy the weather while she would take her afternoon nap or the sunset while she is already asleep. The Kitchenette; Do not expect this to be anywhere close to a Stay Bridge Suite or Residence Inn. This is a small fridge, a microwave. There is not even what you need to open a bottle of wine. The bed were comfortable…

title: Phillies Spring Training
review: Great place to stay for Phillies fans.......Fun bar..beautiful view of bay.....Holiday Inn reps. couldn't be more helpful..except  you have to reserve a place on the Jolley Trolley to go BrightHouse Field....we were told different at the counter..

title: Another Great Stay!!
review: This is our second stay at this property!  We were in town to see the Phillies at Spring training and see a band "Blackthorn".  They are from the Philadelphia area. We were in a one bedroom suite with two queen beds over looking the pool area.  The beds are so comfortable.  Very spacious and we loved having 2 bathrooms.  Mini fridge, sink, microwave and pull out sofa bed. Front desk was very helpful!!   Service on Sunday night at Jimmy's was great, awesome waitress, Megan, waited on us all night!! Location of the hotel is great.  You can walk everywhere.  Walgreen's is down the street attached to a liquor store.  You can wall to at least 2 Frenchy's. Elevators tend to be a little slow, we used the steps a lot. We hope to be back next year.

title: Fun and Beautiful place to stay
review: our room was on the 4th floor overlooking the band/restaurant area.  The sunsets from this view were nothing short of magnificient.  The wildlife is incredible. Dolphins, pelicans, sea turtles were everywhere.  We had a king bed which was comfortable.  We did not have any blanket just sheets so we like our air conditioning on full blast so blankets are a must at night.  Just go to the desk and get them.  No problem there.  Nice big bathroom, nice little kitchen area with sink and refrigerator.  Nice flat screen tv.  The price is really exceptional for this hotel and the bang for the buck is well worth it. The pool is heated, big, lots of chairs.  The tiki bar is fun, the rum bucket drinks are well worth it.  Two was my limit!  The view from inside the pool looking out into the…

title: Extremely Clean
review: I recently stayed at this facility for a two night stay.  I was in Florida on business that was taking place one hour north of Clearwater Beach but at the last minute decided to spend two nights in Clearwater for some much needed R&R.  Every aspect of the property was updated and clean.  I found the front desk to be personable, friendly and professional.  The pool area is very nice with an outdoor Tikki Bar and the most amazing gulf view for sunsets.  The hotel sits just on the outskirts of town and is a short 5 minute walk to the beautiful Clearwater Sandy Beaches.  I personally liked the location as it was not in the center of town and was in an area that wa less noisy.  I would definitely recommend this hotel for any travelor going to Clearwater.

title: Another Wonderful Vacation!
review: I can't say enough about this place.  The staff are so friendly (Rachel at the Tiki bar) and  helpful (entire front desk staff) our room was VERY comfortable and meticulous (thank you Carmen!). A full service restaurant, pool and waterfront view make this hotel an excellent choice for anyone visiting the beautiful and family-friendly Clearwater Beach area.

title: Beautiful Sunset and Boating View
review: My husband I stayed 2/23 for 7 nights to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. From check in to check out, our entire stay was excellent. Very clean and updated room with kitchenette was perfect!  Sitting at the bar during happy hour and watching the sunset was spectacular. We enjoyed several appetizers but the best was the Seafood Martini with ahi tuna. The bar staff was very sociable and made us feel very "welcomed".  The hotel is within walking distance to everything you need...pharmacy, conveniece store, shopping and many fine restaurants. I do also need to mention that a housekeeper decorated our bed with towels that were in the shapes of an elephant and a flower.  This was a wonderful touch when we came back to the room. Thank you for an excellent stay!  Cinnaminson, NJ

title: Excellent Vacation Spot
review: How kind of you to take time to write such a wonderful review of our resort!  We're so pleased you enjoyed your stay here, plus the amenities of our resort and the beautiful surroundings.  Happy 25th Wedding Anniversary to you as well.  All of our guest's enjoy sitting out on Jimmy's deck to catch the spectacular sunsets.    Hopefully you'll be able to return for another visit, and until that time, we invite you to stay up to date with us on our Facebook page:  Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites, Clearwater Beach.  From all of us, we say Thank You again!  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: What's that smell?
review: We stayed here for 3 nights to see the Phillies in Spring Training. It was a great find. We had a 2 room suite.Full bedroom with bath and adjoining room with bath, wet bar, sofa (Sleeeper) lounge, table.  We had a vew of the ocean it was great. The Restuarnat is very good and we sat on the deck for dinner and breakfast and it was like we were in heaven. The sinset fromthe desk is something you have to see to believe.  The pool area was very nice although the weather was  a tad too chilly for me but some people were in the pool. The porperty is right on the water and a couple blocks form the beach. We paid to ride the trolley to and form the game and we thought that was a good recommendation by the front desk.. Parking was a little tight with a fee but enough room for all. Will…

title: Fun spring break getaway
review: My wife and I visited this hotel for our babymoon Valentines Day weekend. We reserved an ocenview room (616) and the view was spectacular! When we arrived in the room, we noticed a funny mildew/moldy smell but thought that maybe the smell was coming from the water in gulf. Having a pregnant wife with an aversion to smells can be challenging at times so we always pack a candle when traveling.  We went to dinner that night and came back to the room and it was like being punched in the face by the odor. We checked the fridge and looked everywhere but couldn't determine where it was coming from. Luckily the weather was pleasant so we slept with the sliding door open.  The next day we spent most of our time exploring the area and we thought surely that when the cleaning crew came,…

title: Very enjoyable stay!!
review: Dear Valued Guest:  Thank you so much for taking the time to tell us about your experience with our hotel during your stay last month.  Your willingness to share this is greatly appreciated and allows us an excellent opportunity to review the situation and discuss solutions to ensure this does not happen again to another guest. I am terribly disappointed the effect this had on your stay with us.  We will rectify this situation immediately and look forward to your next visit.    Best Regards, Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Very nice hotel
review: We were only here one night with a group of high school band members.  The hotel was wonderful to us and was a great place to stay with the kids because it was within walking distance to everything.  We enjoyed some appetizers and beverages in the evening, on the outdoor deck, while listening to a guitar player and it was the perfect way to unwind after our bus trip there.  We had breakfast on the deck as well, which was delicious.  I would love to go back!

title: Comfortable and clean
review: My husband and I stayed here from 25th February to the 7th March. The hotel reception was welcoming and very helpful. We used the safety deposit box facility right from arrival, but I didn't get the feeling it would have been a problem, everything seemed very secure. I'm a wheelchair user so to have an adapted room I didn't have the option of a nice view overlooking the gulf which to be honest wasn't a big deal to me, you could see the same view from the pool/bar area. I need a bit of a nap mid afternoon so asked if the room could be cleaned early as the maid tended to be cleaning the room just before 3pm. Again it was no problem, reception got right on to housekeeping and they made sure it was organised. We had some cockroaches in the bathroom and again reception were right on…

title: Back for a 2nd stay, and still very nice
review: This is my 2nd time here-previously in March 2011- for a short trip to Phillies spring training.  Please note that if you go this time of year the place is full of Phillies fans, and it is a sociable jovial group.  They are not loud or rowdy, just happy fans on a fun vacation.  We had a late check-in due to flight delays (and blessedly the bar was open until late so that was a great stress reliever).  They had moved us to an upgraded room that was not what I wanted.  The desk person was very nice, and worked on it until they could come up with a better fit for what I requested, and gave us chit for a free drink.  Don't you just love when a service industry actually gives good service.  The room was clean and quiet with a partcial gulf view.  No place right on the gulf is cheap…

title: Pool seating just feet from the ocean. Immaculate room. Very convenient location. Beach 1 block away.
review: Keeping in mind that this is a Holiday Inn and not the Four Seasons, this hotel was a very nice oceanfront getaway. While our room was average (should've upgraded to Gulf view when there was still availability!), the impeccable attention to detail by the housekeeping staff made it seem like a much nicer place. I'm pretty fussy and their hard work met my standards. The front desk staff also deserves a gold star or two. They went above and beyond including sending up a AAA battery for my insulin pump when the old one fizzled out at 11:00 pm. And they didn't even charge me. We bought week passes for the Jolly Trolley / bus system and traveled down the coast to explore other beaches even though Clearwater Beach was fabulous and just a long block away from the hotel. We weren't nuts…

title: Perfect place to stay near the beach.
review: Room was clean and comfortable.  I liked the little things like having nature sounds on the clock radio with a port to plug in your ipod.  Convenient restaurant on site.  Staff was very helpful and very accommodating. We came down one evening wanting dessert and didn't realize they were closing at that time.  The nice girl happily got the ice cream back out and made a couple of shakes for us (and they weren't even on the menu).  The hotel is literally right next to the water, but the beach area is a short walk down the block  The only negative was having to pay for parking each day.

title: Beautiful View of Sunset
review: My husband and I really enjoyed this hotel, the location and the view.  The sunset is stunning and you are able to see dolphins swimming in the canal.   Only downfall is the hotel pool area seems to be open to public - many people in the pool area were not even staying at the hotel.  Lastly, I WOULDN'T rent a car.  Parking is $20 a night and traffic is crazy on the island.  You don't need to drive anywhere - the hotel is an 8 minute walk from the pier.

title: Nice Experience
review: Thank you so much for taking time to review your recent stay with us.    We're so pleased you enjoyed your visit!  Customer satisfaction is high on our list, so it is nice to hear you found our staff to be helpful and friendly and our resort and amenities to your liking.    We have recently become aware of non-guests use of our pool area and are taking the necessary actions to prevent this in the future to ensure our pool area is specifically for the use of our hotel guests.  We apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused.   Thank you again for taking the time to write your review!  We do appreciate your comments.    Christine Bottger  General Manager

title: Hotel Experience
review: My wife & I enjoyed a four day get away at this hotel. Friendly staff, nice pool & patio on the ocean, at the waters edge. We had a nice suite & was able to walk, ride bikes or drive to many areas of interest. The beach was just a short walk to the side. The restaurant was good and had live music outside in the evening.

title: Wonderful Stay
review: Great location, spectacular view, beautiful sunsets from room balcony or from outdoor swimming pool.  Enjoy a good meal from Jimmy's Fish House located next to swimming area.  They also have live music on weekends and the hotel is very good for family vacations or weekend getaways.

title: Comfortable Stay - Great Location
review: This was a very nice Holiday Inn.  The location was great and there is a very good restaurant in the hotel.  There are also several good restaurants within walking distance, however, avoid one called the Post Corner.  It was terrible.    I will say that we had one of the loveliest rooms we have stayed in.  It was a corner room with a beautiful view of the Gulf.  This room made our stay as the weather was cold and rainy for most of it.  The beach is a short walk as advertised and we did walk the beach each day.  It was beautiful.  We stayed on Holiday Inn points as we are platinum members and I book all our travel at Holiday Inns.  I called twice before arriving to ask that we have an ocean view and I was told that those had been sold out for months.   When we arrived, we asked…

title: Great hotel in a great location
review: We spent four night at this hotel in an ocean view king bedroom, we are also platinum PC members, we received no upgrade but I was very happy with the room we had, we got what we paid for, you can't always have an upgrade.  The staff were great, very friendly and helpful and the view from our room was great.  Housekeeping were fantastic, we put on our do not disturb sign and they did not disturb us . The room was very clean.

title: Amazing beach vacation
review: I have visited numerous beach hotels, being a Florida resident. Last summer my family and I had the joy of staying on Clearwater beach for 5 days. My children enjoyed the property as much as I enjoyed the beach and relaxing! The restaurants were great and the view was just awesome!!!

title: Nice Property, Terrible Guest Service, ZERO recognition for Platinum PC Members
review: How kind of you to take time to write such a wonderful review of our resort!  We're so pleased you enjoyed your stay here, plus the amenities of our resort - including our spacious rooms - and the beautiful surroundings.  Hopefully you'll be able to return for another visit, and until that time, we invite you to stay up to date with us on our Facebook page:  Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites, Clearwater Beach.  From all of us, we say Thank You again!  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Great Beach Hotel
review: Check in at hotel was uneventful.  Was not offered any upgrade based on my Platinum PC status.  Got to room 700, it has to be the smallest king bed room in hotel.  There was barely space to turn around, much less store any luggage.  After unpacking my bags, I entered the bathroom to find it only contained a stand-alone shower and no tub.  I was traveling with my 3 year old, and he HATES showers.  Carpet in the elevators is beaten and filthy, stinks like old beer.  Tried to take a nap in the late afternoon, but the large generator outside and below the room kept starting up, running for 30 minutes and shutting down.   Jimmy’s bar would not honor the Priority Club free drink coupon that I was given to get a carryout milk or juice for my son because the coupon says “good for one…

title: Can't beat it for the price
review: Dear Valued Priority Club Member:  Thank you for taking the time to write and let us know how your stay was.  We value our guest's comments and opinions and use them as training tools to continue to improve our service and product.  We regret we did not meet your expectations during this trip.  We will take your comments and share with all of our departments to review and implement ways to try and meet all of guests needs and expectations.  I would love the opportunity to discuss this with your further if you would like.  You can reach me via email at cbottger@clearwaterbeachholidayinn.com!  Again, thank you for taking the time to share your experience and thank you for your business.    Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Great hotel
review: We had a great stay at this hotel! We had friends recommend and they were right...best in Clearwater! Jimmys food was great, the staff was great! Everyone from the check in staff to the tiki bar and the room service to the housekeeping. The deck that goes right up to the water is awesome! Everything is clean inside and out. The staff is always working hard from early a.m. to evening. The music is great and sitting on the balcony and listening and watching sunsets can't be beat! You will not be sorry if you visit this hotel!

title: Really a nice surprise!
review: Thanks so much for reviewing your recent stay with us.  So glad you enjoyed your stay, the clean and spacious rooms, and the view.  Happy you had fun at Jimmy's as well - it's such a popular place!  We do hope you'll be able to make it back to see us again.  Love to have you.  All the best,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Great hotel
review: Check - in was a breeze. Room was a pleasant surprise. Very spacious. It was a suite. This consisted of two standard rooms joined together. One room had a sleeper couch , small fridge,sink, microwave, dishes and dish clothes. The room had a table that sat four.  Both rooms had full baths and the one we had was a king bed with desk. We had balcony with a view of the pool and gulf. We had a drink at Jimmy's iguana bar and watched the sun set on two nights. The beach is a short walk. This hotel is on the gulf but is on a sea wall. All on all we were leased with our stay.

title: A great meeting and stay
review: How kind of you to take time to write such a wonderful review of our resort!  We're so pleased you enjoyed your stay here, plus our spacious accommodations, amenities of our resort, Jimmy's, and the beautiful surroundings.  Hopefully you'll be able to return for another visit, and until that time, we invite you to stay up to date with us on our Facebook page:  Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites, Clearwater Beach.  From all of us, we say Thank You again!  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Holiday Inn Clearwater Florida - Spacious Suites steps from the Ocean
review: This hotel is a joy to stay in, the view of the gulf is outstanding with a sunset to die for. (every night)! Everywhere is spotless, and the staff are very helpful and friendly. The bar and restaurant provide great food and service. There are plenty of things to do locally if you can tear you self away from the beach. A good base if you are visiting Disney or the Cape, both a relaxing drive away.

title: Great! Nothing bad to say and the price was right!
review: Great location.. Walking distance to beach many restaurants & bars. Hotel restaurant and bar was nice... Good food and reasonable prices. Nice pool area with beautiful view and a nice tiki bar. Room was nice but most importantly clean as was the rest of the property. All of the staff were very professional and friendly. I would recommend to anyone and will likely stay here again. All this and he price was much lower than others I compared in the area.

title: Great Family Vacation
review: Thanks so much for taking time to review our resort following your recent stay.   We're so pleased you had fun in such a fun setting.  The views are quite spectacular, aren't they?  Hope you had chance to get out on the Gulf for a dinner cruise or dolphin watch cruise.  Love to have you return to see us again!  Keep up with us on our Facebook page and watch for deals!  Regards,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Could not have been better!
review: We stayed at this hotel for a weekend getaway, and as single mother of 2 kids (6 & 8 yrs old), this was perfect for us! Rooms were clean, pool was one of our favorite spots, and I loved the fact that kids could eat for free! It's just a short walk to Clearwater Beach, where the water is warm, clear, fairly calm, and there is no driving on the sand, which made me feel safer with my kids enjoying the sun, sand and water! We hope to get back here for another long weekend soon!

title: Nice room, pretty view (from the right room...)
review: Thanks so much for taking time to review our resort following your recent stay.   We're so pleased you and your family found our resort to your liking and our staff friendly.   Love to have you return to see us again!  Keep up with us on our Facebook page and watch for deals!  Regards,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Poor customer service
review: This hotel was as close to perfect as I have seen.  The location is great - about 1 1/2 blocks to the beach (and a beautiful beach it is!!!), and it located right on the water.  We upgraded our room to a gulfview - WELL worth the money with spectacular sweeping views of the gulf and sunset.  Our room was very quiet, and bedding and bed very comfortable.  As far as cleanliness, I do not think I have stayed at a cleaner hotel EVER.  The men on staff in the pool area really do a nice job, especially Shaun.  Tiki bar was fun and when Brandi was bartending, it was most especially hospitable!  Very nice pool area. I would highly recommend! Only two letdowns -the first is that I was lead to believe parking was free for Platinum Priority Club members, which it was not :-(  Also, we were…

title: Fantastic Hotel in Clearwater Beach
review: We had a wonderful time by the water at this Holiday Inn across New Years! Very clean, spacious, NO typical by the sea smells, fantastic balcony off the room, lovely staff & great restaurant! LOVED it~ and highly recommend it! (Shepler's is steps away where we had a FAB New Years Eve party!)

title: Loved the gulf views and great location
review: This hotel may not have all the bells and whistles of the hotels that I love to stay at, but the staff is helpful, the rooms are clean and the view was fantastic! We stepped out of our room and the pool was just a few steps from our patio door. The water view was fantastic! Jimmy's the restaurant on the property did great on our room service. My husband enjoyed seeing "George" a local bird that visited Jimmy's restaurant. It was nice to have a kitchette in our room as well. I enjoyed the pool. My husband had to work but I was there for fun and this hotel helped make my trip a great experience.

title: NICE HOTEL AND LOCATION
review: Planned a long weekend at Holiday Inn & Suites, Clearwater Beach, Florida.  Arrived at hotel at 12pm and we were able to get our room right away. We booked through Busch Gardens and we were pleasantly surprised at the quality of the resort.  Right on the Gulf, nice pool, and the rooms were very nice.  We were celebrating my birthday, and we told the BG people when we booked our trip  When we arrived, the hotel was aware, and they said they had reserved a room with a "water" view.  I am a priority member, so when we requested a room upgrade (to Gulf front),  they could give me the upgrade at $40 extra per night.  So apparently being a priority member doesn't do much for a room upgrade, although they did give me a free drink card for the hotel bar.  We declined the upgrade and…

title: Loved the family suite!
review: I looked at many hotels in the area but booked this one because of the family suite.  It was perfect for us - my wife and I had a king bed and the kids had bunk beds off in a small en suite room.  The kids also had their own TV, sink and full bathroom.  This was in addition to the large separate living room with kitchenette (microwave, sink, fridge) and dining area.  The family suite was huge!  Pros: Location was great, within walking distance of the beach, Pier 60, marina and shops (though it may be a little too far to walk to those things for young kids). Ample parking.  Beds and bathrooms were comfortable.  Pool area was nice, with a heated pool allowing us to swim even though it was chilly. Jimmy's restaurant was great, and kids ate free.  Free wifi. Room rates were…

title: Miss it already!
review: We stayed 12/29/12-1/2/13 and it was the most relaxing vacation we had been on and we so disappointed we didn't stay longer.  The Gulf Front view (room 362) was so gorgeous and worth the little extra!  The dolphins and the sunsets were something off of a post card.  Jimmy's Fish House had live music and great food and our room was very nice and clean!  The beach is around the corner, about a 4 minute walk.  But the Gulf of Mexico is right there off the patio and Jimmy's Fish House, so you eat and watch the boats and dolphins.  The weater was mid 70's so we kept our slider door open all night, every night and slept to the sound of the tide.  There is nothing better than that!  We miss it already and have recommended the Holdiday Inn highly to our friends and family and look…

title: Please define "NON-SMOKING"
review: we booked a waterview room for 5 days. Check in was nice and easy because the place was empty.  Even thought they told us they were booked solid. Just 2 other cars in the lot besides ours.Got to our room on the 6th floor...opened the door and it smelt so bad..musty and stale cigarette smoke..We opened up the balcony door and hall door thinking maybe it had been closed up for awhile.We aired the room out.Went for supper came back..still stinky!!Went down to the desk and chatted with the clerk.We always book NON-Smoking hotels and in all our travels over the last 18 months (20 plus hotels) we have never had a problem..They explained their version of non-smoking...are you ready! "the hotel IS non-smolking BUT you can smoke on the balconies with the door closed"  REALLY!! I guess…

title: a great party hotel at times
review: Dear kitten50,   Thank you for your review regarding your recent stay with us. It is regrettable you were not satisfied with the service you received. I would like to address this with you further. I have sent you a private message to obtain more information about your stay. I look forward to hearing from you and being of further assistance.  Sincerely,  Krysllin G. Case Manager IHGCare

title: Good location, amazing views from Gulf front rooms
review: I liked the location very much.just steps to the beach and shops and bars. Needs a little tlc but overall a bargain. It is a non smoking hotel but you can still smoke on the balcony. This is nuts! When I mentioned to Judy at the front desk she saw nothing wrong with this. Must be a smoker as the room stunk.

title: Had a great stay
review: This was our second time at this hotel and we came back again because of it's excellent location just off clearwater beach, it's great pool, tasty food and relaxed atmosphere. It' really was just like having a short carribean vacation within our Florida vacation especially with the live musician playing in the bar area.    The rooms facing the gulf have amazing views and the sunsets are stunning.

title: Very Average Resort Area Hotel
review: We had a room with a balcony on the 4th floor with a great view of the gulf. The beach was just a 2 minute walk away. We were there for New Years, there was a great fireworks display we watched from our balcony.

title: Great view and atmosphere
review: We had a great room with a private balcony overlooking the ocean. I had no complaints with the room as it was in great condition, comfortable, and there was a convenient nail salon on the bottom floor.
