During certain times of the year, you can watch both the sunrise and sunset from this property. There's a very good casual restaurant on site and the heated pool was great during our November visit. Rooms are clean, common areas are nice... The only negative I can think of is that the hotel is about a block or two from beach access, but the views more than make up for it, in my opinion.   If you like a little nightlife on your vacation, you're just a few steps away from Shephard's which has a great tiki bar, dancing, live music, and a nice restaurant. The dance club doesn't get going until 11 or midnight, but who cares? Sleep in, you're on vacation!

title: Enjoyable and friendly place to stay in Clearwater Beach!
review: My wife, my son and I spent three nights at this hotel for Gasparilla Day.  The reservation system was easy to use and room descriptions and prices were accurate.  I rented a two room, ocean front suite and that is exactly what I got.  The view was great and room spacious.  Check in was quick and very friendly.  Rooms were clean and didn't look too worn.  The on site restaurants and bar were reasonable and the they had live entertainment.  The food was good.  We had it delivered one night for room service and it was prompt and tasty.  Also the hotel was nearby to plenty of other restaurants and places to see.  Clearwater Beach was also only a five minute walk.  Check out was effortless and they allowed me to use their computers and printers for viewing and printing directions…

title: Ok hotel, but price is not worth the stay.
review: The good:  Modern hotel, nice pool area and pool was warm.   Great restaurant attached named "Jimmy's Fish house" where kids eat free if you are staying at the hotel. Clean rooms.  The not so good: They charge $12.00/day for parking. The rooms are not all suites.  The room we stayed in was a regular room with two beds. When checking in one lady was somewhat rude and indifferent.  The other lady working the front desk was nice though. This hotel is not on the beach, although it is just a short walk to Clearwater beach.  All in all I thought the value wasn't there for the price of the stay.  There are many other options in florida for hotels on the beach that are more reasonable and have more to offer.

title: The Best
review: We stay here everytime we come to Clearwater Beach.  Love it.  Very clean and quiet.  Great view on the water side.

title: Not your typical Holiday Inn
review: I trusted past reviewers when booking this hotel as I have not had many great experiences at Holiday Inn properties; but this was definitely an exception to the rule. Check-in was very pleasant and quick, we chose to upgrade to a Gulf view room, absolutely worth every penny. The rooms were very clean, the best I've seen in quite some time (we average a dozen or so hotel stays per year) and the view was just spectacular. The patio is decent size, we enjoyed taking dessert to go from a local restaurant and enjoying it on the balcony listening to the live music and watching the boats out on the Gulf. The beds are a bit firm, the restaurant on-site was a waste of time and parking does cost $12/day, but the location is wonderful, the views are incredible and the staff was friendly. I…

title: Good value, need to know a few things
review: Family vacatiion with three kids, 22, 19, 17. Stayed in the two room suite facing the Ocean. Hotel is very nice, modern and clean. The pool was very warm and large for all to enjoy. There is a small child pool, but there is NOT a hot tub. Towel service was handy at the entrance of the pool. We enjoyed the tiki bar for outside drinks, as well there is an outside restaurant right on the water. There is a coffee shop and ice cream shop located in the lobby area, but we found that to only be open at odd hours and not full time. Be aware that even as a paying guest of the hotel, you will be charged a daily parking fee of $12.00 per day. The location is fantastic and within walking distance of Clearwater Beach, Pier 60, the shops and resturants, you really dont need to use a car once…

title: Had a great time.
review: I booked this hotel based on the reviews on here and was not disappointed.Room was nice and clean and staff were very friendly(the maid made my daughters holiday by giving her some vouchers for the gift shop won in the games room).Good value for money considering its on the beach and i loved the fact they provide free internet in the lobby to look up local attractions.The coffee shop was a bonus too.Would stay again.

title: Great Place to stay
review: Really nice rooms.  I like how the suites have 2 seperate rooms which is nice if you have kids.  Pretty good location (most places to eat are within 1/2 mile).  Pool is nice and the  resteraunt is good. They also have a coffee shop located next to the lobby with good coffee and muffins.

title: Ruined our New Years
review: We have a vacation home in Clearwater and this year we decided to spend our New Years Eve on the beach with our best friends that came down from Canada. Prior to booking our hotel, we visited the Holiday Inn at Clearwater Beach and dined at Jimmys. We also asked to view several of their room types. The first gulfview room was on the second floor and looked directly at the rooftop on the restaurant, very misleading for a gulfview! There was not any water in sight, only a roof! Next we viewed another gulfview room on the 5th floor and we happy with the view and updated furnishings. This was the first week of November so we proceeded to make our reservations for New Years, requesting the proper GULFVIEW rooms. Very excited, we arrived at the Holiday Inn Clearweater Beach on New…

title: Beautiful View with Balcony
review: We were passing through & decided to find a place with a view of the water. Paid $200 per night for a balcony view. The room had a nice micro/frig. The bed was firm. The restaurant in the hotel was excellent. Paid extra for parking in their open lot. The beach access is limited only when low tide. No easy to get on the beach. Nice pool area with lounge chairs that overlook waterway.

title: Beautiful
review: My husband and I, along with 21 other family members stayed here the beginning of December.  Hotel staff was friendly to us.  The assortment of rooms we had were all very nice.  Beds and linens were good, bathrooms were cleaned well.    We enjoyed the pool and deck area outside.  Also, plenty of places to eat were within a very short walk along the beach.  If I were coming to Clearwater Beach to sit on the sand all day, this may not be the first pick of hotels, as it is right on the water, but not on the beach.    The only thing I don't really understand is the high parking cost a day, but I do understand we have visited in the off season.   I would recommend my friends and family to stay here again though.

title: Very Relaxing
review: My husband and I had a very relaxing time at this hotel. Doesn't feel like a hotel per say, feels more like a resort. Live entertainment was exceptional and the best part, we could see and here from our balcony overlooking the Gulf. Dolphin sightings daily again, right off our balcony. Restraunts line the beach walk and Pier 60 always had vendors and street shows nightly, good times! Beach is only a 5 minute walk but with the shops and restraunts lining this walk, and the weather was beautiful, makes for a wonderful time. Hotel was clean and staff very friendly and accomodating.

title: I liked it
review: This is a good 3 star hotel which is why I gave it a 4 instead of a 3. The hotel was clean and quiet. I had limited interaction with the staff, but they were not unpleasant. The location isn't bad. They advertise 500 ft from the beach, but I would say it's closer to 500 meters.  There is a nightclub about 500 ft away though. I liked that! I have two complaints. They have a "business center" (which is really a computer in the lobby with a printer). I was very grateful for that as I printed off two restaurant.com certificates.  However, the computer was incredibly slow. It was a crawl and was even missing some of the radio buttons. I would have to move the mouse around and click until I found the button I needed since they were not displayed. My other complaint relates to the tv.…

title: Great room and view
review: We really enjoyed our vacation the week after Thanksgiving.   Amy, Guest Relations Manager, helped us get the best, quietest room on the 7th floor gulf view.  It was an amazing room, with a beautiful view.  We really felt taken care of, as the maid staff did a great job of cleaning the room and restocking it every day.  There were real dishes, silverware, mugs in our kitchen area, which we weren't expecting.  This was our first vacation in many years, and we really enjoyed the quiet and the beauty of Clearwater Beach.  Thanks, Amy.  Holiday Inn is now home to us, and we have resolved to return next year.

title: Perfect
review: Stayed here in November for 3 nights. Hotel is two blocks from beautiful public beach and has very spacious rooms with balcony. Front desk was very friendly and the pool (with Gulfview) is really big and has a poolbar. Our three year old daughter had the time of her life. The sunset from the pooldeck was amazingly beautiful. Parking was $12 per day, but I think it is not expensive. Would stay here again on my next visit to the Gulfcoast. One more thing: Clearwater Marine Aquarium is a five minute drive. If you want to see dolphin Winter ( from the movie "Dolphin tale") you have to go there.

title: Great Weekend Getaway!
review: My friend and I stayed here for the first time the beginning of November. The deck and pool area were fantastic. Our favorite place to sit was on the lounge chairs facing the water. We saw a few dolphins and loved the fact that we could sit so close to the water without heading down to the beach each time. The beach was a very easy stroll and absolutely beautiful. The sunsets were amazing. Jimmy's Fish House was a fun place to sit and have a drink at the end of the day with great live music. The Tikki bar served up some great drinks while hanging by the pool. We had a city view room and although it would have been great to overlook the ocean, we had fun people watching from our balcony. The staff was very friendly, the room was clean and the beds were comfortable. We did not…

title: Annual Thanksgiving getaway
review: My family visit clearwater every thanksgiving and usually stay at this hotel. the overall experience is average. There are a few thing that i do not like about the hotel but able to overcome them. The coffee shop attached to the hotel is very nice but the coffee is not good. Several time i went to get coffee and the girl did not know how to mix a latta she had to asked me did i want whipped cream are carmel in the latta. What? that is the latta! and my husband coffee was cold and she offer to microwave the coffee. The hotel have free wi fi and coursey desk top PC and only one(1) was in service which cause a waiting line to use the PC. They offer Thanksgiving dinner in Jimmy fish house and the menu was not well balance. Two type of potatoes on the plate with and mostly carb…

title: Awesome!
review: This was our second stay since Labor Day and the hotel and staff were stellar in every way. We're definitely looking forward to our next stay at Christmas! This hotel is a phenomenal find! We HIGHLY recommend!

title: Horrible hotel
review: I know Holiday Inn is not known because its luxury, but this hotel is really bad. The rooms are quite big, but badly furnished. I went with my sister to a wedding that was held there, and we've been freezing all the time. Not only the room was with the air conditioner turned on when we get there, even if outdoor the temperature was 59F, but we tried to warm the room and the heat worked poorly and the machine was terrible noisy. And the maid didn't clean our room in two days. The price of the room was quite high and doesn't include breakfast. Even the ballroom seems a fridge... The breakfast at the bar was bad, and the dinner of the wedding terrible, the service not professional and the food far away of any wedding I've been. If you can avoid this place, don't hesitate. I'm not…

title: Wonderful experience
review: We had a great experience at this hotel... this is not your average Holiday Inn.  The view of the Gulf is amazing and their pool / outdoor area is a fantastic place to hang out and watch some live music right in front of the Gulf.  The restaurant onsite is pricey, we only had an app but it was delicious.  We stayed on the seventh floor and was amazed by the view, it literally doesn't get much better than this.  The private balconies are a super nice amenity.  The rooms and hotel were clean, the bathroom is nice and roomy and the beds are very comfortable.  They also have amenities such as a mini fridge, microwave and room service. They give you real coffee mugs and nice glasses in the room; we didn't realize how nice that is until we stayed at a Marriott for double the price…

title: Nice hotel but no private beach access, hotel on a seawall.
review: What a nice review!  Thank you so much for taking time to write.  We're glad you enjoyed your stay here -- the views from our higher levels are stunning, aren't they?  Sounds like you made some good memories here and we hope you can return with your family next time.  In fact, we have many people who come with multi-generations to make it a mini-family reunion getaway!  We invite you to stay in touch on our Facebook page:  Holiday Inn Clearwater Beach.  And...we want to wish you a wonderful Holiday season.  Thanks again!  Christine Bottger General Manager Holiday Inn Clearwater Beach

title: Better than I expected
review: Rooms are clean, a bit small but the bed and pillows very comfortable.   The Staff at this hotel receives a 5 star for their friendliness and desire to make guest feel like true GUEST!   The rates were a bit steep for our gulf front room in comparison to other hotels along the beach considering they DO NOT have private beach access directly from the hotel. The  hotel is located on the ocean side but does not have a private beach or beach access of its own because it is on a seawall. You have to exit the hotel and go out on to the sidewalk and walk about 500 feet to the Public Beach access. I would like to see this made clear under their advertisements for the people who wish to have a hotel with a sandy beach in front of the hotel.   Other then that...all was great.

title: Great place for a getaway
review: Thanks for taking time to write a review on your recent stay here.  We are pleased that you enoyed your stay -- and our staff will receive your compliments!  Glad you enjoyed the service here and the value.  We do try and mention that we are steps away from the beach; sorry if you didn't see them, but we're glad you enjoyed the short walk to the public beach.  Have a wonderful holiday and we DO hope you can come back with your families next year.  To give you ideas, we invite you to join our Facebook page:  Holiday Inn Clearwater Beach.   Thanks again,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Enjoyable stay
review: I stayed in Orlando for a few days on business and wanted to hit the beach for a couple of days before going home. I chose this hotel b/c of trip advisor reviews. It was clean, recently remodeled and view was amazing. It is still a Holiday Inn, but the pool, staff and restaurant onsite were very nice. I will be coming back next year!

title: Exactly what you expect! Peace of mind.
review: I am currently staying at this holiday inn right now while writing this review, room 559 with a city view and 2 queen beds. Its not the standard room because it has a balcony but its not a villa (can't imagine how nice those must be).  I came here with my wife to spend a 6 night get away close to the wounderful clearwater beach. We were looking for a nice clean place for a good rate very close to the beach and that is what we got. The place smells great and is very clean. I call front desk at least 3 times a day and they are always very helpful and friendly. The view from the room is nice, the room is big enough for 4 people but no sofa. I would definatly come back to this place and recomend to anyone coming to clearwater. It looks exactly like the pictures they advertise. I…

title: Great place to stay
review: Thank you so much for taking time to write a review - especially while you are still here!  We're glad you are enjoying your stay here and pleased that our staff is responding to your needs.  As to the seagulls - well, it's something all the area resorts have to deal with - we just don't have them trained yet!  We're having spectacular weather while you're here; hope you are headed out for another great day.    Thanks again,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Great mid priced hotel
review: This hotel is great!  The location is only blocks from the beach.  The restaurant/bar has great food and drinks.

title: Nice hotel on Clearwater Beach
review: Thanks so much for taking time to write a response.  You've sure traveled a long way from Missoula!  Hope you have left with wonderful memories and that we'll see you back here again soon.  All the best,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Great location, Clean hotel, Good for families
review: This hotel is really nice & I love the party pool area and Jimmy's Fish Market.  Only problem is that you have to walk a little bit to get to the beach area.

title: Didn't want to leave!
review: We recently went on a trip to the Gulf Coast of Florida and stayed at the Holiday Inn Hotel On S. Gulfview Blvd. in Clearwater Beach.  This hotel had it all!  The room was lovely with adorable towel animals to greet us each day.  The gulf view from the balcony was breathtaking with dolphin sightings daily and sunsets that you see in your dreams.  The Hotel restaurant, Jimmy's Fish House had nightly entertainment that you never pay a cover charge for and rivals expensive venues.  Food there was abundant for the price and delicious.  Everyone on staff that we encountered were extremely pleasant. We didn't want to leave!

title: Our Clearwater Beach favourite
review: We're so glad you and your family enjoyed your stay here!  Thak you for taking time to write such a nice review.  We're glad your youngsters liked the towel animals and enjoyed watching the dolphin.  And we'll pass along your compliments to Jimmy's also!  We invite you to stay in touch with us via our Facebook page:  Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites - Clearwater Beach.  Thanks again!  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: brilliant hotel
review: We have just returned from a almost two week break with the stay paid for with our priority club points.   This is our favourite Clearwater Beach hotel and have been staying in this property every year for the last 7 years when it was firstly a Ramada and then a Holiday Inn.  In my opinion the best part of the hotel is that it isn't directly on the beach, instead you have a beautiful waterway and you can sit on your lounger and watch dolphins, manatees etc swim past all day!  If the beach is your thing then it is nothing more than a couple of minutes walk away.  Staff excellent, very friendly and helpful, particularly the two gents who work in the pool area.  Can't wait to go back next year!

title: Lovely room and amenities
review: We're so pleased you enjoyed your holiday here with us recently.  We love our UK visitors! You are right - there is something so special about seeing the dolphin in a natural environment!  We'll pass along your compliments to our staff because it means so much to us to offer customer satisfaction.    Thank you and we'll look to see you next year!   And....please "like" our Facebook page - Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites - Clearwater Beach.  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Not on the beach
review: we stayed here for a week after being on international drive in orlando and it was everything we wanted. we had a room on 9th floor with amazing views, staff very good, lots to see and do locally. wonderful sunsets

title: Please!!! Don't bother!!
review: Save your money and book for a somewhere better. This hotel is located far from anything and it's a complete rip off.  Stayed there for two nights and the rooms were expensive to start with for what was a very basic room only ($170) per night.   Not only that I was horrified on checkout to see that the hotel also charges you a state tax (per night!) and the best one - an occupancy tax (per night!). And guess what, if you take a car they will also sting you for another $12 per night for that as well!  I think the only thing they won't charge you for here is breathing the oxygen.  Expect a very expensive stay. You could make your money go further elsewhere!!!

title: A hotel that delivers on value
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts regarding your most recent stay.  The hotel is mandated to charge State (7%) and Local (5%) taxes as required by law on all services rendered.  We are deeply sorry if this was not communicated along with our daily parking charge at the time of booking.  The Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites prides itself in providing excellent services and accommodations.  We regret we fell short in this instance.  Should you wish to discuss this further please contact me directly at (727) 447-6461 x 7042.    Best Regards,   Christine Bottger General Manager

title: nice view thats it
review: We stayed there August 15th and will be back again. Music, 2 bars, 2 pools, a very pleasant office staff and a fantastic view out over the boats tied up alongside. Very comfortable bed and everything is clean as a whistle. Indoor parking at no charge and you are only a short walk to the beach. Plus was it is only a two block walk to Crabby Bills.

title: Relaxing Getaway
review: Thank you so much for taking time to review our hotel!  We're glad you enjoyed your stay here recently - and our staff will be so pleased to hear your compliment.  Being from the Villages means that you are close enough to return for short getaways, and we do hope we'll be seeing you back soon.  All the best!  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Good service, rooms a bit tired
review: like I said nice view thats it, We went to this hotel for our honeymoon in August of 2011, I asked for and payed for a ocean view room when we  arrived we had a nice view of the parking lot, We I went to the front desk and we  got a lot of fancy answers why we had that room,  Every other day our key for our room did not work, again a lot of fancy answers  We stayed at this hotel 7 days every other day we had to change room's 2 day's before we left we got the rite room, the hotel over charged my credit card 700.Dollars Thank God there was a Chase bank in town to help us out, The staff is clueless about customer service, to bad such a nice hotel so if you like POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE and a lot of fancy answers this place is for you

title: OK but nothing special
review: We had to find accomodation for one night before moving on to the Hyatt in Clearwater (don't ask long story) so we pulled up to this hotel and asked the rate for one night for a suite, 2 queen beds and gulf view. It was around $245. The lobby was OK, the check in was quick, the lifts to the 16th floor was painfully slow. The carpets were well worn and had sen their day, the room was spacious but had that lived in stale smell. The view was great. All in all and adequate hotel but not luxury, having said that I don't think it has claimed to be anyway. So hey ho there we go.

title: Excellent getaway location!
review: This hotel is well managed - clean and friendly.  It is right on the water - breath taking views!  Shops and dining within walking distance, etc.  We will come back to this location without any hesitation!!!

title: Very good experience, can't wait to come back :)
review: Thank you so much for taking time to write such a lovely review of our hotel! Isn't it nice to know you're less than two hours away from us to make it easier for those mini-vacations?  We are pleased you found our staff friendly and glad you enjoyed our spacious suites.  You are right; we are so close to shops and restaurants to add to your experience!  Hopefully you can come back soon!  The Clearwater Superboat National Championships, Clearwater Jazz Holiday, Outback Bowl beach day, plus the chance to see our "movie star" Winter dolphin at Clearwater Marine Aquarium all are great fun.  If you are on Facebook, we invite you to join us at Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Clearwater Beach for many exciting updates.  Thanks again!  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Clearwater Beach uninspired
review: Great location on Clearwater Beach.  We had views of the gulf and the bay from our balcony. Room was nice, clean, great comfortable bed and all the amenities you would want.  Some people commented that it is not really on the beach, well it is right on the water but you do have a 2 minute walk to the beach, not a big deal.  And the pool was so nice we actually came back to it after a quick dip in the ocean.  The restaurant/bar had really friendly staff.  Definitely a fun and affordable place for a nice romantic weekend.

title: What a wonderful walk in hotel
review: Thank you for taking time to review our hotel!  We are so pleased you found us a fun place to stay - that's the compliment type we like best!  Glad you enjoyed our awesome Gulf views and our comfortable rooms, plus our very popular pool.  You're not too far away from us, so hopefully you can return soon!  In the meantime, we invite you to join our Facebook Page for lots of updates:  Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites, Clearwater Beach.  Sincerely, Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Nice Hotel, Nice location But Watch Out For What You Pay For!
review: Stayed at this hotel for a week at the end of August 2011. Check-in was pleasant but was shocked to find that the Gulf view room that I paid for through Hotel.com was not what I expected.  The view from my balcony faced the side of the adjoining building, my view was 90% concrete and 10% the sea! Not very happy I went to reception to resolve the matter. I spoke to the assistant manager, he told us that the room we initially had was gulf view even though it was practically facing the concrete wall and insisted that if I wanted the 'Gulf View' that they called 'Gulf Front View' I would have to pay for the upgrade. What a joke as I paid a lot of money for what I expected to be a room facing the Gulf.....that's why I chose  ...GULF VIEW! After much deliberation he finally managed to…

title: Girls weekend!
review: We had an excellent girls weekend in Clearwater Beach.  The hotel was great.  The best part about it was the POOL! The beach view was good too, but there is ZERO beach access so we were surprised about that.  The only hiccup we had was that when we arrived we had one free night and one paid night.  They expected us to stay in one room on one floor the first night, then pack up and switch rooms & floors the second night.  They acted like it was non negotiable.  Finally after speaking with a manager, they made everything right and our trip was perfect.  The restaurant at the hotel was super good.  We also drove down to Crabby Bills (EXCELLENT crab!) for dinner one night.  The walk along the boardwalk and beach area was wonderful.  It was gorgeous weather to boot.

title: We can hardly wait til our next visit!
review: Thank you so much for sharing your "Girls Weekend" with us on TripAdvisor!  We're so glad your group enjoyed their stay, loved the pool and the restaurant, and that one of our managers was able to straighten out your room situation.  We hope you girls will come back again soon!  There is SO much to see and do in Clearwater!  You're invited to join our Facebook page for updates:  Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites, Clearwater Beach.  Maybe you'll find another tempting reason to return!  (Also, we'd love to have you post photos in our FB album!)  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Great place to chill after Orlando theme parks
review: We were guest at this hotel from September 2nd to September 5th, 2011. As a former hotel maid and guest service representative at various beach resorts, I know first hand how very difficult it is to keep everyone happy all of the time, especially during busy holiday weekends.  That being said, the accommodations were absolutely impeccable and every staff person we encountered did a terrific job making us feel welcome, including guest service members and management, housekeeping staff and management, the maintenance engineers, parking staff, and security personnel.  The housekeeping staff did a phenomenal job, going above and beyond to keep the room warm and welcoming, including turning down the covers and tucking the remote into the covers right where we would find it!  The…

title: Pleasant stay in a great location.
review: What a wonderful review!  We certainly thank you for taking the time to respond to your trip here all the way from Iowa!  It is wonderful to hear that we met and/or exceeded your expectations.  Our staff, including housekeeping, will be pleased to hear your compliments to them, as will Jimmy's Fish House management.  As you could probably tell, there is so much to do in the Clearwater area, and one way to stay informed is by following our Facebook page:  Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Clearwater Beach.  In fact, you are welcome to post photos of your trip in one of our albums if you'd like!  Many thanks again and we hope you have a wonderful fall.  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Fun in the Sun
review: We traveled here with 3 families with kids ranging from 14-24. The hotel was clean and the staff were extra friendly. Great ocean views from the pool.  Rooms were clean and tidy. Jimmys Fish House restuarant which is attached to the hotel had great food and service.  We had sixteen people in our group and everyone had a great time. I would recommend this hotel to friends and family.

title: I'd do it again!
review: We are so glad you and your group had a great vacation!  And glad you liked Jimmy's -- tt's the kind of restaurant where locals as well as visitors frequent.  We hope you'll return soon - maybe after "Dolphin Tale" debuts next month.  Did you see "Winter" at the Clearwater Marine Aquarium while you were here?  We invite you to stay in touch on our Facebook page:  Holiday Inn Clearwater Beach - and you are welcome to add photos as well.  Thanks again for taking the time to write!  Christine Bottger, General Manager

title: Really nice and close to the beach.
review: We really enjoyed this hotel and the pool area. The beach was a 5 minute walk so if you have small children you might want to think about that and if you drive to the beach it' $16 day to park. There are a lot of great restraunts within walking distance. Front desk staff was very helpful. All in all we had a great time and would recommend this hotel and will come back again!

title: Horrible hotel would never go back BEWARE
review: I really liked this hotel, very clean, cleaning staff was nice and would even turn on the sound of seagulls and ocean waves on our bedside clock so that when we returned to our hotel it sounded like we were still on the beach! it was a small gesture but it was nice. The restaurant here is AMAZING. Pretty pricey (most entrees about $15-20 min.) but it was delicious and you couldn't beat the waterfront view. We felt like we were eating right on the ocean! The only complaint I really have is that the rooms do NOT have a safety box. You have to give anything you want locked up to the front desk and then they lock them into security boxes behind the counter for you. It is EXTREMELY incovenient to have to run to the desk every time we wanted to leave the hotel, so we honestly just…

title: Amazing Place
review: Soo much for privacy with the see thru curtains.  was awoken everyday from noise from housekeeping playing in hallways and one 4 A.M. emergency evacuation which was a false alarm. Service at hotel restaurant Jimmys iguana restaurant and bar was horrible. Hotel jacks up prices on vending machines on the weekends same thing with parking.  Have fun finding a parking spot since they allow the public to pay to park there. I would never stay there again.  I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND IT TO ANYONE. There is also no beach at the hotel soo if you want beachfront look elsewhere.

title: Great Stay
review: We had a wonderful trrip.  The hotel rooms are huge!  We had the King kid suite and loved it.  The staff was helpful and nice.  The only problem was every game in the game room was out of order.  That really sucked.  But other than that I would definately stay here again with my family.

title: Perfect location!
review: I ended my road trip of florida in this hotel, stayed for 2 nights and they were perfect!  The hotel was so close to the beach which was great for a short trip.  Breakfast outside over looking the sea in the mornings was wonderful, as were drinks in the evening!  The room was huge, maybe a bit dated but very clean and comfy so i was happy with that!  Would stay here again :)

title: It is waterfront, but no beach
review: We are so glad you enjoyed your stay here and hope you have good memories now that you're back in Ireland!  Thank you so much for telling us that you enjoyed our hotel.  We agree, having breakfast outside while watching the beautiful waters of the Gulf and looking for dolphin is very special!  If you would like to stay updated, we invite you to "like" us on Facebook at:  Holiday Inn Clearwater Beach  Enjoy the rest of your summer!  Christine Bottger, General Manager

title: we wont be back
review: I stayed here because I wanted to be on the beach.  While the hotel is on the water, it has a rocky shoreline and sea wall. There's no sandy beach.  I was kind of disappointed because I had made a reservation with my online corporate travel agent (and paid extra) for a "gold room with a view."  I got standard room with a view of the parking lot :(  I was told by the night time manager that my reservation with a view "did not specify gulf view."  I also thought a suite meant more than one room, because I stayed at the double tree last week.  These are one room, plus a bathroom.  I think my expectation was incorrect. Oh well...  I have to remind myself that it is a 3 star hotel, I normally stay in much nicer class hotels.  I would say it is a good choice for its class.  Everything…

title: The Best Family Suite Ever!
review: Great location but old hotel rooms need to be up dated . Breakfast is served in the bar which is a big turn off . Staff are very nice and help full.  during the day the bar had constant  music bands playing at the weekend and from our room this was a disaster as it was very hard to rest. I am sorry to say but overall we found the hotel  a let down. We booked this hotel from recommendation on web site which does not show true to standards.

title: Not your typical Holiday!
review: This was certainly not our 1st trip to this Holiday Inn, nor will it be our last.  My husband and I actually got married at this resort and we keep going back. The rooms are immaculate, the restaurant has great food, drinks, and atmosphere, and the views are outstanding!  They also have a very nice conference center that was just built in 2009 that is a great spot for wedding receptions or conferences.  After having priced out several of the resorts on the beach to have our wedding at, this Holiday Inn was significantly less expensive than similar places for the same service, food, etc.  In sum, we will continue to stay at this resort every time we stay at Clearwater Beach.  Many of the folks that came to our wedding have come back to Clearwater Beach on vacation and stay at…

title: Wonderful time, would definitely stay here again
review: We arrived July 26th to find our two rooms had been upgraded due to my husbands medallion status. Our rooms had a fridge micowave, extra sink and coffeemaker, utensils, plates bowls etc. I guess it is a mini suite. It is wonderful.  The hotel itself is stuffy in the hallways but the rooms are nice and cold, the place is clean, nice hotel pool, well kepts, and pool bar.  Jimmys fishhouse and iguana bar serves nice mix of food,8-20 dollar items but kids eat free.The beach is about two blocks down. We drove due to a bad foot. Bring a credit card to pay for parking at the beach daily as that is how it is done here in the pay kiosks. There are umbrellas to rent if so desire and restrooms. Stores and places to eat across the street. walk further down about a mile total from the hotel …

title: Decent Hotel
review: I had business in Tampa and a friend suggested that my colleagues and I stay in Clearwater, in order to be near the water.  We found a government rate at this hotel and got it.  The hotel is fine.  It's a Holiday Inn.  Nothing fancy, nothing horrible.  My room was decent.  The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was newly remodeled.  I had a basic room with a view but no balcony.  The carpet needs updating.  It seems to ver a very family friendly hotel.  It was close to the beach, but not right on it.  I jogged to it with no trouble at all.

title: Fantastic!  We will definitely be back.
review: This hotel is wonderful!  We stayed in a kid's suite and loved it.  Great views, great beach, great pool, great restaurant, and the list goes on and on.  This one is a winner.

title: LOVED LOVED LOVED this hotel
review: All the staff was super friendly, the resturant had great food, and the pool was so nice.  The view from our room was amazing.  We had a balcony which overlooked the water and the resturant.  We loved opening our door and listening to the live music from the resturant as we were getting ready to go out for the night.  The room was very clean.  No complaints.

title: Very Nice!
review: My wife and I stayed here for three nights while visiting family near by. We loved it! Our suite on the 4th floor over looked the Gulf. The room was perfect. Our room as I said was on the 4th floor in tower 1 over the bar. We could see (from our balconey)and hear the music that played live every night just below us from the bar. It was never to loud and over by ten or eleven.The pool was just fine, we were always able to find chairs for relaxing. You can walk to Clearwater beach in 3 or 4 minutes if you want. the hotel has a very small piece of beach which is perfect if you want quiet time. The restraunt/bar on site has an outside patio were we had breakfast every morning looking out at the Gulf. All the staff were very nice. Only negative was paying $12 a night for parking. We…

title: Better View from the Parking Lot!
review: I felt my room description was misleading - I booked and paid a premium for a Gulf Front Room, to enjoy the "spectacular view of the Gulf" from my private balcony. What I got was a spectacular view of the pool from the 2nd floor room, with kids and drunks staring up into my room. Since the pool is open till 11 I couldn't get to sleep until midnite.  I could barely see the gulf over the pool, and my kids couldn't see it at all. When I went to talk to the front desk about getting a room where I could see the gulf, she explained very rudely that they were booked up and we were stuck there. I then politely said I considered my room a "Pool Front Room" and not a "Gulf Front Room" and asked for a discount, and she became even more rude and said "that's the gulf past the pool so it's a…

title: Nice hotel with clean room and good locale...
review: I stayed here recently with my mother,daughter and 3 nephews. The suites are very large ( 2 rooms) to be exact. This is a good hotel for a family as there is a kitchenette area with a microwave and small fridge.  The hotel is not exactly on the beach, but within close walking proximity. The rooms are clean, and there are many restaurants within walking distance.  Mc Donald's, Ihop, and a cheap Italian restaurant with good food named Gondola.. The hotel advertises kids under 12 eat free; however by the time you pay the 18% service charge, the kids are not really free... Pool area was crowded everyday and of decent size. Yes, there is a charge for parking $12 a day, but its better than the $35 you can pay in Miami and Fort Lauderdale.... The beach was great, calm, and clean, and…

title: Nice Hotel..but Bad Experience...
review: We are a Platinum Rewards Club member.  When we went to our room, it was right by the pool area on the first floor- our patio was literally the pool deck!  We asked for another room and were given a gorgeous room!  It was really nice, only thing it was 85 degrees in there.  It continued to be hot, and finally we called to see if we could get a fan, and were told that the air is energy efficient.  They said it is motion detected and if there is no motion in the room it shuts off.  So we figured it would cool off - wrong! - we slept all night sweating at 81 degrees.  We decided the next day to leave and go somewhere else.  They couldn't put our points immediately back in, so we paid out of pocket for the next Holiday Inn.  By the way, it says "right on Clearwater…

title: Had a fabulous time here & already miss it!
review: I booked a package deal through Allegiant Air & after reading quite possibly hundreds of reviews on hotels I decided on the Holiday Inn and Suites.  I read so many positive reviews on them & even called them a couple of times prior to booking.  They were always very friendly and helpful over the phone.  I finally purchased our vacation package and crossed my fingers that getting such a great deal would not get me a tiny, no view room that would make me regret finding this bargain.   I knew the moment we walked into our room that I made a wise choice.  We checked in July 3rd & stayed 4 nights.  The hotel was busy & all booked up due to the holiday, but Charles still made time to explain their Priority Club, which allowed us a late check-out & worked great since we had a late…

title: Will Recommend This Place
review: The hotel was very nice.  The property was well maintained and the rooms were as well.  The beds were super comfy and the pillows were awesome (they provided both soft and firm pillows).  The bathrooms were the best I've seen in a hotel and the complimentary shampoo/conditioner were Bath & Body Works!  The scent was lime coconut which smelled sooo good!  The pool area was nice and featured a kiddie pool and a regular pool that boasted an 8 foot depth.  It's located right on the beach and is adjoined to an in-house restaurant that offers live music every night.  I would definitely recommend this place!    The only downside (for me) is that there aren't many fast food places nearby...the majority of the eating establishments are sit down dining.

title: Hats off to holiday inn clearwater beach!
review: We are so pleased to learn you enjoyed yoyur stay with us (and our Bath & Beyond products)!  Thank you so much for taking the time to review us.  We are happy you had good weather and a chance to enjoy our facilities and neighboring areas.  You are right - we have more independent restaurants than fast food, but next time, as, our front desk and they can make recommendations.  We hope you'll be able to visit again soon - meanwhile, if  you're on Facebook, check us out as Holiday Inn Clearwater Beach.  Thanks again!  Christine Bottger, GM.

title: Nice hotel and area for a short trip.
review: We came to holiday inn in clearwater and let me start off by saying clearwater beach florida is a beautiful place! We arrived 2 hours before check in and the front desk allowed us to check in early. The hotel was beautiful and well maintained, our room was great and the housekeeping went above and beyond to keep our room clean. The pool area was nice and my family enjoyed swimming with a gorgeous view of the gulf. The restaurant jimmys was a little bit pricey but it was nice atmosphere also. This hotel is close to the beach and pier 60 which was great for my family. I enjoyed my stay and the next time I visit clearwater i will definetly stay here again!!!

title: Not a good experience
review: Thank you for writing such a great review about our property!  We are so pleased you and your family enjoyed your stay here!!  As you can see, we have a great destination and so much to do - you'll have to come back soon to explore more!  If you are on Facebook, we invite you to become a fan so we can keep you informed.  And...if you have photos of your stay you'd  like to share, we would welcome them!  Thanks again and have a great summer!   Christine Bottger, G.M.

title: Great Hotel
review: Hotel:  We had a pleasant 2 night stay which was just enough.  We arrived on a Sunday at about 2 pm and were given a room immediately.  The 2 receptionists were polite and one informed me that kids 12 and under eat for free at their restaurant.  This would have been a plus, but we never ate there.  We had a double-queen, city-view room on the top floor which was great and so was the view.  We could still see the beach from our balcony!  Room was clean and smelled fresh.  The bathroom was also clean and fully stocked with toiletries.  Be sure to ask for extra bath towels if you are a family of 4 - seems the norm is to leave 3.  I asked a cleaning lady that happened to be on our floor for an extra towel and she was very nice and gave me 2.  The only complaint I have about the room…

title: Pleasant Experience
review: This was my second visit in a year and the condition of the hallways and common areas of the property have become a bit shabby. Hallway carpet is tattered and paint is worn. The elevator bumps along in the hotel and the elevator in the Duval center broke on the last day of our conference. That said, my room was clean and adequate, complete with a towel animal on the bed and a sound machine with the ocean and seagulls playing. A tasty breakfast was provided each day as part of our conference in the Duval conference building and a satisfactory lunch was served in the hotel. Sunset cocktails were enjoyed at the bar overlooking the water. The staff is hardworking and eager to please. There is much to do in the immediate vicinity.

title: Short get away for a birthday to relax
review: Nice place! Not on the beach but on the channel. Beautiful view while we enjoyed dinner and then some time in the pool. We watched dolphin and manatee swim by. Room was very nice, marble counter tops in the kitchenette and bathroom. Comfortable beds with nice linens and plump and soft towels that smelled nice. There's a parking fee. It's a short distance to the beach and pier. It was just the ticket for a short stay for us. Would go back again.

title: Anniversary Vacation!
review: My husband and I stayed at the Holiday Inn for our 1 year wedding anniversary.  This was a last minute trip after not being able to get an all inclusive in the Caribbean and Mexico.  The hotel staff was really nice and helpful.  I can’t say enough nice things about the staff and how accommodating they are.  There was one staff member that was so helpful, but I can’t remember her name! :(  The room was very spacious with a king size bed, fridge, sink and microwave.  The hotel looked over the Gulf.  We did see dolphins.  We also went jet skiing.  We flew into the Tampa airport which was only about a half hour drive to Clearwater Beach.  We also visited St. Pete’s which was also about a half hour drive.   We spent half of our day at the beach which was a 5 minute walk from the…

title: Loved It From Start to Finish
review: Upgraded upon check-in (a pleasurable experience) to a suite; balcony overlooked parking lot, but we could see the Gulf also, BEAUTIFUL!!!  We were here for 8 days, 7 nights (May 29-June 6) and couldn't have been happier - food, excellent; bar, excellent; evening entertainment to compliment the beautiful sunsets - WOW!!!  We just sat back and relaxed, just what we needed.    I just noticed one thing, during the weekends the pool is so crowded, there isn't room for the guests and how do you know that all people are guests of the hotel???  However, we will be back.  Everyone so nice and we were always greeted with a smile :)!! Thank you for a wonderful vacation!!  Sorry I have forgotten the very nice woman, who we saw every morning in the restaurant, her name - she was WONDERFUL!!…

title: ideally located for the beach
review: We stayed here for a couple of nights whilst holidaying in US, it was a lovely end to our holiday which had been quite busy, skiing followed by 3 nights in Orlando visiting theme parks.  This hotel is ideally located for the beaches of Clearwater. The hotel has a nice pool which we would return to at the end of the day to soak up the last rays of sunshine. We upgraded to rooms with a view of the gulf which was worth it, these rooms were more spacious. The hotel was clean and furnishings of a good standard.  We ate at Jimmys which was an enjoyable meal but we needed a change the next evening, we tried the buffet at the hotel next door which was good value if you have a large appetite but be aware if you arrive late the buffet ends at about 10pm if not before.

title: Nice hotel
review: Pros Located a short walk from Clearwater Beach and surrounding restaurants. Nice, updated rooms and bathrooms. Beautiful views of the water.  Cons Service was hit and miss. Go elsewhere for breakfast if you're pressed for time. Wifi also seemed to be hit and miss. Pool was pretty small and always crowded.

title: Average hotel, service, and amenities with a beach front price
review: We stayed here for a long weekend, booking a number of rooms for a large family get-together. The hotel is well-located in Clearwater Beach, near most of the attractions and major beaches.  The hotel is a little dated, but fairly clean and reasonably well-maintained. We found the layout of the hotel to be maze-like -- it appears that it was built in sections over time and not especially well-integrated. Our room was on the top floor and included a walk-out balcony with a reasonably nice view of the beach and surrounding buildings. The rooms include individual AC units, which are a little noisy, but functional.  Overall, service was prompt and friendly, though not exceptional. We gathered for breakfast each morning on the outside patio, which has a nice view of the ocean. Service…

title: Love this place!!!
review: I went here with four friends and we had such a good time!! Everything is right there! Restaurant, pool, bar.  the Jimmy Iguana bar is the best - great prices!! If my friends didn't want to roam around town, I would have never left the hotel!!! Rooms so clean - people the best! Will definately go back!

title: Best Value on Clearwater Beach by far
review: I hosted 45 people for a conference. I knew the property was newly renovated. The rooms were all in like new condition. The restaurant, "Jimmys" was a big hit with it's views and bar. We used their  "Duvall" room for our meetings. All our breaks were done in the meeting room with the beach in the background. As the host, you want a super responsive front desk and they were all that. Claudia and Tracey kept all their promises. We will be back!

title: Great hotel, definitely be back.....
review: We stayed at the Holiday Inn & Suites, Clearwater Beach on recommendation from trusted friends and we weren't disappointed. The location is excellent, we had a Gulf front Suite which had unobstructed views across the Gulf of Mexico. The Hotel isn't the most modern, luxurious place we've ever stayed but where it may have lacked a little in this department it more than made up for it with the friendly easy going atmosphere we experienced throughout our stay which, from our point of view is just as important.... We checked in late Friday evening after a long journey from the UK and the receptionist could not have been more friendly / helpful. I have to agree with other reviewers however and say that the reception staff during the day were not a patch on those manning the desk in…

title: Great Place to Vacation!
review: This hotel is in a great location. Rooms are very nice with a flat screen tv. Check in and check out was a breeze. Front desk staff is very nice and a special thanks to Patty who was friendly, courteous, and very helpful! It's a great place for families. The pool area is gorgeous and right next to the water! The beach is just a 5 minute walk away.Good restaurants are within walking distance. Pier 60 is a fun place around sunset with music, magicians, entertainers, and vendors.Buses and the Trolley make getting around easy! I will stay here again on my next trip to Clearwater Beach!

title: A good recovery means we will be back
review: Our stay started out a little rough with a couple of rooms that didn't meet our expectations for cleanliness.  However, after a discussion with the front desk and a posting on Facebook, they were quick to resolve our issues and make us feel like it was important that they resolve things in a way that made us happy.  In the end we were pleased with the way things worked out and plan to make a return visit to this hotel.  We stayed for six nights -- May 16-22.  We loved the pool area and especially the lower deck for sunning.  There have been a lot of posts, both good and bad, about the hotel being ocean front but no beach access.  We found the gulf splashing up against the wall of the lower deck to be quite delightful.  We saw dolphins playing every day we were  there and saw a…

title: HOLIDAY INN CLEARWATER, FLORIDA.
review: We stayed here 12 days in May 2011, great hotel, over looks the gulf of Mexico, rooms nice, very clean, roomy with good facilities, hair shampoo, conditioner, soap, body cream, all complimentary, towels and sheets changed daily. Restaurant live music nightly, cafe, hair salon, free internet, ( very slow ), launderette, gift shop, arcade (very old fashioned) old gaming arcade 70s, Pool, poolside bar, free towels, sunloungers, very good along side the sea, parking $12 a night + tax, not assured a parking space if you move, free safe at reception, good choice of channels on the TV, fridge and microwave in your room, free ice on all landings + drinks and snack machines at reasonable prices,we had a balcony with table and chairs,  there is a gym. The negatives are  the parking as…

title: Will find something else next time...
review: The good:   Front lobby staff is friendly,  maintenance came quickly to resolve an issue and was very friendly, the pool and kids pool is great for families, the restaurant has decent food. The bad: the whole layout of hotel is weird.  Everyone going to the pool or the beach has to walk through the lobby wet and in swim attire.  Gives a trashy feel to the hotel and makes for a hot sandy lobby and elevator.   The staff has to haul trash and other " back of the house"  things on the main elevator also.  Like I said, gives a trashy feel to the hotel.  The cleaning staff was talking so loudly in the hallway and woke my daughter from her nap.  And she was sleeping with a sound machine!  Very unprofessional.  The small details make the hotel seem run down; the lock on our door wasn't…

title: Amazing place to stay!!!!
review: My husband and I spent 6 nights here and had a wonderful time! Its a great location, within walking distance to almost everything to do here at the beach. Every day the housekeeping  came in and changed the sheets and cleaned up! The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room overlooked the pool and the gulf, so we had a beautiful view!! We were not disappointed at all and we will stay here again!!

title: 1st Class stay right on the Gulf -
review: I brought my two girls (18 and 28) down for a vacation and chose Clearwater Beach on May 22nd. From St. Petersburg - Clearwater International Airport (PIE) we rented a car from Dollar and drove about 12 miles to the Holiday Inn. It took about 20 minutes and was a very easy drive. We used our GPS on our phones and got there with no problems. There was plenty of parking and got booked into our rooms right away. The front desk staff were friendly and courteous even though they were very busy. We got to our room and dropped the bags and the girls were off to the pool. Our room wasn't Gulf View and when I saw the view from the pool and that we were right on the Gulf and went to the front desk and upgraded our room to Gulf View for $75 more a night. This included a suite (Now were…

title: Fabulous location - Great Hotel
review: Stayed in this hotel for 7 nights, cant praise it enough. Didnt really know what to expect as there were some reviews which gave a negitive slant, however i would definately visit here again, The location was one of the best in the area, and being set at the entrance to the intercostal waterway, we saw Dolphins and Manatee! swim up and down each day. The hotel is clean and great value for money. Plenty of shops and restaurants within a 5 minute walking distance, and hotel has a great waterfront restaurant and Bar.

title: Priority Club Upgrades - not here!
review: This was our 4th visit using PC points and I have to say that EVERYother IHG hotel in Florida has no problem upgrading it's PC guests for FREE to suites, executive level, ocean view and free parking etc etc but not HI Clearwater? Even though the hotel was less than half full and it was midweek a water view room cost an extra $40 per night along with $12 parking per day. So our 2 'free nights' cost over a $100? I should add that I was given a free drink voucher for 1 drink (we tossed a coin to see who would get it..lol) On PC 'free nights' we always make a point of having a meal or two and a few drinks in the hotel and spending a few bucks.. but not here simply as a point of principle.  The Post Corner restaurant a couple of minutes away does a great breakfast anyway.  Can I…

title: Perfect Location and Clean as can bee!
review: From the bed being made differently each day to the perfect sunset views, this hotel was perfect for our recent vacation to Clearwater Beach, FL. The hotel is located right at the corner of the ocean and inlet facing south which makes it a wonderful place to view everything coming and going including lots of dolphin.  Also, the way in which the hotel faces, the late afternoon sun does not beat down into the rooms so they stayed nice and cool but still allowed for beautiful sunset pictures.   Absolutely everything was immaculately clean; everywhere in the hotel.  Our room was quite large with a nice large bathroom too.  Holiday Inns seem to be doing a great job with their bathrooms, allow room to move and soft, comfortable decor.  Since I often have problems at other hotels with…

title: Pleasant hotel, nice location
review: Thank you so much for taking time to review our hotel!  We're so pleased you found most everything to your liking!     Coming from Georgia, I hope you watch out for deals and specials throughout the year so you can become one of our valued repeat customers.  In the meantime, if you are on social media, we do have a Facebook page:  Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Clearwater Beach.  Thank you again!  It means a lot to our entire staff when then know a customer has a pleasant stay!  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Not Impressed::::::::::::::::
review: After being in traffic for an hour to get in the Island, very frustrated and hungry with teenage children, The front desk girl says in a very rude voice, yea well you think you had a hard day? Try checking in all these guest! Kris or Krissy try getting a job you like, Your not paid to be rude and give evil looks to the guest and throwing your pen when we have question, Every time I asked a question she would say Mam. Mam would you please let me speak, Then the other girl Jane came over and helped and Kris walked away, Our room was very nice, gulf front suite,  Restaurant to expensive, We were there for 6 nights, Did enjoy our stay, Pool side people very nice, Nice guy in parking, He was from Michigan like we are. Night time front desk AWESOME so very nice. Helped with dinner…

title: Clean rooms, great view
review: Stayed two nights and the hotel is very clean and the room was nice. I had a gulf view room which was great. The hotel is right on the gulf but the beach is about a two-three minute walk. Large pool area that is connected to the outside seating area for the restaurant. The food was pretty decent and the band at night was outstanding. The service at the restaurant seemed slow but that is really the only slightly negative I had. Plenty of places to eat and listen to music in walking distance. They do charge guest’s $12 a night to park and I don’t really understand this. Hey, I’m already paying a bunch of money for the room so let me park for free!

title: Brilliant Location - want to return !
review: A great hotel - we had a sea view family room which was fab, clean and spacious - I think it would make a big difference if you were at the rear of the hotel so seriously consider the upgrade !   Jimmy's bar / restaurant was really enjoyable & good value.  Hotel overlooks sea but no direct beach, however the beach is only 2 minutes walk away on safe pavements.  Fantastic white sand. We saw dolphins (from hotel room looking out to sea) on many occasions. Pool was great with plenty of loungers. Parking is $12 for guests. Staff were friendly. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel but found local places with ease.  Walk to Pier 60 is about 15 mins slow pace - worth going before sunset to see craft sales & artists performing.  We also went on small boat (little toot) dolphin watching…

title: kinda kid friendly
review: Thank you so much for taking the time to write about your recent stay here at Holiday Inn Clearwater Beach!  We love knowing our UK friends have had a great stay here!   Glad you liked your room, Jimmy's, Little Toot and Pier 60.  I'm sure you have found other places you didn't have time for - so hope you and your family can come back again!  Thanks so much again!  Christine Bottger, General Manager

title: Great Experience
review: This vacation was for 2 adults and 2 kids (ages 6 and 8) we stayed for 6 days.  We got a kids suite- which was fantastic with lots of room- but was described as having a "private balcony with views of the intercoastal waterway" which is really code for "trash cans, roof with satallite dishes and parking lot" view.  There are no views of any water from any room labeled like this, they all view an adjacent buiding.  No kids suites have ocean front views.   Ocean front rooms will enjoy a very loud sound system playing during the dinner hours below on the resturaunt patio.  The room was clean but  the king bed was very soft and had divots in it where bodies usually lay.  The sofa sleeper in the living room was old and sagging in the middle, actually having staples exposed along the…

title: Really enjoyed our stay
review: My Sister booked The Holiday Inn in Clearwater last week as we were in the area for a family function.  Here is the run down:  Parking:  It's $12 a day-I can see why.  It's location is key and the hotel will allow non-customers to park there for $20 a day.  We never had an issue finding a parking spot, but I could see in busier times how this could be a problem.    Room:  We arrived a little early, and the office was kind enough to grant us early check-in.  In addition, they upgraded our room.  This room was great!  We were on the sixth floor, and on the very end so we had gorgeous views of the Gulf from the side window and sliding door.  The beds and linens were very nice.  We checked to make sure there were no signs of bed bugs, and there were none.  We also had a little…

title: Holiday Inn suites
review: Stayed here for 2 nights during a recent trip to Florida. rooms were very nice and location is GREAT with the main beach 1/2 block away. There are several olaces to eat and drink ALL within walking distance.  Here are a few spots I suggest: Jimmy Fish house Iguana bar ( in hotel ) Bait House ( on the Pier at turnaround 3 blocks away ) Crabbys Frenchys ( 4 locations in area ) Post Common ( great breakfast )  Jimmys has a great Prime rib dinner, also try the crabcake rueban sandwich  Drink specials are at the bar at Jimmys but not at the pool bar ( MAKE NOTE OF THIS )  We will be back for sure

title: Would definitely stay again.
review: We were extremely pleased with the quality of this Hotel accomodation. Our room on the top floor on the Gulf side had an amazing view, was bright and clean and updated. It was wonderful to go to sleep to the waves hitting the wall of the lounge deck below and the live entertainment nightly from the attached restaurant. The pool was clean and it was a short walk to the beach, only a few minutes more to Pier 60, which has nightly Street Theatre for entertainment of  all ages. Great Location. Great Service. Great Sunsets.

title: DISAPPOINTING
review: I was a little disappointed with this hotel.  I just couldn’t seem to bond with it.  On arrival we weren’t really met with great smile from the younger two Reception girls.  One was on the phone and appeared to be having words with a pending customer.  Then afterwards they were complaining to each other.  Anyway the four of us, 2 Adults, and 2 older Teenagers were shown to the rooms.  I had requested a quiet room earlier and they had a note of this.  She did say she had tried her bests but rooms were limited with the type of accommodation we had booked.  When we arrived at our room we found we had no large bath towels, there were ample flannels and small hand towels. We requested some more but after 3 hours they hadn’t arrived so we had to ring again.  This bath towel problem…

title: Read if you have young children
review: A lot of reviews out there, and everyone has an opinion, but here is our review. We traveled from Michigan to Clearwater (my wife, myself and our two boys - 10 & 7). The hotel was clean and rooms were nice. Pool - The pool was excellent for the boys. It was heated, although the 'shallow' end was not your typical depth. It was 4.5 feet. If your kids can swim, it would not be an issue, but if you have real little ones, you would have to hold them or have a floatation device. Pool was very nice though. Tiki bar located right next to pool and chairs surround the pool. Chairs get 'taken up' early, so if you want a chair by the pool during the day, you'd better get down there in the morning. Restaurant was nice and food was good. Kids eat free (in restaurant) if an adult orders an…

title: Great Hotel - Can't wait to go back with the kids!!
review: My husband and I were looking for a quick weekend getaway without the kids where we were close enough to fly back home in a hurry.  We love the Clearwater area and some of the hotel prices are ridiculous.  We happened to come upon the hotel's website and decided to give it a try.  This hotel was great!  Upon check in, the staff was so friendly and to top it off, we were upgraded to a suite and given a voucher for 2 free drinks at Jimmy's.  We got up to our room and couldn't be happier.  Very clean, modern and spacious.  The pool area was great.  There were plenty of chairs by the pool as well as a patio of lounge chairs that overlook the Gulf.  Also, 2 cabana's are available for rental.  Jimmy's was great.  I had read many reviews on this site so was a little leary but once…

title: Outstanding!!
review: This is one fantastic hotel. I have traveled all over the world and the staff and attention to detail are amazing. Security patrols at night through out the property are seamless. Just watched two guards escort a guy to his car and made sure he left at midnight while most of the guests were sleeping. He must have been a real problem because the guests are free to have a great time and they don't go overboard with rules and regulations. Jimmy's Fish House totally sucks though. DON'T eat there. WAY overpriced and mostly inedible. Many great restaurants near by with food you can actually eat at a third of the price. Even fine dining at half the price. Island Way Grill for example. My wife and I spent $80.00 on a meal we couldn't even eat at Jimmy's. IT'S THAT BAD!!!

title: Great place to stay in Clearwater Beach.
review: My only complaint here was the parking fee. They also rent out parking places for a fee if you drive in to the beach. I can see why they would charge non-guests, but not if you're staying there. We ordered breakfast in the room and it was very good. They don't have a beach on property so we hung around the pool, which was nice.

title: Big Disappointment!! Left Early...
review: We stayed at five hotels during our trip and this was the worst. I called at 2pm and asked if we could check in early or use the parking lot because we had been sitting in traffic almost two hours. The front desk person (Christin) huffed "Traffic is bad for everyone!!" Then when we did arrive at the hotel I overheard her being incredibly rude to the cleaning staff on the phone. I was appalled...and a bit surprised.       We proceeded to our room with a "bay view". The whole back side of the building overlooks a parking garage and airconditioner units. We couldn't even sit outside because of the heat and sound.The pool view rooms would have probably been descent. The pool area has a nice view of the water. There is no beach at the hotel you have to walk down the strip a few…

title: Great spring training location
review: My sister and I (both over 50) spent 3 nights here for a quick winter getaway to Phillies spring training.  We were upgraded from a gulf view room, to a corner view room w/ a full kitchen about 20 feet from the water.  The room was large, comfy and away from things like the elevator and ice machine.  (it was over the music area outside the bar, but they stopped playing each night by 11 pm).  Everyone from the front desk to maid were helpful and did a great job w/ any requests.  The location was ideal if you wanted waterfront and baseball (Bright House field was only about 20 mins away)   I am looking forward to going back next year and taking my daughter.

title: Excellent, excellent, excellent
review: This was my best trip to Florida to date.  This hotel offers everything a person could ask for.  Tiki bar by the pool overlooking the gulf, restaurant/lounge which offered delicious food at a (relatively) decent price (including a breakfast buffet every morning), outside entertainment every night, and a friendly staff.  Our rooms were so nice and housekeeping did a great job every day we were there.  There is a game room attached to the pool so my teenage son was thrilled.  Video games are available in the room for a fee for those who have teenagers.  Plenty of things to do within walking distance.  There is a nightclub next door (too young for my tastes), gas station across the street, Walgreens just a short walk, and tons of restaurants/surf shops within walking distance of…

title: Great stay.. one drawback
review: Our room and view was absolutely wonderful! I was pleasantly surprised with the amount of chairs by the pool and the great pool. The main thing that kind of irked me was the service at Jimmy's. Don't get me wrong, the food was great and I was especially happy with the breakfast buffet. However, the wait times for food were HORRIBLE, surprisingly even when the restaurant was seemingly empty. It seemed like many of the serving staff had a terrible attitude as well. It is sad because the all of the staff within the hotel were very helpful and extremely polite.. the restaurant needs to strive to hire more like them. Overall, I am happy with the stay and will definitely stay there again.. just might venture out more for food.

title: Wonderful First Family Visit to Clearwater Beach
review: We decided to take a mini getaway during February break for the first time this year.  The lousy cold and snowy winter in the northeast was getting too much for us! My husband is a priority club Platinum member, and we read great reviews so we decided to stay here. What a great time...  we got upgraded to a spacious suite upon check in, which was wonderful!  The staff was very friendly, the weather was spectacular, and we saw a few dolphins in the Gulf on the first morning that we woke up. The beach is an easy 10 minute walk ... very doable with our two sons ages 6 and 9. The sunsets here are incredible.  The beach itself was clean and gorgeous, with some of the finest sand we ever seen. Definately walk to the end of Pier 60, the views are awesome! Jimmy's restaurant  at the…

title: Wow!! Great hotel in a great location at the right price!
review: We are so pleased to read you enjoyed your escape from the Boston winters!  (been there, done that, and moved here to escape it!)   Thanks so much for taking the time to write us.  We hope you'll be like many of our guests and return soon! Enjoy springtime in Boston - come on back and catch the BoSox playing our Tampa Bay Rays!

title: Great place to stay for spring training
review: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for our recent trip to Clearwater Beach for the Phillies spring training.  We were traveling on a budget but also did not want to sacrifice satyaing at a nice place to save a few dollars. We felt that the Holiday Inn delivered and we were surprised how nice the hotel was considering we did not spend top dollar.  The location was great!  We were right on the beach and felt like we could jump in the Gulf from our hotel balcony.  We paid a little more for the gulf front room but it was well worth it.  We saw dolphins swimming by several times a day and even saw sting rays in the water one morning.  Really cool stuff!!!  Our room was plenty big and very clean.  The lobby was beautiful and the hotel staff could not have been more friendly and…

title: Best stay in Clearwater Beach
review: Last Year we stayed at the Holiday Inn in January and had a great time.  This time we went at the end of February and had much warmer weather.  It was clear and sunny with a high of about 80 each day.  We again booked a gulf view king room, but this time stayed in tower 2 on the 3rd floor.  This trip the outdoor dining and entertainment was available.  We ate at Jimmy's Fish house several times and had a very good experience. The food and service was great.  They have live entertainment until 11:00 PM each night which we enjoyed very much.  The acoustic bounce of the space in front of the hotel were such that we also could enjoy the music from our balcony, even though we were more than 300 feet away from the stage.  If you are interested in that we were on the third floor at the…

title: Great hotel and location.
review: Oh, how nice of you to take time to review our hotel and add photos and memories of your visit here from Minneapolis!  We hope you enjoyed the break in winter weather and soaked up the sunshine!  There is always something new and exciting to do in Clearwater, so we hope you will become one of our regulars and return as soon as you can!    Have a wonderful springtime and thank you again!  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Pleasant experience
review: The Holiday Inn has a great location - near surf shops, restaurants, a very short walk to the beach and a slightly longer one to PIer 60.  The real strip on Mandalay Blvd is about 3/4 of a mile away with more dining and shops.  The hotel pool is nice, with lots of pool chairs, and there's also a very nice sun deck away from the pools and kids.  The restaurant has reasonably priced, tasty food.  The hotel staff was very polite, and energetic.   The bed was one of the most comfortable I've been in.  The only drawback was that the fitness center was very small, with all machines - no free weights.  All told, however, it's good home base for a relaxing vacation.

title: lovely view and spacious comfortable room
review: Carmen!  We are delighted that you took time to write and compliment our hotel!  Thank you!  And, we are happy to know you enjoyed your stay and found our staff pleasing to you.    We love it when guests from the North can escape the winter weather and experience a bit of sunshine, so we hope you'll become one of our regular "guest family" and come back soon!  In the meantime, if you are on Facebook, stay in touch with us at  Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Clearwater Beach.  All the best -  Christine Bottger Holiday Inn Clearwater Beach

title: Nice hotel but NO extras
review: My friend and I stayed at the Holiday Inn on Clearwater Beach for 2 nights in February.  The first night was fine – the room was relatively nice and the beds were comfortable and clean.  The balcony overlooked the parking lot.  For the second night, we decided to upgrade to a gulfview room.  At an extra $40 per night, this was a big investment, but it made our so-so experience amazing.  The view was fantastic and we had a lovely balcony.    The location of the hotel was good.  As others have mentioned, it’s literally a five minute walk to the beach.  It is right next door to Sheppard’s, which had a good live band at their outdoor tiki bar.  It was also a pleasant walk (about 1.5 miles down the beach) to some excellent restaurants.  We did not eat at the hotel, so I can’t speak…

title: AMAZING!!!!!
review: We got in on a Saturday night and had upgraded to a gulf front room.  However, our room overlooked the pool house and tiki bar and we couldn't see much of the gulf.  We asked if we could be moved to a higher room and with no hesitation we were the next morning.  The staff is top notch and all the gals at the front desk were super sweet to us.  The restaurant/bar is a great place with super food and service!  I would recommend to anyone!!!

title: Awesome Gulf View Suite
review: I stayed here for three days before a cruise.  Got the gulfview suite and it was awesome...beautiful balcony overlooking water.  There is no beach here but the pool is very nice and the beach is about a block away. We didn't have a car and were able to walk for food, drug store, etc.  The restaurant at the hotel has good food but the service was slow.  I dont know what the other rooms are like at this hotel but i highly recommend the gulfview suite if you can swing it.

title: Truth = It is very good. Great location, great restaurant / bar. No Beach.
review: Buffy, thank you so much for taking time to review our property!  We love visitors from Michigan - they always get so excited at being in the sun and by the beach!   Glad you had time to explore how many fun things to do within walking distance - or the trolley!  If you are into social media, we'd love to have you become a follower of:  Clearwater Beach Hotel & Suites.  Thanks, and please remember - we love repeat customers!     All the best...  Christine Bottger Holiday Inn Clearwater Beach

title: Great location
review: Sometimes it's hard to decide on a hotel when you read reviews.  Someone is always unhappy  about the towels being too stiff or the person at the front deck didn't kiss their butt enough.  Things that matter to me most are: cleanliness, location and a good bar / restaurant. This hotel had all of that.  I was there on business so I didn't take advantage of the pool area but it looked great. This hotel is waterfront but doesn't have a beach.  It's basically a concrete bulkhead on the water. I totally recommend it.

title: Very surprised and disappointed
