review: We are so pleased you enjoyed your stay, despite the fact it was a business trip and you couldn't have time to enjoy all our venues.  Hope you'll come back soon!  We do appreciate that you took the time to review us - it makes our staff so happy to know they've served our customers well.  Hope to see you back here for a leisure visit!  Thanks again, Christine Bottgher, G.M.

title: Beautiful view of the Gulf
review: We stayed at the Holiday Inn at Clearwater Beach during the Thanksgiving week-end and were quite satisfied. The room looked new, was spacious, clean, with green plants (!) and with a oceanfront view, and what a view – the sunset was just spectacular! We enjoyed the sunset from our balcony, before we had a good meal at the outdoor dining at Jimmy's Fishhouse. We tried the restaurant for both breakfast, lunch and dinner, and the staff was very friendly, the food great and the portions were large at every meal. The hotel itself does not have a private beach, but it is only a 5 minute walk along a nice walkway to reach it. One night we went out to a nice Italian restaurant, just a 10 minute walk from the hotel. I loved that you could walk everywhere, not depending on a car. Paying…

title: Good stay on the coldest night in Clearwater
review: Thank you so much, Emma, for taking time to review our hotel!  We're so pleased you chose to stay with us and had a wonderful time -- and you travelled all the way from Oslo!    Indeed, our sunsets are spectacular and even we never tire of watching them - nor of watching the dolphin out on the Gulf waters.  We hope you'll be a repeat guest and come back soon!  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger, General Manager

title: Beautiful hotel on beautiful beach
review: Great location this - overlooking the sea and near to one of the world's best beaches.  We were staying in Orlanod for the week and decided to have a holiday within the holiday and drive down to Clearwater Beach, one of our favourite locations in Florida, so we could stop at Busch Gardens on the way back.  Unfortunately this was one of the coldest nights ever in central florida so there were no walks on the beach watching the sunset.  The following morning bulldozers like snowploughs were clearing the sand from the road.  The hotel is lovely - clean, well equipped, nice spacious room overlooking the Gulf of Mexico and the hotel pool.    Only beef - why charge for parking in a hotel car park?  I know they want to deter non residents from parking there whilst they visit the beach…

title: Nice Stay
review: Thank you so much for taking the time to review our hotel!  We love our U.K. guests!  We're so sorry your visit was on the coldest day in December!  We who live here don't like the cold weather either!    We are so pleased you took time from your Orlando holiday to come to Clearwater Beach - and we hope you'll be able to return again when the weather is milder.  Kind regards,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Beautiful views, excellent service.
review: We stayed at this restaurant for five nights and had a blast. We had an oceanview room on the ninth floor with balcony and the views were absolutely amazing. The sunset at night is absolutely gorgeous!! We had the best view in town! There was no point in riding the sunset boats since we had the luxury of seeing it from our own room. You're only about a five minute walk from clearwater beach and the pier. Very relaxing area, but not very much to do around the area. Bars are a little lame. Its about a 45 min ride to Tampa.

title: quiet location great pool and view of the Gulf
review: rooms very clean, we tried to upgrade to a gult view room but they were an extra 60 dollars per night so didnt bother.  Great location for the beach just a few mins walk and the beach was fantastic. Free internet/computer use in reception which kept our teenage daughter entertained for a while.  Would recommed the hotel food but ask for the sunset special menu in the evening 3 courses for 12 dollars well worth the money would definately go back to this hotel

title: Relax, you're on the Gulf!
review: Thank you so much for taking time to share your experiences!  We are so pleased you had an enjoyable stay here -- for sure, the weather cooperated!  We love our British friends and hopefully will have the pleasure of seeing you return again.  If you are on Facebook, we'd love to keep you updated!  We're at:  Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites - Clearwater Beach.  Many thanks again and we hope you have a wonderful Holiday season!  Claudia Huber Director of Sales and Marketing

title: Great Stay and Ideal Location.
review: Stayed here in Jan 2010 for 5 days and liked it so much we're booking again for Jan 2011. 5th floor room overlooking the pool and the Gulf was fantastic and we spent the early evening sat on the balcony with a couple of pre dinner bloody marys watching the sun go down. Heaven Ate in the restaurant once and ate at the bar once, both excellent.  Staff were all friendly and helpful Plentiful towels for the pool Overall a wonderful peaceful and chilled out stay (Don't know if it's like that in summer as I've heard Shepherds next door can be a bit noisy ) Within easy reach of Clearwater & Tampa it's just a great place to relax in the winter sun!! See you in Jan!! (only thumbs down is $12 parking charge)

title: Very satisfactory experience
review: Had a room overlooking the bay which was fantastic.  Room had recently been remodelled so was fresh and new.  Balcony was great for relaxing and watching the boats and an occassional dolphin.  Ate several times in the restauarant and the food was good, huge portions.  Excellent location, close to the beach and a short walk to restaurants and the pier.  Only downside was there was no safe in the room but safety deposit boxes were available at reception.

title: Hidden Gem of Clearwater!
review: Friendly & helpful staff, clean rooms & facility, good location.  Small problem with jammed lock on sliding door to balcony was fixed within minutes.  There is a very nice pool and patio area overlooking the Gulf but no direct access to sand beach.  Beach access is a five minute walk.  Attractive restaurant and bar.

title: Great location, great rooms
review: We spent our last 2 nights in Florida at Clearwater Beach, and this hotel is very well located. A few hundred yards takes you to the beach areas, and the start of the restaurant areas. We had a large Kidsuite - lounge/dining/kitchen area, with separate bedroom.  The kidsuite is just off the master bedroom, with 2 full size bunk beds.  We even had a balcony with gulf views. The hotel has lovely outdoor areas, but we were disappointed that there weren't any non-smoking areas outside, and we seemed to be surrounded by smokers.  This is advertised as a 100% non-smoking hotel, but this only seems to apply indoors.  We did see dolphins from the terrace area, and spent an afternoon at the pool area, where there were plenty of free beds and towels.

title: great stay
review: Thank you so much for your review of your hotel following your stay with us in October.  We appreciate that you took the time to write.  We can understand your disappointment at encountering smokers outside, but our hotel does comply with local, State and Federal smoking laws and we're sorry if the smokers were bothersome to you.  We hope you'll return to visit us soon, and in the meantime - if you are in to social media, we encourage you to follow us on Twitter:  @ClearwaterBchHI or on Facebook:  Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Clearwater Beach.  Sincerely,  Christine Bottger General Manager

title: Great Location!
review: My wife & I stayed here from 10/05-10/12 & simply loved it. We had a gulf front suite (room 860, 860a) that gave us plenty of room to spread out & relax. We found every member of the staff to be very friendly & informative. We were able to watch dolphins & manatees on a daily basis from our balcony. As other reports have stated the hotel is extremely clean; we watched people scrubbing the pool perimeter daily & straightening the lounges & tables nightly. The pool is heated and we never found it to be crowded. We ate a lot of our meals there as we found the food to be good & reasonably priced. We actually had room service deliver our meals to our suite twice as we watched the gorgeous sunsets. Housekeeping was great and we found towel animals daily. The weather was spectacular,…

title: We could not believe what an amazing time we had.
review: Thank you so much, SuperDan, for the glowing report on our property.  We are so pleased that you and your wife enjoyed it so much.  And...we are glad our dolphins "made the scene" and added to your enjoyment!  We'll look forward to the next time you can come stay with us - and, in the meantime, if you are into social media, we would welcome have you join us on Twitter -- @ClearwaterBchHI or on Facebook:  Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Clearwater Beach.  Again, sincere thanks!  Claudia Huber Director of Sales

title: Very nice hotel  Beautiful Sunset
review: We really enjoyed our stay, and would recommend this property to anyone!  The rooms were clean, comfortable, and modern, and the staff was friendly.  We paid a super budget price of $82 per night through a third party agency, but the hotel staff upgraded us to a partial ocean view room on a high floor.  We didn't even have to ask for the upgrade!  We could see Sand Key beach and the intercoastal from our balcony, and could watch the pirate ship sail out each night.    The bar was great, and we received two comp drink coupons at check in.  The restaurant had a nice atmosphere with a large waterfront outdoor patio, but the food was only average.  There was live music every night, also average, but better than nothing.  The hotel is right on the water, where the intercoastal meets…

title: Great stay at the beach
review: We are not usually fans of Holiday Inn hotels, but decided to give this a try.  The day manager (Tricia) was very nice at check in, and worked with us to find a room with a great view of the water.  This hotel is located on the channel where all the boats go out into the gulf, so there was always activity to watch.  We frequently saw dolphins playing, and even saw several manatees.  It does not have a beach, and guests have to walk up to the public beach area, which is approximately 1/4 mile away.  We knew this already, and had no problem...the sidewalks are clean and wide enough to accommodate, even when carrying beach supplies.      After hours at the beach, we always check out the pool and Holiday Inn has a beautiful area.  Water was clean and inviting, and once again there…

title: Another excellent stay!
review: This was my second stay at the Holiday Inn on Clearwarer beach., the first being in May 2010 for 2 days.  We enioyed the hotel and the area so much that we decided to come back for 4 days this time around.  We had a king bed room with balcony, partial gulf view which was great.  Room was always clean and housekeeping did a great job every day.  The food at Jimmy Iguana's was mostly good, we had at least one meal a day there.  Staff was helpful as always.  The pool was clean, as were the resort grounds.  This is the nicest Holiday Inn property I have stayed at, and I have stayed at quite a few.  This hotel really is a great value.

title: Wish we had stayed longer
review: Stayed here with extended family (6 adults and 4 kids) for 1 night away from the Orlando theme parks in August. I booked 3 rooms on Priority Club points and was pleasantly surprised on arrival to find 2 of these were upgraded to kids suites. The kids suites were huge with 2 bathrooms, living space, kitchen and 2 balconies. Standard room (used by grandparents) was also very comfortable and of a better quality than many UK Holiday Inns. On arrival I was also given a voucher for a free welcome drink, although this was only for me as the PC member.  Pool area was great - clean and well maintained with complementary towels, sun loungers etc.  My only criticism of this hotel would be that one of the children in our party is allergic to tree nuts and the restaurant was unable to advise…

title: Great Location with Friendly, Helpful Staff
review: We spent two nights of our vacation to Florida at this hotel and we were not disappointed. I use Holiday Inns regularly throughout the UK and I can say that this premises was by far the best Holiday Inn I have stayed in. The rooms were very clean and very well equipped, flat screen TV's, air con, tea/cofee etc. The two beds were Queen size and sumptious! The staff were extremely friendly giving us help and advice whenever we needed it. I would definately stay here again. One last tip - visit Crabby Bill's Fish Restaurant, good honest sea food, delicious!

title: Great location & pool. Rooms are clean and comfortable.
review: This hotel is on the water but doesn't have water access. The outside pool and tiki bar are cool and are located right on the water front. The rooms were ok-they were clean and comfy. The staff was also friendly and helpful. Hotel parking is an additional $12 each day. It's about a 5 minute walk to the beach and about 10 minutes to Pier 60. Overall, a pretty good place to stay.

title: Just as amazing as I remembered!!
review: After visiting this hotel last year, my partner and I visited this hotel in early summer. I abusolutly love this place! The staff is so nice, and the rooms are amazing. The atmosphere is so comfortable and inviting. I would come here over and over again if I could! I love the food in the morning and its perfect to sit downstairs at night and listen to the band next to the ocean and have a drink! I will certaintly be back again!!!

title: Hotel would be better if the food was good.
review: I am traveling with wife and children. Rooms are good enough. Restaurant is crap. Our stay would have been much more comfortable with a restaurant that could serve decent food. I had the seared tuna and a "Jimmy Buffet" burger on the first night, to go. I opened the container to find pink tuna steak (medium cooked?) and 3 ounces of wasabi (like somehow that would make up for it!)  The burger, well Mickey D's across the street could have feed 3 for the price. Second night, in the establishment, asked the server if somehow there could have been a mistake with the seared tuna and was promised "a good cut". We ordered the shrimp sampler ($21.00) and seared tuna ($13.00). (EPIC FAIL). Drinks on the house just can not make up for this.

title: Hands down best hotel and restaurant in Clearwater!
review: This hotel was amazing! The rooms were beautiful and clean with an incredible view. Jimmy's Fish House had the most amazing tuna sashimi and seafood gumbo I've ever had. The view from the outside deck was breathtaking and the service was perfect!  I won't stay anywhere else!

title: Best Holiday Inn I've Ever Stayed At
review: My husband and I went down (without reservations) for my son's wedding.  Drove around Clearwater Beach and just pulled in.  Asked reservations if they had any rooms and she gave us keys to look at 2 rooms.  One ocean view and one city view.  My husband picked the city view (for the price).  It was really nice!  They have a beautiful pool and open bar area which was pretty crowded but never felt cramped.  We ate breakfast and lunch at the hotel.  Food was good and reasonably priced.  Ate breakfast with a white crane pretty much each morning.  Beautiful view of the gulf.  I'd go again in a heartbeat!  And, btw, the beach wedding was GORGEOUS!  (Unrelated to the hotel)

title: Great base for a Clearwater beach stay....
review: Hotel was clean and confortable (bed and linen were lovely and comfy) and everything you'd expect for a Holiday Inn.   Good location....just two mins walk to the start of Clearwater beach and everything in the resort is well within walking distance.   Pool was nice although got a little busy, but there is an extra level of sunloungers beside the sea and this was nice as you got a breeze whilst lay there as well as hearing the sound of the waves.  Overall a nice neat hotel, nicely decorated, clean and well located.

title: Nice and neat
review: We spend only two nights. Although we were expecting a beachfront hotel (it's not , but you can see the ocean from your room and the public beach it's one block away) we had a good time. It was clean, confortable and even when we had to pay for the breakfast,  the restaurant was nicely located, close to the canal so you can enjoy the ocean and the pool area.

title: Nice Hotel but a few things to be aware of
review: The hotel overall is very clean and quiet. Their website claims that it is directly on the Gulf.  That is true but don't assume that means beachfront. You will have to walk to the public beach down the street.  Parking anywhere near the beach can be difficult on a nice day if you don't get there early so I suggest that you leave your car at the hotel and walk, you are already paying $12 plus tax per day for parking at this hotel as it is.  Some of the information in their in-room reference folder is incorrect ( prices/ hours of operation) so be sure to ask the front desk just to be sure. I was charged more for a pedicure than the listed price but didn't realize it until later. Yes, there is a salon in this hotel.  Very nice ladies and very accomodating.  Hair, facials,…

title: Quietest Motel we've ever stay in! ALMOST everything we expected.
review: Our three night stay was GREAT, however the hotel is not beach front, just a rock-lined seawall with a nice paver-topped deck. There is no beach access on the property as we determined via Google Earth the on the morning we were to leave for our vacation. The walk to Clearwater Bch is about 10-15 minutes with little ones. The restaurant and lounge are quite nice though. Good food, nice atmosphere, great rum runners (made with a 151 floater just like I like um'). The staff is very helpful and the pool area is maintained meticulously. Oh, just watch out for hungry birds when dining on the open air, waterfront deck, especially during the morning.     The location is conveinent to Walgreens and a conveinence store but it's about 3/4 mile to the pier, overall our stay was perfect,…

title: Perfect Oceanfront Accomodations
review: We looked at 3 hotels (Beachview Inn & Palm Pavilion) before deciding on this one - by far our best choice! The best online price I found was $149, however we received a $109 walk-in rate for a very clean room with microwave, flat screen tv, balcony and refrigerator. This oceanfront hotel is on the south end of Clearwater Beach but easily within walking distance of most shops/restaurants and one mile from the pier. Our room appeared nearly new - granite countertops in the bathroom, everything was spotless and comfortable. The pool/hot tub/tiki bar overlooks the ocean where we saw an occasional dolphin. Jimmys Iguana Bar & Restaurant on are on-site as is an ice cream shop. As a Priority Club member (sign up online before you go) you get 2 free drinks and 2 free ice cream coupons.…

title: Pleasant Surpise
review: I frequently travel for business and pleasure and generally avoid Holiday Inns but the conference was booked there, so I was stuck with the choice. Much to my surprise, it was a very pleasant stay of 3 days. The room was updated and fresh and  was immaculate with an upscale feel. The AC worked fine. The bathroom vanity had a granite countertop. The housekeeper even made towel animals and the clock/radio was set with seagulls playing when I arrived. The mattress was comfortable and the summer weight coverlet was just perfect. The staff couldn't have been more helpful, all the way from the front desk to the chef to the housekeepers. The conference facility was light and bright with a view of the channel so you could see boats going by. Only downside was that I had a view of a…

title: A Great Stay
review: We stayed at the Holiday Inn & Suites, Clearwater Beach on 10-12 June 2010.  We had booked our stay through travelrepublic.co.uk and booked a standard room as we would only be here for 2 nights.  Upon arrival we were allocated a room on the side of the hotel which had a partial ocean view and not the city or car park view we had anticipated - a nice touch.  The room itself was far superior to any Holiday Inn I have previously stayed in.  There was a kitchen area with granite countertop comprising sink, microwave and under-counter fridge.  The room contained 2 double beds, tv, table and chairs and good drawer storage and hanging area for clothes.  The bathroom was also set out with granite countertops and had a raised bowl sink with complimentary toiletries and a large walk-in…

title: Nice hotel but not what we expected...
review: The hotel was nice but there are some things to be aware of.  I'll start with the good.  It has a nice pool, tiki bar and restaurant and the rooms were clean and newly remodeled.  The bad.  We thought we were on the beach.  Our beach consisted of a wall of rocks.  It was about a 10-15 minute walk to the beach.  The beds were not very comfortable.  Add money for parking at the hotel, it's not free.   The pier is about a half mile away.  I'd recommend this hotel if you don't care about not having direct beach access.

title: Excellent hotel, very pleased
review: The Holiday Inn was great.  We could tell upon checking in that we would really enjoy our stay.  My only issue was that we did not get a balcony, which is something we booked.  I did not make it a huge deal, as we could have upgraded to a suite for an extra $50... We decided we did not need it as we hardly spent any time in the room.  Our days were spent relaxing at the tiki bar and Jimmy Iguanas.  Also, we took several walks down the beach and the area is great!  Lots of little restaraunts and bars to stop in at.  We ate at the restaraunt on site both days and were very pleased.  The location is good, and the beach is litterally steps away.  Shephards is right next door, which is a pretty good place to spend the night.

title: One of the nicest hotels and locations I have ever visited!
review: My daughter and I just got back from staying at this Holiday Inn and we had a wonderful time.  Definitely one of the nicest hotels and locations I have ever visited.  Clearwater Beach is truly a gem!  The beach is just a short walk away and chairs and umbrellas are available for rent at $20 for the day.  Concerning the hotel, it is beautiful!  The staff was friendly and helpful.  Our room was immaculately cleaned every day and a USA Today was delivered to our door.  As another person commented, there are sheers on the windows and not drapes, so if the early morning sun bothers you or if you are concerned about privacy, it might be a problem.   We ate several meals in the hotel restaurant and were pleased with the quality of the food, but the service was a bit lacking at times. …

title: Fantastic stay
review: Stayed for 2 weeks at the Holiday inn and cannot praise the hotel and staff enough. The room was spotless and kept like this over our stay. We had a gulf view suite and had a fantastic view where we frequently saw dolphins and manatees. Because we were staying 2 weeks our parking was reduced to $7 per day. All the staff were very pleasent and helpful in all areas and we ate several times at the restaurant. We found the food to be of a good standard, was always timely and hot. There was entertainment every night. the beach was only a few steps away from the hotel and the water was wonderful. The resort of Clearwater was fantastic and so easy to get around as the public transport system is excellent. . A car is not required unless you want to go further afield.  Catch the jolly…

title: Great place for families
review: Just got back from 4 nights in Clearwater Beach at the HOliday Inn and Suites and had an excellent time!  Loved the location of this place...3 or 4 min walk to public beach access and the gulfview room views were amazing.  We spent alot of time in the pool area and it was so lovely and nice to have the nice bar right by the pool.  Our kids enjoyed it.  There is a small wading pool for toddlers but for those 3-7 year olds that can't touch in the pool (4 ft and 8 ft deep) yet you will want floaties.  We didn't have a car but that wasn't a problem.  If we didn't walk to our location, we hopped on the beach trolley or took the bus south to John's Pass in Madiera Beach.  Also, the hotel restaurant offers free meals to kids with a paying adult - BONUS!  And, the suites are so…

title: Can't Wait To Go Back!
review: We stayed at the Holiday Inn in Clearwater Beach & loved it!  Our rooms were great.  We had a suite which included 2 seperate rooms, one a bedroom with a bathroom and one a spacious living room/kitchen area with another bathroom.  Two bathrooms were a plus for us traving with older children.  We had a gulf view and enjoyed watching the boats and dolphins daily.  It had an excellent pool area with the Iguana bar and also a bar/restaurant overlooking the gulf.  The sunsets were beautiful.  My son went fishing and restaurant cooked his fish for a small fee.  The bartenders and wait staff were very friendly as were most of the other guests staying at the hotel.  The beach was a short walk for us but it would probably more of a hassle for families with small children.  We had a great…

title: Average hotel
review: My self and my husband stayed at this hotel for 2 nights.  We selected it as it seemed to one of the few hotels that received reasonable reviews on Trip Advisor, that wasn't really expensive. On a plus side, we were able to check in early. On the down side, the receptionist gave us the wrong room key - to a room which already had people in - which was rather embarrassing.  This was rectified, but the receptionists were more interested in blaming each other than appologising to us.  The other two issues were that the bath didn't drain, so gradually filled up while you were in the shower - on the 2nd day it didn't drain away at all. Also they had obviously cleaned a stain on the carpet, but they had left a large area that was sopping wet and soapy. On the plus sides, it is right…

title: Great Location, Excellent staff
review: We stayed at the Holiday Inn in Aoril 2010.  We had a suite with a gulf view, which was incredible.  the rooms are spacious and well looked after.  the amenities both in the hotel and the room were great.  We don't usually use hotel restauramts but had dinner 3 times as the food was so good.  The only drawback was a very very slow breakfast though the staff were great.  The staff on reception were so helpful as we needed a medical trip and also were stranded for 4 extra nights due to the volcano, they were so very helpful and couldn't do enough for us.  I would recommend this hotel very highly.

title: great for price
review: clean rooms, friendly service. Great bar right on the water, great sunset view. club walking distance. beach is a short walk, but no problem. was very surprised that the room we had was facing the ocean and the sunset and although right above the outdoor restaurant it was not too loud at night with the live music.. it is a great hotel for the value.

title: Great place for a getaway weekend!
review: We are two sisters from Orlando and we were looking for a great getaway weekend close to the beach. We decided to go to Clearwater Beach after searching in the internet for places to stay in Clearwater we feel like Holiday Inn was the right one for me and my sister and fortunately was the perfect place for us.  The hotel is located just 4 or 5 minutes away from the beach, restaurants and stores.   We were walking around the area all the time and we never got tired to see all the wonderful things around the hotel. We totally recommend Holiday Inn for a place to stay while you visit Clearwater Beach. We love our room  and our view.   We love it and probably we will be coming back during the summer.  Orlando- Florida

title: Extremely Clean
review: My fiance and I were quite impressed with our stay at the Holiday Inn.  We had booked through Hotwire <1 month before the trip and stayed in there for roughly $115 a night for the week.  Parking was $12 a night in addition to this, but we found out that wasn't unrealistic for the area.  There wasn't a beach in front of the hotel even though it was on the water (rocks were below), but there was no problem with this.  There was a set of private condos next to the Holiday Inn and then on the other side was the beach.  EXTREMELY short walk.  The room was extremely clean and comfortable.  Beds were plush and had 4 pillows on each bed (2 were identified as being Firm, while the other 2 said Soft). Everything in the room was quite modern and better then expected.  There were marble…

title: Good and Bad
review: We booked this hotel for a quick weekend trip to Clearwater to visit family.  I thought it would be nice to stay on the beach since it was our first trip to Florida with our kids (4 and 2).  When I booked, I was surprised at the price per night for this hotel versus other beach hotels, and even some off-beach hotels.  First, I was also surprised to see that the hotel was not on the beach.  It was on the water, but there was no beach.  Just a patio, and a drop into the water.  The hotel is on the end of the strip of beach, and actually faces south.  You had to walk about a block to get to a very nice public beach nearby.  This solved the price mystery.  I wasn't necessarily disappointed, as it was a short walk, but the hotel website lead you to believe that there was a beach on…

title: No beach
review: Nice hotel, newer than most Holiday Inns in beach towns but was very upset to find that there was no beach front. it is "on" the water literally. You have to walk about 1/2 a mile to a small beach which we didn't do since I can't walk that far without pain so I was very disappointed. Did not get a gulf view room (most HI will upgrade us since we are Priority club members) but the place was full with 2 weddings going on. but they gave us a suite which consisted of 2 rooms with a door that wouldn't stay open in between. Kind of strange but OK. Since there were weddings at the hotel you had to be out of the pool area by 4 each day and since we didn't arrive until 2 or 3 that didn't give us much time outside. And we were checking out the next day  Did eat lunch at the water front…

title: Rude Front Desk Staff
review: We stayed last year and found FRONT DESK STAFF RUDE but the maid manager !!?? called front desk and got us a great room water view. This return stay started off HORRIBLE at the FRONT DESK and we just wanted to leave. We stay using priority points and would have to forfiet points. We travel a lot about 90 stays a year on points and this is a FRONT DESK TO STAY AWAY FROM!!!!!!!!

title: Nice Place and Location, but Very unaccommodating to groups
review: If you are looking to bring a group for a retreat/conference/wedding excursion, this is the last place in Clearwater I would recommend.  I could possibly see this as a place to go to if you were with your family but if you are planning on traveling with a group any bigger than 20 people DO NOT book rooms at the Holiday Inn, you will regret it.  The pool is also terrible and the beach is not as close as advertised. The staff was also quite rude and very unhelpful and short.

title: Better than expected!
review: This is the hotel I will always stay at when we come to clearwater.  The hotel was very clean.  It even smelled clean.  The staff was friendly and the maid was very thorough.  The beds were even comfortable.  We were upgraded from city view to gulf view and they said that parking was $12 a night but only charged us $12 for the whole stay.  It a short walk to the beach.  And we even saw 3 dolphins just sitting at the table in our room while we were eating breakfast.  I'll be back!

title: Great location
review: Stayed during easter weekend which meant it was very crowded on the island. The room was clean and we had a view of the city and the gulf. Noise was not an issue and our room was next to the elevator on the 8th floor.  The restaurant was was what you would expect for a hotel and we had a great meal on Easter. We rented jet skies right next door and their price was better than anyone else I called. The one thing I did not like was the charge for parking and that non-hotel guest were allowed to use the pool which meant you could not find a chair unless you went down at 8am.  We went to the beach which was a quick 2 min walk.  Staff was very helpful and quick to respond to requests.

title: False Advertising: NOT ON THE BEACH!!!!!
review: I thought this hotel was on the beach, which is the ONLY reason we booked it. All of the information on its website suggests that it is directly on the beach and the Gulf of Mexico.  IT IS NOT.  If you are planning on going to a hotel with direct beach access, cross this one off of your list.  We were incredibly deceived and disappointed, and checked out after only one day. Fortunately, we were not charged for leaving early, since the hotel's fire alarms were out of service! There was a note/warning posted on the front door from the fire marshall advising that the alarms were not in service.  Obviously, we didn't feel safe on the 5th floor under those circumstances.  The staff advised that the alarms had been "reset", but the fire marshall just hadn't checked them yet. Sorry,…

title: A wonderful stay!
review: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Hotel and Suites Clearwater for three nights in late March.  Fortunately the weather had improved by this time (although poured rain one day!).  We thought this hotel was great!  The staff was very friendly and efficient.  We had a golf-front room and it was wonderful to look out over the water while drinking our morning coffee or evening wine.  We even saw dolphins swimming by!   We thoroughly enjoyed the evening entertainment, which we could view from our balcony if we wanted, but recognize this could be a problem for people with young children.   I checked and you could hear the music a little in the room with the doors closed.  However, the show did end shortly after 11 pm.  We found the service and food in the hotel restaurant to be very good…

title: Very friendly staff, nice rooms
review: I accompanied my husband on a business trip with our 5 month old son. First trip with the baby and we had a perfect experience at this hotel.   We had a King Suite so we had plenty of room to set up his crib, a play area and the kitchenette provided everything we needed to store his food. The staff at the hotel was very sweet with my son and the restaurant staff was very easy going and friendly. Even the guests that stayed there we're really nice people (you don't get that everywhere!).   Weather was bad like for everyone else who went to Florida this Winter, but it looked like the pool area was well-maintained and fun for a warm day. It's not on the beach but this is good if you have a baby and don't want to get sand everywhere! Rooms were updated and very well designed. This…

title: Fun Holiday at Holiday Inn
review: This was our second time at the Holiday Inn Hotel and Suites in Clearwater.  We requested the same room as the year before and our wish was granted.  We were in town to see our Wonderful Philadelphia Phillies and the Holiday Inn is in a great location to enjoy all the fun of the Pier and a short right to Bright House Field where we watched our Phils beat up on Detroit and the Yanks.    The rooms were always clean when we returned from the game and pleanty of clean towels were lef for us.  They would even make towel swans for the beds which made me feel as if I was at at Carribean resort.  The beds were comfortable and the rooms have a nice little kitchen area with refrig, microwave, coffee maker, sink and cabinets that are stocked with dishes, cups and dish towels to make…

title: Excellent value and location
review: I have been traveling to Clearwater Beach off and on since 1991. My wife and I had a suite with a gulfview and two queen beds. The rooms are spacious and kept very clean. The beds are comfortable with two types of pillows provided (firm and soft). Each of the rooms in the suite have 32" flat screen tvs and each of the rooms have their own bathrooms (very convenient when traveling with a female companion). The staff at the Holiday Inn is extremely friendly and helpful. The views from our balcony were exceptional. This is a smoke free hotel however you are permitted to smoke on the balcony. The food at the hotel is above average and will do in a pinch however there are a plethera of great restaurants within a fifteen minute drive from the hotel. The beach is a short walk from the…

title: Good value, thin walls
review: Overall a positive experience, but the walls were super-thin - could hear everything going on in the hall and on the street outside.  This was particularly a problem as it was spring break and there were drunken idiots around.  However, the suites were very nice - converted from 2 connecting standard hotel rooms into one room with a king bed and one with a sofa bed - 2 complete bathrooms.  The hotel was waterfront, but not beachfront (agree with previous review that this was not entirely clear on the website).  Was walking distance to the beach.  Parking was $12 per night extra.  Sleep interrupted each night with noise - once with someone trying to get into a bolted room on our hall, the other by the clock radio alarm going off at midnight.  My daughter was cold in the sofa bed…

title: Nice bang for the buck
review: The Holiday Inn was a good, clean, safe hotel.  The rooms were nice; the staff cleaned the room promptly everyday. The front desk staff was very friendly.  As others have said, it is outrageous paying $12 per day to park in an open, flat lot.   There are plenty of restaurants and atrractions within walking distance.  Frenchy's (grouper sandwhiches), Crabby Bills, and IHOP are good choices.  Smokey Bones on route 60 in Clearwater does good bbq.  Keegan's, Guppies, or Salt Rock are excellent places to try for fresh local seafood.  As others have said, it is outrageous paying $12 per day to park in an open, flat lot.    The food at Jimmy's Fish House in the hotel was okay.  At night they even had a two-man band playing.  If you want a more festive night life go next door to…

title: Fantastic Value; love this hotel
review: We wanted to stay at a nice hotel, for a long weekend in Clearwater, without spending a fortune. We wanted a nice view, clean rooms, and good service, and got all of this an more at the Holiday Inn. We booked an ocean front suite and the room was above expectations. The restaurant was wonderful, and the service fromm all was perfect. If there is a downside at all it is that the hotel does not sit on the beach. But a shot walk will get you onto the beach, no problem. This hotel was well worth the money; not easy to say these days.

title: Great Rooms, Great value
review: This hotel was great. Had large beautiful suites with seperate bedroom. Room was spotless and the cleaning staff was top notch. Pool was beautiful as were the views. Great place to stay with kids.  There were only 3 negatives.  1. They had no direct beach access. This wasn't really clear on the website. 2. They charged $12 a night for parking that wasnt made clear when I booked it 3. The retaurant in the hotel (Jimmy's) was horrible. Great for drinks but the food was very poor.

title: Nice hotel but lacked customer service
review: We recently stayed at this hotel and booked it through Allegiant Airlines when we booked our flights.  After booking the hotel on-line, I called the hotel with our confirmation # from Allegiant to see if we had a "gulf" view room.  I was told over the phone that we did (I didn't get the ladies name I spoke to), I was also told that our room would have a refrigerator (which it did) and also that we'd need to bring our own towels for the beach (which we did).  But, when we arrived, they had no record of a "gulf" view room and since I couldn't provide the name of the person I spoke to when I called their hotel, we were stuck in a "city" view room.  If we wanted to upgrade to a "gulf" view room, it would have cost us an add'l $60.00 per night.  So, that put a sour taste in our mouth…

title: Best Hotel of our 2009 Winter Holiday
review: November 2009 we toured Sothern Florida staying in 8 different hotels over 2 weeks, this was our favourite.  Yes there is a charge for parking in the car park, the hotel isn't on the beach.  We had a double aspect suite over looking the harbour and pool area, the staff were friendly the room was lovely. Spacious comfortable and well equipped. We enjoyed having the use of a kitchen to prepare food for ourselves after almost a week of nothing but restaurant food.  The beach is a short walk away from the hotel, there aren't many restaurants nearby but there are a few and the bar in the hotel was friendly

title: Very Hotel in good location with great views
review: I loved this hotel. I was looking for a hotel on  the beach and this was really on the intercoastal waterway so I wasn't sure. It turned out to be a really nice location. We had a king Gulf front room with a balcony on the second floor over looking the pool and intercostal. I got some beautful sunset pictures from my balcony of the ships out watching it set. It was about a 1/4 mile walk to the pier area where they have a little festival everynight at sundown with vendors. Also, their are so many good restaurants around the pier area or a block back from there. We loved Frenchys, Cooters and Crabby Bills. All of these places had good happy hour prices on drinks and excellent sea food for a very reasonable price. The beach is only a 5 minute walk but the pool area is very nice…

title: Clearwater here we come!
review: We have used the Holiday Inn Clearwater Beach for the past two years as part of our annual Florida roadtrip using PC points. We are once again heading over from Scotland in April and will spend a couple of days in Clearwater. This will be our third visit and we hope for the same high standards we have previously enjoyed.  We will avoid the week ends as it can be really busy on the beach.  Every member of staff we came into contact with at the HI  has been extremely courteous, friendly and really helpful and it is no surprise that it has such a high score.  Try it you will NOT be disappointed.

title: Gulf front room worth the extra
review: This was our 6th trip to Clearwater Beach but our first stay at the Holiday Inn.  It was our 20th anniversary so we were looking for something special.  We booked a gulf front king room for 5 days.  We were able to get a very good deal by doing an early booking and staying Sunday night to Friday thereby avoiding the higher weekend rates.  The room was really great.  Not on the beach but only a few feet from the the waters edge.  The sound of the surf  was great.   We were in tower 1 above the restaurant.  We had a couple meals in Jimmy's Fish House which were very good.  It was quiet in the hotel since we came right after the long cold spell. The only negative comment would be the cost of parking which had just gone up from 10 dollars a day to 12 dollars.

title: NEVER HAD A ROOM LIKE THIS BEFORE
review: What a top rate hotel very clean ,probably the best and biggest breakfasts i have ever had .Service very good clean as a whistle and in an exellent position, five minutes walk from the harbour and beach, decent pool and entertainment most nights. One downside if you have a car they charge $12 a night for parking. the room we had consisted of a bedroom on suite , it had two double beds a flat screen tv and a desk the adjoining room had a flat screen tv two setees table and chairs kitchen and bathroom brill.

title: FANTASTIC LOCATION AND HOTEL
review: Spent 1 night (1/1/10) prior to catching a cruise and couldn't ask for a better location or hotel. Right on the water with fantastic views. Though there is no swimming beach, was not a problem with the beautiful pool area. There was also an outside bar area, but closed since it was darn freezing that week. We were very surprised by the 2 room suite with 2 bathrooms,  Nice to have a walkout balcony also. Would absolutely come again.

title: Blast
review: Great location, restaurant with beauti ful view, everything is right there, walking distance. A nice sandy park for the kids by the beach.

title: Do not book "Water View"
review: Our first stay at this hotel was in February 2009.  We booked a king room using points.  When we arrived we were greeted by a wonderful girl who let us know we were upgraded to an ocean front suite.  The hotel was a near capacity, but the staff was fantastic.    Fast forward to November- we decided to head down to Florida a few days early for a cruise out of Tampa and return to this hotel,because we had such a great stay in February.  I booked a "water view", assuming it would be on the side of the hotel, not expecting ocean front but a view.  We checked in early evening and did not have the same warm greeting, not bad, but nothing special.  We went to our room, which was in the front of the building over looking the parking lot!!  I returned to the front desk and was told we…

title: Not on the beach
review: Not sure why folks are so high on this hotel.  It's a Holiday Inn near the beach, not a Marriott, a Holiday Inn, not on the beach, near the beach.  Place is on a seawall overlooking a portion of the inland waterway (intercoastal).  If you enjoy standing in a parking lot (or on a pool deck), leaning over a rope fence looking at some non-descript patch of water, knock yourself out but please know that this is not a beachfront property.  The beach is a 5 to 10 minute walk away.  The rooms - standard Holiday Inn fare; nothing less, nothing more. $10/day for parking!

title: Great location, water view rooms are worth it!!
review: Thank you so much for taking the time to convey your comments regarding your recent stay with us here at the Holiday Inn & Suites on Clearwater Beach.     We rely on you, our guest, to tell us how we are doing and how we can better meet the needs of our guests.    We appreciate you taking the time to convey your comments and thank you for patronage.      Managment and Staff of the Holiday Inn & Suites

title: A very nice hotel, but has several drawbacks
review: My fiance and I wanted a quick weekend getaway trip. He had some Holiday Inn points, so we decided to go with this hotel. Newly renovated, the outdoor area is beautiful. The beach and the main drag are within walking distance. There is also a beautiful national state park that is about a half hour walk - worth the trip if it's not a beach day. The restaurants within walking distance are all beachy-bar type - which is fine. If you want a nicer dinner, I HIGHLY recommend Forlini's. You'd have to drive or cab, but it is totally worth it. The wait staff was great (even the water guy was amazing - I didn't want any ice in my water and he was SO attentive to that little detail!), it was a great wine list, and the conch appetizer was delicious! Anyway, we really enjoyed the weekend…

title: Resort calibre hotel for a great deal
review: First off, I'd like to give compliments to the staff.  They were simply amazing.  The front desk staff was incredibly friendly and helpful.  Patty, who works in evening, was especially awesome.  And the housekeeping staff is second to none.  The care and attention they put into each and every room is amazing.  You won't see one speck of dirt when you come back to your room in the evening.  The housekeeping staff even makes little animals out of the towels.  Very cute!  But here are the drawbacks to this hotel.  First, be aware that there is a bar attached.  It's not hard to imagine the sorts of problems that can go along with that.  For a couple nights, me and my colleagues were woken up by drunks who were making noise and banging on doors in the hallway during weird hours (like…

title: A little disappointed
review: We just returned from a 3 night stay at the Holiday Inn. We were traveling with 6 people and had booked 3 rooms - 2 gulf front rooms and the other a gulf view. When we checked in, the gulf front rooms we were assigned to were on the 2nd and 3rd floor of the first tower and had a very disappointing view of the water due to the roof line of the restaurant in the hotel. My parents were staying on the 2nd floor (room 214) and were literally eye level with the peak of the roof when you sat on their balcony. We were in room 316, which was somewhat better, but still not what we had hoped for. I really can't believe that they can charge the same price for these rooms as the ones higher up with the real views. We're not ones to complain, but we also don't typically spend extra money to…

title: Perfect Vacation!
review: We went to Clearwater Beach for our 1st wedding anniversary.  There are so many options for hotels in this area that it's overwhelming.  We decided to play it safe and stay at the Holiday Inn.  You can't go wrong with a Holiday Inn!  The staff was very friendly, the bar/restaurant was awesome (I recommend the frozen mango daquiri) and our room was perfect.  The view out to the Gulf was amazing.  Every day when we came back to our room the housekeeping staff had made us a cute little animal out of towels and had turned on the sound machine to brids and crashing waves.  We had an amazing time and would go back today if we could!

title: This place is AWESOME!!!!!!!!
review: We were there for a wedding and every room (6) were very clean and House Keeping was increadable.  The Location and the amenities are perfect.  Within walking distance to the beach and lots of great places to eat. The Pool area was well kept and tools where always available for use since we were there for a wedding we need our hair, nails and makeup done and they had a salon on site which was awesome. Even though it was October they had live music every night. You just can't bet this place and we plan on going back again.

title: VERY NICE
review: Room was clean, quite & comfortable. Staff was friendly & professional. Housekeeping staff did an excellent job on the room each day. Not located right on the "beach" but close enough not to be a problem. Resturant serves a buffet on Sunday breakfast wihich was nothing special along with a very limited menu if that is not your cup of tea. Went somewhere else because of this. They must really cut the kitchen staff on weekend. All in all a very resonable place to stay, would go there again in future.

title: Top Class hotel in fab location
review: I would recommend this hotel to everyone. The location was perfect with just a few minutes from the beach, a lovely pool and bar area which was perfect for watching the sunsets with a nice cool drink.  Had a lovely room right on the front overlooking the water where both dolphins, manatees and turtles were spotted in the water from our balcony.  Will deffo go there again.  All staff were friendly and cleaners did a fab job on our rooms everyday of our stay.  Free wireless computer was available whenever we needed as well.

title: Great stay!
review: We were in Orlando for two weeks and spent the middle weekend at this hotel to celebrate our wedding anniversary. The hotel was very clean and modern, service was great, lovely bar and pool area. Good value for money, will stay again next time! You won't be dissapointed!

title: Great rooms & outstanding service!
review: Just returned from 3 days at this wonderful hotel.  Rooms are spacious and the staff provides excellent service - from front desk to services to housecleaning.  We reserved a suite with 2 beds.  Rooms are immaculate and very comfortable.  We were able to prep light meals and everyone had plenty of room - something that is rare when traveling with teenagers!  The only thing that might be a problem for some (especially with younger kids) - the hotel charges $10 per day to use the parking lot - we saw many people doing this and using the pool that were not hotel guests.  They were enjoying the poolside bar and the area was crowded.  At night though, the pool was practically empty.  Food at Jimmy's Fish House was not very good, but there are plenty of other places to eat within…

title: A week in paradise
review: I spent a week at the Holiday Inn Suites on Clearwater Beach. The hotel itself was great. No complaints about the rooms, service, or the staff. My wife and i had a wonderful romantic vacation together. It was truly like a week in paradise. The hotel is not on the beach, but it's such a short walk that it was not an issue, and the plethora of chairs by the pool and the seawall made it enjoyable to look out on the Gulf and enjoy a drink together. My ONLY complaint is the parking fee policy for my rental car. $10.00 a day. That's BS, and the only reason i gave it three stars on value. Everyone should complain, it'll go away if they hear from us. Otherwise, highly recommended. Wonderufl place for vacation.

title: Hotel Nice; Jimmy's Restaurtant HORRIBLE
review: The hotel restaurant, Jimmy's Fishhouse, continues to disappoint me. I heard "thru the grapevine" that after the Holiday Inn acquired the hotel, management replaced the Kitchen Chef with a Line Cook. That's not necessarily a bad thing EXCEPT when every fish appetizer, sandwich, dinner comes out smelling sooooo FISHY the flies swarm the meal! This weekend (the 3rd time this year) Grouper Nuggets not only smelled fishy but tasted AWFUL :( !!! Raw Oysters delivered to the room Saturday were served in a TO GO BOX and NOT WITH ICE! I'm talking RAW OYSTERS!!! Incidentally, the restaurant "ran out" of Raw Oysters Sunday! What a surprise! Just a huge disappointment. If you're going to stay at the hotel....go somewhere else to eat or BYOF - bring your on food.

title: Perfect
review: I have been going to Clearwater Beach since I was a kid.  I have not been there in quite some time.  This hotel has been renovated and it is wonderful!  The view from our room was amazing.  We had a view of Sand Key.  The staff was wonderful.  The restaraunt was really good.  Kids eat free so I expected a small meal but the portions were too big for our 7 year old.  I really loved eating breakfast on the gulf.  The kids liked watching the beautiful birds and the ocean.  The pool was relaxing and beautiful, just like the pictures.  I am a total germaphobe and the rooms were spotless.  Everything was spotless including the lobby, game room, pool etc..  Very close to the beach.  Loved taking walks to the pier at night.  Best trip to Clearwater hands down.   Absolutely no complaints.

title: Nice, Clean. Relaxing
review: This hotel is very nice and not expensive for a beachfront property.  The view of the ocean from the balcony was beautiful and very relaxing.  The staff was very friendly and professional.   The only 2 negitives are that  the hotel offered free wireless internet but I could only get logged on if i sat on the balcony and  there is $10 per day parking fee but I was aware of that before I booked the hotel

title: Nice hotel but don't stay here if you want beachfront - like with sand and all
review: This is a very nice hotel right on the water but it does not have a beach - not in any tide - that is desirable. There is a very small area that is in front of the parking garage between the Holiday Inn and Shephards. This did not keep us from the beach in any way and we loved walking around. If you have children though and would like to take a cooler, it is not that convenient to walk. We stayed in a gulf view suite. The view was wonderful. The rooms were nice and clean. It was great having two bathrooms. Both beds are in one room with a bathroom, the desk, dining area, kitchenette, living and an additional bath are in the adjoining room. It worked out GREAT when someone would get up earlier than others - you just went to the other room and shut the door. Friendly and helpful…

title: Fantastic views from gulf front suite
review: We took a break from the Orlando parks and enjoyed one night in a gulf front 2 room suite on the sixth floor, this was obviously two seperate bedrooms previously, one room retained two large beds and an adjoining door lead to a room with two settees with a table and a sideboard with Tv. Also to be found in this room was a small kitchenette with microwave, fridge and sink. Both rooms had toilets and basins. The rooms were newly decorated and very clean. The main feature of the rooms was the fantastic view of the inlet and sand key beach. A large balcony off the bedroom allowed you to watch the amazing sunset and if you were lucky to watch dolphins swim in the inlet.  The hotel was clean and the reception well run and helpful. The pool and tiki bar areas were also clean and well…

title: We love this hotel
review: We stayed here in June.  We have actually stayed here 3 different times and absolutely love it.  The hotel is fully remodeled and everything is beautiful.  The rooms are huge and very clean.  The staff are all very friendly.  The two girls at Jimmy's Bar (I think their names were both Meg - it was a Saturday night) are fabulous!  The gentlemen that do maintenance around the pool area keep everything very tidy and are very friendly.  We look forward to seeing them every year when we are there.  We wouldn't stay anywhere else in Clearwater.  We could go on and on about the great hotel!!!

title: Wonderful!
review: What a great place to stay. A blink of an eye walking distance to the warm Gulf Of Mexico beach or a hop from the pool to the Gulf. The only downfall was that they charge $10 a day to park iin the lot. I can't wait to go back!

title: Not too bad....
review: Stayed in a family suite to take a break from Orlando...hotel is older (formely Ramada Inn Gulf View) but the suite was remodeled...I am picky about hotel bathrooms and the sink and shower were newer - granite countertops.....The location is great - beach is about a 5 minute walk away...the pool goes to 8' and doesn't have a very shallow end...I thought the pool area could have been bigger, but the view was great.  The staff was helpful.  Ate lunch at Frenchy's on the beach - great food and service - highly recommend this restaurant.

title: Love this place
review: We really enjoyed this place. It was our first time to the gulf and would stay here again. Had a similar experience at the same souviner shop. Never went back there. Jimmy's Fish house was wonderful as well as Sheperds next door. Loved that it is close to Pier 60. Pool was very nice, not too crowded when we were there. Really wish there was beach access from the property. Staff very friendly. Room nice.

title: Pleasantly surprised and loved every minute of it!!
review: I travel every summer to various places and have stayed in various hotels and by far this hotel was the best yet for the family. The family suite was perfect; very clean and kept clean on a daily basis.The area was perfect for us. The beach was an extremely short walk away, spectacular sunsets, and right near Pier 60.  I would absolutely recommend this hotel to any and everyone. When we return we will definitely be staying here again. The only mishap was when we went to the "Flipperz Beach" store adjacent to the hotel...very poor customer service; an employee actually ran outside to yell/threaten/ us with our children there just because we decided not to purchase anything!! I advise not to go there...there are plenty of other souveniour places to shop. Otherwise awesome place to…

title: too bad there was no beach
review: We spent 1 night there in a very spacious and comfy suite. Particulary liked the mini kitchen with fridge, sink and microwave. If you were staying for a few days, it would be a bonus. Had a partial view of the gulf and a balcony. It suited our needs. The restaurant was very good and we had a table by by the railing next to the gulf. Very nice for the sunset. My only gripe was that though it was right on the gulf, there was no hotel access to the water and no beach. A seawall that dropped into the water. We had to walk to the next hotel over for beach access. The pool was on the small side and very crowded. All in al, we had a good time. Oh yeah, very well equipped fitness center

title: Definately worth it
review: Great hotel, Awesome Customer service and right on the ocean.  Had a great stay.  Hotel is very nice, pool is very relaxing and right on the ocean is incredible.  Saw a manatee one day and you are right next door to Shepards which has a party on their deck every day.

title: Excellent Customer Service
review: Megan H. @ Jimmy's Fish House located on the grounds of Holiday Inn Clearwater Beach, was amazing. Her customer service was excellent and she made my stay  at the Holiday Inn that much better.  Also the hotel is great and teh amenities it offers is wondeful as well. Very clean and welcoming.

title: Top Notch!
review: We just stayed at this hotel and I cant think of enough words to express how nice everything was. Everyone is very friendly and the hotel was super clean. I loved the short walk to the beach and restaurants, then at night to sit out on the deck and watch the sunset and listen to the ocean. They say no swimming, but my two teenage boys enjoyed finding  seashells right by the hotel. If we ever get back to Clearwater, we will definately stay here again.

title: Relaxing Weekend On The Water... Therapy At Its Finest!
review: Just spent an excellent 2 days at this Holiday Inn. Our room, a king gulf view suite, was spacious, very clean, and our balcony, right on the gulf, had a beautiful view of the inlet and surrounding waters. Sat out there viewing the boats going by, listening to the live music, drinking our rum runners...just the therapy we needed!  Staff was very friendly and went over and beyond to accommodate.

title: Great Weekend Away
review: Holiday Inn and Suites provided the perfect base to explore the Clearwater Area. The hotel was clean, the staff was friendly and the room was large.   We stayed in a standard guest room, king bed, and the room met all our needs. The hotel restaurant was great to grab and quick breakfast or dinner.   During our visit we visited the Tampa Electric Manatee Viewing Center, the Clearwater Aquarium, the Big Cat Rescue and John's Pass Village. We ate at Frenchy's Rockaway (not as great as the reviews make it out to be), Island Way Grill (awesome) and had a great lunch at Sculleys (we were able to watch dolphins swimming past as we ate).  This hotel was a great fit for anyone looking for a quick weekend away.

title: Nice Hotel with a stunning view
review: This is a nice Hotel. Our room, a superior gulf view suite, was very comfortable and had a stunning view over the ocean. The room also felt very clean. The in-house Jimmys Fish House is a great place for lunch or dinner. The pool was ok and you'll reach the beach after a 5 minutes walk. There are though some negative stuff, the air conditioning system in the room makes some noise and the breakfast buffét on weekends is not much to have, the a la carté breakfast is better. Altogether I recommend this Hotel.

title: Top Notch Beach Hotel
review: Usually if I stay on the beach I look further down the the coastline away from Clearwater Beach.  From the time I arrived at  The Clearwater Beach Holiday Inn & Suites until I left it was a wonderful 2 day one night relaxing local getaway for me.  This Holiday Inn went through renovations not too long ago so everything is still in excellent condition for a beach hotel.  It is not directly on the powdery sand beach but it is within a 5 minute stroll to the beach and it is nice to walk to Calidiase Island and back.    The Suites are very well layed out with the the bedroom and bath on one side and a room with a sofa dinette table, tv, wet bar with microwave and refrigerator and extra bath on the other.  One bath has walk in shower which alone is a plus.   I checked in a little…

title: Won't stay anyplace else in Clearwater Beach!
review: Just returned from a 4 night stay at Holiday Inn & Suites.  The location is great.  Short one block walk to the main beach or to the left of the hotel is a small private type beach area that is great to relax at. Wave runners and parasailing right next door as well. Parking at $10 per day is a bummer, however, we paid more than that per night in Orlando, so I guess $10 is not too bad.  We did not have trouble finding a parking space, but from reading others reviews I was worried and expressed my concern at check-in.  I was told if we couldn't find a parking space to just let them know. Our room was AWESOME!! One bedroom with 2 queens, 2 baths and a living room with sofa bed, table and chairs, fridge, microwave and small sink. And two tv's!! Great when travelling with kids!  The…

title: Awesome and will be returning
review: All we can say was that this place was perfect!  WE went back and forth before our honeymoon, and couldn't decide on a hotel to stay at.  We finally decided on the Holiday Inn.  From the moment we walked in the door, it was amazing.  The front desk was the nicest I've ever experienced.  We hung out at the pool and tiki bar every day.  Cabana Bob was the best.  The bartenders at the tiki bar were awesome!  And the restaurant/bar was great!  We ate there every morning for breakfast, and a lot of times for dinner.  There was not one complaint about the hotel or staff.  We would recommend this hotel to anyone who was visiting the Clearwater Beach area.

title: Had a Blast!!
review: Myself and two of my friends stayed for a long girls weekend trip at this hotel. The hotel was beautiful and far nicer than most of the other hotels in the area. The hotel staff was very friendly and willing to meet our every needs. The room was very clean and the staff made sure to give us plenty of fresh towels everyday. We had a city room view which was fine because the pool/bar area was usually pretty busy until around 1-2 am.We did have some problems with people being loud in the hallway becuase there was a wedding the weekend we went. I also felt like the rooms were not as private as they should be because I was woken up several times by a baby crying in the room next to us in the middle of the night.  We felt like we had everything that we needed with in the hotel itself.…

title: Great location
review: Nice beach location. Stayed there on a PC reward night and got and upgrade and welcome package as a PC member.  Do not remember the official rate, but would not pay more than 150 $. Some of the staff are average, others very friendly. Seems that some area's of the hotel could use some renovation. Overall, would say "nothing special, but nothing wrong"

title: Never Again
review: Room was handicapped, hotel claimed we booked a HC room.  When informed that we did not they claimed Price Line booked it that way & turned up their noses that we used Price Line, in other words too bad, so sad, should have gone through us.  Wife wanted a tub vs HC shower and there was no counter for toiletries. Dumb thing is suppose a handicapped person actually needed a room!  Hotel tried to "upgrade" us to suite but wanted $20 more per night. All this and you get to pay $10 per day for the pleasure of parking in thier lot too!  Other rooms did not have tub or did not have king bed. One even said, no view.  Well thats the one we want-NOT. No offer to change room after Sunday when many other rooms were available.   NO INTERNET ACCESS in room until last day. Hotel knew half the…

title: Good hotel, great view
review: I spent 1 night in the hotel in February with my friend and we enjoyed the place. We got a room with full sea view and it was absolutely worse the money we paid (nearly USD 200) for the night. The parking place is good and you can easily walk to the senter, where you have some nice restaurants and bars.  Make sure to go to the sunset party which is really an extraordinary experience.  The entrance hall is a little cold and not really inviting but the staff is really helpful. Ask them to send you to the boat tour were you could see dolphins in their natural environment, it is cearly an experience worse the day. Overall a great place and really chaming.

title: Lovely Stay at the Holiday Inn
review: Stayed at this Holiday Inn for 10 days in May and really enjoyed it.  I agree with everything written in the previous review by Skipper711 and was going to write something very similar.  The pool area is lovely and beautifully situated on the waterfront. The service was friendly and the housekeeping excellent. We also ate at Jimmy’s several times and found the food to be excellent, the service friendly and the atmosphere pleasant.  The only minor irritation was the rather loud music played around the pool all day and well into the evening. .We could hear this very clearly from our 8h floor oceanfront balcony and it got to be a little annoying hearing the same radio station music day after day.   We would definately return to this hotel.

title: Relaxing time on the beach at a reasonable price
review: I booked our trip on Priceline and felt I got a GREAT deal, especially since we got a non-stop flight. ($1,054 for 2 people, including all taxes and  insurance. The car was separate, and I would not recommend USave. They are not directly on the airport property and we weren't  impressed with the car or their fees).  I will return to Avis and Hertz in the future, as they seem to have better service and vehicles.   We arrived on Memorial Day, and the hotel was packed, traffic was crazy, and the beaches were jammed with people. Our flight time had changed to a much earlier arrival, so we had to wait several hours in order to get our room.  There are numerous shops and restaurants nearby, so we walked around to familiarize ourselves with the area.  Originally when we arrived, we…

title: Great Hotel!!!
review: This property was awesome!  Great location, mind you they have no beach...but a short walk to get to it.  Great view.  If they had beach to offer they could charge this much - otherwise the cost should be lower.  We had 2 small children (2 & 4) with a separate room for them to sleep in.   We never had any issues with the children there.  Restaurant was great and there is lots of good places around to eat.  The beach is just incredible and they have an excellent playground for the kids just down the street.  One girl on the front desk needed an attitude adjustment but other than her we had a great 2 nights there.

title: VERY Nice Holiday Inn
review: We were very pleased with this hotel.  It was very clean, the room was fantastic, and the pool area was very fun.  They upgraded our room to a king suite, which was very nice.  Huge room, with separate living room (I think it was a sleeper too).  We had zero issues during our stay.  The only drawback to this facility is it is on the South end of town.  Short walk to the beach (less than 5 mins.), but it is a good 15 minutes to the main section of town (Pier 60, etc.), and we could never time the trolley right (it doesn't keep to its schedule very well).  We WILL be coming to this facility again!

title: arrange your own airport transportation
review: We had a good stay at this hotel.  It was clean and well managed.  We feel that it is a good value for the money and will consider staying there again.  One negative.   Before arriving at the Clearwater airport, I called ahead to see if there was airport transportation.  The hotel transportation isn't available, however they did highly recommend Marie who has a towncar and was very dependable.  We arranged for her to pick us up.  The cost from the airport, $40 without the gratuity, did seem high, but we felt she did do a good job and what's a few extra buck when you are traveling?  We gave her our departure time for the return trip. She tried to convince us that we were leaving too early for our flight home and wanted to pick us up later. We didn't want to cut the time as close…

title: Great Priority Club Stay
review: We stayed at t his hotel for 5 nights for Spring Break the first week of April.  We used priority club points for two rooms for the entire stay, so it was free.  The rooms were very nice, they upgraded us to two suites.  They have 2 queen beds in one room and a sofa, table, small kitchen, extra dresser and bathroom in the next room.  They both had a view of the ocean, one faced Shephards and one faced town.  For the free nights, we had to move one night to another room, a King, and they gave us an ocean front room.  The pool is very nice, it got hard to find a chair when the weather finally cleared up, so we would walk to the beach.  The beach was 5 minutes away, crowded, but still lots of room.  We walked to dinner and the Pier 60 every night, there is a Walgreens close too. …

title: Unhappy Ending
review: We hosted a lage group at the hotel and found the location, rooms and even the food to a good value, however upon our departure we asked the hotel to hold a few items why we  where gone for a week, upon our return several itmes where stolen from the  hotels secured holding area. We only recevied a apology after our group spent thousands of dollors durring our stay.

title: Didn't try Hotel, Looks Nice, But Tried Jimmy's!
review: - I tried Jimmy's Restaurant toward the end of my week-long trip to Clearwater Beach Island. All of us got burgers(since we went for lunch), and it left everything to be desired.  The burger was kinda dry and had NO condiments, neither were there condiments on the table.  So, we asked the waitress and we had to wait over 10 minutes for them , so we just ate them w/o the condiments.  Overall, I reccommend this place for fish.  There fish looks good, but this is not a place to order a good burger.  Try Beach Shanty Cafe on Mandalay for an AWESOME burger for lunch.

title: Rooms are OK but very noisy!
review: We booked in this hotel for 4 nights. They originally messed up with our arrival date but offered very little in the way of compensation. The noise level is higher than most hotels. You could clearly hear someone using the bathroom next to you and the sound from the TV in the next room sounded like it was in our own. I do commend the hotel on the maid services as they do a good job and the pool area is very nice.

title: Met Expectations
review: It could be a fancier place but it meets all expectations. Relatively clean, hot water, comfortable bed.   I was on the fourht floor of tower 2.  Nothing to look at except the parking lot and the guy attempting to collect money from people in order to park.  It was good comic relief while sitting on the balcony.     You have to pay extra to park your car.  They also do beach patron parking so there are a few hundred cars in the lot for people who aren't at the hotel.  So depending on your time of getting there you may park in some weird location but I never once did not have a parking spot.    Location is walkable to all of the stuff we wanted to do.  Pier 60, Beach, Crabby Bills, Pool, Mini Golf, McDonalds, Dunkin Donuts, etc.  We drove to Sand Key Beach one day.  Much more…

title: simple but exceeded all of our expectations
review: Good restaurant, great service, friendly staff, good proximity to beach and area attractions.  Will be returning there for our next visit to Clearwater Beach.

title: decent facilty, but housekeeping steals
review: Stayed there in mid March. Nice suites, decent work out facility. Short walk to beach. Housekeeping staff was not honest and actually stole a stuffed animal belonging to our daughter.  Unreal, and no apologies from hotel management. Breakfast server staff was excellent.

title: Great hotel, great location, great price!
review: The Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites in Clearwater Beach was an excellent hotel in a resort area.  The price was very reasonable especially for a mid-summer visit.  We had a two room suite and the adjoining door could be closed and locked for privacy.  The hotel was a 10 minute walk from the Clearwater Beach public beach so the fact that the hotel was not 'beachfront' was not a problem.  Many other attractions were a short drive (20 minutes or less) from the hotel.  There were a great number of restaurants and other attractions (such as mini-golf, shopping, etc) within walking distance of the hotel.  The food at the hotel restaurant was excellent and reasonably priced.  The hotel pool was good sized and had many chairs to sit on.  There was a great view of Clearwater Bay from the…

title: Perfect Gulf Front View
review: My wife I stayed at the Holiday Inn and Suites on Clearwater Beach from Feb. 18 til the 24th.   It was a great stay.  The lobby of the hotel was inviting and any of the staff that we had to deal with during our stay were very friendly and always willing to answer any questions we had.  We stayed on the 7th Floor (top floor) and our room faced the Gulf of Mexico.  We had a fantastic view also of Sand Key where you find Madeira Beach. St. Pete's, etc.  Everyday we would have a view of so many different boats touring vacationers around and many sail boats.  Right below our room was the patio and in the evening when the weather was warm there would be someone singing on a little stage.  It was nice to sit on the balcony having a relaxing cocktail after a day of exploring Clearwater…

title: For us, this hotel was great
review: We went stayed at this hotel with another couple, no children, in April of 2008. We were able to get a suite on the pool side. The other couple got a single room that faced the road. Our room was great, their's was OK. I mean it was decent, but compared to ours, not as nice because of the streetview. I really liked that once we arrived at the hotel we never got back in our car until it was time to leave, 5 days later. Everything we needed or wanted was there. Keep in mind there was not much we needed/wanted except some cold drinks, a little food, live music , beach and lounging chairs The best thing I liked about this hotel was the seating beyond the pool that faces the water. Every morning we walked next door to the buffet breakfast (not a great breakfast but good enough) and…

title: Got 2 free nights with Priority Points - a real gem!
review: I wasn't expecting much- we used ponts for 2 free nights. The room was gorgeous! It was a 2 room suite- one had bath,kitchen area and living room, the other room had the double beds. The restaurant was delicious and the pool beautiful. We had just coem from a 6 night stay at the Pink Shell Beach Resort inFMB so thought we would be dissapointed but in no way were we! There is plenty of shops, mini golf and restaurants within walking distance.

title: We had a great time at the Holiday Inn
review: We got married at Sand Key and enjoyed our hotel suite room.  It was very nice having 2 rooms one with the bar and couch, table etc.  andother room with the beds.  The suite had 2 bathrooms which was nice.  It was great place to entertain with the 2 rooms.  We enjoyed our trip to Florida.

title: fantastic !
review: This hotel is the place to stay,we had the most amazing 2 weeks and will be going back .The photos on the hotel web site do not do it justice! We were upgraded to a suite,which with 2 teenagers was great as it gave us our own space ,this included 2 bathrooms and 2 plasmas!Also a living area with kitchenette.
