The location is not on the beach ,but when the tide went out you could climb down to the bay to play and swim . The pool area was lovely with plenty of sun loungers . Jimmys had lovely food and some good entertainment ,but for me it was the view, to sit and have dinner or a drink and watch the dolphins as the sunset was my highlight !Children ate free with paying aduts and the portions were huge . The pool was open to 11pm every night which kept the kids cool and happy as…

title: Best HI we've ever stayed at
review: We stayed for 4 nights in Dec 08 and were not disappointed.  In fact we were extremely surprised at the level of accommodation for being a Holiday Inn.   We had a king room gulf view on the 7th floor I think. We enjoyed our balcony at the end of day being able to sit and listen to the live music on the patio at Jimmy's directly beneath our balcony. I see some people complain about hearing the music. Not us.  It added some character to our stay. You are after all on vacation aren't you? If the music bothered you then you are a stick in the mud.  The pool area beside Jimmy's was great. The water was warm and it is a seriously deep pool. Actually too deep for our liking. But the lounging area that looks over the gulf is great.  The view was great and there was plenty of boat action…

title: Great New Years in Clearwater!
review: We stayed in Clearwater Beach for two nights for New Years (Dec 30th-1st.)  I thought my rate was pretty good for it being New Years Eve (paid around $150 a night.)  We decided not to pay the extra for the ocean view so we had a city view.  All rooms have a small balcony with a couple of chairs.  Our room was very clean and comfortable.  We spent a lot of time at the pool/deck  watching the boats since the weather was nice.  The deck by the pool is large and has several lounge chairs set up where you can just relax and watch the sunset.  One of the mornings as I was reading the paper and having my coffee out there I did see a dolphin.  We had several drinks at the bar (Iguana Bar) and they were all very tasty, expensive, but expected at a bar at the beach.  We didn't plan on…

title: absolutely a waste of money
review: first off i will say that upon entering the hotel i did feel that it was truly a beautiful place. the hell began once i checked into my room which they did not have the room i had booked and they supposedly gave me an "upgrade". it was all a lie...the room i ordered was to be a king suite with a full kitchen and i was to recieve a cot for my children. when i got to my room that i had payed wayyyy to much money for it was 2 double beds and as far as a kitchen we had a little fridge and a microwave. also on the phone during reservations i was told we had a beach outback on the property. This was also a big lie.. when i confronted the hotel management about the situation they told me it was an agency that made reservations and they dont know any better then she proceeded to tell me…

title: Nice Hotel
review: I stayed at this hotel in winter of 07.  The hotel had just been bought out by Holiday Inn.  I was very impressed with the HUGE, brand new suite I stayed in.  I actually had to go back down the the front desk and make sure they had given me the right room given the price I was paying.     The service and lobby decor are what you should expect for a 3 star hotel.  Front desk help was very friendly.  Servers at the restaurant/bar were just average, not overly friendly but not rude either.  Pool was nice and clean.  Rooms were cleaned daily with no problems.  Huge public beach was about a 2 block walk away and looked nice although we just hung out at the hotel pool the whole time.  There are two bars; one at the restaurant and one right by the pool.  Hotel was not filled to…

title: Awesome Hotel!!!
review: This hotel is wonderful!  The rooms were clean and had balconies that either overlook the street or the gulf.  We had a street view, but our friends had a gulf view suite with an awesome view.  The beach is a short walk, but you can also swim in front of the hotel if you climb down the wall. Every day we saw dolphins swim by and also saw a Manatee.  The pirate ship cruise goes by daily also.  The food in the restaurant was good and kids eat free - which is a bonus.  This was a very relaxing vacation and recommend anyone to visit and stay here.

title: Great Hotel
review: We spent one night at this location and were pleasantly surprised.  The staff was extremely friendly.  We ate lunch and dinner at the hotel restaurant and received terrific service and our kids (10 and 8) ate free.  Our room was comfortable and the flat screen tv is nice, although reception wasn't the greatest.    The outdoor heated pool was very nice, lots of chairs and pool towels.  Some previous reviews complained that the pool was not kid friendly since it was pretty deep.  Our kids both swim and enjoyed it.  The beach access is a short walk, so if you're the least bit active, the walk is no problem and the beach is beautiful.  We spent the evening at Pier 60 and the kids loved the playground and checking out the vendors that set up each evening.  We ate dinner at Crabby…

title: Fabulous
review: This hotel was truly awesome!!  My husband and I went to Clearwater Beach to get married and had several family members stay at the hotel as well.  The staff was excellent and professional.  They met all of our needs and family's needs.  The hotel is new and the cleanliness was immaculate.  The bathrooms, kitchenettes are all new, modern, and fresh.  The beds are comfortable and clean.  We stayed on the 6th floor with a gulf view.  We couldn't have asked for a better view.  The balconies are spacious and allowed for us to enjoy evening sunsets and views of dolphins!  The pool area and outdoor lounge are wonderful.  There is live music during the day and night.  Musicians are excellent, with Jimmy Buffet type of music.  We weren't sure what we would be getting when we booked…

title: Wonderful!
review: This was a truly wonderful experience...we had a 2 room suite with private gulf front balcony...the hotel, room, & view were beautiful...the pool is nice & clean.  Front desk & housekeeping staff kind & professional.  Location was great...would definately stay again or recommend.

title: Fantastic Hotel and even better staff.
review: Upon arriving we were greeting with a smile and a hello and from there the trip got even better.  The hotel is moderate priced but extremely clean and kept.  The staff went way over and above to make our stay great.  The food at the bar and restaurant was very good, especially the ceasar wrap and the ahi seared tuna. The lady bartenders were fantastic to my wife and I and A Rod was a star.  Overall I would give this a 5 star stay due to cleanliness, friendliness and overal stay.   I travel 3 days a week , 40 weeks a year.  So a reccommendation does not come eash from me.  If you stay here tell them 710 said hello.

title: Fantastic hotel!
review: We traveled to Clearwater for an important friend's wedding.  We stayed at the Holiday Inn Wed-Mon, Oct. 22-27.  Although the wedding party blocked rooms for the wedding, we found a cheaper price through holidayinn.com.    We purchased a suite w/ king sized bed and were not dissapointed!  Our 1 year old stayed in his pack n play in the living room and my mother slept on the pull out sofa bed.    Even with the bed out, there was plenty of room for him to play and move.  This room had a small fridge, microwave, sink, cabinets, dishes and silverware.  There was also a flat screen 32" tv on the wall, a small dinner table with 2 chairs.  The bathroom had a walk in tiled shower with modern granite, and sink.  Everything was fantastic.    Our room joined the living room with a lockable…

title: Solid Hotel for the Money
review: My wife and I were traveling to Clearwater for a wedding, and although we would not typically chance a Holiday Inn we have never seen, the description of the property on their website described a recent major makeover - so we took the chance. And we are glad we did.  The hotel is located after the newly designed Clearwater Beachwalk area. From the stories I heard, the redesign has made the area much more accessible and more pedestrian friendly. There are wide walkways, clearly marked cross-walks, and you're still right on the beach. For those familiar with the Ft. Lauderdale beach front - you'll see the resemblance. However, the nice part is that only one monolith hotel has been built so there are still plenty of small motels to keep the sky visible. It was a very nice area to…

title: Columbus Day Weekend
review: Four night stay in two-room suite with two beds and second bath. 4th floor Gulf front view. Clean Living area with picture window, flat panel TV, and table and chairs. Sofa bed was uncomfortable to sit on and worse to sleep on. Small counter area with 4 cup coffee service, sink, microwave and small fridge. Main bath had plenty of clean towels walk in shower and no counter space. Bath products were excellent.  Second room had two hard beds that were clean. Second bath had tub shower combo again no counter space, but had plenty of clean towels and great bath products. I liked the flat panel TV and second 4 cup coffee service in this room too. Balcony was great with table and two chairs good view. Both air conditioners exhaust to the balcony so I had to turn off the two AC to use…

title: Everything except the construction was great!
review: checked in at 4AM expecting to have to be out by 11 the ame morning. they gave me a suite and gave me the room to check out the next morning, for no extra charge.  Room was great! beds were very comfortable, and I liked that there was a balcony to smoke on, so I dint have to go down to the parking lot. they even had an ash tray on the table for me to use.  one down side, they charge for parking.  would stay here again!

title: clearwater review
review: Nice hotel  about 500 meters from Pier 61  beach only a  3 min walk  Staff very friendly  Jimmy bar and restaurant in hotel excellent - has its own atmosphere and menu not like a normal holiday inn

title: New rooms, great food
review: The hotel and its rooms are in immaculate condition, looks like a new renovation to me.   The room we had contained mini-kitchen, large flat-screen TV and very tasteful decoration, although quite a noisy A/C unit that I would expect to find in an old motel!  We arrived late and couldn't be bothered to go out for dinner so reluctantly dined at the hotel's restaurant, however the food and service was superb and we ended up eating there the second night too. You can dine right next to the sea and some nights they have live music.  Fairly expensive by US hotel standards, but I guess the location accounts for that. Will definately visit again.

title: Very Nice Hotel
review: We just returned from a two night stay at this hotel.  It is very nice.  We used points for our first night and I felt like we didn't get the same treatment as the second night when we actually paid.  Upon arrival, our room was not ready even though the hotel was not completely booked.  Even though we have been priority club members for a long time, an upgrade could not be done.  We had a very nice room on the 4th floor overlooking the city, it had been renovated and they are very nice.  The pool area was also good, the kids enjoyed the pool and access to the beach is close by.  We didn't try the restaurant or room service.  The manager on duty when we checked out on Saturday was wonderful, she was very accomodating since our flight wasn't until later in the evening.   Also the…

title: Wonderful romantic get away
review: My husband and I stayed at Holiday Inn Suites Clearwater August 13th - August 17.  We had a wonderful time. We stayed on the 8th floor in a quiet room with city views (it also has a view of Clearwater beach from the balcony) in the second tower.  It was really awesome. Initially, I was disappointed that our room was not a suite; however it quickly became less of a problem because the view was really wonderful. The staff was eager to help and problem solve. We had a great time in Clearwater. Based on the reviews we knew not to eat at Jimmy's though we did have drinks (four free with Priority Club). On a separate note the patio area just below the pool adjacent to Jimmy's is the perfect location to watch the sun go down. We loved it! Nothing like being with someone you love,…

title: Impressive
review: Just got back from a 2 night stay at this hotel. We absolutely loved it. My husband and I went for a relaxing mini vacation to kick back and this was the perfect place. The rooms were amazing; clean, modern, and nice sized. The flat screen T.V. was a plus too! The view from the balcony was incredible. The pool is directly beneath most of the balconies of rooms in tower 2, but it didn't bother us. The tiki bar was great although just a tad pricey, but comparable to mixed drinks at other bars. The pool was awesome as well - it doesn't seem that big until you are in it - and yes, they don't mess around with a 1-2" section, there is a baby pool for that. Just past the pool there are several lounge chairs on the edge of the deck overlooking the water. It was perfect! While laying out…

title: Great Place, Great Location
review: I was in the area on Thursday and Friday on business and my wife flew down to meet me Tampa for a get away weekend. We had a great time staying at the Holiday Inn Gulfview! Our room was on the Gulf side of the building and the view was spectacular!  The room and entire hotel was very clean. Sitting on the balcony, listening to the music from Jimmy's bar & resturant was fun too! Jimmy's provides for some good adult nightlife for guests and many others go there to party on Saturday night. Not an overly crowded "club" or "meat market," but more along the lines of a place where more mature adults (singles and couples alike) would want to hang out, drink cocktails and mingle. Many couples were dancing to the live music there.   Now to speak towards some of the other comments raised…

title: Very modern room
review: Nice hotel.  Great pool.  The restaurant was very good.  Far from airport. Had to walk a few blocks to the beach.  If you want to buy a botel of water it costs $3.  The room was nice....had a flatscreen TV.  Had a small kitchen which would be nice for people staying in the area a few days.

title: Not Child-Friendly
review: We had to cancel our reservation after seeing the property. The pool was 4 1/2 feet deep and there was no shallow area for children. Plus there was no direct access to the beach or to the gulf. If you wanted access to the gulf you either needed to go down to the public beach or "sneak" on to another hotel property near by. So with no beach access (or gulf access) and not child friendly we needed to cancel our reservation. So we do not recommend this hotel to anyone traveling with kids who think the hotel is directly on the gulf.

title: Summertime and the livin is easy at the beach!
review: Wow- what a great property!  We spent a week at the Holiday Inn and Suites Clearwater Beach from July 19-25 and couldn't have been happier with our stay!  The staff was top-notch and the rooms are wonderful.  We booked a city-view suite for two adults and two teens, and although our room was located right near the elevator, we only heard noise one night.  The suite is actually two adjoining rooms, one set up as a living area with a fold-out sofa and the other with two queen beds.  More than enough room for the four of us.    There was a good-sized mini fridge and microwave with silverware and dishes for 4, so we stopped at a grocery and bought breakfast and snack foods and sodas- probably saving us $150+ over the course of the week.    We had several meals at Jimmy's- the onsite…

title: Good Location and Great Value
review: My wife and I spent a long weekend at this hotel. After several weeks of researching all the hotels in the area, the Holiday Inn seemed to be the right choice and it was!!   We live across the street from the beach in Melbourne Beach, Florida (East Coast) and our goal was to see the sunrise rise and set on the same day (Mission accomplished).  The location was good but not great. The good thing was it was on the inlet and you could watch the boat traffic and you could even swim right off the pool deck area at low tide. The water was just as clean and nice as the beach. The beach was about 3-5 minute walk, no big deal but was so crowded.  I drove over to the State Park, hoping it would not be as crowded "Wrong" plus the parking meters took quarters only (12 minutes for 25 cents).…

title: Very nice hotel for a relaxing and satisfying vacation
review: 1st week July '08  -  Stayed for a week at the Holiday Inn in Clearwater Beach, FL  This place has recently been fully renovated and the rooms, beds, pool, etc. are all in great shape.  As a priority club member, I got an upgrade with a view of the gulf which I would highly recommend over the views looking at the roadway.    This gave a great view of the gulf, boats moving along the water, and activities in the pool below.  There is a public beach within 5 minute walk up the road from the hotel, as well as short walks to an iHOP and very good Italian restaurant.  The only sad note (if there was one) is that you have to pay $7  / day to park in the hotel's own parking lot.  After awhile it became obvious why.  All of these hotels along the gulf guard their parking lots like…

title: Great Time at Holiday Inn
review: We went over from Orlando for a quick get away this past Saturday. When we stay at the beach it has to be overlooking the beach. Th Holiday Inn is great, we brought our son 2, and our daughter 5, for my son's second birthday. The hotel is cleaner than most properties. The location is perfect to walk to all the Clearwater Beach attractions. We spent time at the pool and the beach. Everyone we met was very friendly. Our room was a executive room with 2 queen beds. We can not wait to return. We also took the Pirate Cruise, great for the kids and what veiw with free adult beverages.

title: fabulous and wonderful value
review: Wow, this Hoilday Inn was really impressive.  It was cleaner and nicer than Hiltons we have stayed in. We stayed in the suites and it was great for  3 teenagers and 2 adults. Bethany at the front desk was extremely professional and made sure we had a great room for the needs of our family. I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone. The value was incredible!!!  My husband travels to Clearwater 2 times a year so we will definately be back.  Make sure you sign up for the priority club to get a free drink each night of your stay and an upgrade.  The shrimp over ice was wonderful for a nightly special of $10.00.  Thanks Holiday Inn for a great stay!!!!

title: Great Spot in ClearwaterBeach
review: The Holiday Inn was a wonderful place. The staff was wonderful and the room very very nice.  We upgraded to an ocean view for only a small charge.  The hotel bar/restauarant has a fabulous view at sunset and the live acoustic guitar player was really good.   Only a couple of small things I didn't like. 1) the towels in the room and at the pool were low grade and felt like sandpaper. 2) the device they have to keep away the seagulls is some sort of high pitched sonic device that was slighlty annoying. It sounded like a dolphin's high pitch squeal 3) something was up with our AC unit. It worked well, but the next day both myself and my traveling companion were coughing up a storm as if we smoked a pack of cigarettes the night before.  These 3 things certainly ould not keep me from…

title: Well worth the trip.....
review: Came down to Tampa area for work and to visit some customers. Decided to have my wife join me and make it a work/vacation trip. Booked my room thru my companies travel agency and had a standard room. Called a week before my arrival and asked about an upgrade as my wife was traveling with me. Lady I spoke with at the front desk was one of the most pleasant people I have ever dealt with in my travels. She without question upgraded me to a suit with a gulf view (as a Priority Club member and frequent visitor of Priority Club hotels). Absolutely love the suit we were given. The room and the view made this an absolute perfect trip for us. Room was very nice and the recent renovations are clearly evident. Having traveled up and down the Clearwater Beach area on this visit, I can…

title: Very Nice
review: The rooms are very nice and the hotel was very quite. I have been to this hotel in the past when it was NOT a Holiday Inn and it left a lot to be desired.  There were two minor problems the room was supposed to be a bay view, but when you sat on the balcony, all you could see was the roof, the other problem was the  first stepin the pool, it was very slippery and if it had not been for my friend I would have fell and could have had a serious injury. We enjoyed out night there and slept very well. I would definatley stay there again and would reccomend to family & friends.

title: We really liked it
review: We appreciate your kind words about our wonderful hotel and staff.  We rely on our guests to let us know how we are doing and where we need to improve and we appreciate you taking the time to share your comments and concerns.  We look forward to welcoming you back to our hotel when you are in the Clearwater Beach area again.  Thanks again, Management & Staff

title: perfect location
review: I used my points for this stay. We had the time of our lives. Excellent location, excellent service, excellent rooms, free upgrade

title: Holiday Inn MkII - even better than the Sunspree!
review: Over the past 10 years, on every occasion we have visited Clearwater Beach, we had stayed at the Holiday Inn Sunspree, located at the southern end of the resort. This has now been demolished for private accommodation. Consequently, when we decided we wanted to go back to Clearwater, we scanned the resort for available hotels. To our surprise we found the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites - what a find! Best hotel on the Beach by a mile! We arrived at our room to find a suite converted from 2 rooms, each with separate shower and bathroom, and plasma TV's in each room! We also had a balcony overlooking the beach, and the best view of the sunset in the whole resort. What a hotel - best location, excellent facilities, great sun deck, and right next to the beach. Brilliant!

title: Great Location
review: I agree with most of the other reviewers. The hotel has a great location. Gas station across the street, plenty of food options within walking distance. The beach prominade has been recently completed so there is a nice walkway between the beach and the road.  This hotel is oceanfront, but not beachfront. The pool area is walled in next to the ocean. It's a block walk to the beach.   Join the Holiday Priority Club on their website and you'll get a free drink for each night of your stay.  It's about 16 miles from the airport, so it will take less than 30 minutes to get there in normal traffic.  Nice large rooms with fridges and microwaves.

title: Great Value
review: More than I ever expected.  Rooms were recently updated and very tidy.  The pool/bar area overlooks the gulf and had beautiful views especially at Sunset.  Restaurant and bar had great seafood and excellent prices.  Perfect location as you could walk almost anywhere.  Although hotel is on the gulf it is a 3 minute walk to the beach which was very convenient.  I would definitely recommend as this was a great experience and value!

title: Fantastic stay
review: The holiday inn was a fantastic hotel, could walk to pretty much anything in around 20 minutes.  The room was large and clean, with a great ocean view, plasma was a nice touch and the bed was really comfortable.  Can recommend the hotel restaurant, did some really great seafood and was reasonably priced.  It was nice to watch the sun go down with a cold beer, good food and a little live music.  Hotel staff I encountered did all they could to make your stay pleasant.  Would definately go back.

title: Great Girls' Trip
review: I used my priority points and got more than I expected. Upon checking in, front desk told me that they were 100% occupancy and they had to switch my room. We went from a standard room to a suite which was great for 3 women. The pool was perfect. The front desk bent over backwards to make our stay wonderful! I can't wait to go back!

title: A little note about this hotel
review: A quick note- We stayed at this property at the end of Spring Break week- (I did not know this when we came to clearwater) I was very apprehensive as we did not have reservations. Pulled into the Holiday Inn and were treated great. Never any roudy people. Seemed very family oriented. Was happy with all the served from housekeeping to the front desk and bartenders. They even let us do a late checkout on our last day. No extra fee, If you sign up for their Priority Club. THis is the second time I have stayed in a Holiday Inn this one and in KeyLargo and have been more than pleased. Very, Very clean hotel Keep up the good work and don't think twice about staying here - just book it

title: Good Review to Read Before Your Clearwater Trip
review: Two years ago we stayed at Shepards resort next door to this Holiday Inn. The Holiday Inn on Clearwater has just been renovated and the rooms are much nicer than those of Shepards (larger and cleaner).  We had no issues with housekeeping who came into our rooms each day while we were out and we returned to all of our belongings and nice clean rooms.   The location is pretty decent as you are just a few minutes walk to the main public beach. The pool is pretty nice as it sits directly on a beautiful view of the Gulf.  A Walgreens with an attached liquire store is a two minute walk as well.  Here are my negatives about this Holiday Inn which are easy to work around on your trip if you head the warning ahead of time.   1) The Holiday Inn contracts their room service out to the…

title: Great Stay in Clearwater Beach
review: Had a great stay at the Holiday Inn. Received a special rate. Room was ready as advertised. I asked for a quiet room away from the elevators and got just that, high in Tower 1 (room 600), away from the noise by the pool area behind Tower 2.  Staff were very helpful. Requested room service and the front desk sent someone up within 5 minutes.  The rooms were recently updated and was impressed with the furnishings and cleanliness.  Had supper at Jimmy's and the scallops wrapped in bacon was excellent.  Overall, I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Great for family of 4 with teenagers
review: I am surprised at the 2 recently negative reviews of this hotel but can understand that sometimes nothing can go right at a chain hotel.  Our experience was very different.    We arrived at 8-8:30 Sunday evening March 30.  So our room was ready. We made a reservation for a 2 Room Suite with 2 bathrooms.  The room included two queen size beds, a large flat screen TV, square dining type table and two armed chairs that fit the table.  This room also had a walkout balcony with sliding doors.  On the balcony were two plastic chairs and a small table.  The two rooms overlooked the pool and Gulf of Mexico.  The other room which was adjoining with a door that could be closed for privacy had a mini refrigerator, microwave, sink with a large counter area and adequate storage area for…

title: Exceeded Expectations
review: I spent several days reading reviews on Clearwater Beach Hotels and labored over my decision based on the reviews I'd been reading. Finally decided on the Holiday Inn despite some of the negative reviews and was glad I did! They did an amazing re-do in my opinion. It looked like a new hotel. The hotel/room was clean, beds were comfy. We got the 2 room queen suite which includes 2 Queen beds, 2 bathrooms, one w/ a shower the other w/ a tub. Mini fridge, microwave, sofabed, dining table. Included dishes/ utensils too. Both Living room and bedroom had nice 37in LG Flat screen TV's but I don't recall seeing the weather channel ??? Had a wonderful view of the pool and ocean that was breathtaking. Nice balcony w/ 2 chairs and a table. Housekeeping had failed to clean here as they…

title: Hated this hotel
review: This hotel is a joke. The staff is rude and unhelpful. We were not given the room we had reserved. I called for room service two minutes after they were scheduled to close and of course, that was two minutes too late. The housekeeping never showed up until after 4:00 p.m., which would be when we were back from the beach and getting ready to go out. The day we checked out, we were running late. I called to see if we could leave an hour late, but of course, on that day they were going to need to clean the room first thing that morning.   The $7 per day parking charge is ridiculous. How can they charge parking to people that are staying in the hotel? The pool was nice, but in order to get a lawn chair next to it, you had to wake up early in the morning and throw your towel on one…

title: Very Nice Place to Stay
review: Stayed here over spring break with the family.  Very nice hotel to stay at.  Even though we had a room with "no view" it still had a side view of the ocean and pool area.  Great lobby area with gift shop, beauty salon, restaurant, and the pool  area was fantastic.  The bar is great with a nice deck with live entertainment.  You can't walk out onto the beach from the hotel but it is just a short short walk to beach area from parking lot.  Close to shops, and restaurants.  Don't recommend eating in the hotel restaurant because it is pricy. We had breakfast there - just three of us and it was $40.  Recommend a McDonalds down the street for breakfast.  The room was clean and the maid service good.  Would definitely stay there again. Beware-parking is $7 a night added to room.

title: Family friendly, full service hotel
review: This hotel is 5 star. Our families originally booked at Hi Seas, what a dump(Don't ever stay there) We walked over to the Holiday and booked two rooms for the week. From the first second at the front desk, we were made to feel welcome by the staff. We booked a kids suite with three rooms and bunk beds for the kids(What a great idea by Holiday Inn) After checking in we went to the awesome pool and were greated by our server Danielle(Jersey) who was great, and boy can she mix a drink. Later we also met Trent who was a great and friendly bartender in his own rite. Sometime later we met with the food and beverage Mgr, Cheryl who made sure the food and drinks were excellent. My family has been going to Clearwater for the past 7 years, and we could not have asked for a better hotel.…

title: An absolute nightmare
review: This hotel was an absolute nightmare.  The only thing good was the location.  They charge $7/day to park.  The staff kept entering our room even after they were told not to.  3 out of 4 days we stayed there we found staff in our room.  They removed the Do Not Disturb sign and entered.  There was money taken from the room.  The keys kept having to be reprogrammed.  The door only locked part of the time, and when reported nothing was done.  The room was paid for through a travel agency in December.  They were given the voucher at check in and still tried to bill my credit card.  There was one employee who was good at his job and that was Gilbert.  The restaurant associated with the hotel had terrible service.  There were long waits and cold food.  I would NOT recommend staying…

title: Great Hotel
review: We recently stayed at this hotel for a Spring Break trip with two of our teenagers.  The hotel was exceptionally clean, the staff exceptionally friendly and helpful.  The "suite" is in fact two rooms, but not a problem - we kept the door open with a shoe!  The pool was immaculately kept - and housekeeping was very attentive.  We had a problem with the TV remote around midnight, and within minutes we received a new one.  The short walk to the beach is not a problem, and the beach(es) are beautiful.  The hotel is not on a beach, but there is a lovely patio area with deck chairs that is directly on the Gulf.  I would highly recommend this hotel to families on Spring Break - there were mostly families and older couples staying at this hotel when we were there.

title: Nice Gulf view... but not on the beach
review: I was told that the Holiday inn was a good place to stay in clearwater beach... There were several listed on web sites that I looked at... but when I got there there was only one. This hotel has just been updated, it was nice and clean, nice pool area with bar, small kids pool for the little ones so they can play in 1 foot of water. I had a few issues with the hotel, one was that it was overlooking the gulf, but you had to walk down the street a few blocks to get to the beach... not far, I just thought that the hotel was on the beach. Nice views from my gulf front room, would go for that as some of the gulf view are really looking at a building and you can see the ocean. The other issue was that this was a suite... but the suite was really 2 rooms side by side with a connecting…

title: fine rooms - good location
review: When a wholesaler botched our prepaid stay at another property, we called this hotel the night  before and booked two, two-bedroom suites for our family group.  The best feature of the hotel was the rooms.  Newly remodeled, good quality furnishings, plasma tvs, bedding for six, two full baths, balcony.  One suite was "city view" and the other gulf view for $130 more per night.  The city view suite had a glimpse of the gulf anyway and was the better value.  The hotel was pretty quiet, although there were a number of children around the adequate pool.   The beach in front of the hotel was mostly washed away years ago, but  there is a good public beach one mile south at Sand Key Park.  Good area for running (go south).  Very clean property, with housekeepers working hard keeping it…

title: nice surprise!
review: I have seen some reviews online about holiday inn at clearwater beach, but you must realize that there was an old holiday inn sunspree resort that was old and rundown and the reason we stopped going to holiday inns.  We started to go to the hilton but this year they were so overpriced we decided to give this new holiday inn a shot.  We were pleasantly surprised!  Everything is brand new.  We were upgraded to a suite with two bedrooms, two bathrooms, a kitchen, living room and eat in area, a jacuzzi tub,  two balconies, one facing the water the other facing the parking lot/street area.   It was nice and having been to clearwater many times i knew this hotel is on  the water but the beach is like a two minute walk.  You have access to the water, but there is a sea wall.  The only…

title: Fantastic in Florida
review: I booked this hotel through my "Priority Plus Points Card" for Holiday Inn. If you have a "Air Miles Card" you can also transfer the points towards a free stay. We arrived on Dec 28, 2007 and were checked in promptly. To our surprise they gave us a free upgrade to the 2 room suite with kitchenette. We chose this hotel because of their recent 27 million dollar renovation which we hoped would mean a nice clean room. The rooms were fantastic. They were brand new with no expense spared. The beds were very comfortable. The rooms feature a 32" LCD High Def T.V and granite countertops in the bathrooms. Absolutely no worries of cockroaches here. Even my wife was happy!  My only complaint about the room was that the door and walls seemed thin as you could hear people in the halls. I…

title: Skeptical then impressed
review: Had a suite at the hotel.  Very impressed.  I didn't know what to expect, but arrived to find a hotel very much like you'd find in a new Hilton or Marriott room.  Usually when I hear of hotel renovations it usually amounts to just a fresh coat of paint, they have truly gutted the place and made it top notch.  The common areas and entrance of the hotel are still under construction, but the guestroom I had was great.  The room was clean, the bedding was comfortable, the bathroom was great.  They even had Bath and Body brand toiletries.  The air conditioner was loud, but worked very well and cooled the room down quickly.  For the price, it was a great room.  Within walking distance of Pier 60 and several restaurants and clubs.  Parking is at a premium and on weekends they had a…

title: Good for family
review: I stayed on business this past week.  That was one strange room.  I booked a suite and when I arrived (very late) I was not ready to walk into a room and not find a bed.  Turns out you get two hotel rooms.  This really became an unusual trip when I was sort of locked in my own room because as I was leaving I left everything in one room returned to the other room to double check that I picked everything up and the security door swung shut and locked me in that half.  I could not leave that room because I did not have a key to the other room:)  They sent someone right up who was able to get me in.  On that note most everyone there was very helpful.    Anyway I think if you are going there for vacation than it would be better.  On business I would rather return to some of the other…

title: Second time and it was a charm
review: Our 31st anniversary and our second year in a row celebrating it here. Seventh floor gulfview room directly over the stage. Beautiful sunsets and wonderful music from our balcony. I don't think it could have been better. Only complaint that I had in this room pertains to the place next door, Shephards. Unlike this resort their music is loud and continued for hours longer. With the hurrican glass door shut you could still hear the bass. Then loud voices in the common parking lot when the music was over and then a load mouth intoxicated female excited to find her room near ours at  2:30 AM . Can't blame this resort because the neighbor likes to get people drunk and play loud music. We decided that we will avoid being here on Saturday nights in the future.

title: Great Hotel!
review: I stayed at the Clearwater Beach Gulfview Resort for two nights on a business trip in Clearwater. It's a great location overlooking the water. The bar (inside and out) were both very nice with friendly bartenders. The room itself was much more than I expected. There was a flat screen TV (although we didn't get very many channels), a microwave, and a mini fridge. I was impressed with the quality of the sheets and pillows (although my bed was a little stiff). I was also surprised to see such high quality soaps (bath and body works) used in each room. I travel A LOT for work so it was nice to see such attention to detail. I would definitely stay there again.

title: Good hotel for price - good for couples, young families...
review: First of all, we booked our flights thru Expedia and Hotel as well and got additional $40 off of hotel costs (instead of thru their website which charged a whole lot more). Expedia pre-charges you so there shouldn't be any additional charges via hotel unless you did room service or anything like that. I had called the receptionist prior to booking and lady told me that entire hotel was pretty much done with renovation, except for the lobby face, which was true. I also asked about the resort fee, which she said is $7 a day - which includes your "free" wireless internet, guest parking and pool accomodations. We got the Gulf view room in the main building (the one with the lobby) on 5th floor and it overlooked the pool and water front. View wasn't bad - it was actually pretty…

title: Good time in Clearwater
review: This hotel was nicer than some of the earlier reviews. The construction is complete in the pool area. The resturant bar was nice. The only complaint I had was that the air conditioners vent to the balcony instead of a central system. This makes the balconies all most unusable in the summer.

title: Horrible!!! Read this!!!
review: This place Charged us $250 for smoking outside on the balcony ... and there was an ashtray outside ... DONT TRUST this place!!!... OVER RATED!!! HORRIBLE!!! walls are thin and staff will curse you off !!! they charged us 2 weeks later $250 for smoking in the room when we did not smoke in the room!!! DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!

title: Excellent rooms in new tower, avoid old tower at all costs!
review: We booked this through a travel agent and all seemed fine until the night before when we read reviews on trip advisor.  EEK!  We were worried.  We called the travel agent and they re-assured us no probs that they've heard of.  We went, we checked in late - all seemed ok but we got a horrible horrible room in the old block.  The carpets were sticky and dirty, cockroach in the bathroom, room just very run down and the view (side view of sea) overlooking dumpsters and car park and noisy were just not what we were looking for.  We went downstairs and she said that she could move us to the new block but at an extra $70 per night.  We decided to decide in the morning.  In the morning it looked just as bad so we decided to move.  We weren't happy with paying the extra money but after…

title: Great stay at Clearwater Beach Gulfview Resort
review: We spent 6 nights over the 4th of July and had a great time.  We have been staying at this hotel for over 5 years.  The renovation job is excellent.   The front desk, bartenders and staff are more than accommodating.  Can't say enough good things about this hotel.  We ate many meals at Jimmy Iguanas, you will not be disappointed with your meal.  We will be returning next July 4th and can't wait.    Thanks Gulfview for another great vacation!

title: Had a great time!
review: My husband and I just returned from a fabulous trip to Clearwater Beach.  The Gulfview Resort exceeded our needs, as we were there for a long weekend to have fun and relax.  They had a nice pool area, and while this resort sits on the water, and not directly on a beach, beautiful beach is only a block away, and close enough to the pier60 and Sand Key as well.  We took full advantage of the hotel's Jimmy's Fishhouse and Iguana Bar.  The staff is awesome, the drinks are wonderful and the food was fantastic.  They had entertainment daily, and the hotel is next door to Shepard's, known for its entertainment as well.  The hotel is fully remodeled so the rooms are nicely updated.  If I had to throw a negative in, I suppose the front desk staff could be a little more cheerful.  The…

title: Save your money
review: I stayed at the Gulfview over Memorial Day weekend (May 26,27) with my girlfriend.  I booked the room using the hotel’s website in early March.  In April my credit card  was billed for a “No Show”. Two months before my reservation. After three days, two phone calls and one Email the charges were credited back.  My reservation was for a “GULF FRONT NON SMOKING 2 QUEEN BEDS” room. In my reservation, I requested a room on an upper floor. The hotel website boasts of spectacular views of The Gulf of Mexico.  Upon check in, I was given a “2 QUEENS POOLSIDE CABANA ROOM”. This room was on the first floor and opened directly to the pool.  The view is of playing children and people sun bathing directly in front of your door and window. The front desk staff showed no concern for my needs…

title: Loved it
review: We at the Gulfview strive to meet all of our guest requests, However somtimes we miss this mark, As with all reservations with special requests; try to remember that it is only a request not a gaurantee. Reservations mix-up<sincere apology< We are a none smoking facility, All rooms are non-smoking.Cabana rooms are  poolside but just beyond the pool is the Gulf of Mexico. Same side of the Resort.

title: Choose wisely
review: My husband and I, with our two kids (ages 8 & 10) stayed at the Resort for 4 nights in their Cabana Pooside Room.  The view was beautiful, the pool was great.  We loved the live music sitting poolside or while having lunch at the Resort's restaurant.  Since our room was poolside, it was nice to put the kids to bed or to let them play in the game room while we enjoyed the music and drinks from the outdoor bar, while still keeping an eye on the kids.  We initially planned on going to Busch Gardens but the kids were happy to stay right in Clearwater so why bother spending all the $$ at Busch Gardens if they weren't asking to go!  Pier 60 was fun at night.  We all had a wonderful time.  I looked around the area for a better choice in hotel and couldn't find one.  We hope to come…

title: Nice rooms, but thin walls!
review: This hotel is a mixed bag. The bag will be less mixed when the construction on the old tower is done. Get a room as far away from the construction as you can and get one with a water view. That is a water view - as there is no beach, but there is one very close by. The big plus is the bar scene at the hotel and at the bar next door. We had no problem with room noise, but we had an end room - a big plus. The location is great. Within walking distance are fun bars and restaurants and a nice internet cafe. We drove over to the Hilton and spent a little time at their bar. It was worth it for a change of pace - little more upscale than most. Their beach looked great too. The Gulfview Resort served as a great base at a reasonable price and we would stay there again (when the…

title: Clearview Inn is the place to stay during Phillies Spring Training
review: We visited the Gulfview in Clearwater Beach for the first time in April '07.  The hotel grounds/amenities were pretty basic but the rooms were nicely remodeled, the pool area got plenty of sun and was updated (just finishing up re-modeling when we were there) and the bar/restaurant was nicely located on the water and connected to the pool area.  The beach is a short walk from the hotel, so we really didn't miss having a hotel located "on the beach".  Our only complaint was how noisy the room was -- thin walls made it too easy to hear hallway conversations and doors slamming.  Additionally, we chose to stay in a room with a "City View" which is right on the main road.  There was a lot of noise from nearby construction and traffic, in general - it was disappointing when sitting on…

title: Clearwater Beach becoming over priced for  what it is!
review: Have been visiting ClearWater Beach  for quite some time. The resturants and shops are  great. Beach is great and everyone seems to have  fun. However,   some of  hotel accomodations are  over priced for  what you get. Seems the city is looking  to change  its  culture  for  multimillionaires who can purchase their high priced condos rather than keeping hotels so everyone can enjoy. Sorry to say that we plan to go to other  areas. Will look further  South.  Heard  Vero Beach - Sanibel Island is the  place to go.

title: Nice newly renovated hotel
review: I just recently stayed 2 nights at the Gulfview.   At this time they were going through a major renovation which was about 50% completed at the time of our visit.  The good thing is you get to stay in the newly renovated tower,  the other tower is now being renovated and no one stays in it.   I had a city view room with a king bed.  The room had the following amenities 42" LCD TV, small fridge,  microwave,  granite countertops.  Very well done.  Did not hear any construction noise.  So if your looking for a nice clean room at a good rate  this is the place.  I booked online hotels.com and saved about $30.00 a night over booking directly with the resort.

title: Good choice on the beach
review: I wasn't sure what to expect from this hotel, since I'd seen mixed reviews.  However, the experience was very pleasant.  We only had one night to spend at the beach due to sitter issues, but we appreciated our choice.   We booked on Expedia, and then upgraded to a gulf view room upon checkin for an extra $60 (a little high, but it was a Friday and we only had one night, so it was worth it).  There were some issues at checkin due to untrained staff and a not-so-patient trainer (he was actually quite rude to his new staff and it was slightly embarrassing for us to witness).   The entire new part of the hotel is gorgeous, and our room was beautiful as well.  The ocean comes right up to the walkway by the pool area and it was a great view.  The room was also spotlessly clean.  The…

title: Wonderful Stay!
review: Prior to staying in this Hotel we had great concerns about our visit as the reviews were pretty poor - especially about the old tower.  We almost considered changing our trip and going to another hotel but were very pleased we didn't.  We arrived on Sat 4 November 2006 and were very happy to find we were in the renovated tower .... phew!!  and work on the old tower was due to start on the Monday. Imagine there will be some noise and disturbance whilst these renovations take place in the next few months so probably need to be prepared for this. However, we can only say that the renovated tower is excellent - the room was perfect with very large bed, flat screened tv, micro and fridge - all perfectly clean with very nice decor.  Overall we were very impressed with the polite and…

title: Ultra clean and modern top choice!
review: This hotel exceeded all my expectations.  Lots of comparing and review reading took place before I booked this hotel and upon arrival even my wife was impressed!  Our room on 2nd floor had microwave, minifridge, big screen flat panel TV, granite countertops,  modern new furnishings, fixtures and carpet.  The new tower we stayed in had recently just opened and since we couldn't find even a scuff mark or blemish in this sharp room we may have been one of 1st to stay in it.   The view of the pool area and gulf was fantastic off our balcony.   My wife and I stayed 4 nites and did quite a bit of walking around the area.  We are soundly convinced this was the best place to stay in the area.  Throughout our stay all employees were pleasant and staff was constantly cleaning or polishing…

title: Loved it !!!!!!!!
review: Just got back yesterday, and would go back to this hotel anytime. It was clean, the staff was very courteous and friendly.  We had our kids with us and the pool area was perfect for them.  I was very concerned after reading some of the comments, but booked anyways and was so glad I did. yYou could tell the rooms had just been renovated and they did an excellent job decorating.  I felt that is was truly an upper class resort hotel.  It had something for every age group.  The only drawback for some would be that it is not beachfront, however, it is 2 minutes to the beach sand area that it did not matter to us.  Just keep in mind when you read the negatives that some people are never happy with what they have.

title: Not bad
review: We stayed here in the week of sep 20-23,2006 we got adjoining rooms, the corner of the building on the 4th floor looking at the pool and ocean.  The room was well decorated and nice. (not new but not runned down.) The one with looking directly at the ocean was nicer than the other one next to it.   The pool is nice and so is the new lobby, looks real classy for the future. The only three things that I found wrong was that there was no room service and really slow  house keeping (do to lack of "latin" staff in the hotel) and all of florida.  Trust me it makes a difference. as well as the constuction of the protective wall from the ocean.  But the workers don't start untill about 11 so there is really notting to worry about were sleep is concered about. OH and there is an ocean…

title: I loved it!
review: It was my first time to my states and we was at clearwater beach looking for our hotel they were beautiful and my eye caught an hotel that was ok but was'nt as nice that was our hotel it looked shabby from the outside due to work on the hotel but when we entered the hotel i fell in love with it lovely staff lovely cleaners the room was really tidy and the waffle house did great food!The only problem is that our room was on top of the fan so it was noisy when you opened the baclony door.BEST HOLIDAY EVER!

title: terible hotel. Will never stay there again
review: We arrived at the hotel and thought the lobby was lovely and clean and everything was fine. After reading the reviews we didnt know what kind of a place it would be. We went to the recieption and when checking in we were told that our booking may have been cancled. We thought this was a bit strange. We then found out it was not cancelled but we had to wait at least an hour until our rooms was cleaned. We travelled to Florida with another family and when we arrived in the rooms the first thing we noticed was the size of the rooms for four people they were tiny! We settled in and in the two rooms the paint was all scraped of the bath and the shower rail blue moulded the carpet was filthy and when you walked on it your feet  were black. Everything was damp because of the air con…

title: Forget this hotel!
review: This hotel is not on the beach.  It is terribly overpriced, they are more concerned with turning it into a condo then making their customers happy.  It was very dirty.  We were promised a "gulfview" room, and yeah we could see it on the side.  We could also see all the construction going on and the road.  Thumbs down!

title: Did not Like
review: This facility was by no means anything that I would consider  a resort. It was very overpriced and the staff was very unprofessional except for one person.  The rooms were very outdated and not so clean.  The sofa was once a light fabric but was very dingy and soiled.  The room next to us had set out their room service by the door from the evening before and it set there from 7:00am til 9:00pm before it was removed. That was very gross and stinky.  I don't understand why the housekeeping did not pick it up.  They walked by it several times that day.This facility really did not offer its guests anything but a place to sleep.  If you are looking for a comfortable, clean and enjoyable place to stay, this is NOT it.  I will never again return to this facility.  It is on the Gulf but…

title: Dirty, Stinky, Musty
review: After reading some of the reviews my husband and I were hesitant about booking this hotel for our family vacation. We thought we would give it a try as it claimed to be right on the gulf and beach. When we arrived we were told that our reservation had been changed due to water damage. They were giving us a smaller and cheaper room but still charging us for our reserved room. They gave us a room on the 6th floor nonsmoking and when we walked in I couldn't believe what I was seeing. Dirty, smelly carpet with stains and burn marks on the floor. The bathrooms were filthly and had not been cleaned in a while. I was told they did not have any other rooms available. I told them I refuse to stay in the room they gave us. They did come up with another room but we only stayed in that room…

title: Perfectly Acceptable
review: I stayed at this hotel over Memorial Day weekend and was afraid of what I would find after reading some of the negative reviews.  The positive reviews are what made me keep my reservations.  On arriving at the hotel, you can't help but notice the large amount of construction going on and it is an eyesore.  Then you notice the old part of the hotel where renovation has yet to spread.  It is hard not to think negative thoughts.  I suddenly wished I had cancelled my reservation and went somewhere else.  But I headed inside anyway and what a surprise!  The lobby is beautiful.  The staff was very friendly, as stated before.  The elevators are slow and the carpet inside the elevator needs a thorough scrubbing but the walls of the elevator are clean and, yes, the elevator's paperwork…

title: Not the best......
review: Hi All.... While I wasn't there just for the pleasure of staying at the hotel, I did expect something better than I found.  The staff was great and the food was good but, the construction of the new tower really spoiled my "sun time".  I ended up staying on the bottom sundeck closest to the water to avoid the dozen or so pairs of eyes that gawked everytime a female walked near the pool.  As a result, I only saw 2 women actually using the pool. I personally didn't get in once.  Also, there's no beach at the hotel.  Folks, don't spend your money at this hotel until it's construction is completed.  I did enjoy my stay  in Clearwater but had I known the mess the hotel was in, I would have cancelled my reservations and stayed somewhere else.

title: The Construction noise on tower 2
review: Construction on tower 2 was on going, from 7am-3pm, Mon -Sat. lounging at pool side was unbearable. The box springs in our room was disgusting, should be changed We had room 403 opposite tower 2. Because of the construction, the rates were cheap. I suggest not booking this hotel for any vacation anytime soon for the year 2006-07

title: Excellent Wedding Reception Site
review: I planned my wedding ceremony and reception from NJ and worked very closely with the catering manager on my dinner reception details.  She was an extreme pleasure to work with!  The food was great and the price was right!  The room was exactly as she described it to me.  She paid allot of attention to details and the service that evening was perfect!!  I had 50 guests, dance floor and open bar - the room size was perfect!  bathrooms and lobby were very clean and presentable.

title: Better than expected after reading the reviews
review: Upon arriving at the hotel, it clearly fit its negative descriptions.  The elevators were nasty, as were the hallways.  My room smelled awful...musty, just strange.  I then requested a room change which was given no questions asked.  The people at the front desk are great and very accomodating...as good as a 5 star within their resources...and I am a very hard customer.  Back to the room, next room smelled funny also, but nothing like the 1st.  I aired it out & determined the smell actually came from the self-mixed cleaners they use.  I requested no cleaners for the week(stayed 8 nights), just towels, vacuum, and make bed.  Worked out great!  The room was very clean & the towels were fine.  If you check out the hotel's home page, the room with the yellow comforter does not…

title: Great Location
review: The Ramada Inn Gulfview was in a great location close to all the amenities of Clearwater Beach. Nice pool close to water's edge. Rooms reasonable size and very clean.

title: Hotel From Hell!!!!
review: My husband & I just returned from our trip to Clearwater. We had found the CWB Gulfview Resort online to stay at...sounded good. New rooms...blah, blah....Were we in for a rude awakening!!! I won't go into detail on each thing we found miserable, I will just list them and let you form your own opinion.  1- Dirty, rotton, filthy mattresses, springs coming out (see photos) 2- Hair and scum in shower - never cleaned during our three day stay. 3- Mold on shower curtain - Humm, shower curtains cost how much? 4 - Skid marks in toilet - obviously not cleaned! 5 - Pillow cases put on pillow wrong side out???? Duh 6 - Pillows so flat you need 4 to make a normal one - suggestion...bring your own folks. 7 - Stains on chairs - wouldn't sit on them 8 - Carpet dirty, esp. in halls and…

title: Very, Very Disappointed
review: Stayed at the Gulfview from 2/27-3/4/06.  The bedding and bathrooms were clean but the carpet was so dirty that the soles of your feet became black.  When I was checking out, I commented about it to the desk staff.  Their response, and I quote, "We have a lot of people tell us that, we just can't get the carpet clean, some of our visitors put a sheet on the floor so the kids can crawl around".  Yes, that is what was said.  Considering the conferece rate for the room was $176.00 per night, I could not believe it.  This was the hotel recommended by the Hilton when all of their blocked rooms for the conference were filled.  I am very disappointed in the Gulfview for this specific reason. On the other hand, the food at Jimmy's was very good and it looks like that the place will be…

title: Better than expected
review: Initially, when I arrived at the hotel, I was disappointed. The lobby was under construction and no one had informed me. The rooms were plain and aging. There was a Waffle House attached, never a good sign. But after experiencing the staff and the view and the restaurant/bar and the short walk to the gorgeous beach, I was pleased. The staff was very helpful; they even offered another hotel to us, but we did not want to move our stuff. They made excellent suggestions for enjoying our time there,and the room was clean, albeit older. We really enjoyed our time at Clearwater Beach, and that changed my mind about the hotel. It looks like it will be simply gorgeous when they are done remodeling, and the pool is very nice.

title: Great Choice
review: We stayed at the Gulfview resort from 1/14-1/16 for weekend getaway with some friends ($79/night).  The pictures from the hotel are pretty accurate although the place is under some renovation.  The rooms were good but could definetly use a makeover.  The staff was very friendly.  We at at Jimmy's restaurant one night... good food.  There is also a Waffle House connected to the building in the front.  We also ordered room service one night and they were fast and the food was great.  The only downside.. if you want a place that has a sand beach then don't look for it here.  It's located on the inlet and not truly gulf front.  Overall it worked out great and I would stay again.  Another plus for us is Shepherd's Beach Resort next store.  We were looking for some nightlife and this…

title: Brilliant
review: We stayed here in 2004 and fell in love with the place. The staff from the hotel and bars were very helpful and polite. They were building Jimmys at the time. We came back for 5 weeks in 2005 and were pleasantly surprised by being upgraded to the top floor (penthouse type) suite, complete with kitchen glass 6ft table and absolutely fantastic views across the gulf around to the main Island, and all this for just $99 per night. Jimmys was finished and was a sight to behold. Many of the staff remembered us and it was like meeting old friends. Tower 1 had some building going on and was closed, but we had been told about this 6 months earlier so were expecting it. The pool and pool-side areas were clean the Tiki bar was open all day as was Jimmys. During the latter part of August it…

title: We had a FAB TIME!
review: We were a little worried after checking out some of the poor reviews for this hotel but we shouldn't have been.  Yes the hotel is under renovation, but our room was clean and tidy, fresh towels/toiletries every day, free in room tea/coffee facilities & beds changed every other day.  The pool area & pool were clean with plenty of free beds on offer for all guests.  The pool bar was open at weekends with the Iguana bar available midweek for all your pool refreshments at other times. The staff were very helpful/friendly, the waffle bar offered reasonable breakfasts for every palate and Jimmy's fish bar was excellent with a free sunset every night guaranteed free of charge right on the waterfront! We travel to Florida every year and have yet to come across such a bargain!  If you…

title: Room with a WOW! view
review: Stayed here 5 years ago, loved it and decided to return for a one week stay.  Booked an upgraded suite for 140 dollars per night which is well worth it.  Our room was on the 6th floor overlooking the ocean, what a sight.  If you are into total relaxation and watching the dolphins swim by then this is the place to go.  Pool area was lovely although I have to admit one of the two tower blocks is totally boarded up as they are refurbishing the hotel and there is noise from the building work.  Seemingly this will take approx one year so be prepared before you go.  Other than this the hotel is great.  The reception staff are great especially the main receptionist girl who was fantastic.  I would also recommend eating in Jimmys Fish House which is located in the hotel.  What a view…

title: Terrible place...
review: We were given a smoking room, despite specifically asking for non-smoking (my wife and I do not smoke and we had two children under 6 with us).  The room stank.  Asked for a change - nothing else available.   The room itself was dirty and very dilapidated - there was a perfect imprint of an iron on the carpet in the middle of the room.  One entire wing of the hotel was boarded up - the foyer was fenced off with plasterboard.  The poolside was dirty, as was the terrace.  The noise at night was unbelievable - kids shouting at well past 3 am right in the corridors.  We stayed one night and left, despite booking & paying for a week.  The girl at the check out didn't even ask why - they are obviously used to people leaving early.  Do yourself a favour - DONT VISIT THIS HOTEL.

title: Lovely stay
review: Spent a week at this hotel.  Rooms were clean, the view was magnificent. Friendly staff, good atmosphere and mix of people. Would stay there again was worried about previous bad reviews but really enjoyed the week.

title: We had a blast!
review: My girlfriends & I just returned from a "girls-weekend" and we had a blast.  We were a bit nervous after reading some of these bad reviews, but we just figured we would have fun anyway since we would all be together. The front desk was great! "Tia" was awesome!  And anything we asked for was taken care of immediately.  Jimmy Iganua's was wonderful.  We spent alot of time there.  There was music at night & those guys were very nice & alot of fun.  The food was very good as well.  And then if you wanted a little bit more crazy & upbeat you just had to walk across the parking lot to Sheppards.   We checked out a couple other places for dinner and it was only a $5.00 cab ride, not too bad.  (The Trolley thing never seemed to come, and when it did it wasn't going where we were. Not…

title: Much better than the (old) reviews!
review: This hotel was much better than the reviews from April!    The room was very clean.  Though we didn't get to face the pool, we did get a view of the ocean from the other side.  We were there only two nights:  Memorial Day and the day before.  We bought our reservations off a site here at TripAdvisor and paid a fraction of the price!  ($75 a night as opposed to $175 from the hotel, and that included all taxes and fees).  The carpet and bedding looked new.  The restroom looked a little old, but it was kept very clean.  This is a very suitable hotel for most anyone, especially for those with small children.  The baby pool is large enough and kept very clean as was the larger pool.    My two year old spent most his time there.  However, I don't recommend anyone with families coming…

title: great
review: I was not looking forward to staying at this hotel in fact we tried to change it before we left the uk, the hotel was fine very friendly staff very clean and the bar/resturant area was fantastic what a view, what a place to watch the sun go down, and the dolphins used to swim right past the bar which was fantastic

title: Excellent hotel.
review: Me my wife and our two children stayed here for eleven nights and i must say and was a bit hesitant after reading some of the reviews, but how wrong can you be the front desk staff where freindly and helpful, and the room we where given was very clean with new beds and new carpet, the view was second to none and the whole experience was heavenly.

title: this hotel is perfectly fine
review: i went to florida to visit my girlfriend who had moved two years previously. we wanted to stay on the beach and someplace with nightlife so we wouldnt have to drive. the name has now been changed to the clearwater gulfview resort which allows for some confusion as there or two or three other places with the same words but in different order. but anyway we decided to stay at shephards because we heard it was a great place to party. they only had availability for two of the three nights we were staying but mgmt. gave me the number to the gulfview. i have to say this hotel was completely adequate. we stayed in room 312 and had a partial gulfview. the manager was really nice and reduced my price for the room because i had requested a gulf view but they did not have one. all of the…

title: Not worth the money at all
review: We just returned from our Florida trip and stayed the last two nights at this hotel.  I will never stay at this hotel again.  In my opinion the hotel room was very dirty.  The carpet was stained and burned, and the bathroom was pretty gross and not cleaned well.  I have a 14 month old son and felt this was not the best place for kids.  The pool area is very nice and we enjoyed our time at the Tiki bar (very good food and drinks).  The only problem is the bar is open until 2:00 a.m. and our room was right above it.  Very noisy and then when the bar dies down all the drunks hang out around the pool area.  I could not sleep.  Also, the bed was very uncomfortable.  Durning our stay we saw several people complain to the hotel staff about their rooms not being clean.  I like to stay…

title: I wouldn't recommend it!
review: When we stayed here in late April '05, the name has changed to Gulfview Beach Resort but the elevator inspection signage still has the place listed at Ramada Inn.  The good points about this hotel are the gulfview restaurant, Jimmy's; the lobby, which looked like it had been recently remodeled; and the hotel staff, they were friendly and polite.  The food at Jimmy's was great, the band was very entertaining and the view of the sunset was fabulous.    The elevator floor looked as if it had not been vacuumed in a few days.  Our room was in a corner near the stairwell . . . lots of people running up and down the stairs and slamming the door all night.  It was prom night so there were a lot of young people partying in the hotel and they were a little rowdy.  The noise from the…

title: Incompetent Management
review: What a way to ruin a vacation.  We were awoken by neighbors who where loud and throwing items agains the wall.  We called the front office twice.  After nothing changed we asked for a different room.  We were moved to a room that was actually closer to the noisy neighbors.  Three hours later we were finally in a suitable room.  The next morning we discuss the event with management.  The management walked away from me.  I complained a second time threatening no payment.  This time the manager called the police to have me removed from the hotel.  This was clearly a manager who abuses his authority, and gives no consideration to the comfort of the guests at his hotel.

title: Avoid disappointment - Don't Book It
review: My wife and I were booked in to stay here for a week from Aug 20. We weren't expecting the hotel to be on the beach but we were disappointed with the room. The hotel comprises 2 towers, one side overlooks the pool facing towards the gulf with nice views, the other side looks over the road towards the city. The other tower should be avoided at all costs as most of the rooms either face directly towrds the side of the other tower giving either no view of anything but concrete while the other side faces the hotel next door. Whilst the rooms aren't too small the furniture must be around 20 years old, I tries to open one of the drawers only to have it come away in my hands, the surface on the bath was peeling over the entire surface which was ok whilst showering but forget taking a…
